1639.en: And once the king said: "I have dreamt that there are seven fat cows and seven lean cows are devouring them, and there are seven fresh green ears of corn and seven others dry and withered. My nobles! Tell me what is the interpretation of this dream, if you are well#versed in interpretation of dreams."

1640.arabic: قالوا اضغث احلم وما نحن بتاويل الاحلم بعلمين
1640.en: They said: "These are confused dreams, and we do not know the interpretation of such dreams."

1641.arabic: وقال الذى نجا منهما وادكر بعد امة انا انبئكم بتاويله فارسلون
1641.en: Then of the two prisoners, the one who had been set free, now remembered, after the lapse of a long period, what Joseph had said. He said: "I will tell you the interpretation of this dream; just send me (to Joseph in prison)."

1642.arabic: يوسف ايها الصديق افتنا فى سبع بقرت سمان ياكلهن سبع عجاف وسبع سنبلت خضر واخر يابست لعلى ارجع الى الناس لعلهم يعلمون
1642.en: Then he went to Joseph and said to him: "Joseph, O truthfulness incarnate, tell the true meaning of the dream in which seven fat cows are devoured by seven lean ones; and there are seven green ears of corn and seven others dry and withered so that I may return to the people and they may learn."

1643.arabic: قال تزرعون سبع سنين دابا فما حصدتم فذروه فى سنبله الا قليلا مما تاكلون
1643.en: Joseph said: "You will cultivate consecutively for seven years. Leave in the ears all that you have harvested except the little out of which you may eat.

1644.arabic: ثم ياتى من بعد ذلك سبع شداد ياكلن ما قدمتم لهن الا قليلا مما تحصنون
1644.en: Then there will follow seven years of great hardship in which you will eat up all you have stored earlier, except the little that you may set aside.

1645.arabic: ثم ياتى من بعد ذلك عام فيه يغاث الناس وفيه يعصرون
1645.en: Then there will come a year when people will be helped by plenty of rain and they will press (grapes)."

1646.arabic: وقال الملك ائتونى به فلما جاه الرسول قال ارجع الى ربك فسـله ما بال النسوة التى قطعن ايديهن ان ربى بكيدهن عليم
1646.en: The king said: "Bring this man to me." But when the royal messenger came to Joseph he said: "Go back to your master and ask him about the case of the women who had cut their hands. Surely my Lord has full knowledge of their guile."

1647.arabic: قال ما خطبكن اذ رودتن يوسف عن نفسه قلن حش لله ما علمنا عليه من سو قالت امرات العزيز الـن حصحص الحق انا رودته عن نفسه وانه لمن الصدقين
1647.en: Thereupon the king asked the women: "What happened when you sought to tempt Joseph?" They said: "Allah forbid! We found no evil in him." The chief's wife said: "Now the truth has come to light. It was I who sought to tempt him. He is indeed truthful."

1648.arabic: ذلك ليعلم انى لم اخنه بالغيب وان الله لا يهدى كيد الخائنين
1648.en: Joseph said: "I did this so that he \[i.e. the chief) may know that I did not betray him in his absence, and that Allah does not allow the design of the treacherous to succeed.

1649.arabic: وما ابرئ نفسى ان النفس لامارة بالسو الا ما رحم ربى ان ربى غفور رحيم
1649.en: I do not seek to acquit myself; for surely one's self prompts one to evil except him to whom my Lord may show mercy. Verily my Lord is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful."

1650.arabic: وقال الملك ائتونى به استخلصه لنفسى فلما كلمه قال انك اليوم لدينا مكين امين
1650.en: The king said: "Bring him to me. I will select him exclusively for my own service." So when Joseph spoke to him the king said: "You are now one of established position, fully#trusted by us."

1651.arabic: قال اجعلنى على خزائن الارض انى حفيظ عليم
1651.en: Joseph said: "Place me in charge of the treasures of the land. I am a good keeper and know my task well."

1652.arabic: وكذلك مكنا ليوسف فى الارض يتبوا منها حيث يشا نصيب برحمتنا من نشا ولا نضيع اجر المحسنين
1652.en: Thus did We establish Joseph in the land so that he could settle wherever he pleased. We bestow favour, out of Our Mercy, on whomsoever We please, and We do not cause the reward of those who do good to go to waste.

1653.arabic: ولاجر الاخرة خير للذين امنوا وكانوا يتقون
1653.en: Surely the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believe and act in a God#fearing way.

1654.arabic: وجا اخوة يوسف فدخلوا عليه فعرفهم وهم له منكرون
1654.en: And Joseph's brothers came to Egypt and presented themselves before him. He recognized them, but they did not know him.

1655.arabic: ولما جهزهم بجهازهم قال ائتونى باخ لكم من ابيكم الا ترون انى اوفى الكيل وانا خير المنزلين
1655.en: And when he had prepared for them their provisions, Joseph said: "Bring to me your other brother from your father. Do you not see that I give full measure and am most hospitable?

1656.arabic: فان لم تاتونى به فلا كيل لكم عندى ولا تقربون
1656.en: If you do not bring him to me, you shall have no corn from me; and do not even attempt to come close to me."

1657.arabic: قالوا سنرود عنه اباه وانا لفعلون
1657.en: They said: "We will surely try to prevail over our father to send him. Be sure we shall do so."

1658.arabic: وقال لفتينه اجعلوا بضعتهم فى رحالهم لعلهم يعرفونها اذا انقلبوا الى اهلهم لعلهم يرجعون
1658.en: And Joseph said to his servants: "Put surreptitiously in their packs the goods they had given in exchange for corn." Joseph did so expecting that they would find it when they returned home. Feeling grateful for this generosity, they might be inclined to return to him.

1659.arabic: فلما رجعوا الى ابيهم قالوا يابانا منع منا الكيل فارسل معنا اخانا نكتل وانا له لحفظون
1659.en: When they returned to their father they said: "Father! We have been denied further supply of corn. So send with us our brother that we may bring the supplies. We shall be responsible for his protection."

1660.arabic: قال هل امنكم عليه الا كما امنتكم على اخيه من قبل فالله خير حفظا وهو ارحم الرحمين
1660.en: The father said: "Shall I trust you with regard to him as I had trusted you earlier with regard to his brother? Allah is the Best Protector and is the Most Merciful."

1661.arabic: ولما فتحوا متعهم وجدوا بضعتهم ردت اليهم قالوا يابانا ما نبغى هذه بضعتنا ردت الينا ونمير اهلنا ونحفظ اخانا ونزداد كيل بعير ذلك كيل يسير
1661.en: And when they opened their things they found that their goods had been given back to them. Thereupon they cried: "Father! What else would we desire? Look, even our goods have been given back to us, so we shall go now and bring supplies for our family, we shall protect our brother, and bring another camel#load of corn. That additional supply will be easily secured."

1662.arabic: قال لن ارسله معكم حتى تؤتون موثقا من الله لتاتننى به الا ان يحاط بكم فلما اتوه موثقهم قال الله على ما نقول وكيل
1662.en: Their father said: "I shall never send him with you until you give me a solemn promise in the name of Allah that you will bring him back to me, unless you yourselves are surrounded." Then after they had given him their solemn promise, he said. "Allah watches over what we have said."

1663.arabic: وقال يبنى لا تدخلوا من باب وحد وادخلوا من ابوب متفرقة وما اغنى عنكم من الله من شى ان الحكم الا لله عليه توكلت وعليه فليتوكل المتوكلون
1663.en: And he enjoined them: "My sons! Do not enter the city by one gate; rather enter it by different gates. I can be of no help to you against Allah. Allah's command alone prevails. In Him have I put my trust and in Him should all those who have faith put their trust."

1664.arabic: ولما دخلوا من حيث امرهم ابوهم ما كان يغنى عنهم من الله من شى الا حاجة فى نفس يعقوب قضىها وانه لذو علم لما علمنه ولكن اكثر الناس لا يعلمون
1664.en: And it so happened that when they entered the city (by many gates) as their father had directed them, this precautionary measure proved ineffective against Allah's will. There was an uneasiness in Jacob's soul which he so tried to remove. Surely he was possessed of knowledge owing to the knowledge that We bestowed upon him. But most people do not know the truth of the matter.

1665.arabic: ولما دخلوا على يوسف اوى اليه اخاه قال انى انا اخوك فلا تبتئس بما كانوا يعملون
1665.en: When they presented themselves before Joseph, he took his brother aside to himself and said: "Verily I am your own brother Joseph; so do not grieve over the manner they have treated you."

1666.arabic: فلما جهزهم بجهازهم جعل السقاية فى رحل اخيه ثم اذن مؤذن ايتها العير انكم لسرقون
1666.en: Then, while Joseph was having their provisions loaded, he put his drinking#cup in his brother's saddlebag. And then a herald cried: "Travellers, you are thieves."

1667.en: Turning back they asked: "What have you lost?"

1668.arabic: قالوا نفقد صواع الملك ولمن جا به حمل بعير وانا به زعيم
1668.en: The officials said: "We have lost the king's cup." (And their chief added): "He who brings it shall have a camel#load of provisions, I guarantee that."

1669.arabic: قالوا تالله لقد علمتم ما جئنا لنفسد فى الارض وما كنا سرقين
1669.en: They said: "By Allah, you certainly know that we did not come to act corruptly in this land, nor are we those who steal."

1670.arabic: قالوا فما جزؤه ان كنتم كذبين
1670.en: The officials said: "If you are lying, what will be the penalty for him who has stolen?"

1671.arabic: قالوا جزؤه من وجد فى رحله فهو جزؤه كذلك نجزى الظلمين
1671.en: They replied: "He in whose saddlebag the cup is found, he himself shall be its recompense." Thus do we punish the wrong#doers.

1672.arabic: فبدا باوعيتهم قبل وعا اخيه ثم استخرجها من وعا اخيه كذلك كدنا ليوسف ما كان لياخذ اخاه فى دين الملك الا ان يشا الله نرفع درجت من نشا وفوق كل ذى علم عليم
1672.en: Then Joseph began searching their bags before searching his own brother's bag. Then he brought forth the drinking#cup from his brother's bag. Thus did We contrive to support Joseph. He had no right, according to the religion of the king (i.e. the law of Egypt), to take his brother, unless Allah so willed. We exalt whomsoever We will over others by several degrees. And above all those who know is the One Who truly knows.

1673.arabic: قالوا ان يسرق فقد سرق اخ له من قبل فاسرها يوسف فى نفسه ولم يبدها لهم قال انتم شر مكانا والله اعلم بما تصفون
1673.en: They said: "No wonder that he steals for a brother of his stole before." But Joseph kept his reaction to himself without disclosing the truth to them. He merely said to himself: "You are an evil lot. Allah knows well the truth of the accusation that you are making against me (to my face)."

1674.arabic: قالوا يايها العزيز ان له ابا شيخا كبيرا فخذ احدنا مكانه انا نرىك من المحسنين
1674.en: They said: "O powerful chief (al#aziz)! His father is an age#stricken man, (and in order that he may not suffer) seize one of us in his stead. We indeed consider you an excellent person."

1675.arabic: قال معاذ الله ان ناخذ الا من وجدنا متعنا عنده انا اذا لظلمون
1675.en: Joseph said: "Allah forbid that we should seize any except him with whom we found our good. Were we to do so, we would surely be one of the wrong#doers."

1676.arabic: فلما استيـسوا منه خلصوا نجيا قال كبيرهم الم تعلموا ان اباكم قد اخذ عليكم موثقا من الله ومن قبل ما فرطتم فى يوسف فلن ابرح الارض حتى ياذن لى ابى او يحكم الله لى وهو خير الحكمين
1676.en: Then, when they had despaired of Joseph they went to a corner and counselled together. The eldest of them said: "Do you not know that your father has taken a solemn promise from you in the name of Allah, and you failed in your duty towards Joseph? So I will not depart from this land until my father permits me, or Allah pronounces His judgement in my favour. He is the best of those who judge."

1677.arabic: ارجعوا الى ابيكم فقولوا يابانا ان ابنك سرق وما شهدنا الا بما علمنا وما كنا للغيب حفظين
1677.en: So go back to your father and tell him: "Father! Your son has certainly been guilty of stealing. We did not see him stealing but testify according to what we know, and obviously we had no power to keep watch over that what is altogether hidden from us.

1678.arabic: وسـل القرية التى كنا فيها والعير التى اقبلنا فيها وانا لصدقون
1678.en: You may inquire of the dwellers of the city where we were, and of the people of the caravan with whom we travelled. We are altogether truthful in what we say."

1679.arabic: قال بل سولت لكم انفسكم امرا فصبر جميل عسى الله ان ياتينى بهم جميعا انه هو العليم الحكيم
1679.en: The father heard the narration and said: "(All that is untrue). But your souls have made it easy for you to engage in a heinous act. So, I will be graciously patient even at this. Allah may well bring them all back to me. He is All#Knowing, All#Wise."

1680.arabic: وتولى عنهم وقال ياسفى على يوسف وابيضت عيناه من الحزن فهو كظيم
1680.en: Then he turned his back to them, and said: "O my grief for Joseph!" His eyes whitened with grief and he was choked up with sorrow trying to suppress his grief.

1681.arabic: قالوا تالله تفتؤا تذكر يوسف حتى تكون حرضا او تكون من الهلكين
1681.en: The sons said: "By Allah! You will continue to remember Joseph until you will either consume yourself with grief, or will die."

1682.arabic: قال انما اشكوا بثى وحزنى الى الله واعلم من الله ما لا تعلمون
1682.en: He said: "I will address my sorrow and grief only to Allah, and I know from Allah what you do not know.

1683.arabic: يبنى اذهبوا فتحسسوا من يوسف واخيه ولا تايـسوا من روح الله انه لا يايـس من روح الله الا القوم الكفرون
1683.en: My sons! Go and try to find out about Joseph and his brother and do not despair of Allah's mercy. Verily only the unbelievers despair of Allah's mercy."

1684.arabic: فلما دخلوا عليه قالوا يايها العزيز مسنا واهلنا الضر وجئنا ببضعة مزجىة فاوف لنا الكيل وتصدق علينا ان الله يجزى المتصدقين
1684.en: On going to Egypt they presented themselves to Joseph and said to him: "O chief! We and our family are struck with distress and have brought only a paltry sum. So give us corn in full measure, and give it to us in charity. Allah rewards those who are charitable."

1685.arabic: قال هل علمتم ما فعلتم بيوسف واخيه اذ انتم جهلون
1685.en: When Joseph heard this (he could not hold himself and said): "Do you remember what you did to Joseph and his brother when you were ignorant?"

1686.arabic: قالوا انك لانت يوسف قال انا يوسف وهذا اخى قد من الله علينا انه من يتق ويصبر فان الله لا يضيع اجر المحسنين
1686.en: They exclaimed: "Are you indeed Joseph?" He said: "Yes, I am Joseph and this is my brother. Allah has surely been gracious to us. Indeed whoever fears Allah and remains patient, Allah does not allow the reward of such people to go to waste."

1687.arabic: قالوا تالله لقد اثرك الله علينا وان كنا لخطـين
1687.en: They said: "We swear by Allah! Indeed Allah has chosen you in preference to us and we were truly guilty."

1688.arabic: قال لا تثريب عليكم اليوم يغفر الله لكم وهو ارحم الرحمين
1688.en: He replied: "No blame lies with you today. May Allah forgive you. He is the Most Merciful of all those that are merciful.

1689.arabic: اذهبوا بقميصى هذا فالقوه على وجه ابى يات بصيرا واتونى باهلكم اجمعين
1689.en: Take this shirt of mine and throw it over my father's face. He will regain his sight. And bring to me all your family."

1690.arabic: ولما فصلت العير قال ابوهم انى لاجد ريح يوسف لولا ان تفندون
1690.en: And as the caravan set out (from Egypt), their father said (in Canaan): "Indeed I smell the fragrance of Joseph. I say so although you may think that I am doting."

1691.arabic: قالوا تالله انك لفى ضللك القديم
1691.en: They said: "Surely you are still in your same old craze."

1692.arabic: فلما ان جا البشير القىه على وجهه فارتد بصيرا قال الم اقل لكم انى اعلم من الله ما لا تعلمون
1692.en: And when the bearer of good news came he threw Joseph's shirt over Jacob's face, whereupon he regained his sight, and said: "Did I not tell you that I know from Allah what you do not know?"

1693.arabic: قالوا يابانا استغفر لنا ذنوبنا انا كنا خطـين
1693.en: They said: "Father! Pray for the forgiveness of our sins; we were truly guilty."

1694.arabic: قال سوف استغفر لكم ربى انه هو الغفور الرحيم
1694.en: He said: "I shall pray to my Lord for your forgiveness, for He, and indeed He alone, is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful."

1695.arabic: فلما دخلوا على يوسف اوى اليه ابويه وقال ادخلوا مصر ان شا الله امنين
1695.en: And when they went to Joseph, he took his parents aside and said (to the members of his family): "Enter the city now, and if Allah wills, you shall be secure."

1696.arabic: ورفع ابويه على العرش وخروا له سجدا وقال يابت هذا تاويل ريى من قبل قد جعلها ربى حقا وقد احسن بى اذ اخرجنى من السجن وجا بكم من البدو من بعد ان نزغ الشيطن بينى وبين اخوتى ان ربى لطيف لما يشا انه هو العليم الحكيم
1696.en: And after they had entered the city, Joseph raised his parents to the throne beside himself, and they (involuntarily) bowed in prostration before him. Joseph said: "Father! This is the fulfilment of the vision I had before # one that My Lord has caused to come true. He was kind to me when He rescued me from the prison, and brought you from the desert after Satan had stirred discord between me and my brothers. Certainly my Lord is Subtle in the fulfilment of His will; He is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

1697.arabic: رب قد اتيتنى من الملك وعلمتنى من تاويل الاحاديث فاطر السموت والارض انت ولى فى الدنيا والاخرة توفنى مسلما والحقنى بالصلحين
1697.en: My Lord! You have bestowed dominion upon me and have taught me to comprehend the depths of things. O Creator of heavens and earth! You are my Guardian in this world and in the Hereafter. Cause me to die in submission to You, and join me, in the end, with the righteous."

1698.arabic: ذلك من انبا الغيب نوحيه اليك وما كنت لديهم اذ اجمعوا امرهم وهم يمكرون
1698.en: (O Muhammad), this is part of news from the Unseen that We reveal to you for you were not present with them when Joseph's brothers jointly resolved on a plot.

1699.arabic: وما اكثر الناس ولو حرصت بمؤمنين
1699.en: And most of the people, howsoever you might so desire, are not going to believe.

1700.arabic: وما تسـلهم عليه من اجر ان هو الا ذكر للعلمين
1700.en: You do not seek from them any recompense for your service. This is merely an admonition to all mankind.

1701.arabic: وكاين من اية فى السموت والارض يمرون عليها وهم عنها معرضون
1701.en: How many are the signs in the heavens and the earth which people pass by without giving any heed!

1702.arabic: وما يؤمن اكثرهم بالله الا وهم مشركون
1702.en: And most of them believe in Allah only when they associate others with Him in His Divinity.

1703.arabic: افامنوا ان تاتيهم غشية من عذاب الله او تاتيهم الساعة بغتة وهم لا يشعرون
1703.en: Do they, then, feel secure that an overwhelming chastisement shall not visit them, and the Hour shall not suddenly come upon them without their even perceiving it?

1704.arabic: قل هذه سبيلى ادعوا الى الله على بصيرة انا ومن اتبعنى وسبحن الله وما انا من المشركين
1704.en: Tell them plainly: "This is my way: I call you to Allah, on the basis of clear perception # both I and those who follow me. Allah # Glory be to Him # is free of every imperfection. I have nothing to do with those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity."

1705.arabic: وما ارسلنا من قبلك الا رجالا نوحى اليهم من اهل القرى افلم يسيروا فى الارض فينظروا كيف كان عقبة الذين من قبلهم ولدار الاخرة خير للذين اتقوا افلا تعقلون
1705.en: The Messengers whom We raised before you, (O Muhammad), and to whom We sent down revelations, were only human beings, and were from among those living in earthly habitations. Have these people not travelled in the earth that they may observe the end of their predecessors? Certainly the abode of the Hereafter is much better for those (who accepted the call of the Messengers and) acted in a God#fearing manner. Will you still not act with good sense?

1706.arabic: حتى اذا استيـس الرسل وظنوا انهم قد كذبوا جاهم نصرنا فنجى من نشا ولا يرد باسنا عن القوم المجرمين
1706.en: (It also happened with the earlier Messengers that for long they preached and people paid no heed) until the Messengers despaired of their people, and the people also fancied that they had been told lies (by the Messengers), then suddenly Our help came to the Messengers. And when such an occasion comes We rescue whom We will; as for the guilty, Our chastisement cannot be averted from them.

1707.arabic: لقد كان فى قصصهم عبرة لاولى الالبب ما كان حديثا يفترى ولكن تصديق الذى بين يديه وتفصيل كل شى وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون
1707.en: Certainly in the stories of the bygone people there is a lesson for people of understanding. What is being narrated in the Qur'an is no fabrication; it is rather confirmation of the Books that preceded it, and a detailed exposition of everything, and a guidance and mercy for people of faith.

1708.arabic: المر تلك ايت الكتب والذى انزل اليك من ربك الحق ولكن اكثر الناس لا يؤمنون
1708.en: Alif. Lam. Mim. Ra'. These are the verses of the Divine Book. Whatever has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and yet most (of your) people do not believe.

1709.arabic: الله الذى رفع السموت بغير عمد ترونها ثم استوى على العرش وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجرى لاجل مسمى يدبر الامر يفصل الايت لعلكم بلقا ربكم توقنون
1709.en: It is Allah Who has raised the heavens without any supports that you could see, and then He established Himself on the Throne (of Dominion). And He it is Who has made the sun and the moon subservient (to a law), each running its course till an appointed term. He governs the entire order of the universe and clearly explains the signs that you may be firmly convinced about meeting your Lord.

1710.arabic: وهو الذى مد الارض وجعل فيها روسى وانهرا ومن كل الثمرت جعل فيها زوجين اثنين يغشى اليل النهار ان فى ذلك لايت لقوم يتفكرون
1710.en: He it is Who has stretched out the earth and has placed in it firm mountains and has caused the rivers to flow. He has made every fruit in pairs, two and two, and He it is Who causes the night to cover the day. Surely there are signs in these for those who reflect.

1711.arabic: وفى الارض قطع متجورت وجنت من اعنب وزرع ونخيل صنوان وغير صنوان يسقى بما وحد ونفضل بعضها على بعض فى الاكل ان فى ذلك لايت لقوم يعقلون
1711.en: And on the earth there are many tracts of land neighbouring each other. There are on it vineyards, and sown fields, and date palms: some growing in clusters from one root, some standing alone. They are irrigated by the same water, and yet We make some excel others in taste. Surely there are signs in these for a people who use their reason.

1712.arabic: وان تعجب فعجب قولهم اذا كنا تربا انا لفى خلق جديد اولئك الذين كفروا بربهم واولئك الاغلل فى اعناقهم واولئك اصحب النار هم فيها خلدون
1712.en: And were you to wonder, then wondrous indeed is the saying of those who say: "What! After we have been reduced to dust, shall we be created afresh?" They are the ones who disbelieved in their Lord; they are the ones who shall have shackles around their necks. They shall be the inmates of the Fire, wherein they will abide for ever.

1713.arabic: ويستعجلونك بالسيئة قبل الحسنة وقد خلت من قبلهم المثلت وان ربك لذو مغفرة للناس على ظلمهم وان ربك لشديد العقاب
1713.en: They challenge you to hasten the coming of evil upon them before the coming of any good, although people who followed a like course before had met with exemplary punishment (from Allah). Verily your Lord is forgiving to mankind despite all their wrong#doing. Verily your Lord is also severe in retribution.

1714.arabic: ويقول الذين كفروا لولا انزل عليه اية من ربه انما انت منذر ولكل قوم هاد
1714.en: Those who refused to believe in you say: "Why has no (miraculous) sign been sent down upon him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and every people has its guide.

1715.arabic: الله يعلم ما تحمل كل انثى وما تغيض الارحام وما تزداد وكل شى عنده بمقدار
1715.en: Allah knows what every female bears; and what the wombs fall short of (in gestation), and what they may add. With Him everything is in a fixed measure.

1716.en: He knows both what is hidden and what is manifest. He is the Supreme One, the Most High.

1717.arabic: سوا منكم من اسر القول ومن جهر به ومن هو مستخفۭ باليل وساربۢ بالنهار
1717.en: It is all the same for Him whether any of you says a thing secretly, or says it loudly, and whether one hides oneself in the darkness of night, or struts about in broad daylight.

1718.arabic: له معقبت من بين يديه ومن خلفه يحفظونه من امر الله ان الله لا يغير ما بقوم حتى يغيروا ما بانفسهم واذا اراد الله بقوم سوا فلا مرد له وما لهم من دونه من وال
1718.en: There are guardians over everyone, both before him and behind him, who guard him by Allah's command. Verily Allah does not change a people's condition unless they change their inner selves. And when Allah decides to make a people suffer punishment, no one can avert it. Nor can any be of help to such a people against Allah.

1719.arabic: هو الذى يريكم البرق خوفا وطمعا وينشئ السحاب الثقال
1719.en: He it is Who causes you to see lightning that inspires you with both fear and hope, and He it is Who whips up heavy clouds.

1720.arabic: ويسبح الرعد بحمده والملئكة من خيفته ويرسل الصوعق فيصيب بها من يشا وهم يجدلون فى الله وهو شديد المحال
1720.en: The thunder celebrates His praise and holiness, and the angels, too, celebrate His praise for awe of Him. He hurls thunderbolts, striking with them whom He wills while they are engaged in disputation concerning Allah. He is Mighty in His contriving.

1721.arabic: له دعوة الحق والذين يدعون من دونه لا يستجيبون لهم بشى الا كبسط كفيه الى الما ليبلغ فاه وما هو ببلغه وما دعا الكفرين الا فى ضلل
1721.en: To Him alone should all prayer be addressed, for those to whom they do address their prayers beside Him are altogether powerless to respond to them. The example of praying to any other than Allah is that of a man who stretches out his hands to water, asking it to reach his mouth, although water has no power to reach his mouth. The prayers of the unbelievers are a sheer waste.

1722.arabic: ولله يسجد من فى السموت والارض طوعا وكرها وظللهم بالغدو والاصال
1722.en: All that is in the heavens and the earth prostrates itself, whether willingly or by force, before Allah; and so do their shadows in the morning and in the evening.

1723.arabic: قل من رب السموت والارض قل الله قل افاتخذتم من دونه اوليا لا يملكون لانفسهم نفعا ولا ضرا قل هل يستوى الاعمى والبصير ام هل تستوى الظلمت والنور ام جعلوا لله شركا خلقوا كخلقه فتشبه الخلق عليهم قل الله خلق كل شى وهو الوحد القهر
1723.en: Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?" Say: "Allah." Tell them: "Have you taken beside Him as your patrons those who do not have the power to benefit or to hurt even themselves?" Say: "Can the blind and the seeing be deemed equals? Or can light and darkness be deemed equals?" If that is not so, then have those whom they associate with Allah in His Divinity ever created anything like what Allah did so that the question of creation has become dubious to them? Say: "Allah is the creator of everything. He is the One, the Irresistible."

1724.arabic: انزل من السما ما فسالت اودية بقدرها فاحتمل السيل زبدا رابيا ومما يوقدون عليه فى النار ابتغا حلية او متع زبد مثله كذلك يضرب الله الحق والبطل فاما الزبد فيذهب جفا واما ما ينفع الناس فيمكث فى الارض كذلك يضرب الله الامثال
1724.en: Allah sends down water from the heavens and the river#beds flow, each according to its measure, and the torrent carries along a swelling scum. In like manner, from that metal which they smelt in the fire to make ornaments and utensils, there arises scum like it. Thus does Allah depict truth and falsehood. As for the scum, it passes away as dross; but that which benefits mankind abides on the earth. Thus does Allah explain (the truth) through examples.

1725.arabic: للذين استجابوا لربهم الحسنى والذين لم يستجيبوا له لو ان لهم ما فى الارض جميعا ومثله معه لافتدوا به اولئك لهم سو الحساب وماوىهم جهنم وبئس المهاد
1725.en: There is good reward for those who respond to the call of their Lord. And those who do not respond to their Lord, (a time will come when) they shall offer all they have # even if they have all the riches of the world and the like of it besides to redeem themselves (from the chastisement of Allah). They will be subjected to a severe reckoning and Hell shall be their refuge. What a wretched resting place it is!

1726.arabic: افمن يعلم انما انزل اليك من ربك الحق كمن هو اعمى انما يتذكر اولوا الالبب
1726.en: He who knows that the Book which has been sent to you from your Lord is the Truth, is he like him who is blind to that truth? It is only people of understanding who take heed:

1727.arabic: الذين يوفون بعهد الله ولا ينقضون الميثق
1727.en: those who fulfil their covenant with Allah and do not break their compact after firmly confirming it;

1728.arabic: والذين يصلون ما امر الله به ان يوصل ويخشون ربهم ويخافون سو الحساب
1728.en: who join together the ties which Allah has bidden to be joined; who fear their Lord and dread lest they are subjected to severe reckoning;

1729.arabic: والذين صبروا ابتغا وجه ربهم واقاموا الصلوة وانفقوا مما رزقنهم سرا وعلانية ويدرون بالحسنة السيئة اولئك لهم عقبى الدار
1729.en: who are steadfast in seeking the good pleasure of their Lord; who establish Prayer and spend both secretly and openly out of the wealth We have provided them, and who ward off evil with good. Theirs shall be the ultimate abode

1730.arabic: جنت عدن يدخلونها ومن صلح من ابائهم وازوجهم وذريتهم والملئكة يدخلون عليهم من كل باب
1730.en: \# the Ever#lasting Gardens which they shall enter and so shall the righteous from among their fathers, and their spouses, and their offspring. And angels shall enter unto them from every gate, and say:

1731.arabic: سلم عليكم بما صبرتم فنعم عقبى الدار
1731.en: "Peace be upon you. You merit this reward for your steadfastness." How excellent is the ultimate abode!

1732.arabic: والذين ينقضون عهد الله من بعد ميثقه ويقطعون ما امر الله به ان يوصل ويفسدون فى الارض اولئك لهم اللعنة ولهم سو الدار
1732.en: As for those who break the covenant of Allah after firmly confirming it, who cut asunder the ties that Allah has commanded to be joined, and who create corruption in the land: Allah's curse shall be upon them and theirs shall be a wretched abode (in the Hereafter).

1733.arabic: الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشا ويقدر وفرحوا بالحيوة الدنيا وما الحيوة الدنيا فى الاخرة الا متع
1733.en: Allah grants the provision to whomsoever He wills abundantly and grants others in strict measure. They exult in the life of the world, although compared with the Hereafter, the life of the world is no more than temporary enjoyment.

1734.arabic: ويقول الذين كفروا لولا انزل عليه اية من ربه قل ان الله يضل من يشا ويهدى اليه من اناب
1734.en: Those who have rejected (the message of Muhammad) say: "Why has no sign been sent down upon him from his Lord?" Tell them: "Allah lets go astray those whom He wills, and guides to Himself those who turn to Him."

1735.arabic: الذين امنوا وتطمئن قلوبهم بذكر الله الا بذكر الله تطمئن القلوب
1735.en: Such are the ones who believe (in the message of the Prophet) and whose hearts find rest in the remembrance of Allah. Surely in Allah's remembrance do hearts find rest.

1736.arabic: الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت طوبى لهم وحسن مـاب
1736.en: So those who believe (in the message of the Truth) and do good are destined for happiness and a blissful end.

1737.arabic: كذلك ارسلنك فى امة قد خلت من قبلها امم لتتلوا عليهم الذى اوحينا اليك وهم يكفرون بالرحمن قل هو ربى لا اله الا هو عليه توكلت واليه متاب
1737.en: Thus have We sent you as a Messenger to a community before which many other communities have passed away that you may recite to them whatever We have revealed to you. And yet they deny the Lord of Mercy. Say to them: "He is my Lord, there is no god but Him. In Him I have placed all my trust and to Him I shall return."

1738.arabic: ولو ان قرانا سيرت به الجبال او قطعت به الارض او كلم به الموتى بل لله الامر جميعا افلم يايـس الذين امنوا ان لو يشا الله لهدى الناس جميعا ولا يزال الذين كفروا تصيبهم بما صنعوا قارعة او تحل قريبا من دارهم حتى ياتى وعد الله ان الله لا يخلف الميعاد
1738.en: And what would have happened were a Qur'an to be revealed wherewith mountains could be set in motion, or the earth cleft, or the dead made to speak? (To show such signs is not at all difficult for) everything rests entirely with Allah. So, do not the people of faith (still look forward to such a sign in response to the demand of the unbelievers and) despair as a result of knowing that had Allah so willed, He could have guided all to the Truth. Misfortune continues to afflict the unbelievers on account of their misdeeds, or to befall on locations close to their habitation. This will continue until Allah's promise (of chastisement) is fulfilled. Indeed Allah does not go back upon His promise.

1739.arabic: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فامليت للذين كفروا ثم اخذتهم فكيف كان عقاب
1739.en: Surely the Messengers before you were ridiculed, but I always initially granted respite to those who disbelieved, and then I seized them (with chastisement). Then, how awesome was My chastisement!

1740.arabic: افمن هو قائم على كل نفس بما كسبت وجعلوا لله شركا قل سموهم ام تنبـونه بما لا يعلم فى الارض ام بظهر من القول بل زين للذين كفروا مكرهم وصدوا عن السبيل ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد
1740.en: Is it, then, in regard to Him Who watches over the deeds of every person that they are acting blasphemously by setting up His associates? Tell them: "Name those associates (if Allah Himself has made them His associates)! Or are you informing Allah of something the existence of which He does not even know?" Or do people arbitrarily utter empty words? Indeed, their foul contriving has been made to seem fair to the unbelievers and they have been barred from finding the Right Way. Whomsoever Allah lets go astray will have none to guide him.

1741.arabic: لهم عذاب فى الحيوة الدنيا ولعذاب الاخرة اشق وما لهم من الله من واق
1741.en: They shall suffer chastisement in the life of the world, and surely the chastisement of the Hereafter is even more grievous. None has the power to shield them from (the chastisement of) Allah.

1742.arabic: مثل الجنة التى وعد المتقون تجرى من تحتها الانهر اكلها دائم وظلها تلك عقبى الذين اتقوا وعقبى الكفرين النار
1742.en: And such will be the Paradise promised to the God#fearing: rivers will flow beneath it, its fruits will be eternal, and so will be its blissful shade. That is the ultimate destiny of the God#fearing while Fire is the destiny of the unbelievers.

1743.arabic: والذين اتينهم الكتب يفرحون بما انزل اليك ومن الاحزاب من ينكر بعضه قل انما امرت ان اعبد الله ولا اشرك به اليه ادعوا واليه مـاب
1743.en: Those upon whom We bestowed the Scriptures earlier rejoice at the Book revealed to you, while there are also some among different groups that reject part of it. Tell them: "I have only been commanded to serve Allah and not to associate anyone with Him. To Him do I call, and to Him is my return."

1744.arabic: وكذلك انزلنه حكما عربيا ولئن اتبعت اهواهم بعدما جاك من العلم ما لك من الله من ولى ولا واق
1744.en: And it is with the same directive that We revealed to you this Arabic Writ. Were you indeed to follow the vain desires of people after the true knowledge has come to you, none will be your supporter against Allah, and none will have the power to shield you from His punishment.

1745.arabic: ولقد ارسلنا رسلا من قبلك وجعلنا لهم ازوجا وذرية وما كان لرسول ان ياتى بـاية الا باذن الله لكل اجل كتاب
1745.en: We indeed sent many Messengers before you and We gave them wives and children; and no Messenger had the power to produce a miraculous sign except by the command of Allah. Every age has its own (revealed) Book.

1746.arabic: يمحوا الله ما يشا ويثبت وعنده ام الكتب
1746.en: Allah effaces whatever He wills and retains whatever He wills. With Him is the Mother of the Book.

1747.arabic: وان ما نرينك بعض الذى نعدهم او نتوفينك فانما عليك البلغ وعلينا الحساب
1747.en: (O Prophet), whether We make you see a part of the punishment that We have threatened them with come to pass during your life#time, or We take you away before that happens, your duty is no more than to convey the Message, and it is for Us to make a reckoning.

1748.arabic: اولم يروا انا ناتى الارض ننقصها من اطرافها والله يحكم لا معقب لحكمه وهو سريع الحساب
1748.en: Do they not see that We are advancing in the land, diminishing it by its borders on all sides? Allah judges, and no one has the power to reverse His judgement. He is swift in reckoning.

1749.arabic: وقد مكر الذين من قبلهم فلله المكر جميعا يعلم ما تكسب كل نفس وسيعلم الكفر لمن عقبى الدار
1749.en: Those who lived before them also devised many a plot, but the master plot rests with Allah. He knows what everyone does. The deniers of the truth will soon come to know whose end is good.

1750.arabic: ويقول الذين كفروا لست مرسلا قل كفى بالله شهيدا بينى وبينكم ومن عنده علم الكتب
1750.en: The unbelievers claim that you have not been sent by Allah. Tell them: "Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you; and so also do those who know the Scriptures."

1751.arabic: الر كتب انزلنه اليك لتخرج الناس من الظلمت الى النور باذن ربهم الى صرط العزيز الحميد
1751.en: Alif. Lam. Ra'. This is a Book which We have revealed to you that you may bring forth mankind from every kind of darkness into light, and direct them, with the leave of their Lord, to the Way of the Mighty, the Innately Praiseworthy,

1752.arabic: الله الذى له ما فى السموت وما فى الارض وويل للكفرين من عذاب شديد
1752.en: (to the Way of) Allah to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Woe be to those who reject the Truth for a severe chastisement,

1753.arabic: الذين يستحبون الحيوة الدنيا على الاخرة ويصدون عن سبيل الله ويبغونها عوجا اولئك فى ضللۭ بعيد
1753.en: to those who have chosen the life of the world in preference to the Hereafter, who hinder people from the Way of Allah, and seek to make it crooked. They have gone far astray.

1754.arabic: وما ارسلنا من رسول الا بلسان قومه ليبين لهم فيضل الله من يشا ويهدى من يشا وهو العزيز الحكيم
1754.en: Never have We sent a Messenger but he has addressed his people in their language that he may fully expound his Message to them. (And after the Message is expounded), Allah lets go astray whomsoever He wills, and guides to the Right Way whomsoever He wills. He is the All#Mighty, the All#Wise.

1755.arabic: ولقد ارسلنا موسى بـايتنا ان اخرج قومك من الظلمت الى النور وذكرهم بايىم الله ان فى ذلك لايت لكل صبار شكور
1755.en: We indeed sent Moses with Our Signs, saying: "Lead your people out of all kinds of darkness into light, and admonish them by narrating to them anecdotes from the Days of Allah." Verily in it there are great Signs for everyone who is patient and gives thanks (to Allah).

1756.arabic: واذ قال موسى لقومه اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم اذ انجىكم من ال فرعون يسومونكم سو العذاب ويذبحون ابناكم ويستحيون نساكم وفى ذلكم بلا من ربكم عظيم
1756.en: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: "Remember Allah's favour upon you when He delivered you from Pharaoh's people who afflicted you with a grievous chastisement, slaughtering your sons, while letting your women live. In it there was a terrible trial from your Lord."

1757.arabic: واذ تاذن ربكم لئن شكرتم لازيدنكم ولئن كفرتم ان عذابى لشديد
1757.en: Also call to mind when your Lord proclaimed: "If you give thanks, I will certainly grant you more; but if you are ungrateful for My favours, My chastisement is terrible.

1758.arabic: وقال موسى ان تكفروا انتم ومن فى الارض جميعا فان الله لغنى حميد
1758.en: Moses said: "Were you to disbelieve # you and all those who live on earth # Allah is still Self#Sufficient, Innately Praiseworthy."

1759.arabic: الم ياتكم نبؤا الذين من قبلكم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود والذين من بعدهم لا يعلمهم الا الله جاتهم رسلهم بالبينت فردوا ايديهم فى افوههم وقالوا انا كفرنا بما ارسلتم به وانا لفى شك مما تدعوننا اليه مريب
1759.en: Have the accounts of your predecessors not reached you: the people of Noah, the Ad, the Thamud, and those who came after them # they whose number is not known to any except Allah? Their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs, but they thrust their hands in their mouths, and said: "We do surely reject the Message you have brought, and we are in disquieting doubt about what you are summoning us to."

1760.arabic: قالت رسلهم افى الله شك فاطر السموت والارض يدعوكم ليغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويؤخركم الى اجل مسمى قالوا ان انتم الا بشر مثلنا تريدون ان تصدونا عما كان يعبد اباؤنا فاتونا بسلطن مبين
1760.en: Their Messengers said: "Can there be any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He invites you that He may forgive you your sins and grant you respite till an appointed term." They replied: "You are only a human being like ourselves. You seek to prevent us from serving those whom our forefathers have been serving all along. If that is so, produce a clear authority for it."

1761.arabic: قالت لهم رسلهم ان نحن الا بشر مثلكم ولكن الله يمن على من يشا من عباده وما كان لنا ان ناتيكم بسلطن الا باذن الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون
1761.en: Their Messengers told them: "Indeed we are only human beings like yourselves, but Allah bestows His favour on those of His servants whom He wills. It does not lie in our power to produce any authority except by the leave of Allah. It is in Allah that the believers should put their trust.

1762.arabic: وما لنا الا نتوكل على الله وقد هدىنا سبلنا ولنصبرن على ما اذيتمونا وعلى الله فليتوكل المتوكلون
1762.en: And why should we not put our trust in Allah when it is indeed He Who has guided us to the ways of our life? We shall surely continue to remain steadfast in face of your persecution. All those who have to put trust, should put their trust only in Allah."

1763.arabic: وقال الذين كفروا لرسلهم لنخرجنكم من ارضنا او لتعودن فى ملتنا فاوحى اليهم ربهم لنهلكن الظلمين
1763.en: Then the unbelievers told their Messengers: "You will have to return to the fold of our faith or else we shall banish you from our land." Thereupon their Lord revealed to them: "We will most certainly destroy these wrong#doers,

1764.arabic: ولنسكننكم الارض من بعدهم ذلك لمن خاف مقامى وخاف وعيد
1764.en: and will then cause you to settle in the land as their successors. That is the reward for him who fears to stand for reckoning and holds My threat in awe."

1765.en: They sought Our judgement. And (thanks to that judgement) every obstinate tyrant opposed to the Truth was brought to naught.

1766.arabic: من ورائه جهنم ويسقى من ما صديد
1766.en: Hell is before him and he shall be made to drink of the oozing pus,

1767.arabic: يتجرعه ولا يكاد يسيغه وياتيه الموت من كل مكان وما هو بميت ومن ورائه عذاب غليظ
1767.en: which he will gulp but will scarcely swallow, and death will come upon him from every quarter, and yet he will not be able to die. A terrible chastisement lies ahead in pursuit of him.

1768.arabic: مثل الذين كفروا بربهم اعملهم كرماد اشتدت به الريح فى يوم عاصف لا يقدرون مما كسبوا على شى ذلك هو الضلل البعيد
1768.en: This is the example of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are like ashes upon which the wind blows fiercely on a tempestuous day. They shall find no reward for their deeds. That indeed is the farthest point in straying.

1769.arabic: الم تر ان الله خلق السموت والارض بالحق ان يشا يذهبكم ويات بخلق جديد
1769.en: Do you not see that Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth? Were He to will, He could take you away and bring a new creation.

1770.en: That is not at all difficult for Allah.

1771.arabic: وبرزوا لله جميعا فقال الضعفؤا للذين استكبروا انا كنا لكم تبعا فهل انتم مغنون عنا من عذاب الله من شى قالوا لو هدىنا الله لهدينكم سوا علينا اجزعنا ام صبرنا ما لنا من محيص
1771.en: Then all of them will appear exposed before Allah, and the weak ones will say to the haughty ones: "We merely followed you. Will you, then, protect us from Allah's chastisement?" They will say: "Had Allah shown us the Way to our salvation, we would surely have also guided you. Now it is all the same whether we cry or suffer patiently, we have no escape."

1772.arabic: وقال الشيطن لما قضى الامر ان الله وعدكم وعد الحق ووعدتكم فاخلفتكم وما كان لى عليكم من سلطن الا ان دعوتكم فاستجبتم لى فلا تلومونى ولوموا انفسكم ما انا بمصرخكم وما انتم بمصرخى انى كفرت بما اشركتمون من قبل ان الظلمين لهم عذاب اليم
1772.en: After the matter has been finally decided Satan will say: "Surely whatever Allah promised you was true; as for me, I went back on the promise I made to you. I had no power over you except that I called you to my way and you responded to me. So, do not blame me but blame yourselves. Here, neither I can come to your rescue, nor can you come to mine. I disavow your former act of associating me in the past with Allah. A grievous chastisement inevitably lies ahead for such wrong#doers."

1773.arabic: وادخل الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها باذن ربهم تحيتهم فيها سلم
1773.en: As for those who had believed and did good in the world, they shall be admitted to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow. There, with the leave of Allah, they shall abide forever, and will be greeted with: "Peace".

1774.arabic: الم تر كيف ضرب الله مثلا كلمة طيبة كشجرة طيبة اصلها ثابت وفرعها فى السما
1774.en: Do you not see how Allah has given the example of a good word? It is like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed, and whose branches reach the sky,

1775.arabic: تؤتى اكلها كل حينۭ باذن ربها ويضرب الله الامثال للناس لعلهم يتذكرون
1775.en: ever yielding its fruit in every season with the leave of its Lord. Allah gives examples for mankind that they may take heed.

1776.arabic: ومثل كلمة خبيثة كشجرة خبيثة اجتثت من فوق الارض ما لها من قرار
1776.en: And the example of an evil word is that of an evil tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, wholly unable to endure.

1777.arabic: يثبت الله الذين امنوا بالقول الثابت فى الحيوة الدنيا وفى الاخرة ويضل الله الظلمين ويفعل الله ما يشا
1777.en: Thus, through a firm word, Allah grants firmness to the believers both in this world and in the Hereafter. As for the wrong#doers, Allah lets them go astray. Allah does whatever He wills.

1778.arabic: الم تر الى الذين بدلوا نعمت الله كفرا واحلوا قومهم دار البوار
1778.en: Did you not see those who have exchanged Allah's favour with ingratitude to Him, causing their people to be cast in the abode of utter perdition

1779.en: Hell, wherein they shall roast? How wretched a place to settle in!

1780.arabic: وجعلوا لله اندادا ليضلوا عن سبيله قل تمتعوا فان مصيركم الى النار
1780.en: They have set up rivals to Allah that they may lead people astray from His way. Tell them: "Enjoy for a while. You are doomed to end up in the Fire!"

1781.arabic: قل لعبادى الذين امنوا يقيموا الصلوة وينفقوا مما رزقنهم سرا وعلانية من قبل ان ياتى يوم لا بيع فيه ولا خلل
1781.en: (O Prophet), tell those of My servants who believe that they should establish Prayer and spend out of what We have provided them with, both secretly and openly, before there arrives the Day when there will be no bargaining, nor any mutual befriending.

1782.arabic: الله الذى خلق السموت والارض وانزل من السما ما فاخرج به من الثمرت رزقا لكم وسخر لكم الفلك لتجرى فى البحر بامره وسخر لكم الانهر
1782.en: It is Allah Who created the heavens and the earth, Who sent down water from the heaven and thereby brought forth a variety of fruits as your sustenance, Who subjected for you the ships that they may sail in the sea by His command, Who subjected for you the rivers,

1783.arabic: وسخر لكم الشمس والقمر دائبين وسخر لكم اليل والنهار
1783.en: Who subjected for you the sun and the moon and both of them are constant on their courses, Who subjected for you the night and the day,

1784.arabic: واتىكم من كل ما سالتموه وان تعدوا نعمت الله لا تحصوها ان الانسن لظلوم كفار
1784.en: and Who gave you all that you asked Him for. Were you to count the favours of Allah you shall never be able to encompass them. Verily man is highly unjust, exceedingly ungrateful.

1785.arabic: واذ قال ابرهيم رب اجعل هذا البلد امنا واجنبنى وبنى ان نعبد الاصنام
1785.en: And call to mind when Abraham prayed: "My Lord! Make this city secure, and keep me and my sons away from worshipping the idols.

1786.arabic: رب انهن اضللن كثيرا من الناس فمن تبعنى فانه منى ومن عصانى فانك غفور رحيم
1786.en: My Lord! They have caused many people to go astray. Now, if anyone follows my way, he is from me; and if anyone follows a way opposed to mine, then surely You are Ever#Forgiving, Most Merciful."

1787.arabic: ربنا انى اسكنت من ذريتى بواد غير ذى زرع عند بيتك المحرم ربنا ليقيموا الصلوة فاجعل افـدة من الناس تهوى اليهم وارزقهم من الثمرت لعلهم يشكرون
1787.en: "Our Lord! I have made some of my offspring settle in a barren valley near Your Sacred House! Our Lord! I did so that they may establish Prayer. So make the hearts of people affectionately inclined to them, and provide them with fruits for their sustenance that they may give thanks.

1788.arabic: ربنا انك تعلم ما نخفى وما نعلن وما يخفى على الله من شى فى الارض ولا فى السما
1788.en: Our Lord! Surely You know all that we conceal and all that we reveal, and nothing in the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

1789.arabic: الحمد لله الذى وهب لى على الكبر اسمعيل واسحق ان ربى لسميع الدعا
1789.en: All praise be to Allah Who, despite my old age, has given me Ishmael and Isaac. Surely my Lord hears all prayers.

1790.arabic: رب اجعلنى مقيم الصلوة ومن ذريتى ربنا وتقبل دعا
1790.en: My Lord! Enable me and my offspring to establish Prayer, and do accept, our Lord, this prayer of mine.

1791.arabic: ربنا اغفر لى ولولدى وللمؤمنين يوم يقوم الحساب
1791.en: Our Lord! Forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day when the reckoning will take place."

1792.arabic: ولا تحسبن الله غفلا عما يعمل الظلمون انما يؤخرهم ليوم تشخص فيه الابصر
1792.en: Do not think Allah is heedless of the evil deeds in which the evil#doers are engaged. He is merely granting them respite until a Day when their eyes shall continue to stare in horror,

1793.arabic: مهطعين مقنعى روسهم لا يرتد اليهم طرفهم وافـدتهم هوا
1793.en: when they shall keep pressing ahead in haste, their heads lifted up, their gaze directed forward, unable to look away from what they behold, their hearts utterly void.

1794.arabic: وانذر الناس يوم ياتيهم العذاب فيقول الذين ظلموا ربنا اخرنا الى اجل قريب نجب دعوتك ونتبع الرسل اولم تكونوا اقسمتم من قبل ما لكم من زوال
1794.en: (O Muhammad), warn mankind of the Day when a severe chastisement shall overtake them, and the wrong#doers will say: "Our Lord, grant us respite for a short while; we shall respond to Your call and will follow Your Messengers." (But they will be clearly told): "Are you not the same who swore earlier that they shall never suffer decline?"

1795.arabic: وسكنتم فى مسكن الذين ظلموا انفسهم وتبين لكم كيف فعلنا بهم وضربنا لكم الامثال
1795.en: You said so even though you had lived in the dwellings of those who had wronged themselves (by sinning), and you were aware how We dealt with them, and We had even explained to you all this by giving examples.

1796.arabic: وقد مكروا مكرهم وعند الله مكرهم وان كان مكرهم لتزول منه الجبال
1796.en: Indeed the unbelievers contrived their plan, but it is in Allah's power to nullify their plan, even though their plans were such that would move even mountains.

1797.arabic: فلا تحسبن الله مخلف وعده رسله ان الله عزيز ذو انتقام
1797.en: So, do not think, (O Prophet), that Allah will go back upon His promise to His Messengers. Surely Allah is Mighty, Lord of retribution.

1798.arabic: يوم تبدل الارض غير الارض والسموت وبرزوا لله الوحد القهار
1798.en: (Do warn them of the) Day when the heavens and the earth shall be altogether changed; when all will appear fully exposed before Allah, the One, the Irresistible!

1799.arabic: وترى المجرمين يومئذ مقرنين فى الاصفاد
1799.en: On that Day you shall see the guilty ones secured in chains;

1800.arabic: سرابيلهم من قطران وتغشى وجوههم النار
1800.en: their garments shall be black as if made out of pitch, and flames of the Fire shall cover their faces

1801.arabic: ليجزى الله كل نفس ما كسبت ان الله سريع الحساب
1801.en: so that Allah may requite each person for his deeds. Allah is swift in reckoning.

1802.arabic: هذا بلغ للناس ولينذروا به وليعلموا انما هو اله وحد وليذكر اولوا الالبب
1802.en: This is a proclamation for all mankind that they may be warned by it, and that they may know that their God is none but the One True God, and that men of understanding may take heed.

1803.arabic: الر تلك ايت الكتب وقران مبين
1803.en: Alif. Lam. Ra'. These are the verses of the Book, and a Clear Qur'an.

1804.arabic: ربما يود الذين كفروا لو كانوا مسلمين
1804.en: Soon will the time come when the unbelievers will wish they were Muslims.

1805.arabic: ذرهم ياكلوا ويتمتعوا ويلههم الامل فسوف يعلمون
1805.en: Leave them to eat and enjoy life and let false hopes amuse them. They will soon come to know.

1806.arabic: وما اهلكنا من قرية الا ولها كتاب معلوم
1806.en: Whenever We destroyed a town, a definite term had previously been decreed for it.

1807.arabic: ما تسبق من امة اجلها وما يستـخرون
1807.en: No people can outstrip the term for its destruction nor can it delay it.

1808.arabic: وقالوا يايها الذى نزل عليه الذكر انك لمجنون
1808.en: They say: "O you to whom the Admonition has been revealed, you are surely crazed.

1809.arabic: لو ما تاتينا بالملئكة ان كنت من الصدقين
1809.en: Why do you not bring down angels upon us if you are indeed truthful?"

1810.arabic: ما ننزل الملئكة الا بالحق وما كانوا اذا منظرين
1810.en: We do not send down the angels (in frivolity); and when We do send them down, We do so with Truth; then people are granted no respite.

1811.arabic: انا نحن نزلنا الذكر وانا له لحفظون
1811.en: As for the Admonition, indeed it is We Who have revealed it and it is indeed We Who are its guardians.

1812.arabic: ولقد ارسلنا من قبلك فى شيع الاولين
1812.en: (O Muhammad), certainly We did send Messengers before you among the nations which have gone by.

1813.arabic: وما ياتيهم من رسول الا كانوا به يستهزون
1813.en: And whenever a Messenger came to them, they never failed to mock him.

1814.en: Even so We make a way for it (that is, the Admonition) in the hearts of the culprits (like a hot rod);

1815.arabic: لا يؤمنون به وقد خلت سنة الاولين
1815.en: they do not believe in it. This has been the wont of people of this kind from ancient times.

1816.arabic: ولو فتحنا عليهم بابا من السما فظلوا فيه يعرجون
1816.en: If We were even to open for them a way to the heavens, and they could continually climb up to it in broad daylight,

1817.arabic: لقالوا انما سكرت ابصرنا بل نحن قوم مسحورون
1817.en: they would still have said: "Surely our eyes have been dazzled; rather, we have been enchanted."

1818.arabic: ولقد جعلنا فى السما بروجا وزينها للنظرين
1818.en: We have indeed set constellations in the heavens and have beautified them for the beholders,

1819.en: and have protected them against every accursed satan

1820.arabic: الا من استرق السمع فاتبعه شهاب مبين
1820.en: save him who may eavesdrop, and then a bright flame pursues him.

1821.arabic: والارض مددنها والقينا فيها روسى وانبتنا فيها من كل شى موزون
1821.en: As for the earth, We have stretched it out and have cast on it firm mountains, and have caused to grow in it everything well#measured.

1822.arabic: وجعلنا لكم فيها معيش ومن لستم له برزقين
1822.en: And We have provided sustenance for you on it and also for those of whom you are not the providers.

1823.arabic: وان من شى الا عندنا خزائنه وما ننزله الا بقدر معلوم
1823.en: There is nothing except that its treasuries are with Us and We do not send it down except in a known measure.

1824.arabic: وارسلنا الريح لوقح فانزلنا من السما ما فاسقينكموه وما انتم له بخزنين
1824.en: We send fertilizing winds, and then cause rain to descend from the sky, providing you abundant water to drink even though you could not have stored it up for yourselves.

1825.arabic: وانا لنحن نحى ونميت ونحن الورثون
1825.en: It is indeed We Who grant life and cause death and it is We who shall be the sole Inheritors of all.

1826.arabic: ولقد علمنا المستقدمين منكم ولقد علمنا المستـخرين
1826.en: Surely We know those of you who have passed before and those who will come later.

1827.arabic: وان ربك هو يحشرهم انه حكيم عليم
1827.en: Indeed your Lord will gather them all together. Surely He is All#Wise, All#Knowing.

1828.arabic: ولقد خلقنا الانسن من صلصل من حما مسنون
1828.en: Surely We brought man into being out of dry ringing clay which was wrought from black mud,

1829.arabic: والجان خلقنه من قبل من نار السموم
1829.en: while We had brought the jinn into being before out of blazing fire.

1830.arabic: واذ قال ربك للملئكة انى خلقۢ بشرا من صلصل من حما مسنون
1830.en: Recall when your Lord said to the angels: "I will indeed bring into being a human being out of dry ringing clay wrought from black mud.

1831.arabic: فاذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحى فقعوا له سجدين
1831.en: When I have completed shaping him and have breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall you down before him in prostration."

1832.en: So, the angels # all of them # fell down in prostration,

1833.arabic: الا ابليس ابى ان يكون مع السجدين
1833.en: except Iblis; he refused to join those who prostrated.

1834.arabic: قال يابليس ما لك الا تكون مع السجدين
1834.en: The Lord inquired: "Iblis! What is the matter with you that you did not join those who prostrated?"

1835.arabic: قال لم اكن لاسجد لبشر خلقته من صلصل من حما مسنون
1835.en: He said: "It does not behove of me to prostrate myself before a human being whom You have created out of dry ringing clay wrought from black mud."

1836.en: The Lord said: "Then get out of here; you are rejected,

1837.arabic: وان عليك اللعنة الى يوم الدين
1837.en: and there shall be a curse upon you till the Day of Recompense."

1838.arabic: قال رب فانظرنى الى يوم يبعثون
1838.en: Iblis said: "My Lord! Grant me respite till the Day when they will be resurrected."

1839.en: Allah said: "For sure you are granted respite

1840.en: until the day of a known time."

1841.arabic: قال رب بما اغويتنى لازينن لهم فى الارض ولاغوينهم اجمعين
1841.en: Iblis said: "My Lord! In the manner You led me to error, I will make things on earth seem attractive to them and lead all of them to error,

1842.en: except those of Your servants whom You have singled out for Yourself."

1843.en: Allah said: "Here is the path that leads straight to Me.

1844.arabic: ان عبادى ليس لك عليهم سلطن الا من اتبعك من الغاوين
1844.en: Over My true servants you will be able to exercise no power, your power will be confined to the erring ones, those who choose to follow you.

1845.en: Surely Hell is the promised place for all of them."

1846.arabic: لها سبعة ابوب لكل باب منهم جز مقسوم
1846.en: There are seven gates in it, and to each gate a portion of them has been allotted.

1847.en: As for the God#fearing, they shall be amid gardens and springs.

1848.en: They will be told: "Enter it in peace and security."

1849.arabic: ونزعنا ما فى صدورهم من غل اخونا على سرر متقبلين
1849.en: And We shall purge their breasts of all traces of rancour; and they shall be seated on couches facing one another as brothers.

1850.arabic: لا يمسهم فيها نصب وما هم منها بمخرجين
1850.en: They shall face no fatigue in it, nor shall they ever be driven out of it.

1851.arabic: نبئ عبادى انى انا الغفور الرحيم
1851.en: (O Prophet), declare to My servants that I am indeed Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

1852.en: At the same time, My chastisement is highly painful.

1853.en: And tell them about Abraham's guests.

1854.arabic: اذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلما قال انا منكم وجلون
1854.en: When they came to Abraham they said: "Peace be upon you!" He replied: "Indeed we feel afraid of you."

1855.arabic: قالوا لا توجل انا نبشرك بغلم عليم
1855.en: They said: "Do not feel afraid, for we give you the good news of a wise boy."

1856.arabic: قال ابشرتمونى على ان مسنى الكبر فبم تبشرون
1856.en: Abraham said: "What, do you give me this tiding though old age has smitten me? Just consider what tiding do you give me!"

1857.arabic: قالوا بشرنك بالحق فلا تكن من القنطين
1857.en: They said: "The good tiding we give you is of truth. Do not, therefore, be of those who despair."

1858.arabic: قال ومن يقنط من رحمة ربه الا الضالون
1858.en: Abraham said: "Who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except the misguided?"

1859.en: He added: "What is your errand O sent ones?"

1860.arabic: قالوا انا ارسلنا الى قوم مجرمين
1860.en: They said: "Verily we have been sent to a guilty people

1861.arabic: الا ال لوط انا لمنجوهم اجمعين
1861.en: excepting the household of Lot. We shall deliver all of them,

1862.arabic: الا امراته قدرنا انها لمن الغبرين
1862.en: except his wife (about whom Allah says that) We have decreed that she shall be among those who stay behind."

1863.en: So when the envoys came to the household of Lot,

1864.en: he said: "Surely you are an unknown folk."

1865.arabic: قالوا بل جئنك بما كانوا فيه يمترون
1865.en: They said: "Nay, we have brought to you that concerning which they have been in doubt.

1866.en: We truly tell you that we have brought to you the Truth.

1867.arabic: فاسر باهلك بقطع من اليل واتبع ادبرهم ولا يلتفت منكم احد وامضوا حيث تؤمرون
1867.en: So set out with your family in a watch of the night, and keep yourself behind them, and no one of you may turn around, and keep going ahead as you have been commanded."

1868.arabic: وقضينا اليه ذلك الامر ان دابر هؤلا مقطوع مصبحين
1868.en: And We communicated to him the decree that by the morning those people will be totally destroyed.

1869.en: In the meantime the people of the city came to Lot rejoicing.

1870.arabic: قال ان هؤلا ضيفى فلا تفضحون
1870.en: He said: "These are my guests, so do not disgrace me.

1871.en: Have fear of Allah, and do not humiliate me."

1872.en: They replied: "Did we not forbid you again and again to extend hospitality to all and sundry?"

1873.arabic: قال هؤلا بناتى ان كنتم فعلين
1873.en: Lot exclaimed in exasperation: "If you are bent on doing something, then here are my daughters."

1874.en: By your life, (O Prophet), they went about blindly stumbling in their intoxication.

1875.en: Then the mighty Blast caught them at sunrise,

1876.arabic: فجعلنا عليها سافلها وامطرنا عليهم حجارة من سجيل
1876.en: and turned the land upside down, and rained down stones of baked clay.

1877.en: There are great Signs in this for those endowed with intelligence.

1878.en: The place (where this occurred) lies along a known route.

1879.en: Verily there is a Sign in this for the believers.

1880.en: And the people of Aykah were also wrong#doers.

1881.en: So We chastised them. The desolate locations of both communities lie on a well#known highway.

1882.en: Surely the people of al#Hijr also rejected the Messengers, calling them liars.

1883.en: We also gave them Our Signs, yet they turned away from them.

1884.arabic: وكانوا ينحتون من الجبال بيوتا امنين
1884.en: They used to hew out houses from the mountains and lived in security.

1885.en: Then the Blast caught them in the morning

1886.arabic: فما اغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون
1886.en: and whatever they had been earning proved of no avail.

1887.arabic: وما خلقنا السموت والارض وما بينهما الا بالحق وان الساعة لاتية فاصفح الصفح الجميل
1887.en: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them except with Truth. Surely the Hour will come. So, (O Muhammad), do graciously overlook them (despite their misdeeds).

1888.en: Your Lord is indeed the Creator of all, the All#Knowing.

1889.arabic: ولقد اتينك سبعا من المثانى والقران العظيم
1889.en: We have indeed bestowed on you the seven oft#repeated verses and the Great Qur'an.

1890.arabic: لا تمدن عينيك الى ما متعنا به ازوجا منهم ولا تحزن عليهم واخفض جناحك للمؤمنين
1890.en: Do not even cast your eyes towards the worldly goods We have granted to different kinds of people, nor grieve over the state they are in, but turn your loving attention to the believers instead,

1891.en: and clearly tell the unbelievers: "I am most certainly a plain warner,"

1892.en: even as We had sent warning to those who had divided their religion into fragments;

1893.en: those who had split up their Qur'an into pieces.

1894.en: By your Lord, We will question them all

1895.en: concerning what they have been doing.

1896.arabic: فاصدع بما تؤمر واعرض عن المشركين
1896.en: (O Prophet), proclaim what you are commanded, and pay no heed to those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity.

1897.en: Surely We suffice to deal with those who scoff at you,

1898.arabic: الذين يجعلون مع الله الها اخر فسوف يعلمون
1898.en: those who set up another deity alongside Allah. They shall soon come to know.

1899.arabic: ولقد نعلم انك يضيق صدرك بما يقولون
1899.en: We certainly know that their statements sorely grieve you.

1900.arabic: فسبح بحمد ربك وكن من السجدين
1900.en: When (you feel so) glorify your Lord with His praise and prostrate yourself before Him,

1901.en: and worship your Lord until the last moment (of your life) that will most certainly come.

1902.arabic: اتى امر الله فلا تستعجلوه سبحنه وتعلى عما يشركون
1902.en: Allah's judgement has (all but) come; do not, then, call for its speedy advent. Holy is He, and far above their associating others with Him in His Divinity.

1903.arabic: ينزل الملئكة بالروح من امره على من يشا من عباده ان انذروا انه لا اله الا انا فاتقون
1903.en: He sends down this spirit (of prophecy) by His command through His angels on any of His servants whom He wills, (directing them): "Warn people that there is no deity but Me; so hold Me alone in fear."

1904.arabic: خلق السموت والارض بالحق تعلى عما يشركون
1904.en: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Allah in His Divinity.

1905.arabic: خلق الانسن من نطفة فاذا هو خصيم مبين
1905.en: He created man out of a mere drop of fluid, and lo! he turned into an open wrangler.

1906.arabic: والانعم خلقها لكم فيها دف ومنفع ومنها تاكلون
1906.en: He created the cattle. They are a source of clothing and food and also a variety of other benefits for you.

1907.arabic: ولكم فيها جمال حين تريحون وحين تسرحون
1907.en: And you find beauty in them as you drive them to pasture in the morning and as you drive them back home in the evening;

1908.arabic: وتحمل اثقالكم الى بلد لم تكونوا بلغيه الا بشق الانفس ان ربكم لروف رحيم
1908.en: and they carry your loads to many a place which you would be unable to reach without much hardship. Surely your Lord is Intensely Loving, Most Merciful.

1909.arabic: والخيل والبغال والحمير لتركبوها وزينة ويخلق ما لا تعلمون
1909.en: And He created horses and mules and asses for you to ride, and also for your adornment. And He creates many things (for you) that you do not even know about.

1910.arabic: وعلى الله قصد السبيل ومنها جائر ولو شا لهدىكم اجمعين
1910.en: It rests with Allah alone to show you the Right Way, even when there are many crooked ways. Had He so willed, He would have (perforce) guided you all aright.

1911.arabic: هو الذى انزل من السما ما لكم منه شراب ومنه شجر فيه تسيمون
1911.en: He it is Who sends down water for you from the sky out of which you drink and out of which grow the plants on which you pasture your cattle,

1912.arabic: ينبت لكم به الزرع والزيتون والنخيل والاعنب ومن كل الثمرت ان فى ذلك لاية لقوم يتفكرون
1912.en: and by virtue of which He causes crops and olives and date#palms and grapes and all kinds of fruit to grow for you. Surely in this there is a great Sign for those who reflect.

1913.arabic: وسخر لكم اليل والنهار والشمس والقمر والنجوم مسخرتۢ بامره ان فى ذلك لايت لقوم يعقلون
1913.en: He has subjected for you the night and the day and the sun and the moon and the stars have also been made subservient by His command. Surely there are Signs in this for those who use their reason.

1914.arabic: وما ذرا لكم فى الارض مختلفا الونه ان فى ذلك لاية لقوم يذكرون
1914.en: And there are also Signs for those who take heed in the numerous things of various colours that He has created for you on earth.

1915.arabic: وهو الذى سخر البحر لتاكلوا منه لحما طريا وتستخرجوا منه حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك مواخر فيه ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون
1915.en: And He it is Who has subjected the sea that you may eat fresh fish from it and bring forth ornaments from it that you can wear. And you see ships ploughing their course through it so that you may go forth seeking His Bounty and be grateful to Him.

1916.arabic: والقى فى الارض روسى ان تميد بكم وانهرا وسبلا لعلكم تهتدون
1916.en: And He has placed firm mountains on the earth lest it should move away from you, and has made rivers and tracks that you may find your way,

1917.en: and He has set other landmarks in the earth. And by the stars too do people find their way.

1918.arabic: افمن يخلق كمن لا يخلق افلا تذكرون
1918.en: Is then the One Who creates like the one who does not create? Will you not, then, take heed?

1919.arabic: وان تعدوا نعمة الله لا تحصوها ان الله لغفور رحيم
1919.en: For, were you to count the favours of Allah, you will not be able to count them. Surely Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

1920.arabic: والله يعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون
1920.en: Allah knows all that you conceal and all that you disclose.

1921.arabic: والذين يدعون من دون الله لا يخلقون شيـا وهم يخلقون
1921.en: Those whom they call upon beside Allah have created nothing; rather, they themselves were created;

1922.arabic: اموت غير احيا وما يشعرون ايان يبعثون
1922.en: they are dead, not living. They do not even know when they will be resurrected.

1923.arabic: الهكم اله وحد فالذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة قلوبهم منكرة وهم مستكبرون
1923.en: Your God is the One God. But the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are steeped in rejection of the Truth, and they are given to arrogance.

1924.arabic: لا جرم ان الله يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون انه لا يحب المستكبرين
1924.en: Surely Allah knows all that they conceal and all that they disclose. He certainly does not love those who are steeped in arrogance.

1925.arabic: واذا قيل لهم ماذا انزل ربكم قالوا اسطير الاولين
1925.en: When they are asked: "What is it that your Lord has revealed?" They answer: "They are merely tales of olden times!"

1926.arabic: ليحملوا اوزارهم كاملة يوم القيمة ومن اوزار الذين يضلونهم بغير علم الا سا ما يزرون
1926.en: (They say so) that they may bear the full weight of their burdens on the Day of Resurrection and also of the burdens of those whom they misled on account of their ignorance. What a heavy burden are they undertaking to bear!

1927.arabic: قد مكر الذين من قبلهم فاتى الله بنينهم من القواعد فخر عليهم السقف من فوقهم واتىهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون
1927.en: Surely many people before them had plotted in a similar manner to (vanquish the Truth), but Allah uprooted the whole structure of their plot from its foundations so that the roof fell in upon them, and the chastisement (of Allah) visited them from unknown directions.

1928.arabic: ثم يوم القيمة يخزيهم ويقول اين شركاى الذين كنتم تشقون فيهم قال الذين اوتوا العلم ان الخزى اليوم والسو على الكفرين
1928.en: And again, on the Day of Resurrection, He will bring them to disgrace, and say: "Tell Me, now, where are those to whom you ascribed a share in My Divinity, and for whose sake you disputed (with the upholders of the Truth)?" Those who were endowed with knowledge (in the world) will say: "Surely today humiliation and misery shall be the lot of the unbelievers";

1929.arabic: الذين تتوفىهم الملئكة ظالمى انفسهم فالقوا السلم ما كنا نعمل من سوۭ بلى ان الله عليمۢ بما كنتم تعملون
1929.en: the same unbelievers who, when the angels seize them and cause them to die while they are engaged in wrong#doing, they will proffer their submission saying: "We were engaged in no evil." (The angels will answer them): "Surely Allah knows well all that you did.

1930.arabic: فادخلوا ابوب جهنم خلدين فيها فلبئس مثوى المتكبرين
1930.en: Go now, and enter the gate of Hell, and abide in it for ever. " Evil indeed is the abode of the arrogant.

1931.arabic: وقيل للذين اتقوا ماذا انزل ربكم قالوا خيرا للذين احسنوا فى هذه الدنيا حسنة ولدار الاخرة خير ولنعم دار المتقين
1931.en: And when the God#fearing are asked: "What has your Lord revealed?" they answer: "Something excellent!" Good fortune in this world awaits those who do good; and certainly the abode of the Hereafter is even better for them. How excellent is the abode of the God#fearing:

1932.arabic: جنت عدن يدخلونها تجرى من تحتها الانهر لهم فيها ما يشاون كذلك يجزى الله المتقين
1932.en: everlasting gardens that they shall enter; the gardens beneath which rivers shall flow, and where they shall have whatever they desire! Thus does Allah reward the God#fearing,

1933.arabic: الذين تتوفىهم الملئكة طيبين يقولون سلم عليكم ادخلوا الجنة بما كنتم تعملون
1933.en: those whose souls the angels seize while they are in a state of purity, saying: "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise as a reward for your deeds."

1934.arabic: هل ينظرون الا ان تاتيهم الملئكة او ياتى امر ربك كذلك فعل الذين من قبلهم وما ظلمهم الله ولكن كانوا انفسهم يظلمون
1934.en: (O Muhammad), are they waiting for anything else than that the angels should appear before them, or that your Lord's judgement should come? Many before them acted with similar temerity. And then what happened with them was not Allah's wrong#doing; they rather wronged themselves.

1935.arabic: فاصابهم سيـات ما عملوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزون
1935.en: The evil consequences of their misdeeds overtook them and what they mocked at overwhelmed them.

1936.arabic: وقال الذين اشركوا لو شا الله ما عبدنا من دونه من شى نحن ولا اباؤنا ولا حرمنا من دونه من شى كذلك فعل الذين من قبلهم فهل على الرسل الا البلغ المبين
1936.en: Those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity say: "Were Allah to will so, neither we nor our forefathers would have worshipped any other than Him, nor would we have prohibited anything without His command." Their predecessors proffered similar excuses. Do the Messengers have any other duty but to plainly convey the Message?

1937.arabic: ولقد بعثنا فى كل امة رسولا ان اعبدوا الله واجتنبوا الطغوت فمنهم من هدى الله ومنهم من حقت عليه الضللة فسيروا فى الارض فانظروا كيف كان عقبة المكذبين
1937.en: We raised a Messenger in every community (to tell them): "Serve Allah and shun the Evil One." Thereafter Allah guided some of them while others were overtaken by error. Go about the earth, then, and observe what was the end of those who rejected the Messengers, calling them liars.

1938.arabic: ان تحرص على هدىهم فان الله لا يهدى من يضل وما لهم من نصرين
1938.en: (O Muhammad), howsoever eager you may be to show them the Right Way, Allah does not bestow His guidance on those whom He lets go astray; and in fact none will be able to help them.

1939.arabic: واقسموا بالله جهد ايمنهم لا يبعث الله من يموت بلى وعدا عليه حقا ولكن اكثر الناس لا يعلمون
1939.en: They swear most solemnly in the name of Allah and say: "Allah shall not raise to life any who dies." (Yes, He will do so); that is a promise by which He is bound, even though most people do not know that.

1940.arabic: ليبين لهم الذى يختلفون فيه وليعلم الذين كفروا انهم كانوا كذبين
1940.en: (That is bound to happen in order that) He may make clear to them the reality regarding the matters on which they differ and that the unbelievers may realize that they were liars.

1941.arabic: انما قولنا لشى اذا اردنه ان نقول له كن فيكون
1941.en: (As for the possibility of resurrection, bear in mind that) whenever We do will something, We have to do no more than say: "Be", and it is.

1942.arabic: والذين هاجروا فى الله من بعد ما ظلموا لنبوئنهم فى الدنيا حسنة ولاجر الاخرة اكبر لو كانوا يعلمون
1942.en: As for those who have forsaken their homes for the sake of Allah after enduring persecution, We shall certainly grant them a good abode in this world; and surely the reward of the Hereafter is much greater. If they could but know (what an excellent end awaits)

1943.en: those who remain steadfast and put their trust in their Lord.

1944.arabic: وما ارسلنا من قبلك الا رجالا نوحى اليهم فسـلوا اهل الذكر ان كنتم لا تعلمون
1944.en: (O Muhammad), whenever We raised any Messengers before you, they were no other than human beings; (except that) to them We sent revelation. So ask those who possess knowledge if you do not know.

1945.arabic: بالبينت والزبر وانزلنا اليك الذكر لتبين للناس ما نزل اليهم ولعلهم يتفكرون
1945.en: We raised the Messengers earlier with Clear Signs and Divine Books, and We have now sent down this Reminder upon you that you may elucidate to people the teaching that has been sent down for them, and that the people may themselves reflect.

1946.arabic: افامن الذين مكروا السيـات ان يخسف الله بهم الارض او ياتيهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون
1946.en: Do those who have been devising evil plans (against the mission of the Messenger) feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them up or that chastisement will not come upon them from a direction that they will not even be able to imagine;

1947.arabic: او ياخذهم فى تقلبهم فما هم بمعجزين
1947.en: or that He will not suddenly seize them while they are going about to and fro and they will be unable to frustrate His design,

1948.arabic: او ياخذهم على تخوف فان ربكم لروف رحيم
1948.en: or that He will not seize them when they are apprehensive of the impending calamity? Surely your Lord is Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

1949.arabic: اولم يروا الى ما خلق الله من شى يتفيؤا ظلله عن اليمين والشمائل سجدا لله وهم دخرون
1949.en: Do the people not see how the objects Allah has created cast their shadows right and left, prostrating themselves in utter submission to Allah?

1950.arabic: ولله يسجد ما فى السموت وما فى الارض من دابة والملئكة وهم لا يستكبرون
1950.en: All living creatures and all angels in the heavens and on the earth are in prostration before Allah; and never do they behave in arrogant defiance.

1951.arabic: يخافون ربهم من فوقهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون
1951.en: They hold their Lord, Who is above them, in fear, and do as they are bidden.

1952.arabic: وقال الله لا تتخذوا الهين اثنين انما هو اله وحد فايى فارهبون
1952.en: Allah has commanded: "Do not take two gods; for He is but One God. So fear Me alone."

1953.arabic: وله ما فى السموت والارض وله الدين واصبا افغير الله تتقون
1953.en: His is whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and obedience to Him inevitably pervades the whole universe. Will you, then, hold in awe any other than Allah?

1954.arabic: وما بكم من نعمة فمن الله ثم اذا مسكم الضر فاليه تجـرون
1954.en: Every bounty that you enjoy is from Allah; and whenever any misfortune strikes you, it is to Him that you cry for the removal of your distress.

1955.arabic: ثم اذا كشف الضر عنكم اذا فريق منكم بربهم يشركون
1955.en: But as soon as He removes the distress from you, some of you associate others with their Lord in giving thanks,

1956.arabic: ليكفروا بما اتينهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون
1956.en: that they may show ingratitude for the bounties We bestowed upon them. So enjoy yourselves for a while, soon you will come to know (the truth).

1957.arabic: ويجعلون لما لا يعلمون نصيبا مما رزقنهم تالله لتسـلن عما كنتم تفترون
1957.en: They set apart for those, whose reality they do not even know, a portion of the sustenance We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be called to account for the lies that you have invented!

1958.arabic: ويجعلون لله البنت سبحنه ولهم ما يشتهون
1958.en: They assign daughters to Allah # glory be to Him # whereas they assign to themselves what they truly desire!

1959.arabic: واذا بشر احدهم بالانثى ظل وجهه مسودا وهو كظيم
1959.en: When any of them is told about the birth of a female his face turns dark, and he is filled with suppressed anger,

1960.arabic: يتورى من القوم من سو ما بشر به ايمسكه على هون ام يدسه فى التراب الا سا ما يحكمون
1960.en: and he hides himself from people because of the bad news, thinking: should he keep the child despite disgrace, or should he bury it in dust? How evil is their estimate of Allah!

1961.arabic: للذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة مثل السو ولله المثل الاعلى وهو العزيز الحكيم
1961.en: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter deserve to be characterized with evil attributes whereas Allah's are the most excellent attributes. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

1962.arabic: ولو يؤاخذ الله الناس بظلمهم ما ترك عليها من دابة ولكن يؤخرهم الى اجل مسمى فاذا جا اجلهم لا يستـخرون ساعة ولا يستقدمون
1962.en: Were Allah to take people to task for their wrong#doing, He would not have spared even a single living creature on the face of the earth. But He grants them respite until an appointed term. And when that term arrives, they have no power to delay it by a single moment, nor to hasten it.

1963.arabic: ويجعلون لله ما يكرهون وتصف السنتهم الكذب ان لهم الحسنى لا جرم ان لهم النار وانهم مفرطون
