1963.en: They assign to Allah what they dislike for themselves and their tongues utter a sheer lie in stating that a happy state awaits them. Without doubt the Fire awaits them and it is to it that they shall be hastened.

1964.arabic: تالله لقد ارسلنا الى امم من قبلك فزين لهم الشيطن اعملهم فهو وليهم اليوم ولهم عذاب اليم
1964.en: By Allah, (O Muhammad), We sent Messengers to other communities before you but Satan made their evil deeds attractive to them (so they paid no heed to the call of the Messengers). The same Satan is their patron today and they are heading towards a painful chastisement.

1965.arabic: وما انزلنا عليك الكتب الا لتبين لهم الذى اختلفوا فيه وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون
1965.en: We have sent down the Book that you may explain to them the truth concerning what they are disputing and that the Book may serve as a guidance and mercy for those who believe in it.

1966.arabic: والله انزل من السما ما فاحيا به الارض بعد موتها ان فى ذلك لاية لقوم يسمعون
1966.en: Allah sends down water from the heaven, and thereby He instantly revives the earth after it lay dead. Verily there is a sign in it for those who have ears.

1967.arabic: وان لكم فى الانعم لعبرة نسقيكم مما فى بطونه من بين فرث ودم لبنا خالصا سائغا للشربين
1967.en: Surely there is a lesson for you in the cattle: We provide you to drink out of that which is in their bellies between the faeces and the blood # pure milk # which is a palatable drink for those who take it.

1968.arabic: ومن ثمرت النخيل والاعنب تتخذون منه سكرا ورزقا حسنا ان فى ذلك لاية لقوم يعقلون
1968.en: And out of the fruits of date#palms and grapes you derive intoxicants as well as wholesome sustenance. Surely there is a sign for those who use reason.

1969.arabic: واوحى ربك الى النحل ان اتخذى من الجبال بيوتا ومن الشجر ومما يعرشون
1969.en: Your Lord inspired the bee, saying: "Set up hives in the mountains and in the trees and in the trellises that people put up,

1970.arabic: ثم كلى من كل الثمرت فاسلكى سبل ربك ذللا يخرج من بطونها شراب مختلف الونه فيه شفا للناس ان فى ذلك لاية لقوم يتفكرون
1970.en: then suck the juice of every kind of fruit and keep treading the ways of your Lord which have been made easy." There comes forth from their bellies a drink varied in colours, wherein there is healing for men. Verily there is a sign in this for those who reflect.

1971.arabic: والله خلقكم ثم يتوفىكم ومنكم من يرد الى ارذل العمر لكى لا يعلم بعد علم شيـا ان الله عليم قدير
1971.en: Allah has created you, and then He causes you to die. Some of you have your lives prolonged to an abject old age, when one loses all knowledge after having acquired it. Allah is All#Knowing, All#Powerful.

1972.arabic: والله فضل بعضكم على بعض فى الرزق فما الذين فضلوا برادى رزقهم على ما ملكت ايمنهم فهم فيه سوا افبنعمة الله يجحدون
1972.en: Allah has favoured some of you with more worldly provisions than others. Then those who are more favoured do not give away their provisions to their slaves lest they become equal sharers in it. Do they, then, deny the favour of Allah?

1973.arabic: والله جعل لكم من انفسكم ازوجا وجعل لكم من ازوجكم بنين وحفدة ورزقكم من الطيبت افبالبطل يؤمنون وبنعمت الله هم يكفرون
1973.en: And Allah has given you spouses from your kind, and has granted you through your spouses, sons and grandsons, and has provided you wholesome things as sustenance. (After knowing all this), do they still believe in falsehood and deny Allah's bounty,

1974.arabic: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا يملك لهم رزقا من السموت والارض شيـا ولا يستطيعون
1974.en: and worship instead of Allah, those helpless beings who have no control over providing them any sustenance from the heavens and the earth; do you worship those who have no power to do anything of this sort?

1975.arabic: فلا تضربوا لله الامثال ان الله يعلم وانتم لا تعلمون
1975.en: So do not strike any similitudes to Allah. Allah knows whereas you do not know.

1976.arabic: ضرب الله مثلا عبدا مملوكا لا يقدر على شى ومن رزقنه منا رزقا حسنا فهو ينفق منه سرا وجهرا هل يستون الحمد لله بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون
1976.en: Allah sets forth a parable: There is one who is a slave and is owned by another and has no power over anything; and there is one whom We have granted good provision Ourselves, of which he spends both secretly and openly. Can they be equal? All praise be to Allah. But most of them do not even know (this simple fact).

1977.arabic: وضرب الله مثلا رجلين احدهما ابكم لا يقدر على شى وهو كل على مولىه اينما يوجهه لا يات بخير هل يستوى هو ومن يامر بالعدل وهو على صرط مستقيم
1977.en: Allah sets forth another parable: There are two men, one of whom is dumb and has no power over anything; he is a burden to his master, and wheresoever his master directs him, he fails to bring forth any good. Can such a person be the equal of one who enjoins justice and himself follows the Right Way?

1978.arabic: ولله غيب السموت والارض وما امر الساعة الا كلمح البصر او هو اقرب ان الله على كل شى قدير
1978.en: Allah has full knowledge of the truths beyond the reach of perception both in the heavens and the earth; and the coming of the Hour will take no more than the twinkling of an eye; it may take even less. Indeed Allah has power over everything.

1979.arabic: والله اخرجكم من بطون امهتكم لا تعلمون شيـا وجعل لكم السمع والابصر والافـدة لعلكم تشكرون
1979.en: Allah has brought you forth from your mothers' wombs when you knew nothing, and then gave you hearing, and sight and thinking hearts so that you may give thanks.

1980.arabic: الم يروا الى الطير مسخرت فى جو السما ما يمسكهن الا الله ان فى ذلك لايت لقوم يؤمنون
1980.en: Have they never noticed the birds how they are held under control in the middle of the sky, where none holds them (from falling) except Allah? Surely there are signs in this for those who believe.

1981.arabic: والله جعل لكم من بيوتكم سكنا وجعل لكم من جلود الانعم بيوتا تستخفونها يوم ظعنكم ويوم اقامتكم ومن اصوافها واوبارها واشعارها اثثا ومتعا الى حين
1981.en: Allah has made your houses a repose, and has provided you with the skins of the cattle for your habitation which are light to handle both when you travel and when you camp; and out of their wool and their fur and their hair He has given you furnishings and goods for use over a period of time.

1982.arabic: والله جعل لكم مما خلق ظللا وجعل لكم من الجبال اكننا وجعل لكم سربيل تقيكم الحر وسربيل تقيكم باسكم كذلك يتم نعمته عليكم لعلكم تسلمون
1982.en: And Allah has provided shade for you out of some of the things He has created; and He has provided you with shelters in the mountains, and has given you coats that protect you from heat as well as coats that protect you in battle. Thus does He complete His favour upon you that you may submit to Him.

1983.arabic: فان تولوا فانما عليك البلغ المبين
1983.en: But if they turn away, your only duty is to clearly deliver the message of the truth.

1984.arabic: يعرفون نعمت الله ثم ينكرونها واكثرهم الكفرون
1984.en: They are aware of the favours of Allah, and yet refuse to acknowledge them. Most of them are determined not to accept the Truth.

1985.arabic: ويوم نبعث من كل امة شهيدا ثم لا يؤذن للذين كفروا ولا هم يستعتبون
1985.en: (They are heedless of) the Day when We shall raise a witness from each community and then the unbelievers will neither be allowed to plead nor will they be asked to repent and seek pardon.

1986.arabic: واذا را الذين ظلموا العذاب فلا يخفف عنهم ولا هم ينظرون
1986.en: Once the wrong#doers have beheld the chastisement, neither will it be lightened for them nor will they be granted any respite.

1987.arabic: واذا را الذين اشركوا شركاهم قالوا ربنا هؤلا شركاؤنا الذين كنا ندعوا من دونك فالقوا اليهم القول انكم لكذبون
1987.en: And when those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity will see those to whom they ascribed this share, they will say: "Our Lord! These are the beings to whom we ascribed a share in Your Divinity and whom we called upon instead of You," whereupon those beings will fling at them the words: "You are liars."

1988.arabic: والقوا الى الله يومئذ السلم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون
1988.en: On that Day they will offer their submission and all that they had fabricated will have vanished.

1989.arabic: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله زدنهم عذابا فوق العذاب بما كانوا يفسدون
1989.en: As for those who disbelieved and barred others from the way of Allah, We shall add further chastisement to their chastisement for all the mischief they did.

1990.arabic: ويوم نبعث فى كل امة شهيدا عليهم من انفسهم وجئنا بك شهيدا على هؤلا ونزلنا عليك الكتب تبينا لكل شى وهدى ورحمة وبشرى للمسلمين
1990.en: (O Muhammad), warn them of the coming of a Day when We shall bring forth a witness against them from each community and We shall bring you forth as a witness against them all; (and it is for that purpose that) We sent down the Book to you which makes everything clear, and serves as a guidance and mercy and glad tidings to those who have submitted to Allah.

1991.arabic: ان الله يامر بالعدل والاحسن وايتائ ذى القربى وينهى عن الفحشا والمنكر والبغى يعظكم لعلكم تذكرون
1991.en: Surely Allah enjoins justice, kindness and the doing of good to kith and kin, and forbids all that is shameful, evil and oppressive. He exhorts you so that you may be mindful.

1992.arabic: واوفوا بعهد الله اذا عهدتم ولا تنقضوا الايمن بعد توكيدها وقد جعلتم الله عليكم كفيلا ان الله يعلم ما تفعلون
1992.en: And fulfil the covenant which you have made with Allah and do not break your oaths after having firmly made them, and after having made Allah your witness. Surely Allah knows all that you do.

1993.arabic: ولا تكونوا كالتى نقضت غزلها من بعد قوة انكثا تتخذون ايمنكم دخلا بينكم ان تكون امة هى اربى من امة انما يبلوكم الله به وليبينن لكم يوم القيمة ما كنتم فيه تختلفون
1993.en: And do not become like the woman who, after having painstakingly spun her yarn, caused it to disintegrate into pieces. You resort to oaths as instruments of mutual deceit so that one people might take greater advantage than another although Allah puts you to the test through this. Surely on the Day of Resurrection He will make clear the Truth concerning the matters over which you differed.

1994.arabic: ولو شا الله لجعلكم امة وحدة ولكن يضل من يشا ويهدى من يشا ولتسـلن عما كنتم تعملون
1994.en: Had Allah so willed, He would have made you all one single community. However, He lets go astray whomsoever He wills and shows the Right Way to whomsoever He wills. Surely you shall be called to account regarding what you did.

1995.arabic: ولا تتخذوا ايمنكم دخلا بينكم فتزل قدمۢ بعد ثبوتها وتذوقوا السو بما صددتم عن سبيل الله ولكم عذاب عظيم
1995.en: Do not make your oaths a means of deceiving one another or else your foot may slip after having been firm, and you may suffer evil consequences because of hindering people from the way of Allah. A mighty chastisement awaits you.

1996.arabic: ولا تشتروا بعهد الله ثمنا قليلا انما عند الله هو خير لكم ان كنتم تعلمون
1996.en: Do not barter away the covenant of Allah for a paltry gain. Verily that which is with Allah is far better for you, if you only knew.

1997.arabic: ما عندكم ينفد وما عند الله باق ولنجزين الذين صبروا اجرهم باحسن ما كانوا يعملون
1997.en: Whatever you have is bound to pass away and whatever is with Allah will last. And We shall surely grant those who have been patient their reward according to the best of what they did.

1998.arabic: من عمل صلحا من ذكر او انثى وهو مؤمن فلنحيينه حيوة طيبة ولنجزينهم اجرهم باحسن ما كانوا يعملون
1998.en: Whosoever acts righteously # whether a man or a woman # and embraces belief, We will surely grant him a good life; and will surely grant such persons their reward according to the best of their deeds.

1999.arabic: فاذا قرات القران فاستعذ بالله من الشيطن الرجيم
1999.en: Whenever you read the Qur'an seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the accursed.

2000.arabic: انه ليس له سلطن على الذين امنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون
2000.en: Surely he has no power over those who have faith and who place their trust in their Lord.

2001.arabic: انما سلطنه على الذين يتولونه والذين هم به مشركون
2001.en: He has power only over those who take him as their patron and who, under his influence, associate others with Allah in His Divinity.

2002.arabic: واذا بدلنا اية مكان اية والله اعلم بما ينزل قالوا انما انت مفترۭ بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون
2002.en: Whenever We replace one verse by another verse # and Allah knows what He should reveal # they are wont to say: "You are nothing but a fabricator (who has invented the Qur'an)." The fact is that most of them are ignorant of the Truth.

2003.arabic: قل نزله روح القدس من ربك بالحق ليثبت الذين امنوا وهدى وبشرى للمسلمين
2003.en: Tell them: "It is the spirit of holiness that has brought it down, by stages, from your Lord so that it might bring firmness to those who believe, and guidance to the Right Way, and give glad tidings of felicity and success to those who submit to Allah."

2004.arabic: ولقد نعلم انهم يقولون انما يعلمه بشر لسان الذى يلحدون اليه اعجمى وهذا لسان عربى مبين
2004.en: Surely We know well that they say about you: "It is only a human being who teaches him," (notwithstanding) that he whom they maliciously hint at is of foreign tongue, while this (Qur'an) is plain Arabic speech.

2005.arabic: ان الذين لا يؤمنون بـايت الله لا يهديهم الله ولهم عذاب اليم
2005.en: Surely Allah will not enable those who do not believe in the signs of Allah to be directed to the Right Way, and a painful chastisement awaits them.

2006.arabic: انما يفترى الكذب الذين لا يؤمنون بـايت الله واولئك هم الكذبون
2006.en: (It is not the Prophet who invents lies), it is rather those who do not believe in the signs of Allah who invent lies. They are liars.

2007.arabic: من كفر بالله من بعد ايمنه الا من اكره وقلبه مطمئن بالايمن ولكن من شرح بالكفر صدرا فعليهم غضب من الله ولهم عذاب عظيم
2007.en: Except for those who were forced to engage in infidelity to Allah after believing the while their hearts remained firmly convinced of their belief, the ones whose hearts willingly embraced disbelief shall incur Allah's wrath and a mighty chastisement lies in store for them.

2008.arabic: ذلك بانهم استحبوا الحيوة الدنيا على الاخرة وان الله لا يهدى القوم الكفرين
2008.en: That is because they love the life of this world more than the Hereafter; and Allah does not guide those who are ungrateful to Allah for His favours.

2009.arabic: اولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم وسمعهم وابصرهم واولئك هم الغفلون
2009.en: They are the ones upon whose hearts and hearing and eyes Allah has set a seal. They are utterly steeped in heedlessness.

2010.arabic: لا جرم انهم فى الاخرة هم الخسرون
2010.en: No doubt they shall be losers in the Hereafter.

2011.arabic: ثم ان ربك للذين هاجروا من بعد ما فتنوا ثم جهدوا وصبروا ان ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم
2011.en: And surely your Lord will be Most Forgiving and Most Merciful towards those who left their homes after they were persecuted, and who thereafter struggled hard and remained constant.

2012.arabic: يوم تاتى كل نفس تجدل عن نفسها وتوفى كل نفس ما عملت وهم لا يظلمون
2012.en: Allah's judgement will come about them all on the Day when everyone shall come pleading in his defence, and everyone shall be fully requited for his deeds and none shall be wronged in the least.

2013.arabic: وضرب الله مثلا قرية كانت امنة مطمئنة ياتيها رزقها رغدا من كل مكان فكفرت بانعم الله فاذقها الله لباس الجوع والخوف بما كانوا يصنعون
2013.en: Allah sets forth the parable of (the people of) a town who were secure and content and whose sustenance came in abundance from every quarter. But then the people of the town showed ingratitude towards Allah for His bounties, so Allah afflicted them with hunger and fear in punishment for their evil deeds.

2014.arabic: ولقد جاهم رسول منهم فكذبوه فاخذهم العذاب وهم ظلمون
2014.en: Most certainly a Messenger came to them from among them; but they rejected him, calling him a liar. Therefore chastisement seized them while they engaged in wrong#doing.

2015.arabic: فكلوا مما رزقكم الله حللا طيبا واشكروا نعمت الله ان كنتم اياه تعبدون
2015.en: So eat out of the lawful and good sustenance that Allah has bestowed upon you, and thank Allah for His bounty, if it is Him that you serve.

2016.arabic: انما حرم عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما اهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فان الله غفور رحيم
2016.en: Allah has forbidden you only carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine; also any animal over which the name of any other than Allah has been pronounced. But whoever eats of them under compelling necessity # neither desiring it nor exceeding the limit of absolute necessity # surely for such action Allah is Much Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2017.arabic: ولا تقولوا لما تصف السنتكم الكذب هذا حلل وهذا حرام لتفتروا على الله الكذب ان الذين يفترون على الله الكذب لا يفلحون
2017.en: And do not utter falsehoods by letting your tongues declare: "This is lawful" and "That is unlawful," thus fabricating lies against Allah. Surely those who fabricate lies against Allah will never prosper.

2018.en: Brief is their enjoyment of the world, and thereafter they shall suffer a painful chastisement.

2019.arabic: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا ما قصصنا عليك من قبل وما ظلمنهم ولكن كانوا انفسهم يظلمون
2019.en: We have already recounted to you what We prohibited to the Jews. In so doing We did not wrong them; it is they who wronged themselves.

2020.arabic: ثم ان ربك للذين عملوا السو بجهلة ثم تابوا من بعد ذلك واصلحوا ان ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم
2020.en: But to those who commit evil out of ignorance and then repent and amend their ways, thereafter your Lord will be Much Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2021.arabic: ان ابرهيم كان امة قانتا لله حنيفا ولم يك من المشركين
2021.en: Indeed Abraham was a whole community by himself, obedient to Allah, exclusively devoted to Him. And he was never one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity.

2022.arabic: شاكرا لانعمه اجتبىه وهدىه الى صرط مستقيم
2022.en: He rendered thanks to Allah for His bounties so that Allah chose him (for His favours) and directed him to the Right Way.

2023.arabic: واتينه فى الدنيا حسنة وانه فى الاخرة لمن الصلحين
2023.en: We bestowed good upon him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall certainly be among the righteous.

2024.arabic: ثم اوحينا اليك ان اتبع ملة ابرهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين
2024.en: Then We revealed to you: "Follow the way of Abraham with exclusive devotion to Allah. He was not one of those who associated others with Allah in His Divinity."

2025.arabic: انما جعل السبت على الذين اختلفوا فيه وان ربك ليحكم بينهم يوم القيمة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون
2025.en: As for the Sabbath, it was made incumbent only on those who differed about its laws. Certainly your Lord will judge on the Day of Resurrection between them regarding the matters they disputed.

2026.arabic: ادع الى سبيل ربك بالحكمة والموعظة الحسنة وجدلهم بالتى هى احسن ان ربك هو اعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو اعلم بالمهتدين
2026.en: (O Prophet), call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and goodly exhortation, and reason with them in the best manner possible. Surely your Lord knows best who has strayed away from His path, and He also knows well those who are guided to the Right Way.

2027.arabic: وان عاقبتم فعاقبوا بمثل ما عوقبتم به ولئن صبرتم لهو خير للصبرين
2027.en: If you take retribution, then do so in proportion to the wrong done to you. But if you can bear such conduct with patience, indeed that is best for the steadfast.

2028.arabic: واصبر وما صبرك الا بالله ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تك فى ضيق مما يمكرون
2028.en: And bear with patience, (O Muhammad) # and your patience is only because of the help of Allah # and do not grieve over them, nor feel distressed by their evil plans.

2029.arabic: ان الله مع الذين اتقوا والذين هم محسنون
2029.en: For surely Allah is with those who hold Him in fear and do good.

2030.arabic: سبحن الذى اسرى بعبده ليلا من المسجد الحرام الى المسجد الاقصا الذى بركنا حوله لنريه من ايتنا انه هو السميع البصير
2030.en: Holy is He Who carried His servant by night from the Holy Mosque (in Makkah) to the farther Mosque (in Jerusalem) whose surroundings We have blessed that We might show him some of Our Signs. Indeed He alone is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

2031.arabic: واتينا موسى الكتب وجعلنه هدى لبنى اسريل الا تتخذوا من دونى وكيلا
2031.en: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a source of guidance for the Children of Israel, commanding: "Take no other Guardian beside Me."

2032.arabic: ذرية من حملنا مع نوح انه كان عبدا شكورا
2032.en: You are the descendants of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah. He was truly a thankful servant.

2033.arabic: وقضينا الى بنى اسريل فى الكتب لتفسدن فى الارض مرتين ولتعلن علوا كبيرا
2033.en: Then We clearly declared to the Children of Israel in the Book: "Twice you will make mischief in the land and will commit transgression."

2034.arabic: فاذا جا وعد اولىهما بعثنا عليكم عبادا لنا اولى باس شديد فجاسوا خلل الديار وكان وعدا مفعولا
2034.en: So, when the occasion for the first of the transgressions arrived, We raised against you some of Our creatures who were full of might, and they ran over the whole of your land. This was a promise that was bound to be fulfilled.

2035.arabic: ثم رددنا لكم الكرة عليهم وامددنكم بامول وبنين وجعلنكم اكثر نفيرا
2035.en: Then We granted you an upper hand against them, and strengthened you with wealth and children, and multiplied your numbers.

2036.arabic: ان احسنتم احسنتم لانفسكم وان اساتم فلها فاذا جا وعد الاخرة ليسـوا وجوهكم وليدخلوا المسجد كما دخلوه اول مرة وليتبروا ما علوا تتبيرا
2036.en: Whenever you did good, it was to your own advantage; and whenever you committed evil, it was to your own disadvantage. So, when the time of the fulfilment of the second promise arrived, (We raised other enemies that would) disfigure your faces and enter the Temple (of Jerusalem) as they had entered the first time, and destroy whatever they could lay their hands on.

2037.arabic: عسى ربكم ان يرحمكم وان عدتم عدنا وجعلنا جهنم للكفرين حصيرا
2037.en: Your Lord may well show Mercy to you, but if you revert to your evil behaviour, We shall revert to chastising you. We have made Hell a prison for those who are thankless of Allah's bounties.

2038.arabic: ان هذا القران يهدى للتى هى اقوم ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصلحت ان لهم اجرا كبيرا
2038.en: Verily this Qur'an guides to the Way that is the Straight most. To those who believe in it, and do righteous works, it gives the good news that a great reward awaits them,

2039.arabic: وان الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة اعتدنا لهم عذابا اليما
2039.en: and warns those who do not believe in the Hereafter that We have prepared for them a grievous chastisement.

2040.arabic: ويدع الانسن بالشر دعاه بالخير وكان الانسن عجولا
2040.en: Man prays for evil in the manner he ought to pray for good. Man is ever hasty.

2041.arabic: وجعلنا اليل والنهار ايتين فمحونا اية اليل وجعلنا اية النهار مبصرة لتبتغوا فضلا من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب وكل شى فصلنه تفصيلا
2041.en: We have made night and day as two signs. We made the sign of the night devoid of light, and made the sign of the day radiant that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the computation of years and numbers. Thus We have expounded everything in detail to keep everything distinct from the other.

2042.arabic: وكل انسن الزمنه طئره فى عنقه ونخرج له يوم القيمة كتبا يلقىه منشورا
2042.en: We have fastened every man's omen to his neck. On the Day of Resurrection We shall produce for him his scroll in the shape of a wide open book, (saying):

2043.arabic: اقرا كتبك كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا
2043.en: "Read your scroll; this Day you suffice to take account of yourself."

2044.arabic: من اهتدى فانما يهتدى لنفسه ومن ضل فانما يضل عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر اخرى وما كنا معذبين حتى نبعث رسولا
2044.en: He who follows the Right Way shall do so to his own advantage; and he who strays shall incur his own loss. No one shall bear another's burden. And never do We punish any people until We send a Messenger (to make the Truth distinct from falsehood).

2045.arabic: واذا اردنا ان نهلك قرية امرنا مترفيها ففسقوا فيها فحق عليها القول فدمرنها تدميرا
2045.en: When We decide to destroy a town We command the affluent among them, whereupon they commit sins in it, then the decree (of chastisement) becomes due against them and thereafter We destroy that town utterly.

2046.arabic: وكم اهلكنا من القرون من بعد نوح وكفى بربك بذنوب عباده خبيرۢا بصيرا
2046.en: Many a generation has been destroyed by Our command since Noah's time. Your Lord is well aware and fully observant of the sins of His servants.

2047.arabic: من كان يريد العاجلة عجلنا له فيها ما نشا لمن نريد ثم جعلنا له جهنم يصلىها مذموما مدحورا
2047.en: If anyone desires immediate benefits, We hasten to grant whatever benefits We will in the present life to whomsoever We please, but thereafter We decree for him Hell wherein he shall burn, condemned and rejected.

2048.arabic: ومن اراد الاخرة وسعى لها سعيها وهو مؤمن فاولئك كان سعيهم مشكورا
2048.en: But he who desires the Hereafter and strives for it in the manner he should, and is a true believer, his striving will come to fruition.

2049.arabic: كلا نمد هؤلا وهؤلا من عطا ربك وما كان عطا ربك محظورا
2049.en: To all of these as well as those We shall provide the wherewithal of this life in the present world by dint of your Lord's Bounty; and from none shall the Bounty of your Lord be withheld.

2050.arabic: انظر كيف فضلنا بعضهم على بعض وللاخرة اكبر درجت واكبر تفضيلا
2050.en: See, how We have exalted some above others in this world, and in the Life to Come they will have higher ranks and greater degrees of excellence over others.

2051.arabic: لا تجعل مع الله الها اخر فتقعد مذموما مخذولا
2051.en: Do not set up any other god with Allah lest you are rendered humiliated and helpless.

2052.arabic: وقضى ربك الا تعبدوا الا اياه وبالولدين احسنا اما يبلغن عندك الكبر احدهما او كلاهما فلا تقل لهما اف ولا تنهرهما وقل لهما قولا كريما
2052.en: Your Lord has decreed: (i) Do not worship any but Him; (ii) Be good to your parents; and should both or any one of them attain old age with you, do not say to them even "fie" neither chide them, but speak to them with respect,

2053.arabic: واخفض لهما جناح الذل من الرحمة وقل رب ارحمهما كما ربيانى صغيرا
2053.en: and be humble and tender to them and say: "Lord, show mercy to them as they nurtured me when I was small."

2054.arabic: ربكم اعلم بما فى نفوسكم ان تكونوا صلحين فانه كان للاوبين غفورا
2054.en: Your Lord is best aware of what is in your hearts. If you are righteous, He will indeed forgive those who relent and revert (to serving Allah).

2055.arabic: وات ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ولا تبذر تبذيرا
2055.en: (iii) Give to the near of kin his due, and also to the needy and the wayfarer. (iv) Do not squander your wealth wastefully,

2056.arabic: ان المبذرين كانوا اخون الشيطين وكان الشيطن لربه كفورا
2056.en: for those who squander wastefully are Satan's brothers, and Satan is ever ungrateful to his Lord.

2057.arabic: واما تعرضن عنهم ابتغا رحمة من ربك ترجوها فقل لهم قولا ميسورا
2057.en: (v) And when you must turn away from them # (that is, from the destitute, the near of kin, the needy, and the wayfarer) # in pursuit of God's Mercy which you expect to receive, then speak to them kindly.

2058.arabic: ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة الى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط فتقعد ملوما محسورا
2058.en: (vi) Do not keep your hand fastened to your neck nor outspread it, altogether outspread, for you will be left sitting rebuked, destitute.

2059.arabic: ان ربك يبسط الرزق لمن يشا ويقدر انه كان بعباده خبيرۢا بصيرا
2059.en: Certainly Your Lord makes plentiful the provision of whomsoever He wills and straitens it for whomsoever He wills. He is well#aware and is fully observant of all that relates to His servants.

2060.arabic: ولا تقتلوا اولدكم خشية املق نحن نرزقهم واياكم ان قتلهم كان خطـا كبيرا
2060.en: (vii) Do not kill your children for fear of want. We will provide for them and for you. Surely killing them is a great sin.

2061.arabic: ولا تقربوا الزنى انه كان فحشة وسا سبيلا
2061.en: (viii) Do not even approach fornication for it is an outrageous act, and an evil way.

2062.arabic: ولا تقتلوا النفس التى حرم الله الا بالحق ومن قتل مظلوما فقد جعلنا لوليه سلطنا فلا يسرف فى القتل انه كان منصورا
2062.en: (ix) Do not kill any person whom Allah has forbidden to kill, except with right. We have granted the heir of him who has been wrongfully killed the authority to (claim retribution); so let him not exceed in slaying. He shall be helped.

2063.arabic: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم الا بالتى هى احسن حتى يبلغ اشده واوفوا بالعهد ان العهد كان مسـولا
2063.en: (x) And do not even go near the property of the orphan # except that it be in the best manner # till he attains his maturity. (xi) And fulfil the covenant, for you will be called to account regarding the covenant.

2064.arabic: واوفوا الكيل اذا كلتم وزنوا بالقسطاس المستقيم ذلك خير واحسن تاويلا
2064.en: (xii) Give full measure when you measure, and weigh with even scales. That is fair and better in consequence.

2065.arabic: ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم ان السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل اولئك كان عنه مسـولا
2065.en: (xiii) Do not follow that of which you have no knowledge. Surely the hearing, the sight, the heart # each of these shall be called to account.

2066.arabic: ولا تمش فى الارض مرحا انك لن تخرق الارض ولن تبلغ الجبال طولا
2066.en: (xiv) Do not strut about in the land arrogantly. Surely you cannot cleave the earth, nor reach the heights of the mountains in stature.

2067.arabic: كل ذلك كان سيئه عند ربك مكروها
2067.en: The wickedness of each of that is hateful to your Lord.

2068.arabic: ذلك مما اوحى اليك ربك من الحكمة ولا تجعل مع الله الها اخر فتلقى فى جهنم ملوما مدحورا
2068.en: That is part of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. So do not set up any deity beside Allah lest you are cast into Hell, rebuked and deprived of every good.

2069.arabic: افاصفىكم ربكم بالبنين واتخذ من الملئكة انثا انكم لتقولون قولا عظيما
2069.en: What, has your Lord favoured you with sons and has taken for Himself daughters from among the angels? You are indeed uttering a monstrous lie.

2070.arabic: ولقد صرفنا فى هذا القران ليذكروا وما يزيدهم الا نفورا
2070.en: We have expounded (the Truth) in diverse ways in this Qur'an that they might take it to heart but all this only aggravates their aversion.

2071.arabic: قل لو كان معه الهة كما يقولون اذا لابتغوا الى ذى العرش سبيلا
2071.en: Say, (O Muhammad): "Had there been other gods with Him, as they claim, they would surely have attempted to find a way to the Lord of the Throne.

2072.arabic: سبحنه وتعلى عما يقولون علوا كبيرا
2072.en: Holy is He and far above all that they say.

2073.arabic: تسبح له السموت السبع والارض ومن فيهن وان من شى الا يسبح بحمده ولكن لا تفقهون تسبيحهم انه كان حليما غفورا
2073.en: The seven heavens, the earth, and all that is within them give glory to Him. There is nothing but gives glory to Him with His praise, though you do not understand their hymns of praise. He is Most Forbearing, Exceedingly Forgiving."

2074.arabic: واذا قرات القران جعلنا بينك وبين الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة حجابا مستورا
2074.en: When you recite the Qur'an, We place a hidden barrier between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter;

2075.arabic: وجعلنا على قلوبهم اكنة ان يفقهوه وفى اذانهم وقرا واذا ذكرت ربك فى القران وحده ولوا على ادبرهم نفورا
2075.en: and We place a covering on their hearts so that they do not comprehend it, and We cause a heaviness in their ears; and when you mention your Lord, the Only True Lord, in the Qur'an, they turn their backs in aversion.

2076.arabic: نحن اعلم بما يستمعون به اذ يستمعون اليك واذ هم نجوى اذ يقول الظلمون ان تتبعون الا رجلا مسحورا
2076.en: We are well aware of what they wish to hear when they listen to you and what they say when they confer in whispers, when the wrong#doers say: "You are only following one who is bewitched."

2077.arabic: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الامثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا
2077.en: Just see how strange are the things they invent about you. They have altogether strayed, and are unable to find the right way.

2078.arabic: وقالوا اذا كنا عظما ورفتا انا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا
2078.en: They say: "When we are turned to bones and particles (of dust), shall we truly be raised up as a new creation?"

2079.en: Tell them: "(You will be raised afresh even if) you turn to stone or iron,

2080.arabic: او خلقا مما يكبر فى صدوركم فسيقولون من يعيدنا قل الذى فطركم اول مرة فسينغضون اليك روسهم ويقولون متى هو قل عسى ان يكون قريبا
2080.en: or any other form of creation you deem hardest of all (to recreate from)." They will certainly ask: "Who will bring us back (to life)?" Say: "He Who created you in the first instance." They will shake their heads at you and inquire: "When will that be?" Say: "Perhaps that time might have drawn near;

2081.arabic: يوم يدعوكم فتستجيبون بحمده وتظنون ان لبثتم الا قليلا
2081.en: on the Day when He will call you and you will rise praising Him in response to His call, and you will believe that you had lain in this state only for a while."

2082.arabic: وقل لعبادى يقولوا التى هى احسن ان الشيطن ينزغ بينهم ان الشيطن كان للانسن عدوا مبينا
2082.en: Tell My servants, (O Muhammad), to say always that which is best. Verily it is Satan who sows discord among people. Satan indeed is an open enemy to mankind.

2083.arabic: ربكم اعلم بكم ان يشا يرحمكم او ان يشا يعذبكم وما ارسلنك عليهم وكيلا
2083.en: Your Lord knows you best. He will have mercy on you if He wills and chastise you if He wills. We have not sent you, (O Muhammad), as an overseer over them.

2084.arabic: وربك اعلم بمن فى السموت والارض ولقد فضلنا بعض النبين على بعض واتينا داود زبورا
2084.en: Your Lord knows all who dwell in the heavens and the earth. We have exalted some Prophets over others, and We gave the Psalms to David.

2085.arabic: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دونه فلا يملكون كشف الضر عنكم ولا تحويلا
2085.en: Tell them: "Call upon those whom you fancy to be (your helpers) instead of Him! They have no power to remove any affliction from you, nor can they shift it (to any other)."

2086.arabic: اولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون الى ربهم الوسيلة ايهم اقرب ويرجون رحمته ويخافون عذابه ان عذاب ربك كان محذورا
2086.en: Those whom they call upon are themselves seeking the means of access to their Lord, each trying to be nearer to Him. They crave for His Mercy and dread His chastisement. Surely your Lord's punishment is to be feared.

2087.arabic: وان من قرية الا نحن مهلكوها قبل يوم القيمة او معذبوها عذابا شديدا كان ذلك فى الكتب مسطورا
2087.en: There is not a town but We shall destroy it or upon which We shall inflict severe chastisement before the Day of Resurrection. This is written down in the Eternal Book (of Allah).

2088.arabic: وما منعنا ان نرسل بالايت الا ان كذب بها الاولون واتينا ثمود الناقة مبصرة فظلموا بها وما نرسل بالايت الا تخويفا
2088.en: Nothing hindered Us from sending Our Signs except that the people of olden times rejected them as lies. We publicly sent the she#camel to the Thamud to open their eyes but they wronged her. We never send Our Signs except to cause people to fear.

2089.arabic: واذ قلنا لك ان ربك احاط بالناس وما جعلنا الريا التى ارينك الا فتنة للناس والشجرة الملعونة فى القران ونخوفهم فما يزيدهم الا طغينا كبيرا
2089.en: And recall when We said to you, (O Muhammad), that your Lord encompasses these people; and that We have made that vision that We have shown you, and the tree accursed in the Qur'an, but as a trial for people. We go about warning them, but each warning leads them to greater transgression.

2090.arabic: واذ قلنا للملئكة اسجدوا لادم فسجدوا الا ابليس قال اسجد لمن خلقت طينا
2090.en: And recall when We asked the angels to prostrate themselves before Adam; all prostrated themselves except Iblis, who said: "Shall I prostrate myself before him whom You created of clay?"

2091.arabic: قال اريتك هذا الذى كرمت على لئن اخرتن الى يوم القيمة لاحتنكن ذريته الا قليلا
2091.en: He then continued: "Look! This is he whom You have exalted above me! If you will grant me respite till the Day of Resurrection I shall uproot the whole of his progeny except only a few."

2092.arabic: قال اذهب فمن تبعك منهم فان جهنم جزاؤكم جزا موفورا
2092.en: Thereupon He retorted: "Be gone! Hell shall be the recompense # and a most ample one # of whosoever of them who follows you.

2093.arabic: واستفزز من استطعت منهم بصوتك واجلب عليهم بخيلك ورجلك وشاركهم فى الامول والاولد وعدهم وما يعدهم الشيطن الا غرورا
2093.en: Tempt with your call all whom you wish. Muster against them all your forces # your cavalry and your foot soldiers; share with them riches and offspring, and seduce them with rosy promises # and Satan's promise is nothing but a deception #

2094.arabic: ان عبادى ليس لك عليهم سلطن وكفى بربك وكيلا
2094.en: but know well that you will have no power against My servants. Your Lord suffices for them to place their trust in."

2095.arabic: ربكم الذى يزجى لكم الفلك فى البحر لتبتغوا من فضله انه كان بكم رحيما
2095.en: Your Lord is He Who steers your vessels across the seas that you may seek of His Bounty. He is ever Merciful towards you.

2096.arabic: واذا مسكم الضر فى البحر ضل من تدعون الا اياه فلما نجىكم الى البر اعرضتم وكان الانسن كفورا
2096.en: When a calamity befalls you on the sea, all those whom you invoke forsake you except Him. But when He delivers you safely to the shore you turn away from Him, for man is indeed most thankless.

2097.arabic: افامنتم ان يخسف بكم جانب البر او يرسل عليكم حاصبا ثم لا تجدوا لكم وكيلا
2097.en: Do you, then, feel secure against His causing you to be swallowed up by a tract of the earth, or letting loose a deadly whirlwind charged with stones towards you, and there you will find none to protect you?

2098.arabic: ام امنتم ان يعيدكم فيه تارة اخرى فيرسل عليكم قاصفا من الريح فيغرقكم بما كفرتم ثم لا تجدوا لكم علينا به تبيعا
2098.en: Or do you feel secure that He will not cause you to revert to the sea, and let a tempest loose upon you and then drown you for your ingratitude whereupon you will find none even to inquire of Us what happened to you?

2099.arabic: ولقد كرمنا بنى ادم وحملنهم فى البر والبحر ورزقنهم من الطيبت وفضلنهم على كثير ممن خلقنا تفضيلا
2099.en: Indeed, We honoured the progeny of Adam, and bore them across land and sea and provided them with good things for their sustenance, and exalted them above many of Our creatures.

2100.arabic: يوم ندعوا كل اناسۭ باممهم فمن اوتى كتبه بيمينه فاولئك يقرون كتبهم ولا يظلمون فتيلا
2100.en: Then think of the Day We shall summon every community with its leader. Those who are given their Record in their right hand shall read the Record of their deeds and shall not be wronged a whit.

2101.arabic: ومن كان فى هذه اعمى فهو فى الاخرة اعمى واضل سبيلا
2101.en: Whoever lived in this world as blind shall live as blind in the Life to Come; rather, he will be even farther astray than if he were (just) blind.

2102.arabic: وان كادوا ليفتنونك عن الذى اوحينا اليك لتفترى علينا غيره واذا لاتخذوك خليلا
2102.en: (O Muhammad), they had all but tempted you away from what We have revealed to you that you may invent something else in Our Name. Had you done so, they would have taken you as their trusted friend.

2103.arabic: ولولا ان ثبتنك لقد كدت تركن اليهم شيـا قليلا
2103.en: Indeed, had We not strengthened you, you might have inclined to them a little,

2104.arabic: اذا لاذقنك ضعف الحيوة وضعف الممات ثم لا تجد لك علينا نصيرا
2104.en: whereupon We would have made you taste double (the chastisement) in the world and double (the chastisement) after death, and then you would have found none to help you against Us.

2105.arabic: وان كادوا ليستفزونك من الارض ليخرجوك منها واذا لا يلبثون خلفك الا قليلا
2105.en: They were bent upon uprooting you from this land and driving you away from it. But were they to succeed, they would not be able to remain after you more than a little while.

2106.arabic: سنة من قد ارسلنا قبلك من رسلنا ولا تجد لسنتنا تحويلا
2106.en: This has been Our Way with the Messengers whom We sent before you. You will find no change in Our Way.

2107.arabic: اقم الصلوة لدلوك الشمس الى غسق اليل وقران الفجر ان قران الفجر كان مشهودا
2107.en: Establish Prayer from the declining of the sun to the darkness of the night; and hold fast to the recitation of the Qur'an at dawn, for the recitation of the Qur'an at dawn is witnessed.

2108.arabic: ومن اليل فتهجد به نافلة لك عسى ان يبعثك ربك مقاما محمودا
2108.en: And rise from sleep during the night as well# this is an additional Prayer for you. Possibly your Lord will raise you to an honoured position.

2109.arabic: وقل رب ادخلنى مدخل صدق واخرجنى مخرج صدق واجعل لى من لدنك سلطنا نصيرا
2109.en: And pray: "My Lord! Cause me to enter wherever it be, with Truth, and cause me to exit, wherever it be, with Truth, and support me with authority from Yourself."

2110.arabic: وقل جا الحق وزهق البطل ان البطل كان زهوقا
2110.en: And proclaim: "The Truth has come, and falsehood has vanished. Surely falsehood is ever bound to vanish."

2111.arabic: وننزل من القران ما هو شفا ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظلمين الا خسارا
2111.en: What We are sending down in the course of revealing the Qur'an is a healing and a grace for those who have faith; but it adds only to the ruin of the wrong#doers.

2112.arabic: واذا انعمنا على الانسن اعرض ونـا بجانبه واذا مسه الشر كان يـوسا
2112.en: Whenever We bestow favours upon man, he arrogantly turns away and draws aside; and whenever evil visits him, he is in utter despair.

2113.arabic: قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم اعلم بمن هو اهدى سبيلا
2113.en: Say, (O Prophet): "Each one acts according to his own manner. Your Lord knows well who is best#guided to the Right Path."

2114.arabic: ويسـلونك عن الروح قل الروح من امر ربى وما اوتيتم من العلم الا قليلا
2114.en: They ask you about "the spirit". Say: "The spirit descends by the command of my Lord, but you have been given only a little knowledge."

2115.arabic: ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذى اوحينا اليك ثم لا تجد لك به علينا وكيلا
2115.en: Had We willed, We could take away what We have revealed to you, then you would find none to help you in recovering it from Us.

2116.arabic: الا رحمة من ربك ان فضله كان عليك كبيرا
2116.en: (Whatever you have received) is nothing but grace from your Lord. Indeed His favour to you is great.

2117.arabic: قل لئن اجتمعت الانس والجن على ان ياتوا بمثل هذا القران لا ياتون بمثله ولو كان بعضهم لبعض ظهيرا
2117.en: Say: "Surely, if mankind and jinn were to get together to produce the like of this Qur'an, they will never be able to produce the like of it, howsoever they might help one another."

2118.arabic: ولقد صرفنا للناس فى هذا القران من كل مثل فابى اكثر الناس الا كفورا
2118.en: We have explained things for people in this Qur'an in diverse ways to make them understand the Message, yet most people obstinately persist in unbelief.

2119.arabic: وقالوا لن نؤمن لك حتى تفجر لنا من الارض ينبوعا
2119.en: They said: "We shall not accept your Message until you cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth;

2120.arabic: او تكون لك جنة من نخيل وعنب فتفجر الانهر خللها تفجيرا
2120.en: or that there be a garden of palms and vines for you and then you cause rivers to abundantly flow forth through them;

2121.arabic: او تسقط السما كما زعمت علينا كسفا او تاتى بالله والملئكة قبيلا
2121.en: or cause the sky to fall on us in pieces as you claimed, or bring Allah and the angels before us, face to face;

2122.arabic: او يكون لك بيت من زخرف او ترقى فى السما ولن نؤمن لرقيك حتى تنزل علينا كتبا نقرؤه قل سبحان ربى هل كنت الا بشرا رسولا
2122.en: or that there come to be for you a house of gold, or that you ascend to the sky # though we shall not believe in your ascension (to the sky) # until you bring down a book for us that we can read." Say to them, (O Muhammad): "Holy is my Lord! Am I anything else than a human being, who bears a Message (from Allah)?"

2123.arabic: وما منع الناس ان يؤمنوا اذ جاهم الهدى الا ان قالوا ابعث الله بشرا رسولا
2123.en: Whenever Guidance came to people, nothing prevented them from believing except that they said: "Has Allah sent a human being as a Messenger?"

2124.arabic: قل لو كان فى الارض ملئكة يمشون مطمئنين لنزلنا عليهم من السما ملكا رسولا
2124.en: Say: "Had angels been walking about in peace on the earth, We would surely have sent to them an angel from the heavens as Messenger."

2125.arabic: قل كفى بالله شهيدا بينى وبينكم انه كان بعباده خبيرۢا بصيرا
2125.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Allah suffices as a witness between me and you. Allah is well aware and fully observes everything pertaining to His servants."

2126.arabic: ومن يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد لهم اوليا من دونه ونحشرهم يوم القيمة على وجوههم عميا وبكما وصما ماوىهم جهنم كلما خبت زدنهم سعيرا
2126.en: Whomsoever Allah guides is rightly guided; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you shall find none # apart from Him # who could protect him. We shall muster them all on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces # blind and dumb and deaf. Hell shall be their refuge. Every time its Fire subsides, We will intensify for them its flame.

2127.arabic: ذلك جزاؤهم بانهم كفروا بـايتنا وقالوا اذا كنا عظما ورفتا انا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا
2127.en: That will be their recompense because they disbelieved in Our Signs and said: "What, when we shall be reduced to bones and particles (of dust), shall we be raised again as a new creation?"

2128.arabic: اولم يروا ان الله الذى خلق السموت والارض قادر على ان يخلق مثلهم وجعل لهم اجلا لا ريب فيه فابى الظلمون الا كفورا
2128.en: Have they not perceived that Allah, Who has created the heavens and the earth, has the power to create the like of them? He has fixed a term for them about which there is no doubt. And yet the wrong#doers obstinately persist in unbelief.

2129.arabic: قل لو انتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربى اذا لامسكتم خشية الانفاق وكان الانسن قتورا
2129.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Even if you owned the treasures of my Lord's Mercy you would have held them back for fear of spending them." Man is indeed ever niggardly.

2130.arabic: ولقد اتينا موسى تسع ايت بينت فسـل بنى اسريل اذ جاهم فقال له فرعون انى لاظنك يموسى مسحورا
2130.en: We granted Moses nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about that: when these signs came forth, Pharaoh said to him: "Moses, I think that you are bewitched."

2131.arabic: قال لقد علمت ما انزل هؤلا الا رب السموت والارض بصائر وانى لاظنك يفرعون مثبورا
2131.en: Moses replied: "You know well that no one but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent these as eye#opening proofs. I truly think, O Pharaoh, that you are indeed doomed."

2132.arabic: فاراد ان يستفزهم من الارض فاغرقنه ومن معه جميعا
2132.en: At last Pharaoh decided to uproot Moses and the Children of Israel from the land, but We drowned him together with all who were with him;

2133.arabic: وقلنا من بعده لبنى اسريل اسكنوا الارض فاذا جا وعد الاخرة جئنا بكم لفيفا
2133.en: and thereafter We said to the Children of Israel: "Now dwell in the land, but when the promised time of the Hereafter comes, We shall bring you all together."

2134.arabic: وبالحق انزلنه وبالحق نزل وما ارسلنك الا مبشرا ونذيرا
2134.en: We have sent down the Qur'an with the Truth, and it is with the Truth that it has descended. And We have not sent you but to proclaim good news and to warn.

2135.arabic: وقرانا فرقنه لتقراه على الناس على مكث ونزلنه تنزيلا
2135.en: We have revealed the Qur'an in parts that you may recite it to people slowly and with deliberation; and (for that reason) We have revealed it gradually (to suit particular occasions).

2136.arabic: قل امنوا به او لا تؤمنوا ان الذين اوتوا العلم من قبله اذا يتلى عليهم يخرون للاذقان سجدا
2136.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): "Whether you believe in it, or do not believe," but when it is recited to those who were given the knowledge before its revelation, they fall down upon their faces in prostration

2137.arabic: ويقولون سبحن ربنا ان كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا
2137.en: and say: "Glory be to our Lord. Surely the promise of our Lord was bound to be fulfilled."

2138.en: And they fall down upon their faces, weeping, and their humility increases when (the Qur'an) is recited to them.

2139.arabic: قل ادعوا الله او ادعوا الرحمن ايا ما تدعوا فله الاسما الحسنى ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها وابتغ بين ذلك سبيلا
2139.en: Say to them (O Prophet!): "Call upon Him as Allah or call upon Him as al#Rahman; call Him by whichever name you will, all His names are beautiful. Neither offer your Prayer in too loud a voice, nor in a voice too low; but follow a middle course."

2140.arabic: وقل الحمد لله الذى لم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك فى الملك ولم يكن له ولى من الذل وكبره تكبيرۢا
2140.en: And say: "All praise be to Allah Who has neither taken to Himself a son, nor has He any partner in His kingdom, nor does He need anyone, out of weakness, to protect Him." So glorify Him in a manner worthy of His glory.

2141.arabic: الحمد لله الذى انزل على عبده الكتب ولم يجعل له عوجا
2141.en: Praise be to Allah Who has revealed to His servant the Book devoid of all crookedness;

2142.arabic: قيما لينذر باسا شديدا من لدنه ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصلحت ان لهم اجرا حسنا
2142.en: an unerringly Straight Book, meant to warn of a stern punishment from Allah, and to proclaim, to those who believe and work righteous deeds, the tiding that theirs shall be a good reward

2143.en: wherein they shall abide for ever;

2144.arabic: وينذر الذين قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا
2144.en: and also to warn those who say: "Allah has taken to Himself a son,"

2145.arabic: ما لهم به من علم ولا لابائهم كبرت كلمة تخرج من افوههم ان يقولون الا كذبا
2145.en: a thing about which they have no knowledge, neither they nor their ancestors. Dreadful is the word that comes out of their mouths. What they utter is merely a lie.

2146.arabic: فلعلك بخع نفسك على اثرهم ان لم يؤمنوا بهذا الحديث اسفا
2146.en: (O Muhammad), if they do not believe in this Message, you will perhaps torment yourself to death with grief, sorrowing over them.

2147.arabic: انا جعلنا ما على الارض زينة لها لنبلوهم ايهم احسن عملا
2147.en: Surely We have made all that is on the earth an embellishment for it in order to test people as to who of them is better in conduct.

2148.arabic: وانا لجعلون ما عليها صعيدا جرزا
2148.en: In the ultimate, We shall reduce all that is on the earth to a barren plain.

2149.arabic: ام حسبت ان اصحب الكهف والرقيم كانوا من ايتنا عجبا
2149.en: Do you think that the people of the Cave and the Inscription were one of Our wondrous signs?

2150.arabic: اذ اوى الفتية الى الكهف فقالوا ربنا اتنا من لدنك رحمة وهيئ لنا من امرنا رشدا
2150.en: When those youths sought refuge in the Cave and said: "Our Lord! Grant us mercy from Yourself and provide for us rectitude in our affairs."

2151.arabic: فضربنا على اذانهم فى الكهف سنين عددا
2151.en: We lulled them to sleep in that cave for a number of years

2152.arabic: ثم بعثنهم لنعلم اى الحزبين احصى لما لبثوا امدا
2152.en: and then roused them so that We might see which of the two parties could best tell the length of their stay.

2153.arabic: نحن نقص عليك نباهم بالحق انهم فتية امنوا بربهم وزدنهم هدى
2153.en: We narrate to you their true story. They were a party of young men who had faith in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance

2154.arabic: وربطنا على قلوبهم اذ قاموا فقالوا ربنا رب السموت والارض لن ندعوا من دونه الها لقد قلنا اذا شططا
2154.en: and strengthened their hearts when they stood up and proclaimed: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We shall call upon no other god beside Him; (for if we did so), we shall be uttering a blasphemy."

2155.arabic: هؤلا قومنا اتخذوا من دونه الهة لولا ياتون عليهم بسلطنۭ بين فمن اظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا
2155.en: (Then they conferred among themselves and said): "These men, our own people, have taken others as gods beside Him: why do they not bring any clear evidence that they indeed are gods? Who can be more unjust than he who foists a lie on Allah?

2156.arabic: واذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون الا الله فاوا الى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيئ لكم من امركم مرفقا
2156.en: And now that you have dissociated yourselves from them and from whatever they worship beside Allah, go and seek refuge in the Cave. Your Lord will extend His mercy to you and will provide for you the means for the disposal of your affairs."

2157.arabic: وترى الشمس اذا طلعت تزور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين واذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال وهم فى فجوة منه ذلك من ايت الله من يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد له وليا مرشدا
2157.en: Had you seen them in the Cave it would have appeared to you that when the sun rose, it moved away from their Cave to the right; and when it set, it turned away from them to the left, while they remained in a spacious hollow in the Cave. This is one of the Signs of Allah. Whomsoever Allah guides, he alone is led aright; and whomsoever Allah lets go astray, you will find for him no guardian to direct him.

2158.arabic: وتحسبهم ايقاظا وهم رقود ونقلبهم ذات اليمين وذات الشمال وكلبهم بسط ذراعيه بالوصيد لو اطلعت عليهم لوليت منهم فرارا ولملئت منهم رعبا
2158.en: On seeing them you would fancy them to be awake though they were asleep; and We caused them to turn their sides to their right and to their left, and their dog sat stretching out its forelegs on the threshold of the Cave. Had you looked upon them you would have certainly fled away from them, their sight filling you with terror.

2159.arabic: وكذلك بعثنهم ليتسالوا بينهم قال قائل منهم كم لبثتم قالوا لبثنا يوما او بعض يوم قالوا ربكم اعلم بما لبثتم فابعثوا احدكم بورقكم هذه الى المدينة فلينظر ايها ازكى طعاما فلياتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ولا يشعرن بكم احدا
2159.en: Likewise, We roused them in a miraculous way that they might question one another. One of them asked: "How long did you remain (in this state)?" The others said: "We remained so for a day or part of a day." Then they said: "Your Lord knows better how long we remained in this state. Now send one of you to the city with this coin of yours and let him see who has the best food, and let him buy some provisions from there. Let him be cautious and not inform anyone of our whereabouts.

2160.arabic: انهم ان يظهروا عليكم يرجموكم او يعيدوكم فى ملتهم ولن تفلحوا اذا ابدا
2160.en: For if they should come upon us, they will stone us to death or force us to revert to their faith whereafter we shall never prosper."

2161.arabic: وكذلك اعثرنا عليهم ليعلموا ان وعد الله حق وان الساعة لا ريب فيها اذ يتنزعون بينهم امرهم فقالوا ابنوا عليهم بنينا ربهم اعلم بهم قال الذين غلبوا على امرهم لنتخذن عليهم مسجدا
2161.en: Thus did We make their case known to the people of the city so that they might know that Allah's promise is true, and that there is absolutely no doubt that the Hour will come to pass. But instead of giving thought to this, they disputed with one another concerning the People of the Cave, some saying: "Build a wall over them. Their Lord alone knows best about them." But those who prevailed over their affairs said: "We shall build a place of worship over them."

2162.arabic: سيقولون ثلثة رابعهم كلبهم ويقولون خمسة سادسهم كلبهم رجما بالغيب ويقولون سبعة وثامنهم كلبهم قل ربى اعلم بعدتهم ما يعلمهم الا قليل فلا تمار فيهم الا مرا ظهرا ولا تستفت فيهم منهم احدا
2162.en: Some will say concerning them: "They were three and their dog, the fourth"; and some will say: "They were five, and their dog, the sixth" ## all this being merely guesswork; and still others will say: "They were seven, and their dog, the eighth." Say: "My Lord knows their number best. Only a few know their correct number. So do not dispute concerning their number, but stick to what is evident, and do not question anyone about them."

2163.arabic: ولا تقولن لشاى انى فاعل ذلك غدا
2163.en: And never say about anything: "I shall certainly do this tomorrow"

2164.arabic: الا ان يشا الله واذكر ربك اذا نسيت وقل عسى ان يهدين ربى لاقرب من هذا رشدا
2164.en: unless Allah should will it. And should you forget (and make such a statement), remember your Lord and say: "I expect my Lord to guide me to what is nearer to rectitude than this."

2165.arabic: ولبثوا فى كهفهم ثلث مائة سنين وازدادوا تسعا
2165.en: They remained in the Cave for three hundred years; and others added nine more years.

2166.arabic: قل الله اعلم بما لبثوا له غيب السموت والارض ابصر به واسمع ما لهم من دونه من ولى ولا يشرك فى حكمه احدا
2166.en: Say: "Allah knows best how long they remained in it, for only He knows all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth. How well He sees; how well He hears! The creatures have no other guardian than Him; He allows none to share His authority."

2167.arabic: واتل ما اوحى اليك من كتاب ربك لا مبدل لكلمته ولن تجد من دونه ملتحدا
2167.en: (O Prophet), recite to them from the Book of your Lord what has been revealed to you for none may change His words; (and were you to make any change in His words) you will find no refuge from Him.

2168.arabic: واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغدوة والعشى يريدون وجهه ولا تعد عيناك عنهم تريد زينة الحيوة الدنيا ولا تطع من اغفلنا قلبه عن ذكرنا واتبع هوىه وكان امره فرطا
2168.en: Keep yourself content with those who call upon their Lord, morning and evening, seeking His pleasure, and do not let your eyes pass beyond them. Do you seek the pomp and glitter of the world? Do not follow him whose heart We have caused to be heedless of Our remembrance, and who follows his desires, and whose attitude is of excess.

2169.arabic: وقل الحق من ربكم فمن شا فليؤمن ومن شا فليكفر انا اعتدنا للظلمين نارا احاط بهم سرادقها وان يستغيثوا يغاثوا بما كالمهل يشوى الوجوه بئس الشراب وسات مرتفقا
2169.en: And proclaim: "This is the Truth from your Lord. Now let him who will, believe; and let him who will, disbelieve. We have prepared a Fire for the wrong#doers whose billowing folds encompass them. If they ask for water, they will be served with a drink like dregs of oil that will scald their faces. How dreadful a drink, and how evil an abode!

2170.arabic: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت انا لا نضيع اجر من احسن عملا
2170.en: As for those who believe and do good We shall not cause their reward to be lost.

2171.arabic: اولئك لهم جنت عدن تجرى من تحتهم الانهر يحلون فيها من اساور من ذهب ويلبسون ثيابا خضرا من سندس واستبرق متكـين فيها على الارائك نعم الثواب وحسنت مرتفقا
2171.en: They shall dwell in the Gardens of Eternity, beneath which streams flow. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, will be arrayed in green garments of silk and rich brocade, and will recline on raised couches. How excellent is their reward, and how nice their resting#place!"

2172.arabic: واضرب لهم مثلا رجلين جعلنا لاحدهما جنتين من اعنب وحففنهما بنخل وجعلنا بينهما زرعا
2172.en: (O Muhammad), propound a parable to them. There were two men of whom We bestowed upon one of the two vineyards, surrounding both of them with date#palms and putting a tillage in between.

2173.arabic: كلتا الجنتين اتت اكلها ولم تظلم منه شيـا وفجرنا خللهما نهرا
2173.en: Both the vineyards yielded abundant produce without failure and We caused a stream to flow in their midst

2174.arabic: وكان له ثمر فقال لصحبه وهو يحاوره انا اكثر منك مالا واعز نفرا
2174.en: so the owner had fruit in abundance and he said to his neighbour, while conversing with him: "I have greater wealth than you and I am stronger than you in numbers."

2175.arabic: ودخل جنته وهو ظالم لنفسه قال ما اظن ان تبيد هذه ابدا
2175.en: Then he entered his vine#yard and said, wronging himself: "Surely, I do not believe that all this will ever perish.

2176.arabic: وما اظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رددت الى ربى لاجدن خيرا منها منقلبا
2176.en: Nor do I believe that the Hour of Resurrection will ever come to pass. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I shall find a better place than this."

2177.arabic: قال له صاحبه وهو يحاوره اكفرت بالذى خلقك من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم سوىك رجلا
2177.en: While conversing with him his neighbour exclaimed: "Do you deny Him Who created you out of dust, then out of a drop of sperm, and then fashioned you into a complete man?

2178.arabic: لكنا۠ هو الله ربى ولا اشرك بربى احدا
2178.en: As for myself, Allah alone is my Lord, and I associate none with my Lord in His Divinity.

2179.arabic: ولولا اذ دخلت جنتك قلت ما شا الله لا قوة الا بالله ان ترن انا اقل منك مالا وولدا
2179.en: When you entered your vineyard, why did you not say: 'Whatever Allah wills shall come to pass, for there is no power save with Allah!' If you find me less than yourself in wealth and children

2180.arabic: فعسى ربى ان يؤتين خيرا من جنتك ويرسل عليها حسبانا من السما فتصبح صعيدا زلقا
2180.en: it may well be that my Lord will give me something better than your vineyard, and send a calamity upon your vineyard from the heavens and it will be reduced to a barren waste,

2181.arabic: او يصبح ماؤها غورا فلن تستطيع له طلبا
2181.en: or the water of your vineyard will be drained deep into the ground so that you will not be able to seek it out."

2182.arabic: واحيط بثمره فاصبح يقلب كفيه على ما انفق فيها وهى خاوية على عروشها ويقول يليتنى لم اشرك بربى احدا
2182.en: Eventually all his produce was destroyed and he began to wring his hands in sorrow at the loss of what he had spent on it, and on seeing it fallen down upon its trellises, saying: "Would I had not associated anyone with my Lord in His Divinity."

2183.arabic: ولم تكن له فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان منتصرا
2183.en: And there was no host, beside Allah, to help him, nor could he be of any help to himself.

2184.arabic: هنالك الولية لله الحق هو خير ثوابا وخير عقبا
2184.en: (Then he knew) that all power of protection rests with Allah, the True One. He is the best to reward, the best to determine the end of things.

2185.arabic: واضرب لهم مثل الحيوة الدنيا كما انزلنه من السما فاختلط به نبات الارض فاصبح هشيما تذروه الريح وكان الله على كل شى مقتدرا
2185.en: (O Prophet), propound to them the parable of the present life: it is like the vegetation of the earth which flourished luxuriantly when it mingled with the water that We sent down from the sky, but after that the same vegetation turned into stubble which the winds blew about. Allah alone has the power over all things.

2186.arabic: المال والبنون زينة الحيوة الدنيا والبقيت الصلحت خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير املا
2186.en: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of the world. But the deeds of lasting righteousness are the best in the sight of your Lord in reward, and far better a source of hope.

2187.arabic: ويوم نسير الجبال وترى الارض بارزة وحشرنهم فلم نغادر منهم احدا
2187.en: Bear in mind the Day when We shall set the mountains in motion and you will find the earth void and bare. On that Day We shall muster all men together, leaving none of them behind.

2188.arabic: وعرضوا على ربك صفا لقد جئتمونا كما خلقنكم اول مرةۭ بل زعمتم الن نجعل لكم موعدا
2188.en: They shall be brought before your Lord, all lined up, and shall be told: "Now, indeed, you have come before Us in the manner We created you in the first instance, although you thought that We shall not appoint a tryst (with Us)."

2189.arabic: ووضع الكتب فترى المجرمين مشفقين مما فيه ويقولون يويلتنا مال هذا الكتب لا يغادر صغيرة ولا كبيرة الا احصىها ووجدوا ما عملوا حاضرا ولا يظلم ربك احدا
2189.en: And then the Record of their deeds shall be placed before them and you will see the guilty full of fear for what it contains, and will say: "Woe to us! What a Record this is! It leaves nothing, big or small, but encompasses it." They will find their deeds confronting them. Your Lord wrongs no one.

2190.arabic: واذ قلنا للملئكة اسجدوا لادم فسجدوا الا ابليس كان من الجن ففسق عن امر ربه افتتخذونه وذريته اوليا من دونى وهم لكم عدوۢ بئس للظلمين بدلا
2190.en: And recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all of them fell prostrate, except Iblis. He was of the jinn and so disobeyed the command of his Lord. Will you, then, take him and his progeny as your guardians rather than Me although they are your open enemies? What an evil substitute are these wrong#doers taking!

2191.arabic: ما اشهدتهم خلق السموت والارض ولا خلق انفسهم وما كنت متخذ المضلين عضدا
2191.en: I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor in their own creation. I do not seek the aid of those who lead people astray.

2192.arabic: ويوم يقول نادوا شركاى الذين زعمتم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم وجعلنا بينهم موبقا
2192.en: What will such people do on the Day when the Lord will say: "Now call upon all those whom you believed to be My partners?" Thereupon they will call upon them, but they will not respond to their call; and We shall make them a common pit of doom,

2193.arabic: ورا المجرمون النار فظنوا انهم مواقعوها ولم يجدوا عنها مصرفا
2193.en: and the guilty shall behold the Fire and know that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no escape from it.

2194.arabic: ولقد صرفنا فى هذا القران للناس من كل مثل وكان الانسن اكثر شى جدلا
2194.en: And surely We have explained matters to people in the Qur'an in diverse ways, using all manner of parables. But man is exceedingly contentious.

2195.arabic: وما منع الناس ان يؤمنوا اذ جاهم الهدى ويستغفروا ربهم الا ان تاتيهم سنة الاولين او ياتيهم العذاب قبلا
2195.en: What is it that prevented mankind from believing when the guidance came to them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord, except that they would like to be treated as the nations of yore, or that they would like to see the scourge come upon them face to face?

2196.arabic: وما نرسل المرسلين الا مبشرين ومنذرين ويجدل الذين كفروا بالبطل ليدحضوا به الحق واتخذوا ايتى وما انذروا هزوا
2196.en: We raise Messengers only to give good news and to warn. But the unbelievers resort to falsehood in order to rebut the truth with it, and scoff at My revelations and My warnings.

2197.arabic: ومن اظلم ممن ذكر بـايت ربه فاعرض عنها ونسى ما قدمت يداه انا جعلنا على قلوبهم اكنة ان يفقهوه وفى اذانهم وقرا وان تدعهم الى الهدى فلن يهتدوا اذا ابدا
2197.en: Who is more wicked than the man who, when he is reminded by the revelations of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets (the consequence of) the deeds wrought by his own hands? We have laid veils over their hearts lest they understand the message of the Qur'an, and We have caused heaviness in their ears. Call them as you may to the Right Path, they will not be ever guided aright.

2198.arabic: وربك الغفور ذو الرحمة لو يؤاخذهم بما كسبوا لعجل لهم العذاب بل لهم موعد لن يجدوا من دونه موئلا
2198.en: Your Lord is All#Forgiving, full of mercy. Had He wished to take them to task for their doings, He would have hastened in sending His scourge upon them. But He has set for them a time#limit which they cannot evade.

2199.arabic: وتلك القرى اهلكنهم لما ظلموا وجعلنا لمهلكهم موعدا
2199.en: All the townships afflicted with scourge are before your eyes. When they committed wrong, We destroyed them. For the destruction of each We had set a definite term.

2200.arabic: واذ قال موسى لفتىه لا ابرح حتى ابلغ مجمع البحرين او امضى حقبا
2200.en: (And recount to them the story of Moses) when Moses said to his servant: "I will journey on until I reach the point where the two rivers meet, though I may march on for ages."

2201.arabic: فلما بلغا مجمع بينهما نسيا حوتهما فاتخذ سبيله فى البحر سربا
2201.en: But when they reached the point where the two rivers meet, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, as if through a tunnel.

2202.arabic: فلما جاوزا قال لفتىه اتنا غدانا لقد لقينا من سفرنا هذا نصبا
2202.en: When they had journeyed further on, Moses said to his servant: "Bring us our repast. We are surely fatigued by today's journey."

2203.arabic: قال اريت اذ اوينا الى الصخرة فانى نسيت الحوت وما انسىنيه الا الشيطن ان اذكره واتخذ سبيله فى البحر عجبا
2203.en: The servant said: "Did you see what happened? When we betook ourselves to the rock to take rest, I forgot the fish # and it is only Satan who caused me to forget to mention it to you # so that it made its way into the sea in a strange manner."

2204.arabic: قال ذلك ما كنا نبغ فارتدا على اثارهما قصصا
2204.en: Moses said: "That is what we were looking for." So the two turned back, retracing their footsteps,

2205.arabic: فوجدا عبدا من عبادنا اتينه رحمة من عندنا وعلمنه من لدنا علما
2205.en: and there they found one of Our servants upon whom We had bestowed Our mercy, and to whom We had imparted a special knowledge from Ourselves.

2206.arabic: قال له موسى هل اتبعك على ان تعلمن مما علمت رشدا
2206.en: Moses said to him: "May l follow you that you may teach me something of the wisdom which you have been taught?"

2207.arabic: قال انك لن تستطيع معى صبرا
2207.en: He answered: "You will surely not be able to bear with me.

2208.arabic: وكيف تصبر على ما لم تحط به خبرا
2208.en: For how can you patiently bear with something you cannot encompass in your knowledge?"

2209.arabic: قال ستجدنى ان شا الله صابرا ولا اعصى لك امرا
2209.en: Moses replied: "You shall find me, if Allah wills, patient; and I shall not disobey you in anything."

2210.arabic: قال فان اتبعتنى فلا تسـلنى عن شى حتى احدث لك منه ذكرا
2210.en: He said: "Well, if you follow me, do not ask me concerning anything until I myself mention it to you."

2211.arabic: فانطلقا حتى اذا ركبا فى السفينة خرقها قال اخرقتها لتغرق اهلها لقد جئت شيـا امرا
2211.en: Then the two went forth until, when they embarked on the boat, he made a hole in it, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "Have you made a hole in it so as to drown the people in the boat? You have certainly done an awful thing."

2212.arabic: قال الم اقل انك لن تستطيع معى صبرا
2212.en: He replied: "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to patiently bear with me?"

2213.arabic: قال لا تؤاخذنى بما نسيت ولا ترهقنى من امرى عسرا
2213.en: Moses said: "Do not take me to task at my forgetfulness, and do not be hard on me."

2214.arabic: فانطلقا حتى اذا لقيا غلما فقتله قال اقتلت نفسا زكية بغير نفس لقد جئت شيـا نكرا
2214.en: Then the two went forth until they met a lad whom he slew, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "What! Have you slain an innocent person without his having slain anyone? Surely you have done a horrible thing."

2215.arabic: قال الم اقل لك انك لن تستطيع معى صبرا
2215.en: He said: "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to patiently bear with me?"

2216.arabic: قال ان سالتك عن شىۭ بعدها فلا تصحبنى قد بلغت من لدنى عذرا
2216.en: Moses said: "Keep me no more in your company if I question you concerning anything after this. You will then be fully justified."

2217.arabic: فانطلقا حتى اذا اتيا اهل قرية استطعما اهلها فابوا ان يضيفوهما فوجدا فيها جدارا يريد ان ينقض فاقامه قال لو شئت لتخذت عليه اجرا
2217.en: Then the two went forth until when they came to a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to play host to them. They found in that town a wall that was on the verge of tumbling down, and he buttressed it, whereupon Moses said: "If you had wished, you could have received payment for it."

2218.arabic: قال هذا فراق بينى وبينك سانبئك بتاويل ما لم تستطع عليه صبرا
2218.en: He said: "This brings me and you to a parting of ways. Now I shall explain to you the true meaning of things about which you could not remain patient.

2219.arabic: اما السفينة فكانت لمسكين يعملون فى البحر فاردت ان اعيبها وكان وراهم ملك ياخذ كل سفينة غصبا
2219.en: As for the boat it belonged to some poor people who worked on the river, and I desired to damage it for beyond them lay the dominion of a king who was wont to seize every boat by force.

2220.arabic: واما الغلم فكان ابواه مؤمنين فخشينا ان يرهقهما طغينا وكفرا
2220.en: As for the lad, his parents were people of faith, and we feared lest he should plague them with transgression and disbelief,

2221.arabic: فاردنا ان يبدلهما ربهما خيرا منه زكوة واقرب رحما
2221.en: and we desired that their Lord should grant them another in his place, a son more upright and more tender hearted.

2222.arabic: واما الجدار فكان لغلمين يتيمين فى المدينة وكان تحته كنز لهما وكان ابوهما صلحا فاراد ربك ان يبلغا اشدهما ويستخرجا كنزهما رحمة من ربك وما فعلته عن امرى ذلك تاويل ما لم تسطع عليه صبرا
2222.en: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and under it there was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man and your Lord intended that they should come of age and then bring forth their treasure as a mercy from your Lord; I did not do this of my own bidding. This is the true meaning of things with which you could not keep your patience."

2223.arabic: ويسـلونك عن ذى القرنين قل ساتلوا عليكم منه ذكرا
2223.en: (O Muhammad), they ask you about Dhu al#Qarnayn. Say: "I will give you an account of him."

2224.arabic: انا مكنا له فى الارض واتينه من كل شى سببا
2224.en: We granted him power in the land and endowed him with all kinds of resources.

2225.en: He set out (westwards) on an expedition,

2226.arabic: حتى اذا بلغ مغرب الشمس وجدها تغرب فى عين حمئة ووجد عندها قوما قلنا يذا القرنين اما ان تعذب واما ان تتخذ فيهم حسنا
2226.en: until when he reached the very limits where the sun sets, he saw it setting in dark turbid waters; and nearby he met a people. We said: "O Dhu al#Qarnayn, you have the power to punish or to treat them with kindness."

2227.arabic: قال اما من ظلم فسوف نعذبه ثم يرد الى ربه فيعذبه عذابا نكرا
2227.en: He said: "We will chastise him who does wrong, whereafter he will be returned to his Lord and He will chastise him grievously.

2228.arabic: واما من امن وعمل صلحا فله جزا الحسنى وسنقول له من امرنا يسرا
2228.en: But as for him who believes and acts righteously, his will be a goodly reward and we shall enjoin upon him only mild commands."

2229.en: Then he set out on another expedition

2230.arabic: حتى اذا بلغ مطلع الشمس وجدها تطلع على قوم لم نجعل لهم من دونها سترا
2230.en: until he reached the limit where the sun rises and he found it rising on a people whom We had provided no shelter from it.

2231.arabic: كذلك وقد احطنا بما لديه خبرا
2231.en: Thus was the state of those people, and We encompassed in knowledge all concerning Dhu al# Qarnayn.

2232.en: Then he set out on another expedition

2233.arabic: حتى اذا بلغ بين السدين وجد من دونهما قوما لا يكادون يفقهون قولا
2233.en: until when he reached a place between the two mountains, he found beside the mountains a people who scarcely understood anything.

2234.arabic: قالوا يذا القرنين ان ياجوج وماجوج مفسدون فى الارض فهل نجعل لك خرجا على ان تجعل بيننا وبينهم سدا
2234.en: They said: "O Dhu al#Qarnayn, Gog and Magog are spreading corruption in this land. So shall we pay you taxes on the understanding that you will set up a barrier between us and them?"

2235.arabic: قال ما مكنى فيه ربى خير فاعينونى بقوة اجعل بينكم وبينهم ردما
2235.en: He answered: "Whatever my Lord has granted me is good enough. But help me with your labour and I will erect a rampart between you and them.

2236.arabic: اتونى زبر الحديد حتى اذا ساوى بين الصدفين قال انفخوا حتى اذا جعله نارا قال اتونى افرغ عليه قطرا
2236.en: Bring me ingots of iron." Then after he had filled up the space between the two mountain#sides, he said: "(Light a fire) and ply bellows." When he had made it (red like) fire, he said: "Bring me molten copper which I may pour on it."

2237.arabic: فما اسطعوا ان يظهروه وما استطعوا له نقبا
2237.en: Such was the rampart that Gog and Magog could not scale, nor could they pierce it.

2238.arabic: قال هذا رحمة من ربى فاذا جا وعد ربى جعله دكا وكان وعد ربى حقا
2238.en: Dhu al#Qarnayn said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: but when the time of my Lord's promise shall come, He will level the rampart with the ground. My Lord's promise always comes true."

2239.arabic: وتركنا بعضهم يومئذ يموج فى بعض ونفخ فى الصور فجمعنهم جمعا
2239.en: And on that Day We shall let some of them surge like waves against others, and the Trumpet shall be blown. Then We shall gather them all together.

2240.en: That will be the Day We shall place Hell before the unbelievers

2241.arabic: الذين كانت اعينهم فى غطا عن ذكرى وكانوا لا يستطيعون سمعا
2241.en: whose eyes had become blind against My admonition and who were utterly disinclined to hear it.

2242.arabic: افحسب الذين كفروا ان يتخذوا عبادى من دونى اوليا انا اعتدنا جهنم للكفرين نزلا
2242.en: Do the unbelievers, then, believe that they can take any of My creatures as their guardians beside Me? Verily We have prepared Hell to welcome the unbelievers.

2243.en: Say, (O Muhammad): "Shall We tell you who will be the greatest losers in respect of their works?

2244.arabic: الذين ضل سعيهم فى الحيوة الدنيا وهم يحسبون انهم يحسنون صنعا
2244.en: It will be those whose effort went astray in the life of the world and who believe nevertheless that they are doing good.

2245.arabic: اولئك الذين كفروا بـايت ربهم ولقائه فحبطت اعملهم فلا نقيم لهم يوم القيمة وزنا
2245.en: Those are the ones who refused to believe in the revelations of their Lord and that they are bound to meet Him. Hence, all their deeds have come to naught, and We shall assign no weight to them on the Day of Resurrection.

2246.arabic: ذلك جزاؤهم جهنم بما كفروا واتخذوا ايتى ورسلى هزوا
2246.en: Hell is their recompense for disbelieving and their taking My revelations and My Messengers as objects of jest.

2247.arabic: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت كانت لهم جنت الفردوس نزلا
2247.en: As for those who believe and do good works, the Gardens of Paradise shall be there to welcome them;

2248.arabic: خلدين فيها لا يبغون عنها حولا
2248.en: there they will abide for ever, with no desire to be removed from there."

2249.arabic: قل لو كان البحر مدادا لكلمت ربى لنفد البحر قبل ان تنفد كلمت ربى ولو جئنا بمثله مددا
2249.en: Say: "If the sea were to become ink to record the Words of my Lord, indeed the sea would be all used up before the Words of my Lord are exhausted, and it would be the same even if We were to bring an equal amount of ink."

2250.arabic: قل انما انا بشر مثلكم يوحى الى انما الهكم اله وحد فمن كان يرجوا لقا ربه فليعمل عملا صلحا ولا يشرك بعبادة ربه احدا
2250.en: Say (O Muhammad): "I am no more than a human being like you; one to whom revelation is made: 'Your Lord is the One and Only God.' Hence, whoever looks forward to meet his Lord, let him do righteous works, and let him associate none with the worship of his Lord."

2252.en: This is an account of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

2253.en: when he cried to his Lord in secret.

2254.arabic: قال رب انى وهن العظم منى واشتعل الراس شيبا ولم اكن بدعائك رب شقيا
2254.en: He said: "Lord! My bones have grown feeble and my head is glistening with age; yet, never have my prayers to You, my Lord, been unfruitful.

2255.arabic: وانى خفت المولى من وراى وكانت امراتى عاقرا فهب لى من لدنك وليا
2255.en: I fear evil from my kinsmen after I am gone; and my wife is barren, so grant me an heir out of Your special grace,

2256.arabic: يرثنى ويرث من ال يعقوب واجعله رب رضيا
2256.en: one that might be my heir and the heir of the house of Jacob; and make him, Lord, one that will be pleasing to You.

2257.arabic: يزكريا انا نبشرك بغلم اسمه يحيى لم نجعل له من قبل سميا
2257.en: (He was told): "Zechariah, We bring you the good news of the birth of a son whose name shall be Yahya (John), one whose namesake We never created before."

2258.arabic: قال رب انى يكون لى غلم وكانت امراتى عاقرا وقد بلغت من الكبر عتيا
2258.en: He said: "My Lord! How can I have a boy when my wife is barren and I have reached an extremely old age?"

2259.arabic: قال كذلك قال ربك هو على هين وقد خلقتك من قبل ولم تك شيـا
2259.en: He answered: "So shall it be." Your Lord says: "It is easy for Me," and then added: "For beyond doubt, I created you earlier when you were nothing."

2260.arabic: قال رب اجعل لى اية قال ايتك الا تكلم الناس ثلث ليال سويا
2260.en: Zechariah said: "Lord, grant me a Sign." Said He: "Your Sign is that you shall not be able to speak to people for three nights, though you will be otherwise sound."

2261.arabic: فخرج على قومه من المحراب فاوحى اليهم ان سبحوا بكرة وعشيا
2261.en: Thereupon Zechariah came out from the sanctuary and directed his people by gestures to extol His glory by day and by night.

2262.arabic: ييحيى خذ الكتب بقوة واتينه الحكم صبيا
2262.en: "O John! Hold the Book with all your strength." We had bestowed wisdom upon him while he was still a child;

2263.arabic: وحنانا من لدنا وزكوة وكان تقيا
2263.en: and We also endowed him with tenderness and purity, and he was exceedingly pious

2264.arabic: وبرۢا بولديه ولم يكن جبارا عصيا
2264.en: and cherishing to his parents. Never was he insolent or rebellious.

2265.arabic: وسلم عليه يوم ولد ويوم يموت ويوم يبعث حيا
2265.en: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he will die, and the day he will be raised up alive.

2266.arabic: واذكر فى الكتب مريم اذ انتبذت من اهلها مكانا شرقيا
2266.en: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Mary, when she withdrew from her people to a place towards the east;
