2267.arabic: فاتخذت من دونهم حجابا فارسلنا اليها روحنا فتمثل لها بشرا سويا
2267.en: and drew a curtain, screening herself from people whereupon We sent to her Our spirit and he appeared to her as a well#shaped man.

2268.arabic: قالت انى اعوذ بالرحمن منك ان كنت تقيا
2268.en: Mary exclaimed: "I surely take refuge from you with the Most Compassionate Lord, if you are at all God#fearing."

2269.arabic: قال انما انا رسول ربك لاهب لك غلما زكيا
2269.en: He said: "I am just a message#bearer of your Lord, I have come to grant you a most pure boy."

2270.arabic: قالت انى يكون لى غلم ولم يمسسنى بشر ولم اك بغيا
2270.en: Mary said: "How can a boy be born to me when no man has even touched me, nor have I ever been unchaste?"

2271.arabic: قال كذلك قال ربك هو على هين ولنجعله اية للناس ورحمة منا وكان امرا مقضيا
2271.en: The angel said: "Thus shall it be. Your Lord says: 'It is easy for Me; and We shall do so in order to make him a Sign for mankind and a mercy from Us. This has been decreed.' "

2272.en: Then she conceived him and withdrew with him to a far#off place.

2273.arabic: فاجاها المخاض الى جذع النخلة قالت يليتنى مت قبل هذا وكنت نسيا منسيا
2273.en: Then the birth pangs drove her to the trunk of a palm#tree and she said: "Oh, would that I had died before this and had been all forgotten."

2274.arabic: فنادىها من تحتها الا تحزنى قد جعل ربك تحتك سريا
2274.en: Thereupon the angel below her cried out: "Grieve not, for your Lord has caused a stream of water to flow beneath you.

2275.arabic: وهزى اليك بجذع النخلة تسقط عليك رطبا جنيا
2275.en: Shake the trunk of the palm#tree towards yourself and fresh and ripe dates shall fall upon you.

2276.arabic: فكلى واشربى وقرى عينا فاما ترين من البشر احدا فقولى انى نذرت للرحمن صوما فلن اكلم اليوم انسيا
2276.en: So eat and drink and cool your eyes; and if you see any person say to him: 'Verily I have vowed a fast to the Most Compassionate Lord, and so I shall not speak to anyone today.' "

2277.arabic: فاتت به قومها تحمله قالوا يمريم لقد جئت شيـا فريا
2277.en: Then she came to her people, carrying her baby. They said: "O Mary! You have committed a monstrous thing.

2278.arabic: ياخت هرون ما كان ابوك امرا سو وما كانت امك بغيا
2278.en: O sister of Aaron! Your father was not an evil man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman."

2279.arabic: فاشارت اليه قالوا كيف نكلم من كان فى المهد صبيا
2279.en: Thereupon Mary pointed to the child. They exclaimed: "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle, a mere child?"

2280.arabic: قال انى عبد الله اتىنى الكتب وجعلنى نبيا
2280.en: The child cried out: "Verily I am Allah's servant. He has granted me the Book and has made me a Prophet

2281.arabic: وجعلنى مباركا اين ما كنت واوصنى بالصلوة والزكوة ما دمت حيا
2281.en: and has blessed me wherever I might be and has enjoined upon me Prayer and Zakah (purifying alms) as long as I live;

2282.arabic: وبرۢا بولدتى ولم يجعلنى جبارا شقيا
2282.en: and has made me dutiful to my mother. He has not made me oppressive, nor bereft of God's blessings.

2283.arabic: والسلم على يوم ولدت ويوم اموت ويوم ابعث حيا
2283.en: Peace be upon me the day I was born and the day I will die, and the day I will be raised up alive."

2284.arabic: ذلك عيسى ابن مريم قول الحق الذى فيه يمترون
2284.en: This is Jesus, the son of Mary; and this is the truth about him concerning which they are in doubt.

2285.arabic: ما كان لله ان يتخذ من ولد سبحنه اذا قضى امرا فانما يقول له كن فيكون
2285.en: It does not befit Allah to take for Himself a son. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a thing He only says: "Be" and it is.

2286.arabic: وان الله ربى وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صرط مستقيم
2286.en: (Jesus had said): "Indeed Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so serve Him alone. This is the Straight Way."

2287.arabic: فاختلف الاحزاب من بينهم فويل للذين كفروا من مشهد يوم عظيم
2287.en: But different parties began to dispute with one another. A dreadful woe awaits on that great Day for those that reject the Truth.

2288.arabic: اسمع بهم وابصر يوم ياتوننا لكن الظلمون اليوم فى ضلل مبين
2288.en: How well shall they hear and how well shall they see on the Day they come to Us! But today the evil#doers are in manifest error.

2289.arabic: وانذرهم يوم الحسرة اذ قضى الامر وهم فى غفلة وهم لا يؤمنون
2289.en: (O Muhammad), warn those who are steeped in heedlessness and are obstinately rejecting the truth that the Day shall come when things will be finally decided and they shall be left with utter remorse.

2290.arabic: انا نحن نرث الارض ومن عليها والينا يرجعون
2290.en: Ultimately, We shall inherit the earth and whatever is on it; to Us shall they be returned.

2291.arabic: واذكر فى الكتب ابرهيم انه كان صديقا نبيا
2291.en: (O Muhammad), recite in the Book the account of Abraham. Most surely he was a man of truth, a Prophet.

2292.arabic: اذ قال لابيه يابت لم تعبد ما لا يسمع ولا يبصر ولا يغنى عنك شيـا
2292.en: (And remind people) when he said to his father: "Father! Why do you worship that which neither sees nor hears, and which can be of no avail to you?

2293.arabic: يابت انى قد جانى من العلم ما لم ياتك فاتبعنى اهدك صرطا سويا
2293.en: Father, a knowledge that has not reached you has come to me. So follow me that I may guide you to a Straight Way.

2294.arabic: يابت لا تعبد الشيطن ان الشيطن كان للرحمن عصيا
2294.en: Father, do not serve Satan, for Satan has indeed been a persistent rebel against the Most Compassionate Lord.

2295.arabic: يابت انى اخاف ان يمسك عذاب من الرحمن فتكون للشيطن وليا
2295.en: Father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Compassionate Lord might strike you and you may end up as one of Satan's companions?"

2296.arabic: قال اراغب انت عن الهتى يابرهيم لئن لم تنته لارجمنك واهجرنى مليا
2296.en: The father said: "Abraham, have you turned away from my gods? If you do not give this up, I shall stone you to death. Now begone from me forever."

2297.arabic: قال سلم عليك ساستغفر لك ربى انه كان بى حفيا
2297.en: Abraham answered: "Peace be upon you. I shall seek pardon for you from my Lord. My Lord has always been kind to Me.

2298.arabic: واعتزلكم وما تدعون من دون الله وادعوا ربى عسى الا اكون بدعا ربى شقيا
2298.en: I shall withdraw from you and all that you call upon beside Allah. I shall only call upon my Lord. I trust the prayer to my Lord will not go unanswered."

2299.arabic: فلما اعتزلهم وما يعبدون من دون الله وهبنا له اسحق ويعقوب وكلا جعلنا نبيا
2299.en: Thereupon Abraham dissociated himself from his people and the deities they worshipped instead of Allah, and We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob and made each of them a Prophet;

2300.arabic: ووهبنا لهم من رحمتنا وجعلنا لهم لسان صدق عليا
2300.en: and We bestowed on them Our mercy, and granted them a truly lofty renown.

2301.arabic: واذكر فى الكتب موسى انه كان مخلصا وكان رسولا نبيا
2301.en: And recite in the Book the account of Moses. He was a chosen one, a Messenger, a Prophet.

2302.arabic: وندينه من جانب الطور الايمن وقربنه نجيا
2302.en: We called out to him from the right side of the Mount, and We drew him near to Us by communing to him in secret,

2303.arabic: ووهبنا له من رحمتنا اخاه هرون نبيا
2303.en: and out of Our mercy We appointed his brother Aaron, a Prophet (that he may assist him).

2304.arabic: واذكر فى الكتب اسمعيل انه كان صادق الوعد وكان رسولا نبيا
2304.en: And recite in the Book the account of Ishmael. He was ever true to his promise, and was a Messenger, a Prophet.

2305.arabic: وكان يامر اهله بالصلوة والزكوة وكان عند ربه مرضيا
2305.en: He enjoined his household to observe Prayer and to give Zakah (purifying alms); and his Lord was well pleased with him.

2306.arabic: واذكر فى الكتب ادريس انه كان صديقا نبيا
2306.en: And recite in the Book the account of Idris. He was a man of truth, a Prophet;

2307.en: and We exalted him to a lofty position.

2308.arabic: اولئك الذين انعم الله عليهم من النبين من ذرية ادم وممن حملنا مع نوح ومن ذرية ابرهيم واسريل وممن هدينا واجتبينا اذا تتلى عليهم ايت الرحمن خروا سجدا وبكيا
2308.en: These are the Prophets upon whom Allah bestowed His favour from the seed of Adam, and from the seed of those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and from the seed of Abraham and Israel. They were those whom We guided and chose (for an exalted position). They were such that when the words of the Most Compassionate Lord were recited to them, they fell down in prostration, weeping.

2309.arabic: فخلف من بعدهم خلف اضاعوا الصلوة واتبعوا الشهوت فسوف يلقون غيا
2309.en: They were succeeded by a people who neglected the Prayers and pursued their lusts. They shall presently meet with their doom,

2310.arabic: الا من تاب وامن وعمل صلحا فاولئك يدخلون الجنة ولا يظلمون شيـا
2310.en: except those who repent and believe and act righteously. Such shall enter Paradise and shall not be wronged at all.

2311.arabic: جنت عدن التى وعد الرحمن عباده بالغيب انه كان وعده ماتيا
2311.en: Theirs shall be everlasting Gardens which the Most Compassionate Lord has promised His servants in a realm which is beyond the ken of perception. Surely His promise shall he fulfilled.

2312.arabic: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا الا سلما ولهم رزقهم فيها بكرة وعشيا
2312.en: They shall not hear in it anything vain; they shall hear only what is good; and they shall have their provision in it, morning and evening.

2313.arabic: تلك الجنة التى نورث من عبادنا من كان تقيا
2313.en: Such is the Paradise which We shall cause those of Our servants who have been God#fearing to inherit.

2314.arabic: وما نتنزل الا بامر ربك له ما بين ايدينا وما خلفنا وما بين ذلك وما كان ربك نسيا
2314.en: (The angels will say): "(O Muhammad!) We descend not except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us and all that is behind us, and all that is in between. Your Lord is not forgetful in the least.

2315.arabic: رب السموت والارض وما بينهما فاعبده واصطبر لعبدته هل تعلم له سميا
2315.en: He is the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between. Serve Him, then, and be constant in serving Him. Do you know anyone that might be His compeer?"

2316.arabic: ويقول الانسن اذا ما مت لسوف اخرج حيا
2316.en: Man is prone to say: "Shall I be raised to life after I die?"

2317.arabic: اولا يذكر الانسن انا خلقنه من قبل ولم يك شيـا
2317.en: Does man not remember that We created him before when he was nothing?

2318.arabic: فوربك لنحشرنهم والشيطين ثم لنحضرنهم حول جهنم جثيا
2318.en: By your Lord, We will surely muster them and the devils together. Then We will surely bring them all, on their knees, around Hell,

2319.arabic: ثم لننزعن من كل شيعة ايهم اشد على الرحمن عتيا
2319.en: and then We will draw aside from each party those who were most rebellious against the Most Compassionate Lord,

2320.arabic: ثم لنحن اعلم بالذين هم اولى بها صليا
2320.en: and then We shall know well all those most worthy to be cast in Hell.

2321.arabic: وان منكم الا واردها كان على ربك حتما مقضيا
2321.en: There is not one of you but shall pass by Hell. This is a decree which your Lord will fulfil.

2322.arabic: ثم ننجى الذين اتقوا ونذر الظلمين فيها جثيا
2322.en: Then We shall deliver those that feared Allah and leave the wrong#doers there on their knees.

2323.arabic: واذا تتلى عليهم ايتنا بينت قال الذين كفروا للذين امنوا اى الفريقين خير مقاما واحسن نديا
2323.en: When Our clear revelations are recited to those who deny the Truth they are wont to say to those who have faith: "Which of the two groups has a better status and whose assemblies are grander?"

2324.arabic: وكم اهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هم احسن اثثا وريا
2324.en: How numerous are the peoples We destroyed before them # those that were more resourceful and grander in outward appearance!

2325.arabic: قل من كان فى الضللة فليمدد له الرحمن مدا حتى اذا راوا ما يوعدون اما العذاب واما الساعة فسيعلمون من هو شر مكانا واضعف جندا
2325.en: Say: "The Most Compassionate Lord grants respite to those who stray into error, until they behold what they had been threatened with, either God's chastisement (in the world) or the Hour (of Resurrection)" # then they fully know whose station is worse, and who is weaker in hosts!

2326.arabic: ويزيد الله الذين اهتدوا هدى والبقيت الصلحت خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير مردا
2326.en: (On the contrary), Allah increases in guidance those who follow the Right Way. Lasting acts of righteousness are better in the sight of your Lord as reward and conducive to a better end.

2327.arabic: افريت الذى كفر بـايتنا وقال لاوتين مالا وولدا
2327.en: Have you seen him who rejected Our signs and said: "Surely I shall continue to be favoured with riches and children."

2328.arabic: اطلع الغيب ام اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا
2328.en: Has he obtained knowledge of the Unseen, or has he taken a covenant with the Most Compassionate Lord?

2329.arabic: كلا سنكتب ما يقول ونمد له من العذاب مدا
2329.en: By no means! We shall write down all what he says; and We shall greatly prolong his chastisement,

2330.en: and We shall inherit all the resources and hosts of which he boasts, and he will come to Us all alone.

2331.arabic: واتخذوا من دون الله الهة ليكونوا لهم عزا
2331.en: They have taken other gods instead of Allah that they may be a source of strength for them.

2332.arabic: كلا سيكفرون بعبادتهم ويكونون عليهم ضدا
2332.en: By no means! They shall soon deny their worship and shall become their adversaries instead.

2333.arabic: الم تر انا ارسلنا الشيطين على الكفرين تؤزهم ازا
2333.en: Do you not see that We have sent devils upon the unbelievers who greatly incite them (to oppose the Truth)?

2334.arabic: فلا تعجل عليهم انما نعد لهم عدا
2334.en: Therefore, do not hasten (in seeking a scourge against them). We are counting their days.

2335.arabic: يوم نحشر المتقين الى الرحمن وفدا
2335.en: The Day shall soon come when We shall bring together the God#fearing to the Most Compassionate Lord, as honoured guests;

2336.en: and We shall drive the guilty ones to Hell as a thirsty herd.

2337.arabic: لا يملكون الشفعة الا من اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا
2337.en: On that Day none will have the power to intercede for them except those who received a sanction from the Most Compassionate Lord.

2338.en: They claim: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken a son to Himself."

2339.en: Surely you have made a monstrous statement.

2340.arabic: تكاد السموت يتفطرن منه وتنشق الارض وتخر الجبال هدا
2340.en: It is such a monstrosity that heavens might well#nigh burst forth at it, the earth might be cleaved, and the mountains fall

2341.en: at their ascribing a son to the Most Compassionate Lord.

2342.arabic: وما ينبغى للرحمن ان يتخذ ولدا
2342.en: It does not befit the Most Compassionate Lord that He should take a son.

2343.arabic: ان كل من فى السموت والارض الا اتى الرحمن عبدا
2343.en: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but he shall come to the Most Compassionate Lord as His servant.

2344.en: Verily He encompasses them and has counted them all.

2345.en: On the Day of Resurrection each one of these will come to Him singly.

2346.arabic: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت سيجعل لهم الرحمن ودا
2346.en: Indeed, the Most Compassionate Lord will soon create enduring love for those who believe and do righteous works.

2347.arabic: فانما يسرنه بلسانك لتبشر به المتقين وتنذر به قوما لدا
2347.en: Therefore, We have revealed the Qur'an in your tongue and made it easy to understand that you may give glad tidings to the God#fearing and warn a contentious people.

2348.arabic: وكم اهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هل تحس منهم من احد او تسمع لهم ركزۢا
2348.en: How numerous are the peoples that We destroyed before them! Do you now perceive any one of them, or hear even their whisper?

2350.en: We did not reveal the Qur'an to you to cause you distress;

2351.en: it is only a reminder for him who fears Allah;

2352.arabic: تنزيلا ممن خلق الارض والسموت العلى
2352.en: a revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens.

2353.en: The Most Compassionate Lord is settled on the Throne (of the Universe).

2354.arabic: له ما فى السموت وما فى الارض وما بينهما وما تحت الثرى
2354.en: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, and all that is in between, and all that is beneath the soil.

2355.arabic: وان تجهر بالقول فانه يعلم السر واخفى
2355.en: Whether you speak out aloud (or in a low voice), He knows what is said secretly, and even that which is most hidden.

2356.arabic: الله لا اله الا هو له الاسما الحسنى
2356.en: Allah # there is no god but He. His are the most excellent names.

2357.en: Has the story of Moses reached you?

2358.arabic: اذ را نارا فقال لاهله امكثوا انى انست نارا لعلى اتيكم منها بقبس او اجد على النار هدى
2358.en: When he saw a fire and said to his family: "Hold on! I have just perceived a fire; perhaps I will bring a brand from it for you, or I will find some guidance at the fire about the way to follow."

2359.en: When he came to it, a voice called out: "Moses!

2360.arabic: انى انا ربك فاخلع نعليك انك بالواد المقدس طوى
2360.en: Verily I am your Lord! Take off your shoes. You are in the sacred valley, Tuwa!

2361.en: I Myself have chosen you; therefore, give ear to what is revealed.

2362.arabic: اننى انا الله لا اله الا انا فاعبدنى واقم الصلوة لذكرى
2362.en: Verily I am Allah. There is no god beside Me. So serve Me and establish Prayers to remember Me.

2363.arabic: ان الساعة اتية اكاد اخفيها لتجزى كل نفس بما تسعى
2363.en: The Hour of Resurrection is coming. I have willed to keep the time of its coming hidden so that everyone may be recompensed in accordance with his effort.

2364.arabic: فلا يصدنك عنها من لا يؤمن بها واتبع هوىه فتردى
2364.en: Let him who does not believe in it and follows his lust not turn your thought away from it, lest you are ruined.

2365.en: And what is in your right hand, O Moses?"

2366.arabic: قال هى عصاى اتوكؤا عليها واهش بها على غنمى ولى فيها مـارب اخرى
2366.en: Moses answered: "This is my staff. I lean on it (when I walk), and with it I beat down leaves for my flock, and I have many other uses for it."

2368.en: So he threw it down, and lo! it was a rapidly moving snake.

2369.arabic: قال خذها ولا تخف سنعيدها سيرتها الاولى
2369.en: Then He said: "Seize it and have no fear. We shall restore it to its former state.

2370.arabic: واضمم يدك الى جناحك تخرج بيضا من غير سو اية اخرى
2370.en: And place your hand in your armpit, it will come forth shining white, without blemish. This is another Sign of Allah,

2371.en: for We shall show you some of Our greatest Signs.

2372.en: And go to Pharaoh now for he has transgressed all bounds."

2373.en: Moses said: "Lord! Open my breast for me;

2374.en: and ease my task for me,

2375.en: and loosen the knot from my tongue

2376.en: so that they may understand my speech;

2377.en: and appoint for me, from my household, someone who will help me bear my burden #

2380.en: and let him share my task

2381.en: that we may abundantly extol Your glory;

2383.en: Verily, You have always watched over us."

2384.en: He said: "Moses, your petition is granted.

2385.en: We have again bestowed Our favour upon you.

2386.arabic: اذ اوحينا الى امك ما يوحى
2386.en: Recall, when We indicated to your mother through inspiration:

2387.arabic: ان اقذفيه فى التابوت فاقذفيه فى اليم فليلقه اليم بالساحل ياخذه عدو لى وعدو له والقيت عليك محبة منى ولتصنع على عينى
2387.en: 'Put the baby into a chest and then throw him in the river. The river will throw him up on the shore, and then an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his will take him.' And I spread My love over you in order that you might be reared in My sight.

2388.arabic: اذ تمشى اختك فتقول هل ادلكم على من يكفله فرجعنك الى امك كى تقر عينها ولا تحزن وقتلت نفسا فنجينك من الغم وفتنك فتونا فلبثت سنين فى اهل مدين ثم جئت على قدر يموسى
2388.en: Recall, when your sister went along, saying: 'Shall I direct you to one who will take charge of him?' Thus We brought you back to your mother so that her heart might be gladdened and she might not grieve. Moses, recall when you slew a person. We delivered you from distress and made you go through several trials. Then you stayed for several years among the people of Midian, and now you have come at the right moment as ordained.

2389.en: I have chosen you for My service.

2390.arabic: اذهب انت واخوك بـايتى ولا تنيا فى ذكرى
2390.en: So go forth, both you and your brother, with My Signs, and do not slacken in remembering Me.

2391.en: Go both of you to Pharaoh, for he has transgressed all bounds,

2392.arabic: فقولا له قولا لينا لعله يتذكر او يخشى
2392.en: and speak to him gently, perhaps he may take heed or fear (Allah)."

2393.arabic: قالا ربنا اننا نخاف ان يفرط علينا او ان يطغى
2393.en: The two said:" Lord! We fear he may commit excesses against us, or transgress all bounds."

2394.arabic: قال لا تخافا اننى معكما اسمع وارى
2394.en: He said: "Have no fear. I am with you, hearing and seeing all.

2395.arabic: فاتياه فقولا انا رسولا ربك فارسل معنا بنى اسريل ولا تعذبهم قد جئنك بـاية من ربك والسلم على من اتبع الهدى
2395.en: So, go to him, and say: 'Behold, both of us are the Messengers of your Lord. Let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not chastise them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord; and peace shall be for him who follows the true guidance.

2396.arabic: انا قد اوحى الينا ان العذاب على من كذب وتولى
2396.en: It has been revealed to us that chastisement awaits those who called the lie to the truth and turned away from it.' "

2397.en: Pharaoh said:" Moses! Who is the Lord of the two of you?"

2398.arabic: قال ربنا الذى اعطى كل شى خلقه ثم هدى
2398.en: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave everything its form and then guided it."

2399.en: Pharaoh asked: "Then, what is the state of the former generations?"

2400.arabic: قال علمها عند ربى فى كتب لا يضل ربى ولا ينسى
2400.en: Moses said: "Its knowledge is with my Lord, recorded in the Book. My Lord does not err, nor does He forget."

2401.arabic: الذى جعل لكم الارض مهدا وسلك لكم فيها سبلا وانزل من السما ما فاخرجنا به ازوجا من نبات شتى
2401.en: He it is Who spread the earth for you; and made in it paths for you, and sent down water from the sky, and then through it We brought forth many species of diverse plants.

2402.arabic: كلوا وارعوا انعمكم ان فى ذلك لايت لاولى النهى
2402.en: So eat yourself and pasture your cattle. Surely there are many Signs in this for people of understanding.

2403.arabic: منها خلقنكم وفيها نعيدكم ومنها نخرجكم تارة اخرى
2403.en: From this very earth We created you and to the same earth We shall cause you to return, and from it We shall bring you forth to life again.

2404.arabic: ولقد ارينه ايتنا كلها فكذب وابى
2404.en: Indeed We showed Pharaoh Our Signs, all of them, but he declared them to be false and rejected them.

2405.arabic: قال اجئتنا لتخرجنا من ارضنا بسحرك يموسى
2405.en: He said: "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land by your sorcery?

2406.arabic: فلناتينك بسحر مثله فاجعل بيننا وبينك موعدا لا نخلفه نحن ولا انت مكانا سوى
2406.en: We shall confront you with a sorcery like your own. So appoint a day when both of us might meet face to face in an open space; an appointment which neither we nor you shall fail to keep."

2407.arabic: قال موعدكم يوم الزينة وان يحشر الناس ضحى
2407.en: Moses said: "The appointment to meet you is on the Day of the Feast and let all people come together before noon."

2408.arabic: فتولى فرعون فجمع كيده ثم اتى
2408.en: Pharaoh went back and concerted all his stratagem and returned for the encounter.

2409.arabic: قال لهم موسى ويلكم لا تفتروا على الله كذبا فيسحتكم بعذاب وقد خاب من افترى
2409.en: (At the time of the encounter) Moses said to them: "Woe to you! Do not invent falsehoods against Allah lest He destroy you with a scourge. Surely those who invent lies shall come to grief."

2410.en: Thereupon they wrangled among themselves about the matter and conferred in secret.

2411.arabic: قالوا ان هذن لسحرن يريدان ان يخرجاكم من ارضكم بسحرهما ويذهبا بطريقتكم المثلى
2411.en: Some of them said: "These two are magicians, who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and to destroy your excellent way of life.

2412.arabic: فاجمعوا كيدكم ثم ائتوا صفا وقد افلح اليوم من استعلى
2412.en: So muster all your stratagem and come forth in a row. Whoever prevails today shall triumph."

2413.arabic: قالوا يموسى اما ان تلقى واما ان نكون اول من القى
2413.en: The magicians said: "Moses, will you throw down or shall we be the first to throw?"

2414.arabic: قال بل القوا فاذا حبالهم وعصيهم يخيل اليه من سحرهم انها تسعى
2414.en: Moses replied: "No, let it be you to throw first." Then suddenly it appeared to Moses, owing to their magic, as if their ropes and staffs were running.

2415.en: So Moses' heart was filled with fear.

2416.arabic: قلنا لا تخف انك انت الاعلى
2416.en: We said to him: "Have no fear; for it is you who will prevail.

2417.arabic: والق ما فى يمينك تلقف ما صنعوا انما صنعوا كيد سحر ولا يفلح الساحر حيث اتى
2417.en: And throw down what is in your right hand; it will swallow up all that they have wrought. They have wrought only a magician's stratagem. A magician cannot come to any good, come whence he may."

2418.arabic: فالقى السحرة سجدا قالوا امنا برب هرون وموسى
2418.en: Eventually the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate and said: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

2419.arabic: قال امنتم له قبل ان اذن لكم انه لكبيركم الذى علمكم السحر فلاقطعن ايديكم وارجلكم من خلف ولاصلبنكم فى جذوع النخل ولتعلمن اينا اشد عذابا وابقى
2419.en: Pharaoh said: "What! Did you believe in Him even before I permitted you to do so? Surely, he must be your chief who taught you magic. Now I will certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and will crucify you on the trunks of palm#trees, and then you will come to know which of us can inflict sterner and more lasting torment."

2420.arabic: قالوا لن نؤثرك على ما جانا من البينت والذى فطرنا فاقض ما انت قاض انما تقضى هذه الحيوة الدنيا
2420.en: The magicians answered: "By Him Who has created us, we shall never prefer you to the Truth after manifest Signs have come to us. So decree whatever you will. Your decree will pertain, at the most, to the present life of the world.

2421.arabic: انا امنا بربنا ليغفر لنا خطينا وما اكرهتنا عليه من السحر والله خير وابقى
2421.en: We believe in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and also forgive us the practice of magic to which you had compelled us. Allah is the Best and He alone will abide."

2422.arabic: انه من يات ربه مجرما فان له جهنم لا يموت فيها ولا يحيى
2422.en: The truth is that Hell awaits him who comes to his Lord laden with sin; he shall neither die in it nor live.

2423.arabic: ومن ياته مؤمنا قد عمل الصلحت فاولئك لهم الدرجت العلى
2423.en: But he who comes to Him with faith and righteous works shall be exalted to high ranks,

2424.arabic: جنت عدن تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها وذلك جزا من تزكى
2424.en: and shall live for ever in everlasting Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Such will be the reward of those who purify themselves.

2425.arabic: ولقد اوحينا الى موسى ان اسر بعبادى فاضرب لهم طريقا فى البحر يبسا لا تخف دركا ولا تخشى
2425.en: Most certainly We revealed to Moses: "Proceed with My servants in the night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be afraid of treading through the sea."

2426.arabic: فاتبعهم فرعون بجنوده فغشيهم من اليم ما غشيهم
2426.en: Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, but they were fully overwhelmed by the sea.

2427.en: Pharaoh led his people astray; he did not guide them aright.

2428.arabic: يبنى اسريل قد انجينكم من عدوكم ووعدنكم جانب الطور الايمن ونزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى
2428.en: Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy and made a covenant with you on the right side of the Mount and sent down on you manna and quails,

2429.arabic: كلوا من طيبت ما رزقنكم ولا تطغوا فيه فيحل عليكم غضبى ومن يحلل عليه غضبى فقد هوى
2429.en: saying: "Partake of the good things that We have provided for you, but do not transgress lest My wrath fall upon you; for he upon whom My wrath falls is ruined.

2430.arabic: وانى لغفار لمن تاب وامن وعمل صلحا ثم اهتدى
2430.en: But I am indeed Most Forgiving to him who repents and believes and does righteous works and keeps to the Right Way."

2431.en: "But, O Moses, what has made you come in haste from your people?"

2432.arabic: قال هم اولا على اثرى وعجلت اليك رب لترضى
2432.en: He said: "They are close behind me, and I hastened to You, Lord, that You may be pleased with me."

2433.arabic: قال فانا قد فتنا قومك من بعدك واضلهم السامرى
2433.en: Said He: "Verily We tested your people in your absence and the Samiri led them astray."

2434.arabic: فرجع موسى الى قومه غضبن اسفا قال يقوم الم يعدكم ربكم وعدا حسنا افطال عليكم العهد ام اردتم ان يحل عليكم غضب من ربكم فاخلفتم موعدى
2434.en: Moses returned to his people full of wrath and grief, and said: "My people! Has your Lord not made good an excellent promise He made to you? And has a long time passed since those promises were fulfilled? Or was it to incur the wrath of your Lord that you broke your promise with me?"

2435.arabic: قالوا ما اخلفنا موعدك بملكنا ولكنا حملنا اوزارا من زينة القوم فقذفنها فكذلك القى السامرى
2435.en: They answered: "We did not break our promise with you out of our own volition; but we were laden with the load of people's ornaments, and we simply threw them down(into the fire), and the Samiri also threw down something,

2436.arabic: فاخرج لهم عجلا جسدا له خوار فقالوا هذا الهكم واله موسى فنسى
2436.en: and brought out of there (from the molten gold) the effigy of a calf that lowed." The people cried out: "This is your deity and the deity of Moses, whom Moses has forgotten."

2437.arabic: افلا يرون الا يرجع اليهم قولا ولا يملك لهم ضرا ولا نفعا
2437.en: Did they not see that it did not return a word to them, and had no power either to hurt them or to cause them any benefit?

2438.arabic: ولقد قال لهم هرون من قبل يقوم انما فتنتم به وان ربكم الرحمن فاتبعونى واطيعوا امرى
2438.en: Certainly Aaron had said to them even before (the return of Moses): "My people, you were fallen into error because of the calf. Surely your Lord is Most Compassionate; so follow me and obey my command."

2439.arabic: قالوا لن نبرح عليه عكفين حتى يرجع الينا موسى
2439.en: But they answered: "By no means shall we cease to worship it until Moses returns to us."

2440.arabic: قال يهرون ما منعك اذ رايتهم ضلوا
2440.en: (After rebuking his people) Moses turned to Aaron and said: "Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

2441.en: from following my way? Have you disobeyed my command?"

2442.arabic: قال يبنؤم لا تاخذ بلحيتى ولا براسى انى خشيت ان تقول فرقت بين بنى اسريل ولم ترقب قولى
2442.en: Aaron answered: "Son of my mother! Do not seize me with my beard, nor by (the hair of) my head. I feared that on returning you might say: 'You sowed discord among the Children of Israel, and did not pay heed to my words.'"

2443.en: Moses said: "What, then, is your case, O Samiri?"

2444.arabic: قال بصرت بما لم يبصروا به فقبضت قبضة من اثر الرسول فنبذتها وكذلك سولت لى نفسى
2444.en: He answered: "I saw what the people did not see. So I took a handful of dust from the trail of the Messenger, and I flung it (into the fire). Thus did my mind prompt me."

2445.arabic: قال فاذهب فان لك فى الحيوة ان تقول لا مساس وان لك موعدا لن تخلفه وانظر الى الهك الذى ظلت عليه عاكفا لنحرقنه ثم لننسفنه فى اليم نسفا
2445.en: Moses said: "Be gone, then. All your life you shall cry: 'Untouchable.' There awaits a term for your reckoning that you cannot fail to keep. Now look at your god that you devotedly adored: We shall burn it and scatter its remains in the sea.

2446.arabic: انما الهكم الله الذى لا اله الا هو وسع كل شى علما
2446.en: Your God is none else than Allah, beside Whom there is no god. His knowledge embraces everything."

2447.arabic: كذلك نقص عليك من انبا ما قد سبق وقد اتينك من لدنا ذكرا
2447.en: (O Muhammad), thus do We recount to you the events of the past, and We have bestowed upon you from Ourself an admonition.

2448.arabic: من اعرض عنه فانه يحمل يوم القيمة وزرا
2448.en: He who turns away from it will surely bear a heavy burden on the Day of Resurrection,

2449.arabic: خلدين فيه وسا لهم يوم القيمة حملا
2449.en: and will abide under this burden for ever. Grievous shall be the burden on the Day of Resurrection,

2450.arabic: يوم ينفخ فى الصور ونحشر المجرمين يومئذ زرقا
2450.en: the Day when the Trumpet shall be sounded and We shall muster the sinners, their eyes turned blue with terror.

2451.arabic: يتخفتون بينهم ان لبثتم الا عشرا
2451.en: They shall whisper among themselves: "You stayed on the earth barely ten days."

2452.arabic: نحن اعلم بما يقولون اذ يقول امثلهم طريقة ان لبثتم الا يوما
2452.en: We know well what they will say to one another: We also know that even the most cautious in his estimate will say: "You lived in the world no more than a day."

2453.arabic: ويسـلونك عن الجبال فقل ينسفها ربى نسفا
2453.en: They ask you concerning the mountains: "Where will they go?" Say: "My Lord will scatter them like dust,

2454.en: and leave the earth a levelled plain

2455.arabic: لا ترى فيها عوجا ولا امتا
2455.en: in which you shall find no crookedness or curvature.

2456.arabic: يومئذ يتبعون الداعى لا عوج له وخشعت الاصوات للرحمن فلا تسمع الا همسا
2456.en: On that Day people shall follow straight on to the call of the summoner, no one daring to show any haughtiness. Their voices shall be hushed before the Most Compassionate Lord, so that you will hear nothing but a whispering murmur.

2457.arabic: يومئذ لا تنفع الشفعة الا من اذن له الرحمن ورضى له قولا
2457.en: On that Day intercession shall not avail save of him whom the Most Compassionate Lord permits, and whose word of intercession is pleasing to Him.

2458.arabic: يعلم ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون به علما
2458.en: He knows all that is ahead of them and all that is behind them, while the others do not know.

2459.arabic: وعنت الوجوه للحى القيوم وقد خاب من حمل ظلما
2459.en: All faces shall be humbled before the Ever#Living, the Self#Subsisting Lord, and he who bears the burden of iniquity will have failed;

2460.arabic: ومن يعمل من الصلحت وهو مؤمن فلا يخاف ظلما ولا هضما
2460.en: but whosoever does righteous works, being a believer, shall have no fear of suffering wrong or loss."

2461.arabic: وكذلك انزلنه قرانا عربيا وصرفنا فيه من الوعيد لعلهم يتقون او يحدث لهم ذكرا
2461.en: (O Muhammad), thus have We revealed this as an Arabic Qur'an and have expounded in it warning in diverse ways so that they may avoid evil or become heedful.

2462.arabic: فتعلى الله الملك الحق ولا تعجل بالقران من قبل ان يقضى اليك وحيه وقل رب زدنى علما
2462.en: Exalted is Allah, the True King! Hasten not with reciting the Qur'an before its revelation to you is finished, and pray: "Lord! Increase me in knowledge."

2463.arabic: ولقد عهدنا الى ادم من قبل فنسى ولم نجد له عزما
2463.en: Most certainly We had given Adam a command before, but he forgot. We found him lacking in firmness of resolution.

2464.arabic: واذ قلنا للملئكة اسجدوا لادم فسجدوا الا ابليس ابى
2464.en: Recall when We said to the angels: "Prostrate yourselves before Adam"; all prostrated themselves save Iblis. He refused.

2465.arabic: فقلنا يـادم ان هذا عدو لك ولزوجك فلا يخرجنكما من الجنة فتشقى
2465.en: Then We said: "Adam! He is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not drive both of you out of Paradise and plunge you into affliction,

2466.arabic: ان لك الا تجوع فيها ولا تعرى
2466.en: (for in Paradise) neither are you hungry nor naked,

2467.arabic: وانك لا تظمؤا فيها ولا تضحى
2467.en: nor face thirst or scorching heat."

2468.arabic: فوسوس اليه الشيطن قال يـادم هل ادلك على شجرة الخلد وملك لا يبلى
2468.en: But Satan seduced him, saying: "Adam! Shall I direct you to a tree of eternal life and an abiding kingdom?"

2469.arabic: فاكلا منها فبدت لهما سوتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة وعصى ادم ربه فغوى
2469.en: Then the two of them ate the fruit of that tree and their shameful parts became revealed to each other, and they began to cover themselves with the leaves from the Garden. Thus Adam disobeyed his Lord and strayed into error.

2470.arabic: ثم اجتبه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى
2470.en: Thereafter his Lord exalted him, accepted his repentance, and bestowed guidance upon him,

2471.arabic: قال اهبطا منها جميعۢا بعضكم لبعض عدو فاما ياتينكم منى هدى فمن اتبع هداى فلا يضل ولا يشقى
2471.en: and said: "Get down, both of you, (that is, man and Satan), and be out of it; each of you shall be an enemy to the other. Henceforth if there comes to you a guidance from Me, then whosoever follows My guidance shall neither go astray nor suffer misery.

2472.arabic: ومن اعرض عن ذكرى فان له معيشة ضنكا ونحشره يوم القيمة اعمى
2472.en: But whosoever turns away from this Admonition from Me shall have a straitened life; We shall raise him blind on the Day of Resurrection,"

2473.arabic: قال رب لم حشرتنى اعمى وقد كنت بصيرا
2473.en: where#upon he will say: "Lord! Why have You raised me blind when I had sight in the world?"

2474.arabic: قال كذلك اتتك ايتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى
2474.en: He will say: "Even so it is. Our Signs came to you and you ignored them. So shall you be ignored this Day."

2475.arabic: وكذلك نجزى من اسرف ولم يؤمن بـايت ربه ولعذاب الاخرة اشد وابقى
2475.en: Thus do We requite him who transgresses and does not believe in the signs of your Lord (during the life of the world); and surely the punishment of the Hereafter is even more terrible and more enduring.

2476.arabic: افلم يهد لهم كم اهلكنا قبلهم من القرون يمشون فى مسكنهم ان فى ذلك لايت لاولى النهى
2476.en: Did they not find any guidance in the fact that We destroyed many nations in whose ruined dwelling#places they now walk about? Surely there are many Signs in them for people endowed with wisdom.

2477.arabic: ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما واجل مسمى
2477.en: Were it not for a word already gone from your Lord, the decree (of their destruction) would have come to pass.

2478.arabic: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ومن انائ اليل فسبح واطراف النهار لعلك ترضى
2478.en: So bear patiently with what they say. Glorify your Lord, praising Him before sunrise and before sunset, and in the watches of the night, and glorify Him and at the ends of the day that you may attain to happiness.

2479.arabic: ولا تمدن عينيك الى ما متعنا به ازوجا منهم زهرة الحيوة الدنيا لنفتنهم فيه ورزق ربك خير وابقى
2479.en: Do not turn your eyes covetously towards the embellishments of worldly life that We have bestowed upon various kinds of people to test them. But the clean provision bestowed upon you by your Lord is better and more enduring.

2480.arabic: وامر اهلك بالصلوة واصطبر عليها لا نسـلك رزقا نحن نرزقك والعقبة للتقوى
2480.en: Enjoin Prayer on your household, and do keep observing it. We do not ask you for any worldly provision; rather, it is We Who provide you, and ultimately the pious will end up the best.

2481.arabic: وقالوا لولا ياتينا بـاية من ربه اولم تاتهم بينة ما فى الصحف الاولى
2481.en: They ask: "Why does he not bring us a (miraculous) sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them a Book containing the teachings of the previous scriptures?

2482.arabic: ولو انا اهلكنهم بعذاب من قبله لقالوا ربنا لولا ارسلت الينا رسولا فنتبع ايتك من قبل ان نذل ونخزى
2482.en: Had We destroyed them through some calamity before his coming, they would have said: "Our Lord! Why did You not send any Messenger to us that we might have followed Your signs before being humbled and disgraced?"

2483.arabic: قل كل متربص فتربصوا فستعلمون من اصحب الصرط السوى ومن اهتدى
2483.en: Tell them, (O Muhammad): "Everyone is waiting for his end. Wait, then, and you will soon know who are the people of the Right Way, and are rightly#guided."

2484.arabic: اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم فى غفلة معرضون
2484.en: The time of people's reckoning has drawn near, and yet they turn aside in heedlessness.

2485.arabic: ما ياتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث الا استمعوه وهم يلعبون
2485.en: Whenever any fresh admonition comes to them from their Lord they barely heed it and remain immersed in play,

2486.arabic: لاهية قلوبهم واسروا النجوى الذين ظلموا هل هذا الا بشر مثلكم افتاتون السحر وانتم تبصرون
2486.en: their hearts being set on other concerns. The wrong#doers whisper to one another: "This person is no more than a mortal like yourselves. Will you, then, be enchanted by sorcery while you see?"

2487.arabic: قال ربى يعلم القول فى السما والارض وهو السميع العليم
2487.en: He said: "My Lord knows well all that is spoken in the heavens and the earth. He is All#Hearing, All# Knowing."

2488.arabic: بل قالوا اضغث احلم بل افترىه بل هو شاعر فلياتنا بـاية كما ارسل الاولون
2488.en: They say: "Nay, these are confused dreams; nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign, even as the Messengers of the past were sent with signs."

2489.arabic: ما امنت قبلهم من قرية اهلكنها افهم يؤمنون
2489.en: Not one township that We destroyed before them believed. Would they, then, believe?

2490.arabic: وما ارسلنا قبلك الا رجالا نوحى اليهم فسـلوا اهل الذكر ان كنتم لا تعلمون
2490.en: (O Muhammad), even before you We never sent any other than human beings as Messengers, and to them We sent revelation. Ask the People of the Book if you do not know.

2491.arabic: وما جعلنهم جسدا لا ياكلون الطعام وما كانوا خلدين
2491.en: We did not endow the Messengers with bodies that would need no food; nor were they immortals.

2492.arabic: ثم صدقنهم الوعد فانجينهم ومن نشا واهلكنا المسرفين
2492.en: Then We fulfilled the promise We had made to them: We rescued them and those whom We wished, and We destroyed those who exceeded all bounds.

2493.arabic: لقد انزلنا اليكم كتبا فيه ذكركم افلا تعقلون
2493.en: We have bestowed upon you a Book that mentions you. Do you not understand?

2494.arabic: وكم قصمنا من قرية كانت ظالمة وانشانا بعدها قوما اخرين
2494.en: How many a wrong#doing town did We shatter and then raise up another people.

2495.arabic: فلما احسوا باسنا اذا هم منها يركضون
2495.en: Then, when they perceived Our chastisement they took to their heels and fled.

2496.arabic: لا تركضوا وارجعوا الى ما اترفتم فيه ومسكنكم لعلكم تسـلون
2496.en: (They were told): "Flee not, but return to your comforts and to your dwellings. You are likely to be questioned."

2497.en: They said: "Woe to us; surely we were wrong#doers."

2498.arabic: فما زالت تلك دعوىهم حتى جعلنهم حصيدا خمدين
2498.en: They did not cease to cry this until We reduced them to stubble, still and silent.

2499.arabic: وما خلقنا السما والارض وما بينهما لعبين
2499.en: We did not create in sport the heavens and the earth and all that lies between the two.

2500.arabic: لو اردنا ان نتخذ لهوا لاتخذنه من لدنا ان كنا فعلين
2500.en: Had it been Our will to find a pastime, We would have found one near at hand; if at all We were inclined to do so.

2501.arabic: بل نقذف بالحق على البطل فيدمغه فاذا هو زاهق ولكم الويل مما تصفون
2501.en: Nay, We hurl the Truth at falsehood so that the Truth crushes falsehood, and lo! it vanishes. Woe to you for what you utter!

2502.arabic: وله من فى السموت والارض ومن عنده لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ولا يستحسرون
2502.en: To Him belongs whosoever dwells in the heavens and on earth. Those (angels) that are with Him neither disdain to serve Him out of pride, nor do they weary of it.

2503.en: They glorify Him night and day, without flagging.

2504.arabic: ام اتخذوا الهة من الارض هم ينشرون
2504.en: Have they taken earthly gods who are such that they raise up the dead to life?

2505.arabic: لو كان فيهما الهة الا الله لفسدتا فسبحن الله رب العرش عما يصفون
2505.en: Had there been any gods in the heavens and the earth apart from Allah, the order of both the heavens and the earth would have gone to ruins. Glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Throne, Who is far above their false descriptions of Him.

2506.arabic: لا يسـل عما يفعل وهم يسـلون
2506.en: None shall question Him about what He does, but they shall be questioned.

2507.arabic: ام اتخذوا من دونه الهة قل هاتوا برهنكم هذا ذكر من معى وذكر من قبلى بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون الحق فهم معرضون
2507.en: Have they taken gods other than Him? Say, (O Muhammad): "Bring forth your proof! Here is the Book with admonition for those of my time and there are also scriptures with admonition for people before me." But most people do not know the Truth, and have, therefore, turned away from it.

2508.arabic: وما ارسلنا من قبلك من رسول الا نوحى اليه انه لا اله الا انا فاعبدون
2508.en: Never did We send any Messenger before you to whom We did not reveal: "There is no god but Me. So serve Me alone."

2509.arabic: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا سبحنه بل عباد مكرمون
2509.en: They say: "The Most Compassionate Lord has taken to Himself a son." Glory be to Him! Those whom they so designate are only His honoured servants.

2510.arabic: لا يسبقونه بالقول وهم بامره يعملون
2510.en: They do not outstrip Him in speech and only act as He commands.

2511.arabic: يعلم ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم ولا يشفعون الا لمن ارتضى وهم من خشيته مشفقون
2511.en: He knows whatever is before them and whatsoever is remote from them and they do not intercede except for him, intercession on whose behalf pleases Him, and they stand constantly in awe of Him.

2512.arabic: ومن يقل منهم انى اله من دونه فذلك نجزيه جهنم كذلك نجزى الظلمين
2512.en: And if anyone of them were to claim: "Indeed I am a god apart from Him," We shall recompense both with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrong#doers.

2513.arabic: اولم ير الذين كفروا ان السموت والارض كانتا رتقا ففتقنهما وجعلنا من الما كل شى حى افلا يؤمنون
2513.en: Did the unbelievers (who do not accept the teaching of the Prophet) not realize that the heavens and the earth were one solid mass, then We tore them apart, and We made every living being out of water? Will they, then, not believe (that We created all this)?

2514.arabic: وجعلنا فى الارض روسى ان تميد بهم وجعلنا فيها فجاجا سبلا لعلهم يهتدون
2514.en: And We placed firm mountains on earth lest it should sway with them, and We made wide paths in them that they may find their way;

2515.arabic: وجعلنا السما سقفا محفوظا وهم عن ايتها معرضون
2515.en: and We made the sky a secure canopy; and yet they turn away from these Signs.

2516.arabic: وهو الذى خلق اليل والنهار والشمس والقمر كل فى فلك يسبحون
2516.en: It is He Who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Each of them is floating in its orbit.

2517.arabic: وما جعلنا لبشر من قبلك الخلد افاي۟ن مت فهم الخلدون
2517.en: (O Muhammad), We did not grant everlasting life to any human being even before you. If you were to die, will they live for ever?

2518.arabic: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ونبلوكم بالشر والخير فتنة والينا ترجعون
2518.en: Every living being shall taste death and We shall subject you to ill and good by way of trial, and to Us shall all of you be eventually sent back.

2519.arabic: واذا راك الذين كفروا ان يتخذونك الا هزوا اهذا الذى يذكر الهتكم وهم بذكر الرحمن هم كفرون
2519.en: When the unbelievers see you they make you an object of fun, saying: "Is he the one who mentions your gods?" They say so, and yet they reject with disdain the very mention of the Most Compassionate Lord.

2520.arabic: خلق الانسن من عجل ساوريكم ايتى فلا تستعجلون
2520.en: Man is hasty by nature. I shall certainly show you My Signs. Do not ask Me to be hasty.

2521.arabic: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صدقين
2521.en: They say: "(Tell us) when will the threat of punishment come to pass if you are truthful?"

2522.arabic: لو يعلم الذين كفروا حين لا يكفون عن وجوههم النار ولا عن ظهورهم ولا هم ينصرون
2522.en: If only the unbelievers knew of the Hour when they shall not be able to keep off the Fire from their faces, nor from their backs; nor shall they be helped.

2523.arabic: بل تاتيهم بغتة فتبهتهم فلا يستطيعون ردها ولا هم ينظرون
2523.en: That will suddenly come upon them and stupefy them. They shall not be able to ward it off, nor shall they be granted any respite.

2524.arabic: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزون
2524.en: Other Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who scoffed at the Messengers were overtaken by the same scourge that they had scoffed at.

2525.arabic: قل من يكلؤكم باليل والنهار من الرحمن بل هم عن ذكر ربهم معرضون
2525.en: Tell them, (O Muhammad): "Who protects you, during the night or the day from the Most Compassionate Lord?" And yet they turn away from the Admonition of their Lord.

2526.arabic: ام لهم الهة تمنعهم من دوننا لا يستطيعون نصر انفسهم ولا هم منا يصحبون
2526.en: Do they have any gods who would protect them against Us? They have no power even to help themselves; nor do they enjoy Our support.

2527.arabic: بل متعنا هؤلا واباهم حتى طال عليهم العمر افلا يرون انا ناتى الارض ننقصها من اطرافها افهم الغلبون
2527.en: Nay, We generously provided them and their fathers, and they enjoyed Our provision for long. Do they not see that We are now advancing into their territory, diminishing it from different sides? Is it they, then, who will triumph?"

2528.arabic: قل انما انذركم بالوحى ولا يسمع الصم الدعا اذا ما ينذرون
2528.en: Tell them: "I only warn you by the Revelation." But the deaf do not hear the cry when they are warned.

2529.arabic: ولئن مستهم نفحة من عذاب ربك ليقولن يويلنا انا كنا ظلمين
2529.en: Were only the slightest whiff from your Lord's punishment to touch them, they would cry out: "Woe to us; we were indeed wrong#doers."

2530.arabic: ونضع الموزين القسط ليوم القيمة فلا تظلم نفس شيـا وان كان مثقال حبة من خردل اتينا بها وكفى بنا حسبين
2530.en: We shall set up just scales on the Day of Resurrection so that none will be wronged in the least. (We shall bring forth the acts of everyone), even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed. We shall suffice as Reckoners.

2531.arabic: ولقد اتينا موسى وهرون الفرقان وضيا وذكرا للمتقين
2531.en: Surely We had granted to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (between right and wrong), and Light and Admonition for the good of the God#fearing,

2532.arabic: الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وهم من الساعة مشفقون
2532.en: for those who fear their Lord without seeing Him and dread the Hour (of Reckoning).

2533.arabic: وهذا ذكر مبارك انزلنه افانتم له منكرون
2533.en: This is a Blessed Admonition that We have revealed. Are you, then, going to reject it?

2534.arabic: ولقد اتينا ابرهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به علمين
2534.en: Surely We had bestowed wisdom upon Abraham even earlier, and We knew him well.

2535.arabic: اذ قال لابيه وقومه ما هذه التماثيل التى انتم لها عكفون
2535.en: Recall, when he said to his father and his people: "What are these images to which you are devoutly clinging?"

2536.en: They answered: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

2537.arabic: قال لقد كنتم انتم واباؤكم فى ضلل مبين
2537.en: He said: "Certainly you and your fathers have all been in manifest error."

2538.arabic: قالوا اجئتنا بالحق ام انت من اللعبين
2538.en: They said: "Are you expressing your true ideas before us or are you jesting?"

2539.arabic: قال بل ربكم رب السموت والارض الذى فطرهن وانا على ذلكم من الشهدين
2539.en: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth which He created and to that I bear witness before you.

2540.arabic: وتالله لاكيدن اصنمكم بعد ان تولوا مدبرين
2540.en: By Allah, I shall certainly carry out my plan against your gods after you are gone."

2541.arabic: فجعلهم جذذا الا كبيرا لهم لعلهم اليه يرجعون
2541.en: Then he broke them all into pieces, sparing only the supreme one among them that they may possibly return to him.

2542.arabic: قالوا من فعل هذا بـالهتنا انه لمن الظلمين
2542.en: (When they saw the idols in this state) they said: "Who has done this to our gods? Surely he is one of the wrong#doers."

2543.arabic: قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له ابرهيم
2543.en: Some of them said: "We heard a youth called Abraham speak (ill) of them."

2544.arabic: قالوا فاتوا به على اعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون
2544.en: The others said: "Bring him, then, before the eyes of the people that they may see (what will be done to him)."

2545.arabic: قالوا انت فعلت هذا بـالهتنا يابرهيم
2545.en: (On Abraham's arrival) they said: "Abraham, are you he who has done this to our gods?"

2546.arabic: قال بل فعله كبيرهم هذا فسـلوهم ان كانوا ينطقون
2546.en: He answered: "Rather it was this supreme one who has done it. So ask them, if they can speak."

2547.arabic: فرجعوا الى انفسهم فقالوا انكم انتم الظلمون
2547.en: Thereupon they turned to their (inner) selves and said (to themselves): "Surely it is you who are the wrong#doers."

2548.arabic: ثم نكسوا على روسهم لقد علمت ما هؤلا ينطقون
2548.en: Then their minds were turned upside down, and they said: "You know well that they do not speak."

2549.arabic: قال افتعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعكم شيـا ولا يضركم
2549.en: Abraham said: "Do you, then, worship beside Allah a thing that can neither benefit you nor hurt you?

2550.arabic: اف لكم ولما تعبدون من دون الله افلا تعقلون
2550.en: Fie upon you and upon all that you worship beside Allah. Do you have no sense?"

2551.arabic: قالوا حرقوه وانصروا الهتكم ان كنتم فعلين
2551.en: They said: "Burn him, and come to the support of your gods, if you are going to do anything."

2552.arabic: قلنا ينار كونى بردا وسلما على ابرهيم
2552.en: We said: "O fire, become coolness and safety for Abraham."

2553.en: They had sought to do evil to him, but We caused them to be the worst losers,

2554.arabic: ونجينه ولوطا الى الارض التى بركنا فيها للعلمين
2554.en: and We saved him and Lot and brought him to the land upon which We had bestowed Our blessings for all the people of the world.

2555.arabic: ووهبنا له اسحق ويعقوب نافلة وكلا جعلنا صلحين
2555.en: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, making each of them righteous.

2556.arabic: وجعلنهم ائمة يهدون بامرنا واوحينا اليهم فعل الخيرت واقام الصلوة وايتا الزكوة وكانوا لنا عبدين
2556.en: And We made them into leaders to guide people in accordance with Our command, and We inspired them to good works, and to establish Prayers and to give Zakah. They worshipped Us alone.

2557.arabic: ولوطا اتينه حكما وعلما ونجينه من القرية التى كانت تعمل الخبئث انهم كانوا قوم سو فسقين
2557.en: We bestowed upon Lot sound judgement and knowledge, and We delivered him from the city that was immersed in foul deeds. They were indeed a wicked people, exceedingly disobedient.

2558.arabic: وادخلنه فى رحمتنا انه من الصلحين
2558.en: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Verily he was of the righteous.

2559.arabic: ونوحا اذ نادى من قبل فاستجبنا له فنجينه واهله من الكرب العظيم
2559.en: We bestowed the same favour upon Noah. Recall, when he cried to Us before; We accepted his prayer and delivered him and his household from the great distress

2560.arabic: ونصرنه من القوم الذين كذبوا بـايتنا انهم كانوا قوم سو فاغرقنهم اجمعين
2560.en: and We helped him against a people who rejected Our signs as false. They were indeed an evil people and so We drowned them all.

2561.arabic: وداود وسليمن اذ يحكمان فى الحرث اذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شهدين
2561.en: We bestowed the same favour upon David and Solomon. Recall, when they gave judgement regarding a tillage into which the sheep of some people had strayed at night, and We were witnesses to their judgement.

2562.arabic: ففهمنها سليمن وكلا اتينا حكما وعلما وسخرنا مع داود الجبال يسبحن والطير وكنا فعلين
2562.en: We guided Solomon to the right verdict, and We had granted each of them judgement and knowledge. We made the mountains and the birds celebrate the praise of Allah with David. It was We Who did all this.

2563.arabic: وعلمنه صنعة لبوس لكم لتحصنكم من باسكم فهل انتم شكرون
2563.en: It was We Who taught him the art of making coats of mail for your benefit so that it may protect you from each other's violence. Do you, then, give thanks?

2564.arabic: ولسليمن الريح عاصفة تجرى بامره الى الارض التى بركنا فيها وكنا بكل شى علمين
2564.en: And We subdued the strongly raging wind to Solomon which blew at his bidding towards the land We blessed. We know everything.

2565.arabic: ومن الشيطين من يغوصون له ويعملون عملا دون ذلك وكنا لهم حفظين
2565.en: And We subdued many devils who dived (into the sea) for him and carried out other jobs besides that. We kept watch over all of them.

2566.arabic: وايوب اذ نادى ربه انى مسنى الضر وانت ارحم الرحمين
2566.en: We bestowed (the same wisdom, judgement and knowledge) upon Job. Recall, when he cried to his Lord: "Behold, disease has struck me and You are the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."

2567.arabic: فاستجبنا له فكشفنا ما به من ضر واتينه اهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة من عندنا وذكرى للعبدين
2567.en: We accepted his prayer and removed the affliction from him, and We not only restored to him his family but as many more with them as a mercy from Us and as a lesson to the worshippers.

2568.arabic: واسمعيل وادريس وذا الكفل كل من الصبرين
2568.en: And (We bestowed the same favour) upon Ishmael, Idris and Dhu al#Kifl, for they were all steadfast.

2569.arabic: وادخلنهم فى رحمتنا انهم من الصلحين
2569.en: And We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were of the righteous.

2570.arabic: وذا النون اذ ذهب مغضبا فظن ان لن نقدر عليه فنادى فى الظلمت ان لا اله الا انت سبحنك انى كنت من الظلمين
2570.en: And We bestowed Our favour upon Dhu al#Nun. Recall, when he went forth enraged, thinking We have no power to take him to task. Eventually he cried out in the darkness:" There is no god but You. Glory be to You! I have done wrong."

2571.arabic: فاستجبنا له ونجينه من الغم وكذلك نۨجى المؤمنين
2571.en: Thereupon We accepted his prayer, and rescued him from grief. Thus do We rescue the believers.

2572.arabic: وزكريا اذ نادى ربه رب لا تذرنى فردا وانت خير الورثين
2572.en: And We bestowed favour upon Zechariah, when he cried to his Lord: "Lord! Leave me not solitary (without any issue). You are the Best Inheritor."

2573.arabic: فاستجبنا له ووهبنا له يحيى واصلحنا له زوجه انهم كانوا يسرعون فى الخيرت ويدعوننا رغبا ورهبا وكانوا لنا خشعين
2573.en: So We accepted his prayer and bestowed upon him John, and We made his wife fit (to bear a child). Verily they hastened in doing good works and called upon Us with longing and fear, and humbled themselves to Us.

2574.arabic: والتى احصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيها من روحنا وجعلنها وابنها اية للعلمين
2574.en: And also recall the woman who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and made her and her son a Sign to the whole world.

2575.arabic: ان هذه امتكم امة وحدة وانا ربكم فاعبدون
2575.en: Verily this community of yours is a single community, and I am your Lord; so worship Me.

2576.arabic: وتقطعوا امرهم بينهم كل الينا رجعون
2576.en: But they tore asunder their faith into many parts. But to Us they are bound to return.

2577.arabic: فمن يعمل من الصلحت وهو مؤمن فلا كفران لسعيه وانا له كتبون
2577.en: Then whosoever does righteous works, while believing, his striving will not go unappreciated. We record them all for him.

2578.arabic: وحرم على قرية اهلكنها انهم لا يرجعون
2578.en: It has been ordained against every town that We ever destroyed that they shall not return (to enjoy a new lease of life)

2579.arabic: حتى اذا فتحت ياجوج وماجوج وهم من كل حدب ينسلون
2579.en: until Gog and Magog are let loose, and begin swooping from every mound,

2580.arabic: واقترب الوعد الحق فاذا هى شخصة ابصر الذين كفروا يويلنا قد كنا فى غفلة من هذا بل كنا ظلمين
2580.en: and the time for the fulfilment of the true promise of Allah draws near, whereupon the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in fear, and they will say: "Woe to us, we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we were wrongdoers."

2581.arabic: انكم وما تعبدون من دون الله حصب جهنم انتم لها وردون
2581.en: (They will be told): "Verily you and the gods you worshipped beside Allah are the fuel of Hell. All of you are bound to arrive there.

2582.arabic: لو كان هؤلا الهة ما وردوها وكل فيها خلدون
2582.en: Had these indeed been gods they would not have gone there. But (as it is), all of you shall ever abide in it."

2583.arabic: لهم فيها زفير وهم فيها لا يسمعون
2583.en: There they shall groan with anguish and the din and noise in Hell will not let them hear anything.

2584.arabic: ان الذين سبقت لهم منا الحسنى اولئك عنها مبعدون
2584.en: But for those whom We had decided to favour with good reward, they shall be kept far removed from Hell.

2585.arabic: لا يسمعون حسيسها وهم فى ما اشتهت انفسهم خلدون
2585.en: They shall not hear even a whisper of it, and they shall live for ever in the delights which they had desired.

2586.arabic: لا يحزنهم الفزع الاكبر وتتلقىهم الملئكة هذا يومكم الذى كنتم توعدون
2586.en: The Hour of the Great Terror shall not grieve them, and the angels shall receive them saying: "This is your Day which you had been promised."

2587.arabic: يوم نطوى السما كطى السجل للكتب كما بدانا اول خلق نعيده وعدا علينا انا كنا فعلين
2587.en: On that Day We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll for writing. Even as We originated the creation first so We shall repeat it. This is a promise binding on Us; and so We shall do.

2588.arabic: ولقد كتبنا فى الزبور من بعد الذكر ان الارض يرثها عبادى الصلحون
2588.en: Surely We wrote in the Psalms, after the exhortation, that the earth shall be inherited by My righteous servants.

2589.arabic: ان فى هذا لبلغا لقوم عبدين
2589.en: Herein, surely, is a message for those devoted to worship.

2590.en: We have sent you forth as nothing but mercy to people of the whole world.

2591.arabic: قل انما يوحى الى انما الهكم اله وحد فهل انتم مسلمون
2591.en: Say: "It is revealed to me that your God is only One God. Will you, then, submit to Him?"

2592.arabic: فان تولوا فقل اذنتكم على سوا وان ادرى اقريب ام بعيد ما توعدون
2592.en: If they turn away, say to them: "I have warned you all alike; and I cannot say whether what you have been promised is near or distant.

2593.arabic: انه يعلم الجهر من القول ويعلم ما تكتمون
2593.en: Indeed He knows what you say loudly and what you hide.

2594.arabic: وان ادرى لعله فتنة لكم ومتع الى حين
2594.en: I think that this \[reprieve\] is possibly a trial for you, an opportunity to enjoy yourselves until an appointed time."

2595.arabic: قل رب احكم بالحق وربنا الرحمن المستعان على ما تصفون
2595.en: The Messenger said: "My Lord! Judge with truth. Our Compassionate Lord alone is our support against your (blasphemous) utterances."

2596.arabic: يايها الناس اتقوا ربكم ان زلزلة الساعة شى عظيم
2596.en: O mankind, fear the (wrath of) your Lord! Indeed, the earthquake of the Hour (of Judgement) will be an awesome thing.

2597.arabic: يوم ترونها تذهل كل مرضعة عما ارضعت وتضع كل ذات حمل حملها وترى الناس سكرى وما هم بسكرى ولكن عذاب الله شديد
2597.en: On the Day when you witness it, the suckling woman shall utterly neglect the infant she suckles, and every pregnant woman shall cast her burden, and you will see people as though they are drunk, when they are not drunk; but dreadful shall be Allah's chastisement.

2598.arabic: ومن الناس من يجدل فى الله بغير علم ويتبع كل شيطن مريد
2598.en: Among people there are some who wrangle about Allah without knowledge and follow every rebellious devil,

2599.arabic: كتب عليه انه من تولاه فانه يضله ويهديه الى عذاب السعير
2599.en: although it is decreed about him that he shall lead into error whosoever takes him for a friend, and will direct him to the torment of the Fire.

2600.arabic: يايها الناس ان كنتم فى ريب من البعث فانا خلقنكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم من مضغة مخلقة وغير مخلقة لنبين لكم ونقر فى الارحام ما نشا الى اجل مسمى ثم نخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا اشدكم ومنكم من يتوفى ومنكم من يرد الى ارذل العمر لكيلا يعلم من بعد علم شيـا وترى الارض هامدة فاذا انزلنا عليها الما اهتزت وربت وانبتت من كل زوجۭ بهيج
2600.en: O mankind! If you have any doubt concerning Resurrection, then know that it is surely We Who created you from dust, then from a drop of sperm, then from a clot of blood, then from a little lump of flesh, some of it shapely and other shapeless. (We are rehearsing this) that We may make the reality clear to you. We cause (the drop of sperm) that We please to remain in the wombs till an appointed time. We bring you forth as infants (and nurture you) that you may come of age. Among you is he that dies (at a young age) and he who is kept back to the most abject age so that after once having known, he reaches a stage when he knows nothing. You see the earth dry and barren and then no sooner than We send down water upon it, it begins to quiver and swell and brings forth every kind of beauteous vegetation.

2601.arabic: ذلك بان الله هو الحق وانه يحى الموتى وانه على كل شى قدير
2601.en: All this is because Allah, He is the Truth, and because He resurrects the dead, and because He has power over everything,

2602.arabic: وان الساعة اتية لا ريب فيها وان الله يبعث من فى القبور
2602.en: (all of which shows that) the Hour shall surely come to pass # in this there is no doubt # and Allah shall surely resurrect those that are in graves.

2603.arabic: ومن الناس من يجدل فى الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتب منير
2603.en: And among people are those that wrangle about Allah without knowledge, without any true guidance, and without any scripture to enlighten them.

2604.arabic: ثانى عطفه ليضل عن سبيل الله له فى الدنيا خزى ونذيقه يوم القيمة عذاب الحريق
2604.en: They wrangle arrogantly, intent on leading people astray from the Way of Allah. Such shall suffer disgrace in this world and We shall cause them to taste the chastisement of burning (in the Next).

2605.arabic: ذلك بما قدمت يداك وان الله ليس بظلم للعبيد
2605.en: That is the outcome of what your own hands have wrought, for Allah never wrongs His creatures.

2606.arabic: ومن الناس من يعبد الله على حرف فان اصابه خير اطمان به وان اصابته فتنة انقلب على وجهه خسر الدنيا والاخرة ذلك هو الخسران المبين
2606.en: And among people is he who worships Allah on the borderline; if any good befalls him, he is satisfied; but if a trial afflicts him, he utterly turns away. He will incur the loss of this world and the Hereafter. That indeed is a clear loss.

2607.arabic: يدعوا من دون الله ما لا يضره وما لا ينفعه ذلك هو الضلل البعيد
2607.en: He invokes, instead of Allah, those who can neither harm nor benefit him. That indeed is straying far away.

2608.arabic: يدعوا لمن ضره اقرب من نفعه لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير
2608.en: He invokes those that are more likely to cause him harm than benefit. Such is surely an evil patron, and an evil associate.

2609.arabic: ان الله يدخل الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر ان الله يفعل ما يريد
2609.en: (In contrast) Allah will assuredly cause those who believe and act righteously to enter Gardens beneath which rivers flow. For, most certainly, Allah does whatever He pleases.

2610.arabic: من كان يظن ان لن ينصره الله فى الدنيا والاخرة فليمدد بسبب الى السما ثم ليقطع فلينظر هل يذهبن كيده ما يغيظ
2610.en: Anyone who fancies that Allah will not support him in this world and in the Hereafter, let him reach out to heaven through a rope, and then make a hole in the sky and see whether his device can avert that which enrages him.

2611.arabic: وكذلك انزلنه ايت بينت وان الله يهدى من يريد
2611.en: Even so We have revealed the Qur'an with Clear Signs. Verily Allah guides whomsoever He wills.

2612.arabic: ان الذين امنوا والذين هادوا والصبـين والنصرى والمجوس والذين اشركوا ان الله يفصل بينهم يوم القيمة ان الله على كل شى شهيد
2612.en: On the Day of Resurrection Allah will most certainly judge among those who believe, and those who became Jews, and Sabaeans, and Christians, and Magians, and those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity. Surely Allah watches over everything.

2613.arabic: الم تر ان الله يسجد له من فى السموت ومن فى الارض والشمس والقمر والنجوم والجبال والشجر والدواب وكثير من الناس وكثير حق عليه العذاب ومن يهن الله فما له من مكرم ان الله يفعل ما يشا
2613.en: Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and all those who are in the earth prostrate themselves before Allah; and so do the sun and the moon, and the stars and the mountains, and the trees, and the beasts, and so do many human beings, and even many of those who are condemned to chastisement? And he whom Allah humiliates, none can give him honour. Allah does whatever He wills.

2614.arabic: هذان خصمان اختصموا فى ربهم فالذين كفروا قطعت لهم ثياب من نار يصب من فوق روسهم الحميم
2614.en: These two groups (the believers and unbelievers) are in dispute about their Lord. As for those that disbelieve, garments of fire have been cut out for them; boiling water shall be poured down over their heads,

2615.arabic: يصهر به ما فى بطونهم والجلود
2615.en: causing (not only) their skins but all that is in their bellies as well to melt away.

2616.en: There shall be maces of iron to lash them.

2617.arabic: كلما ارادوا ان يخرجوا منها من غم اعيدوا فيها وذوقوا عذاب الحريق
2617.en: Whenever they try, in their anguish, to escape from Hell, they will be driven back into it, (and shall be told): "Now taste the torment of burning."

2618.arabic: ان الله يدخل الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر يحلون فيها من اساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير
2618.en: (On the other hand), Allah will cause those who believed and acted righteously to enter the Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall be decked in them with bracelets of gold and pearls and their raiment shall be of silk.

2619.arabic: وهدوا الى الطيب من القول وهدوا الى صرط الحميد
2619.en: They were guided (to accept) the pure word; they were guided to the Way of the Praiseworthy (Lord).

2620.arabic: ان الذين كفروا ويصدون عن سبيل الله والمسجد الحرام الذى جعلنه للناس سوا العكف فيه والباد ومن يرد فيه بالحادۭ بظلم نذقه من عذاب اليم
2620.en: Indeed those who disbelieve and who (now) hinder people from the Way of Allah and hinder them from the Holy Mosque which We have set up (as a place of worship) for all people, equally for those who dwell therein and for those who come from outside, (they surely deserve punishment). Whosoever deviates therein from the Right Way and acts with iniquity, We shall cause him to taste a painful chastisement.

2621.arabic: واذ بوانا لابرهيم مكان البيت ان لا تشرك بى شيـا وطهر بيتى للطائفين والقائمين والركع السجود
2621.en: Call to mind when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House (Kabah), directing him: "Do not associate aught with Me" and "Keep My House pure for those who walk around it, and for those who stand and who bow down and who prostrate themselves (in worship),

2622.arabic: واذن فى الناس بالحج ياتوك رجالا وعلى كل ضامر ياتين من كل فج عميق
2622.en: and publicly proclaim Pilgrimage for all mankind so that they come to you on foot and mounted on lean camels from every distant point

2623.arabic: ليشهدوا منفع لهم ويذكروا اسم الله فى ايام معلومت على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الانعم فكلوا منها واطعموا البائس الفقير
2623.en: to witness the benefits in store for them, and pronounce the name of Allah during the appointed days over the cattle that He has provided them. So eat of it and feed the distressed and the needy.

2624.arabic: ثم ليقضوا تفثهم وليوفوا نذورهم وليطوفوا بالبيت العتيق
2624.en: Thereafter, let them tidy up and fulfil their vows and circumambulate the Ancient House."

2625.arabic: ذلك ومن يعظم حرمت الله فهو خير له عند ربه واحلت لكم الانعم الا ما يتلى عليكم فاجتنبوا الرجس من الاوثن واجتنبوا قول الزور
2625.en: Such (was the purpose of building the Kabah). Whosoever, then, venerates Allah's sanctities will find it to be good for him in the sight of his Lord. Cattle have been made lawful for you except those mentioned to you (as unlawful). So shun the abomination of idols and shun all words of falsehood.

2626.arabic: حنفا لله غير مشركين به ومن يشرك بالله فكانما خر من السما فتخطفه الطير او تهوى به الريح فى مكان سحيق
2626.en: Become exclusively devoted to Allah, ascribing Divinity to none other than Him. Whoso ascribes Divinity to aught beside Allah, it is as though he fell down from the sky whereafter either the birds will snatch him away, or the wind will sweep him to a distant place (causing him to be shattered to pieces).

2627.arabic: ذلك ومن يعظم شعئر الله فانها من تقوى القلوب
2627.en: Such is the fact. And whoso venerates the sanctity of all that have been ordained as symbols of Allah surely does so because it is part of the true piety of the hearts.

2628.arabic: لكم فيها منفع الى اجل مسمى ثم محلها الى البيت العتيق
2628.en: You may derive benefit (from sacrificial animals) until an appointed time. Thereafter their place (of sacrifice) is near the Ancient House.

2629.arabic: ولكل امة جعلنا منسكا ليذكروا اسم الله على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الانعم فالهكم اله وحد فله اسلموا وبشر المخبتين
2629.en: For every people We have laid down a ritual of sacrifice(# although the purpose of the ritual is the same #)that they pronounce the name of Allah over the cattle He has provided them. Your Lord is One God; so submit yourselves to Him alone. And give, (O Prophet), glad tidings to those that humble themselves (before Allah),

2630.arabic: الذين اذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم والصبرين على ما اصابهم والمقيمى الصلوة ومما رزقنهم ينفقون
2630.en: whose hearts shiver whenever Allah is mentioned, who patiently bear whatever affliction comes to them, who establish Prayer, and who spend (for good purposes) out of what We have provided them.

2631.arabic: والبدن جعلنها لكم من شعئر الله لكم فيها خير فاذكروا اسم الله عليها صواف فاذا وجبت جنوبها فكلوا منها واطعموا القانع والمعتر كذلك سخرنها لكم لعلكم تشكرون
2631.en: We have appointed sacrificial camels among the symbols of (devotion to) Allah. There is much good in them for you. So make them stand (at the time of sacrifice) and pronounce the name of Allah over them, and when they fall down on their sides (after they are slaughtered), eat and also feed them who do not ask and those who ask. Thus have We subjected these animals that you may give thanks.

2632.arabic: لن ينال الله لحومها ولا دماؤها ولكن يناله التقوى منكم كذلك سخرها لكم لتكبروا الله على ما هدىكم وبشر المحسنين
2632.en: Neither their flesh reaches Allah nor their blood; it is your piety that reaches Him. He has subjected these animals (to you) that you may magnify Allah for the guidance He has bestowed upon you. Give glad tidings, (O Prophet), to those who do good.

2633.arabic: ان الله يدفع عن الذين امنوا ان الله لا يحب كل خوان كفور
2633.en: Surely Allah defends those who believe. Certainly Allah has no love for the perfidious, the thankless.

2634.arabic: اذن للذين يقتلون بانهم ظلموا وان الله على نصرهم لقدير
2634.en: Permission (to fight) has been granted to those for they have been wronged. Verily Allah has the power to help them:

2635.arabic: الذين اخرجوا من ديرهم بغير حق الا ان يقولوا ربنا الله ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لهدمت صومع وبيع وصلوت ومسجد يذكر فيها اسم الله كثيرا ولينصرن الله من ينصره ان الله لقوى عزيز
2635.en: those who were unjustly expelled from their homes for no other reason than their saying: "Allah is Our Lord." If Allah were not to repel some through others, monasteries and churches and synagogues and mosques wherein the name of Allah is much mentioned, would certainly have been pulled down. Allah will most certainly help those who will help Him. Verily Allah is Immensely Strong, Overwhelmingly Mighty.

2636.arabic: الذين ان مكنهم فى الارض اقاموا الصلوة واتوا الزكوة وامروا بالمعروف ونهوا عن المنكر ولله عقبة الامور
2636.en: (Allah will certainly help) those who, were We to bestow authority on them in the land, will establish Prayers, render Zakah, enjoin good, and forbid evil. The end of all matters rests with Allah.

2637.arabic: وان يكذبوك فقد كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود
2637.en: (O Prophet), if they give the lie to you, then before them the people of 'Ad and Thamud, also gave the lie (to the Prophets),

2638.en: and so too did the people of Abraham and the people of Lot;

2639.arabic: واصحب مدين وكذب موسى فامليت للكفرين ثم اخذتهم فكيف كان نكير
2639.en: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them. How dreadful was My punishment!

2640.arabic: فكاين من قرية اهلكنها وهى ظالمة فهى خاوية على عروشها وبئر معطلة وقصر مشيد
2640.en: How many towns have We destroyed because their people were steeped in iniquity: so they lie fallen down upon their turrets! How many wells lie deserted; and how many towering palaces lie in ruins!

2641.arabic: افلم يسيروا فى الارض فتكون لهم قلوب يعقلون بها او اذان يسمعون بها فانها لا تعمى الابصر ولكن تعمى القلوب التى فى الصدور
2641.en: Have they not journeyed in the land that their hearts might understand and their ears might listen? For indeed it is not the eyes that are blinded; it is rather the hearts in the breasts that are rendered blind.

2642.arabic: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولن يخلف الله وعده وان يوما عند ربك كالف سنة مما تعدون
2642.en: They ask you to hasten the punishment. Allah shall most certainly not fail His promise; but a Day with your Lord is as a thousand years of your reckoning.

2643.arabic: وكاين من قرية امليت لها وهى ظالمة ثم اخذتها والى المصير
2643.en: How many towns did I respite at first though they were steeped in iniquity, and then I seized them! To Me are all destined to return.

2644.arabic: قل يايها الناس انما انا لكم نذير مبين
2644.en: Say (O Muhammad): "O people! I have been sent to you only as a plain warner (before the Doom strikes you)."

2645.arabic: فالذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم
2645.en: So those who believe and act righteously shall be granted forgiveness and an honourable sustenance,

2646.arabic: والذين سعوا فى ايتنا معجزين اولئك اصحب الجحيم
2646.en: whereas those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to profane them, they are the friends of the Fire!

2647.arabic: وما ارسلنا من قبلك من رسول ولا نبى الا اذا تمنى القى الشيطن فى امنيته فينسخ الله ما يلقى الشيطن ثم يحكم الله ايته والله عليم حكيم
2647.en: Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet before you (O Muhammad), but that whenever he had a desire, Satan interfered with that desire. Allah eradicates the interference of Satan and strengthens His Signs. Allah is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

2648.arabic: ليجعل ما يلقى الشيطن فتنة للذين فى قلوبهم مرض والقاسية قلوبهم وان الظلمين لفى شقاقۭ بعيد
2648.en: (He does this) in order that He may make the evil caused by Satan a trial for those in whose hearts there is sickness (of hypocrisy), whose hearts are hard (and vitiated). Surely these wrong#doers have gone too far in their dissension.

2649.arabic: وليعلم الذين اوتوا العلم انه الحق من ربك فيؤمنوا به فتخبت له قلوبهم وان الله لهاد الذين امنوا الى صرط مستقيم
2649.en: (He also does this) in order that those endowed with knowledge may know that it is the Truth from your Lord and that they may have faith in it and their hearts may humble themselves before Him. Verily Allah always directs those that believe to the Right Way.

2650.arabic: ولا يزال الذين كفروا فى مرية منه حتى تاتيهم الساعة بغتة او ياتيهم عذاب يوم عقيم
2650.en: The unbelievers will not cease to be in doubt about it until the Hour suddenly comes upon them, or the chastisement of an ominous day overtakes them.

2651.arabic: الملك يومئذ لله يحكم بينهم فالذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت فى جنت النعيم
2651.en: On that Day all sovereignty shall be Allah's and He will judge among them. Then those who believed and acted righteously shall be in Gardens of Bliss.

2652.arabic: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بـايتنا فاولئك لهم عذاب مهين
2652.en: A humiliating chastisement awaits those who disbelieved and denied Our Signs.

2653.arabic: والذين هاجروا فى سبيل الله ثم قتلوا او ماتوا ليرزقنهم الله رزقا حسنا وان الله لهو خير الرزقين
2653.en: As for those who migrated in the way of Allah, whereafter they were slain, or died, Allah will certainly grant them a goodly provision. Indeed, Allah is the Best of all those who provide.

2654.arabic: ليدخلنهم مدخلا يرضونه وان الله لعليم حليم
2654.en: He will surely admit them to a resort which will please them. Most certainly Allah is All#Knowing, Most Forbearing.

2655.arabic: ذلك ومن عاقب بمثل ما عوقب به ثم بغى عليه لينصرنه الله ان الله لعفو غفور
2655.en: That indeed is so, as for him who retaliates in proportion to the excess committed against him, and is thereafter again subjected to transgression, Allah will surely aid him. Verily Allah is All#Pardoning, All#Forgiving.

2656.arabic: ذلك بان الله يولج اليل فى النهار ويولج النهار فى اليل وان الله سميعۢ بصير
2656.en: So shall it be because it is Allah Who causes the night to emerge out of the day and causes the day to emerge out of the night and Allah is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

2657.arabic: ذلك بان الله هو الحق وان ما يدعون من دونه هو البطل وان الله هو العلى الكبير
2657.en: So shall it be because Allah, He is the Truth, and all whom they invoke instead of Him are false. Allah is Most High, All#Great.
