2658.arabic: الم تر ان الله انزل من السما ما فتصبح الارض مخضرة ان الله لطيف خبير
2658.en: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky whereby the earth turns green? Verily Allah is Subtle, All#Aware.

2659.arabic: له ما فى السموت وما فى الارض وان الله لهو الغنى الحميد
2659.en: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. Surely Allah # He alone is Self# Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

2660.arabic: الم تر ان الله سخر لكم ما فى الارض والفلك تجرى فى البحر بامره ويمسك السما ان تقع على الارض الا باذنه ان الله بالناس لروف رحيم
2660.en: Have you not seen how Allah has subjected to you all that is in the earth, and the vessels that sail in the sea by His command, and it is He Who holds back the sky that it may not fall on earth except by His leave? Surely Allah is Most Gentle, Ever Compassionate to people.

2661.arabic: وهو الذى احياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم ان الانسن لكفور
2661.en: And it is He Who has endowed you with life and it is He who causes you to die, and it is He Who will then resurrect you. Man is indeed extremely prone to denying the Truth.

2662.arabic: لكل امة جعلنا منسكا هم ناسكوه فلا ينزعنك فى الامر وادع الى ربك انك لعلى هدى مستقيم
2662.en: For every people We have prescribed a way of worship which they follow. So, (O Muhammad), let them not dispute with you concerning this, and call them to Your Lord. You are certainly on the Straight Way.

2663.arabic: وان جدلوك فقل الله اعلم بما تعملون
2663.en: And if they dispute with you, say: "Allah knows well what you do.

2664.arabic: الله يحكم بينكم يوم القيمة فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون
2664.en: Allah will judge among you on the Day of Resurrection concerning matters about which you disagreed."

2665.arabic: الم تعلم ان الله يعلم ما فى السما والارض ان ذلك فى كتب ان ذلك على الله يسير
2665.en: Are you not aware that Allah knows all that is in the heaven and the earth? Surely it is all preserved in a Book. Indeed that is easy with Allah.

2666.arabic: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لم ينزل به سلطنا وما ليس لهم به علم وما للظلمين من نصير
2666.en: Instead of Allah they worship those concerning whom He has revealed no sanction and concerning whom they have no true knowledge. None shall be able to help such evil#doers.

2667.arabic: واذا تتلى عليهم ايتنا بينت تعرف فى وجوه الذين كفروا المنكر يكادون يسطون بالذين يتلون عليهم ايتنا قل افانبئكم بشر من ذلكم النار وعدها الله الذين كفروا وبئس المصير
2667.en: When Our Signs are plainly recited to them, you will perceive utter repugnance on their faces and it all but seems as if they will soon pounce upon those who recite Our Signs to them. Say: "Shall I tell you what is worse than that? The Fire with which Allah has threatened those who disbelieve. That is truly an evil end."

2668.arabic: يايها الناس ضرب مثل فاستمعوا له ان الذين تدعون من دون الله لن يخلقوا ذبابا ولو اجتمعوا له وان يسلبهم الذباب شيـا لا يستنقذوه منه ضعف الطالب والمطلوب
2668.en: O people, a parable is set forth: pay heed to it. Those who call upon aught other than Allah shall never be able to create even a fly, even if all of them were to come together to do that. And if the fly were to snatch away anything from them, they would not be able to recover that from it. Powerless is the supplicant; and powerless is he to whom he supplicates.

2669.arabic: ما قدروا الله حق قدره ان الله لقوى عزيز
2669.en: They have not formed a true estimate of Allah. Indeed, Allah is All#Powerful, All#Mighty.

2670.arabic: الله يصطفى من الملئكة رسلا ومن الناس ان الله سميعۢ بصير
2670.en: Allah chooses Messengers from among angels and from among human beings (to convey His command). Allah is All#Hearing, All#Seeing.

2671.arabic: يعلم ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم والى الله ترجع الامور
2671.en: He knows all that is before them and that which is hidden from them. And it is to Allah that all affairs are returned.

2672.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اركعوا واسجدوا واعبدوا ربكم وافعلوا الخير لعلكم تفلحون
2672.en: Believers, bow down and prostrate yourselves before Your Lord and serve Your Lord and do good that you may prosper.

2673.arabic: وجهدوا فى الله حق جهاده هو اجتبىكم وما جعل عليكم فى الدين من حرج ملة ابيكم ابرهيم هو سمىكم المسلمين من قبل وفى هذا ليكون الرسول شهيدا عليكم وتكونوا شهدا على الناس فاقيموا الصلوة واتوا الزكوة واعتصموا بالله هو مولىكم فنعم المولى ونعم النصير
2673.en: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!

2674.en: The believers have indeed attained true success:

2675.en: those who, in their Prayers, humble themselves;

2676.en: who avoid whatever is vain and frivolous;

2678.en: who strictly guard their private parts

2679.arabic: الا على ازوجهم او ما ملكت ايمنهم فانهم غير ملومين
2679.en: save from their wives, or those whom their right hands possess; for with regard to them they are free from blame "

2680.arabic: فمن ابتغى ورا ذلك فاولئك هم العادون
2680.en: As for those who seek beyond that, they are transgressors"

2681.en: who are true to their trusts and their covenants,

2684.arabic: الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خلدون
2684.en: that shall inherit Paradise; and in it they shall abide for ever.

2685.arabic: ولقد خلقنا الانسن من سللة من طين
2685.en: We created man out of the extract of clay,

2686.arabic: ثم جعلنه نطفة فى قرار مكين
2686.en: then We made him into a drop of life#germ, then We placed it in a safe depository,

2687.arabic: ثم خلقنا النطفة علقة فخلقنا العلقة مضغة فخلقنا المضغة عظما فكسونا العظم لحما ثم انشانه خلقا اخر فتبارك الله احسن الخلقين
2687.en: then We made this drop into a clot, then We made the clot into a lump, then We made the lump into bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh, and then We caused it to grow into another creation. Thus Most Blessed is Allah, the Best of all those that create.

2688.en: Thereafter you are destined to die,

2689.en: and then on the Day of Resurrection you shall certainly be raised up.

2690.arabic: ولقد خلقنا فوقكم سبع طرائق وما كنا عن الخلق غفلين
2690.en: We have indeed fashioned above you seven paths. Never were We unaware of the task of creation.

2691.arabic: وانزلنا من السما ماۢ بقدر فاسكنه فى الارض وانا على ذهابۭ به لقدرون
2691.en: We sent down water from the sky in right measure, and caused it to stay in the earth, and We have the power to cause it to vanish (in the manner We please).

2692.arabic: فانشانا لكم به جنت من نخيل واعنب لكم فيها فوكه كثيرة ومنها تاكلون
2692.en: Then through water We caused gardens of date#palms and vines to grow for you wherein you have an abundance of delicious fruits and from them you derive your livelihood.

2693.arabic: وشجرة تخرج من طور سينا تنبت بالدهن وصبغ للاكلين
2693.en: And We also produced the tree which springs forth from Mount Sinai, containing oil and sauce for those that eat.

2694.arabic: وان لكم فى الانعم لعبرة نسقيكم مما فى بطونها ولكم فيها منفع كثيرة ومنها تاكلون
2694.en: And indeed there is also a lesson for you in cattle. We provide you with drink out of what they have in their bellies; and you have many other benefits in them: you eat of them,

2695.en: and are carried on them and also on ships.

2696.arabic: ولقد ارسلنا نوحا الى قومه فقال يقوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من اله غيره افلا تتقون
2696.en: We sent Noah to his people, and he said: "My people! Serve Allah; you have no deity other than He. Do you have no fear?"

2697.arabic: فقال الملؤا الذين كفروا من قومه ما هذا الا بشر مثلكم يريد ان يتفضل عليكم ولو شا الله لانزل ملئكة ما سمعنا بهذا فى ابائنا الاولين
2697.en: But the notables among his people had refused to believe, and said: "This is none other than a mortal like yourselves who desires to attain superiority over you. Had Allah wanted (to send any Messengers) He would have sent down angels. We have heard nothing like this in the time of our forebears of old (that humans were sent as Messengers).

2698.arabic: ان هو الا رجل به جنة فتربصوا به حتى حين
2698.en: He is a person who has been seized with a little madness; so wait for a while (perhaps he will improve)."

2699.en: Noah said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusation that I am lying."

2700.arabic: فاوحينا اليه ان اصنع الفلك باعيننا ووحينا فاذا جا امرنا وفار التنور فاسلك فيها من كل زوجين اثنين واهلك الا من سبق عليه القول منهم ولا تخطبنى فى الذين ظلموا انهم مغرقون
2700.en: Thereupon We revealed to him, saying: "Build the Ark under Our eyes and according to Our revelation. And when Our command comes to pass and the oven boils over, take on board a pair each from every species, and also take your household except those of them against whom sentence has already been passed and do not plead to Me on behalf of the wrong#doers. They are doomed to be drowned.

2701.arabic: فاذا استويت انت ومن معك على الفلك فقل الحمد لله الذى نجىنا من القوم الظلمين
2701.en: And then when you and those accompanying you are firmly seated in the Ark, say: "Thanks be to Allah Who has delivered us from the wrong#doing people."

2702.arabic: وقل رب انزلنى منزلا مباركا وانت خير المنزلين
2702.en: And say: "My Lord! Make my landing a blessed landing, for You are the Best of those Who can cause people to land in safety."

2703.arabic: ان فى ذلك لايت وان كنا لمبتلين
2703.en: There are great Signs in this story; and surely We do put people to test.

2704.arabic: ثم انشانا من بعدهم قرنا اخرين
2704.en: Then, after them, We brought forth another generation;

2705.arabic: فارسلنا فيهم رسولا منهم ان اعبدوا الله ما لكم من اله غيره افلا تتقون
2705.en: and We sent among them a Messenger from among themselves, saying: "Serve Allah; you have no god other than He. Do you have no fear?"

2706.arabic: وقال الملا من قومه الذين كفروا وكذبوا بلقا الاخرة واترفنهم فى الحيوة الدنيا ما هذا الا بشر مثلكم ياكل مما تاكلون منه ويشرب مما تشربون
2706.en: The notables among his people who had refused to believe and who denied the meeting of the Hereafter, and those whom We had endowed with ease and comfort in this life, cried out: "This is no other than a mortal like yourselves who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink.

2707.arabic: ولئن اطعتم بشرا مثلكم انكم اذا لخسرون
2707.en: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you will certainly be losers.

2708.arabic: ايعدكم انكم اذا متم وكنتم ترابا وعظما انكم مخرجون
2708.en: Does he promise you that when you are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, you will be brought forth to life?

2709.en: Far#fetched, utterly far#fetched is what you are being promised.

2710.arabic: ان هى الا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما نحن بمبعوثين
2710.en: There is no other life than the life of the world. We shall live here and here shall we die; and we are not going to be raised again.

2711.arabic: ان هو الا رجل افترى على الله كذبا وما نحن له بمؤمنين
2711.en: This man has forged a mere lie in the name of Allah and we shall never believe what he says."

2712.en: The Messenger said: "My Lord! Come to my help at their accusing me of lying."

2713.en: He answered: "A short while, and they shall be repenting."

2714.arabic: فاخذتهم الصيحة بالحق فجعلنهم غثا فبعدا للقوم الظلمين
2714.en: Then a mighty blast quite justly overtook them, and We reduced them to a rubble. So away with the wrong#doing folk!

2715.arabic: ثم انشانا من بعدهم قرونا اخرين
2715.en: Then, after them, We brought forth other generations.

2716.arabic: ما تسبق من امة اجلها وما يستـخرون
2716.en: No nation can outstrip its term, nor can it put it back.

2717.arabic: ثم ارسلنا رسلنا تترا كل ما جا امة رسولها كذبوه فاتبعنا بعضهم بعضا وجعلنهم احاديث فبعدا لقوم لا يؤمنون
2717.en: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Whenever a Messenger came to his people they rejected him, calling him a liar. Thereupon, We made each people to follow the other (to its doom), reducing them to mere tales (of the past). Scourged be the people who do not believe!

2718.arabic: ثم ارسلنا موسى واخاه هرون بـايتنا وسلطن مبين
2718.en: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our Signs and a clear authority

2719.arabic: الى فرعون وملاي۟ه فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما عالين
2719.en: to Pharaoh and to his chiefs, but they behaved superciliously and they were haughty.

2720.arabic: فقالوا انؤمن لبشرين مثلنا وقومهما لنا عبدون
2720.en: They said: "Shall we put faith in two mortals like ourselves when their people are slaves to us?"

2721.en: So they rejected them, calling them liars, and they too eventually became of those that were destroyed.

2722.arabic: ولقد اتينا موسى الكتب لعلهم يهتدون
2722.en: And We gave Moses the Book that people might be guided by it.

2723.arabic: وجعلنا ابن مريم وامه اية واوينهما الى ربوة ذات قرار ومعين
2723.en: And We made Mary's son, and his mother, a Sign, and We gave them refuge on a lofty ground, a peaceful site with springs flowing in it.

2724.arabic: يايها الرسل كلوا من الطيبت واعملوا صلحا انى بما تعملون عليم
2724.en: Messengers! Partake of the things that are clean, and act righteously. I know well all that you do.

2725.arabic: وان هذه امتكم امة وحدة وانا ربكم فاتقون
2725.en: This community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so hold Me alone in fear.

2726.arabic: فتقطعوا امرهم بينهم زبرا كل حزبۭ بما لديهم فرحون
2726.en: But people later cut up their religion into bits, each group rejoicing in what they have.

2727.en: So leave them immersed in their heedlessness till an appointed time.

2728.arabic: ايحسبون انما نمدهم به من مال وبنين
2728.en: Do they fancy that Our continuing to give them wealth and children (means) that

2729.arabic: نسارع لهم فى الخيرت بل لا يشعرون
2729.en: We are busy lavishing on them all kinds of good? Nay, they do not perceive the reality of the matter.

2730.arabic: ان الذين هم من خشية ربهم مشفقون
2730.en: Surely those who stand in awe for fear of their Lord,

2731.en: who have full faith in the Signs of their Lord;

2732.en: who associate none with their Lord in His Divinity,

2733.arabic: والذين يؤتون ما اتوا وقلوبهم وجلة انهم الى ربهم رجعون
2733.en: who give, whatever they give in charity, with their hearts trembling at the thought that they are destined to return to their Lord;

2734.arabic: اولئك يسرعون فى الخيرت وهم لها سبقون
2734.en: it is these who hasten to do good works and vie in so doing with one another.

2735.arabic: ولا نكلف نفسا الا وسعها ولدينا كتب ينطق بالحق وهم لا يظلمون
2735.en: We do not lay a burden on anyone beyond his capacity. We have a Book with Us that speaks the truth (about everyone); and they shall in no wise be wronged.

2736.arabic: بل قلوبهم فى غمرة من هذا ولهم اعمل من دون ذلك هم لها عملون
2736.en: Nay, their hearts are lost in ignorance of all this; and their deeds too vary from the way (mentioned above). They will persist in these deeds

2737.arabic: حتى اذا اخذنا مترفيهم بالعذاب اذا هم يجـرون
2737.en: until We seize with Our chastisement those of them that are given to luxuriant ways. They will then begin to groan.

2738.arabic: لا تجـروا اليوم انكم منا لا تنصرون
2738.en: "Put a stop to your groaning now! Surely no help shall be provided to you from Us.

2739.arabic: قد كانت ايتى تتلى عليكم فكنتم على اعقبكم تنكصون
2739.en: My Signs were rehearsed to you and you turned back on your heels and took to flight,

2740.en: behaving arrogantly, and making fun, and talking nonsense (about the Book in your nightly chats)."

2741.arabic: افلم يدبروا القول ام جاهم ما لم يات اباهم الاولين
2741.en: Did they never ponder over this Word (of God)? Or has he (to wit, the Messenger) brought something the like of which did not come to their forefathers of yore?

2742.arabic: ام لم يعرفوا رسولهم فهم له منكرون
2742.en: Or is it that they were unaware of their Messenger and were therefore repelled by him for he was a stranger to them?

2743.arabic: ام يقولون به جنة بل جاهم بالحق واكثرهم للحق كرهون
2743.en: Or do they say that there is madness in him? Nay, he has brought them the Truth and it is the Truth that most of them disdain.

2744.arabic: ولو اتبع الحق اهواهم لفسدت السموت والارض ومن فيهن بل اتينهم بذكرهم فهم عن ذكرهم معرضون
2744.en: Were the Truth to follow their desires, the order of the heavens and the earth and those who dwell in them would have been ruined. Nay, the fact is that We have brought to them their own remembrance; and yet it is from their own remembrance that they are turning away.

2745.arabic: ام تسـلهم خرجا فخراج ربك خير وهو خير الرزقين
2745.en: Are you asking them for something? What Allah has given you is the best. He is the Best of providers.

2746.en: You are calling them to a Straight Way,

2747.arabic: وان الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة عن الصرط لنكبون
2747.en: but those who do not believe in the Hereafter are ever prone to deviate from the Right Way.

2748.arabic: ولو رحمنهم وكشفنا ما بهم من ضر للجوا فى طغينهم يعمهون
2748.en: Were We to be merciful to them and remove from them their present afflictions, they would persist in their transgression, blindly wandering on.

2749.arabic: ولقد اخذنهم بالعذاب فما استكانوا لربهم وما يتضرعون
2749.en: (They are such) that We seized them with chastisement (and yet) they did not humble themselves before their Lord, nor do they entreat

2750.arabic: حتى اذا فتحنا عليهم بابا ذا عذاب شديد اذا هم فيه مبلسون
2750.en: until We opened upon them the door of a severe chastisement. Then lo, in this state they become utterly despaired of any good.

2751.arabic: وهو الذى انشا لكم السمع والابصر والافـدة قليلا ما تشكرون
2751.en: It is He Who has endowed you with the faculties of hearing and sight and has given you hearts (to think). Scarcely do you give thanks.

2752.arabic: وهو الذى ذراكم فى الارض واليه تحشرون
2752.en: It is He Who has dispersed you all around the earth, and it is unto Him that you shall all be mustered.

2753.arabic: وهو الذى يحى ويميت وله اختلف اليل والنهار افلا تعقلون
2753.en: It is He Who gives life and causes death, and He holds mastery over the alternation of night and day. Do you not understand this?

2754.arabic: بل قالوا مثل ما قال الاولون
2754.en: Nay, but they say the like of what their predecessors of yore had said.

2755.arabic: قالوا اذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظما انا لمبعوثون
2755.en: They say: "Is it that when we are dead and have been reduced to dust and bones, shall we then be raised up again?

2756.arabic: لقد وعدنا نحن واباؤنا هذا من قبل ان هذا الا اسطير الاولين
2756.en: We were promised such things and so were our forefathers before us. All these are no more than tales of the past."

2757.arabic: قل لمن الارض ومن فيها ان كنتم تعلمون
2757.en: Ask them: "Whose is the earth and those who are in it? Tell us if you know"

2758.en: They will surely say: "Allah's." Say: "Then why do you not take heed?"

2759.arabic: قل من رب السموت السبع ورب العرش العظيم
2759.en: Ask them: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens, the Lord of the Great Throne?"

2760.en: They will surely say: "Allah." Say: "Will you not, then, fear (Allah)?"

2761.arabic: قل من بيده ملكوت كل شى وهو يجير ولا يجار عليه ان كنتم تعلمون
2761.en: Ask them: "Say, if you indeed know, to whom belongs the dominion over all things; (Who is it) that grants asylum, but against Whom no asylum is available?"

2762.en: They will surely say: "(The dominion over all things) belongs to Allah." Say: "Whence are you then deluded?"

2763.en: We have brought before them the Truth, and there is no doubt that they are lying.

2764.arabic: ما اتخذ الله من ولد وما كان معه من اله اذا لذهب كل الهۭ بما خلق ولعلا بعضهم على بعض سبحن الله عما يصفون
2764.en: Never did Allah take unto Himself any son, nor is there any god other than He. (Had there been any other gods) each god would have taken his creatures away with him, and each would have rushed to overpower the other. Glory be to Allah from all that they characterize Him with!

2765.arabic: علم الغيب والشهدة فتعلى عما يشركون
2765.en: He knows both what is visible and what is not visible. Exalted is Allah above all that they associate with Him.

2766.arabic: قل رب اما ترينى ما يوعدون
2766.en: Pray, (O Muhammad): "My Lord, if You should bring the scourge of which they had been warned in my presence,

2767.arabic: رب فلا تجعلنى فى القوم الظلمين
2767.en: then do not include me, my Lord, among these wrong#doing people."

2768.arabic: وانا على ان نريك ما نعدهم لقدرون
2768.en: Surely We are able to show you what We warn them against.

2769.arabic: ادفع بالتى هى احسن السيئة نحن اعلم بما يصفون
2769.en: (O Muhammad)! Repel evil in the best manner. We are well aware of all that they say about you.

2770.arabic: وقل رب اعوذ بك من همزت الشيطين
2770.en: And pray: "My Lord! I seek Your refuge from the suggestions of the evil ones;

2771.en: I even seek Your refuge, my Lord, lest they should approach me."

2772.arabic: حتى اذا جا احدهم الموت قال رب ارجعون
2772.en: (They shall persist in their deeds) until when death comes to anyone of them he will say: "My Lord, send me back to the world

2773.arabic: لعلى اعمل صلحا فيما تركت كلا انها كلمة هو قائلها ومن ورائهم برزخ الى يوم يبعثون
2773.en: that I have left behind. I am likely to do good." Nay, it is merely a word that he is uttering. There is a barrier behind all of them (who are dead) until the Day when they will be raised up.

2774.arabic: فاذا نفخ فى الصور فلا انساب بينهم يومئذ ولا يتسالون
2774.en: And then no sooner the Trumpet is blown than there will remain no kinship among them that Day, nor will they ask one another.

2775.arabic: فمن ثقلت موزينه فاولئك هم المفلحون
2775.en: It will be an Hour when those whose scales are heavy, they alone will attain success;

2776.arabic: ومن خفت موزينه فاولئك الذين خسروا انفسهم فى جهنم خلدون
2776.en: and those whose scales are light, those will be the ones who will have courted loss. They will abide in Hell.

2777.arabic: تلفح وجوههم النار وهم فيها كلحون
2777.en: The Fire shall scorch their faces, exposing their jaws.

2778.arabic: الم تكن ايتى تتلى عليكم فكنتم بها تكذبون
2778.en: "Are you not those to whom My revelations were recited, and you dubbed them as lies?"

2779.arabic: قالوا ربنا غلبت علينا شقوتنا وكنا قوما ضالين
2779.en: They will say: "Our Lord! Our misfortune prevailed over us. We were indeed an erring people.

2780.arabic: ربنا اخرجنا منها فان عدنا فانا ظلمون
2780.en: Our Lord! Take us out of this. Then if we revert (to evil#doing) we shall indeed be wrongdoers."

2781.en: Allah will say: "Away from Me; stay where you are and do not address Me.

2782.arabic: انه كان فريق من عبادى يقولون ربنا امنا فاغفر لنا وارحمنا وانت خير الرحمين
2782.en: You are those that when a party of My servants said: 'Our Lord, we believe, so forgive us, and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those that are merciful,'

2783.arabic: فاتخذتموهم سخريا حتى انسوكم ذكرى وكنتم منهم تضحكون
2783.en: you made a laughingstock of them and your hostility to them caused you to forget Me, and you simply kept laughing.

2784.arabic: انى جزيتهم اليوم بما صبروا انهم هم الفائزون
2784.en: Lo! I have rewarded them this Day for their steadfastness, so that they, and they alone, are triumphant."

2785.arabic: قل كم لبثتم فى الارض عدد سنين
2785.en: Then Allah will ask them: "For how many years did you stay on earth?"

2786.arabic: قالوا لبثنا يوما او بعض يوم فسـل العادين
2786.en: They will say: "We stayed for a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep count of this."

2787.arabic: قل ان لبثتم الا قليلا لو انكم كنتم تعلمون
2787.en: He will say: "You stayed only for a while, if you only knew that.

2788.arabic: افحسبتم انما خلقنكم عبثا وانكم الينا لا ترجعون
2788.en: Did you imagine that We created you without any purpose, and that you will not be brought back to Us?"

2789.arabic: فتعلى الله الملك الحق لا اله الا هو رب العرش الكريم
2789.en: So, exalted be Allah, the True King! There is no god but He, the Lord of the Great Throne.

2790.arabic: ومن يدع مع الله الها اخر لا برهن له به فانما حسابه عند ربه انه لا يفلح الكفرون
2790.en: He who invokes any other god along with Allah " one for whom he has no evidence" his reckoning is with his Lord alone. Indeed, these unbelievers shall not prosper.

2791.arabic: وقل رب اغفر وارحم وانت خير الرحمين
2791.en: And say, (O Muhammad): "My Lord, forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the Best of those that are merciful."

2792.arabic: سورة انزلنها وفرضنها وانزلنا فيها ايت بينت لعلكم تذكرون
2792.en: This is a Surah which We have sent down and We have made it mandatory, and We have sent down clear Commandments in it so that you may learn lessons.

2793.arabic: الزانية والزانى فاجلدوا كل وحد منهما مائة جلدة ولا تاخذكم بهما رافة فى دين الله ان كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الاخر وليشهد عذابهما طائفة من المؤمنين
2793.en: The woman and the man guilty of fornication, flog each one of them with a hundred stripes # and let not any pity for them restrain you in regard to a matter prescribed by Allah, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day, and let, some of the believers witness the punishment inflicted on them.

2794.arabic: الزانى لا ينكح الا زانية او مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها الا زان او مشرك وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين
2794.en: A man guilty of adultery (or fornication) shall not marry any but the woman guilty of the same or a mushrik woman, and none shall marry a woman guilty of adultery (or fornication) but the man guilty of the same or a mushrik man: such marriages are forbidden to true believers.

2795.arabic: والذين يرمون المحصنت ثم لم ياتوا باربعة شهدا فاجلدوهم ثمنين جلدة ولا تقبلوا لهم شهدة ابدا واولئك هم الفسقون
2795.en: As for those persons who charge chaste women with false accusations but do not produce four witnesses, flog them with eighty stripes and never accept their evidence afterwards, for they themselves are transgressors,

2796.arabic: الا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك واصلحوا فان الله غفور رحيم
2796.en: except those who repent and reform themselves; Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

2797.arabic: والذين يرمون ازوجهم ولم يكن لهم شهدا الا انفسهم فشهدة احدهم اربع شهدت بالله انه لمن الصدقين
2797.en: As for those who accuse their own wives but have no witness except themselves, the evidence of one of them is that he shall swear four times by Allah and declare that he is true (in his charge).

2798.arabic: والخمسة ان لعنت الله عليه ان كان من الكذبين
2798.en: Then the fifth time he shall declare that Allah's curse be upon him if he be false (in his charge).

2799.arabic: ويدرؤا عنها العذاب ان تشهد اربع شهدت بالله انه لمن الكذبين
2799.en: (As for the woman), it shall avert the punishment from her if she swears four times by Allah that the man is false (in his charge)

2800.arabic: والخمسة ان غضب الله عليها ان كان من الصدقين
2800.en: and the fifth time she invokes Allah's wrath upon herself, if he be true (in his charge).

2801.arabic: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وان الله تواب حكيم
2801.en: If Allah had not shown you His grace and mercy and if Allah had not been most Forgiving and All#Wise, (you would have been in a great fix because of accusing your wives).

2802.arabic: ان الذين جاو بالافك عصبة منكم لا تحسبوه شرا لكم بل هو خير لكم لكل امرئ منهم ما اكتسب من الاثم والذى تولى كبره منهم له عذاب عظيم
2802.en: Those who have invented the slander, are some of your own people. You should not, however, regard this matter as evil for it has good in it for you. Whoso took any part in this, he earned his share of the sin accordingly, and the one, who had the greatest share of responsibility in it, shall have a terrible punishment.

2803.arabic: لولا اذ سمعتموه ظن المؤمنون والمؤمنت بانفسهم خيرا وقالوا هذا افك مبين
2803.en: When you heard of it, why didn't the Believing men and the Believing women have a good opinion of themselves, and why did they not say, "This is a manifest slander?"

2804.arabic: لولا جاو عليه باربعة شهدا فاذ لم ياتوا بالشهدا فاولئك عند الله هم الكذبون
2804.en: Why did the slanderers not bring four witnesses (to prove their charge)? Now that they have not brought witnesses, they themselves are liars in the sight of Allah.

2805.arabic: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته فى الدنيا والاخرة لمسكم فى ما افضتم فيه عذاب عظيم
2805.en: Were it not for Allah's grace and mercy towards you in this world and in the Hereafter, a painful scourge would have visited you because of the things in which you were involved.

2806.arabic: اذ تلقونه بالسنتكم وتقولون بافواهكم ما ليس لكم به علم وتحسبونه هينا وهو عند الله عظيم
2806.en: (Just think how erroneous you were,) when you passed this lie on from one tongue to the other and uttered with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge. You took it as a trifling matter whereas it was a grave offence in the sight of Allah.

2807.arabic: ولولا اذ سمعتموه قلتم ما يكون لنا ان نتكلم بهذا سبحنك هذا بهتن عظيم
2807.en: Why did you not, as soon as you heard of it, say, "It is not proper for us to utter such a thing? Glory be to Allah! This is a great slander."

2808.arabic: يعظكم الله ان تعودوا لمثله ابدا ان كنتم مؤمنين
2808.en: Allah admonishes you that in future you should never repeat a thing like this, if you are true Believers.

2809.arabic: ويبين الله لكم الايت والله عليم حكيم
2809.en: Allah makes His Revelations clear to you, and He is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

2810.arabic: ان الذين يحبون ان تشيع الفحشة فى الذين امنوا لهم عذاب اليم فى الدنيا والاخرة والله يعلم وانتم لا تعلمون
2810.en: As for those, who like that indecency should spread among the Believers, they deserve a painful punishment in this world and in the Hereafter, for Allah knows and you do not know (its consequences).

2811.arabic: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وان الله روف رحيم
2811.en: If Allah had not shown His grace and mercy to you, (this scandal would have produced very evil results): Allah is indeed very Kind and Merciful.

2812.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا تتبعوا خطوت الشيطن ومن يتبع خطوت الشيطن فانه يامر بالفحشا والمنكر ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته ما زكى منكم من احد ابدا ولكن الله يزكى من يشا والله سميع عليم
2812.en: O Believers, do not follow in Satan's footsteps, for he will incite to indecency and wickedness any who will follow him. If Allah had not shown His Brace and mercy to you, none of you would have been able to cleanse yourself, for it is Allah alone Who cleanses whom He wills, and Allah is All#Hearing, All#Knowing.

2813.arabic: ولا ياتل اولوا الفضل منكم والسعة ان يؤتوا اولى القربى والمسكين والمهجرين فى سبيل الله وليعفوا وليصفحوا الا تحبون ان يغفر الله لكم والله غفور رحيم
2813.en: Those among you, who are bountiful and persons of means, should not swear on oath that they would withhold their help from their relatives, the indigent and those who have left their homes for the cause of Allah: they should forgive and forbear. Do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

2814.arabic: ان الذين يرمون المحصنت الغفلت المؤمنت لعنوا فى الدنيا والاخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم
2814.en: Those who charge with slander those Believing women, who are chaste but simple souls, are accursed in this world and in the Hereafter: there is a great punishment for them.

2815.arabic: يوم تشهد عليهم السنتهم وايديهم وارجلهم بما كانوا يعملون
2815.en: They should not forget the Day when their own tongues and their own hands and test will bear testimony in regard to their misdeeds.

2816.arabic: يومئذ يوفيهم الله دينهم الحق ويعلمون ان الله هو الحق المبين
2816.en: On that Day Allah will give them the full recompense they deserve, and they will realize that Allah is the very Truth, Who makes the Truth manifest.

2817.arabic: الخبيثت للخبيثين والخبيثون للخبيثت والطيبت للطيبين والطيبون للطيبت اولئك مبرون مما يقولون لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم
2817.en: Impure women are for impure men and impure men for impure women, and pure women are for pure men and pure men for pure women. They are free from those scandals which the slanderers utter. There is forgiveness for them and honourable provision.

2818.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستانسوا وتسلموا على اهلها ذلكم خير لكم لعلكم تذكرون
2818.en: O Believers, do not enter other houses than your own until you have the approval of the inmates and have wished them peace; this is the best way for you: it is expected that you will observe it.

2819.arabic: فان لم تجدوا فيها احدا فلا تدخلوها حتى يؤذن لكم وان قيل لكم ارجعوا فارجعوا هو ازكى لكم والله بما تعملون عليم
2819.en: Then, if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter until you have been given permission, and if you are told to go back, you should go back. This is a purer way for you; and Allah has full knowledge of what you do.

2820.arabic: ليس عليكم جناح ان تدخلوا بيوتا غير مسكونة فيها متع لكم والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون
2820.en: There is, however, no harm if you enter houses which are not dwelling places, but contain something useful for you; Allah knows what you disclose and what you conceal.

2821.arabic: قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من ابصرهم ويحفظوا فروجهم ذلك ازكى لهم ان الله خبيرۢ بما يصنعون
2821.en: And O Prophet, enjoin the Believing men to restrain their gaze and guard their private parts. This is a more righteous way for them: Allah has knowledge of what they do.

2822.arabic: وقل للمؤمنت يغضضن من ابصرهن ويحفظن فروجهن ولا يبدين زينتهن الا ما ظهر منها وليضربن بخمرهن على جيوبهن ولا يبدين زينتهن الا لبعولتهن او ابائهن او ابا بعولتهن او ابنائهن او ابنا بعولتهن او اخونهن او بنى اخونهن او بنى اخوتهن او نسائهن او ما ملكت ايمنهن او التبعين غير اولى الاربة من الرجال او الطفل الذين لم يظهروا على عورت النسا ولا يضربن بارجلهن ليعلم ما يخفين من زينتهن وتوبوا الى الله جميعا ايه المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون
2822.en: O Prophet, enjoin the Believing women to restrain their gaze and guard their private parts. and not to display their adornment except that which is displayed of itself, and to draw their veils over their bosoms and not to display their adornment except before their husbands, their fathers, the fathers of their husbands, their sons and the sons of their husbands (from other wives), their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their female associates and those in their possession and male attendants incapable of sex desire and those boys who have not yet attained knowledge of sex matters concerning women; also forbid them to stamp their feet on the ground lest their hidden ornaments should be displayed. O Believers, turn all together towards Allah: it is expected that you will attain true success.

2823.arabic: وانكحوا الايمى منكم والصلحين من عبادكم وامائكم ان يكونوا فقرا يغنهم الله من فضله والله وسع عليم
2823.en: Arrange marriages between the single men and women among your and between your slave men and slave women, who are righteous,, if they be indigent, Allah will provide means for them out of His bounty: Allah has boundless resources and He is AllKnowing.

2824.arabic: وليستعفف الذين لا يجدون نكاحا حتى يغنيهم الله من فضله والذين يبتغون الكتب مما ملكت ايمنكم فكاتبوهم ان علمتم فيهم خيرا واتوهم من مال الله الذى اتىكم ولا تكرهوا فتيتكم على البغا ان اردن تحصنا لتبتغوا عرض الحيوة الدنيا ومن يكرههن فان الله من بعد اكرههن غفور رحيم
2824.en: And those, who cannot find a match, should observe continence till Allah provides them with means out of His bounty And if those who are in your possession, ask for a deed of emancipation, execute the deed of emancipation with them, provided that you find some good in them; and give them something out of the means Allah has given you. And do not force your slave#girls into prostitution for your own worldly gains when they themselves want to keep chaste; and if anyone forces them into it, after such a compulsion Allah will be forgiving and merciful for them.

2825.arabic: ولقد انزلنا اليكم ايت مبينت ومثلا من الذين خلوا من قبلكم وموعظة للمتقين
2825.en: We have sent down to you Revelations giving clear guidance and cited examples of the peoples who went before you to serve as warning and We have imparted admonitions for the God#fearing.

2826.arabic: الله نور السموت والارض مثل نوره كمشكوة فيها مصباح المصباح فى زجاجة الزجاجة كانها كوكب درى يوقد من شجرة مبركة زيتونة لا شرقية ولا غربية يكاد زيتها يضى ولو لم تمسسه نار نور على نور يهدى الله لنوره من يشا ويضرب الله الامثل للناس والله بكل شى عليم
2826.en: Allah is the light of the heavens and the earth: His light (in the universe) may be likened (to the light of) a lamp in a niche: the lamp is in a glass shade: the glass shade is like a glittering star and lamp is lit with the olive oil of a blessed tree which is neither eastern nor western: its oil is (so fine) as if it were going to shine forth by itself though no fire touched it (as though all the means of increasing) light upon light (were provided); Allah guides to His light whomever He wills. He cites parables to make the Message clear to the people; He has perfect knowledge of everything.

2827.arabic: فى بيوت اذن الله ان ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه يسبح له فيها بالغدو والاصال
2827.en: (Those who obtain guidance to His light are found) in the houses which He has enjoined to raise up and to mention His name therein. In them such people glorify Him morning and evening

2828.arabic: رجال لا تلهيهم تجرة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله واقام الصلوة وايتا الزكوة يخافون يوما تتقلب فيه القلوب والابصر
2828.en: as are not diverted by trade and merchandise from remembering Him and from establishing Salat and paying Zakat, for they fear the Day when the hearts will be overturned and the eyes will become petrified.

2829.arabic: ليجزيهم الله احسن ما عملوا ويزيدهم من فضله والله يرزق من يشا بغير حساب
2829.en: (And they behave like this) so that Allah may reward them for their excellent deeds and, in addition to it, show His favour to them out of His bounty: Allah provides without stint for anyone He pleases.

2830.arabic: والذين كفروا اعملهم كسرابۭ بقيعة يحسبه الظمـان ما حتى اذا جاه لم يجده شيـا ووجد الله عنده فوفىه حسابه والله سريع الحساب
2830.en: (On the other hand,) the deeds of those who disbelieved, maybe likened to a mirage in a waterless desert, which the thirsty one took for water; but when he reached there he found nothing to drink; nay, he found there Allah Who settled his full account, and Allah is very swift at reckoning.

2831.arabic: او كظلمت فى بحر لجى يغشىه موج من فوقه موج من فوقه سحاب ظلمتۢ بعضها فوق بعض اذا اخرج يده لم يكد يرىها ومن لم يجعل الله له نورا فما له من نور
2831.en: Or (their efforts may be likened to those of a man trying to swim in) a deep dark ocean, covered with billows, one over the other, and above it a cloud: darkness upon darkness: so much so that if he stretches out his hand, he cannot see it. There is no light for the one whom Allah does not give light.

2832.arabic: الم تر ان الله يسبح له من فى السموت والارض والطير صفت كل قد علم صلاته وتسبيحه والله عليمۢ بما يفعلون
2832.en: Do you not observe that all those who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds with outspread wings, glorify Allah? Each one knows the mode of its prayer and glorification, and Allah has full knowledge of all they do.

2833.arabic: ولله ملك السموت والارض والى الله المصير
2833.en: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and all shall have to return to Him.

2834.arabic: الم تر ان الله يزجى سحابا ثم يؤلف بينه ثم يجعله ركاما فترى الودق يخرج من خلله وينزل من السما من جبال فيها من برد فيصيب به من يشا ويصرفه عن من يشا يكاد سنا برقه يذهب بالابصر
2834.en: Do you not observe that Allah makes the cloud move gently then joins its pieces together: then gathers it into a mass of thick cloud: then you see that rain#drops fall down from its midst: and He sends down hail out of the high up mountains in the heaven: then He smites with it whom He wills and turns it away from whom He pleases: then a flash of lightning from it dazzles the eyes.

2835.arabic: يقلب الله اليل والنهار ان فى ذلك لعبرة لاولى الابصر
2835.en: He alternates the day and the night: there is indeed a lesson in it for those who have observing eyes.

2836.arabic: والله خلق كل دابة من ما فمنهم من يمشى على بطنه ومنهم من يمشى على رجلين ومنهم من يمشى على اربع يخلق الله ما يشا ان الله على كل شى قدير
2836.en: And Allah created every creature from a sort of water: of them some one crawls upon its belly: another walks on two legs and still another on four; Allah creates whatever He wills for He has power over everything

2837.arabic: لقد انزلنا ايت مبينت والله يهدى من يشا الى صرط مستقيم
2837.en: We have sent down Revelations that make the reality quite plain; however, Allah guides to the straight path whomsoever He pleases.

2838.arabic: ويقولون امنا بالله وبالرسول واطعنا ثم يتولى فريق منهم من بعد ذلك وما اولئك بالمؤمنين
2838.en: These people say "We have believed in Allah and the Messenger and we have submitted"; but soon after this, some of them turn away (from obedience): such people are not true Believers.

2839.arabic: واذا دعوا الى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم اذا فريق منهم معرضون
2839.en: When they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, a party of them turns away.

2840.arabic: وان يكن لهم الحق ياتوا اليه مذعنين
2840.en: However, if the truth be on their side, they come towards the Messenger in all obedience.

2841.arabic: افى قلوبهم مرض ام ارتابوا ام يخافون ان يحيف الله عليهم ورسوله بل اولئك هم الظلمون
2841.en: Are their hearts afflicted with the disease (of hypocrisy)? Or, are they in doubt? Or, do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, they themselves are unjust.

2842.arabic: انما كان قول المؤمنين اذا دعوا الى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم ان يقولوا سمعنا واطعنا واولئك هم المفلحون
2842.en: As regards the Believers, when they are called towards Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, they say, "We have heard and obeyed"; such are the people who attain true success,

2843.arabic: ومن يطع الله ورسوله ويخش الله ويتقه فاولئك هم الفائزون
2843.en: and only those attain true success who obey Allah and His Messenger and fear Allah and refrain from His disobedience.

2844.arabic: واقسموا بالله جهد ايمنهم لئن امرتهم ليخرجن قل لا تقسموا طاعة معروفة ان الله خبيرۢ بما تعملون
2844.en: They (the hypocrites) solemnly swear by Allah and say, "If you order us, we will leave our homes." Say to them, "Do not swear oaths for your \`obedience' is well known; Allah is fully aware of what you are doing. "

2845.arabic: قل اطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول فان تولوا فانما عليه ما حمل وعليكم ما حملتم وان تطيعوه تهتدوا وما على الرسول الا البلغ المبين
2845.en: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, you should note it well that the Messenger is responsible for the duty entrusted to him and you are responsible for the duty entrusted to you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, for the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the Message clearly to you.

2846.arabic: وعد الله الذين امنوا منكم وعملوا الصلحت ليستخلفنهم فى الارض كما استخلف الذين من قبلهم وليمكنن لهم دينهم الذى ارتضى لهم وليبدلنهم من بعد خوفهم امنا يعبدوننى لا يشركون بى شيـا ومن كفر بعد ذلك فاولئك هم الفسقون
2846.en: Allah has promised to those among you who believe and do righteous deeds, that He will make them successors in the land just as He made those who passed away before them, and that He will establish their religion, which He has approved for them, on strong foundations and will change their (present) state of fear into peace and security. Let them worship Me and associate none with Me; and the one who disbelieves after this," shall be of those who are perverse transgressors.

2847.arabic: واقيموا الصلوة واتوا الزكوة واطيعوا الرسول لعلكم ترحمون
2847.en: Therefore, establish Salat, pay the Zakat dues and obey the Messenger; it is expected that you will be shown mercy.

2848.arabic: لا تحسبن الذين كفروا معجزين فى الارض وماوىهم النار ولبئس المصير
2848.en: Do not think about those who have disbelieved that they will be able to frustrate Allah in the land; their abode is Hell and it is a very evil abode.

2849.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا ليستـذنكم الذين ملكت ايمنكم والذين لم يبلغوا الحلم منكم ثلث مرت من قبل صلوة الفجر وحين تضعون ثيابكم من الظهيرة ومن بعد صلوة العشا ثلث عورت لكم ليس عليكم ولا عليهم جناحۢ بعدهن طوفون عليكم بعضكم على بعض كذلك يبين الله لكم الايت والله عليم حكيم
2849.en: O Believers, your slaves and those of your children, who have not yet become sex conscious, must ask your permission before coming in to see you on three occasions: before the Fajr Prayer and at noon when you put off your clothes and after the \`Isha' Prayer. These are your three times of privacy. There is no sin for you or for them if they come without permission at other times than these, for you have to visit: ne another over and over again. In this way Allah makes His Comm andments clear to you for He is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

2850.arabic: واذا بلغ الاطفل منكم الحلم فليستـذنوا كما استـذن الذين من قبلهم كذلك يبين الله لكم ايته والله عليم حكيم
2850.en: And when your children have grown sex conscious, they should receive your permission for this just as their elders get permission. In this way Allah makes His Revelations plain to you for He is All#Knowing, AllWise.

2851.arabic: والقوعد من النسا التى لا يرجون نكاحا فليس عليهن جناح ان يضعن ثيابهن غير متبرجتۭ بزينة وان يستعففن خير لهن والله سميع عليم
2851.en: There is no sin for such elderly women as are past the age of marriage, if they lay aside their outer graments provided that they do not mean to display their adornment. Nevertheless, if they behave modestly, it would be better for them: for Allah hears everything and knows everything.

2852.arabic: ليس على الاعمى حرج ولا على الاعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ولا على انفسكم ان تاكلوا من بيوتكم او بيوت ابائكم او بيوت امهتكم او بيوت اخونكم او بيوت اخوتكم او بيوت اعممكم او بيوت عمتكم او بيوت اخولكم او بيوت خلتكم او ما ملكتم مفاتحه او صديقكم ليس عليكم جناح ان تاكلوا جميعا او اشتاتا فاذا دخلتم بيوتا فسلموا على انفسكم تحية من عند الله مبركة طيبة كذلك يبين الله لكم الايت لعلكم تعقلون
2852.en: There is no harm if a blind or a lame or a sick person (takes a meal at another's house): nor is there any harm for yourselves if you take meals at your own houses or at the houses of your fathers and grandfathers or at the houses of your mothers and grandmothers or at your brothers' houses or at your sisters' houses or at the houses of your paternal uncles or at the houses of your paternal aunts or at the houses of your maternal uncles or at the houses of your maternal aunts or from the houses whose keys are in your possession or at the houses of your friends. There is no harm if you take your meals together or separately; however, when you enter the houses, you should send greetings of peace on your people, for the prayer of greetings prescribed by Allah is blessed and pure. Thus Allah makes His Revelation's clear to you. It is expected that you will use your common sense to grasp these.

2853.arabic: انما المؤمنون الذين امنوا بالله ورسوله واذا كانوا معه على امر جامع لم يذهبوا حتى يستـذنوه ان الذين يستـذنونك اولئك الذين يؤمنون بالله ورسوله فاذا استـذنوك لبعض شانهم فاذن لمن شئت منهم واستغفر لهم الله ان الله غفور رحيم
2853.en: True Believers are those who sincerely believe in Allah and His Messenger and who do not leave him without permission when they are with the Messenger for some common good; only those who ask your permission sincerely believe in Allah and His Messenger. Therefore, when they ask your permission for a private business, you may give permission to whomever you like, and ask Allah's forgiveness for such people: Allah is indeed Forgiving and Merciful.

2854.arabic: لا تجعلوا دعا الرسول بينكم كدعا بعضكم بعضا قد يعلم الله الذين يتسللون منكم لواذا فليحذر الذين يخالفون عن امره ان تصيبهم فتنة او يصيبهم عذاب اليم
2854.en: O Believers, do not consider the summoning by the Messenger like the summoning among you by one another. Allah knows well those of you who steal away, concealing themselves behind others. Let those who disobey the order of the Messenger beware lest they should be involved in some affliction, or are visited by a woeful scourge.

2855.arabic: الا ان لله ما فى السموت والارض قد يعلم ما انتم عليه ويوم يرجعون اليه فينبئهم بما عملوا والله بكل شى عليمۢ
2855.en: Beware! whatever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah. He knows whatever you are doing. On the Day you shall return to Him, He will let you know what you have. done: He has full knowledge of everything.

2856.arabic: تبارك الذى نزل الفرقان على عبده ليكون للعلمين نذيرا
2856.en: Highly blessed is He, Who has sent down Al#Furqan, to His servant so that it may be a warner to all mankind:

2857.arabic: الذى له ملك السموت والارض ولم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك فى الملك وخلق كل شى فقدره تقديرا
2857.en: He to Whom belongs the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth: Who has begotten no son: Who has no partner in His Sovereignty: Who created each and every thing and then ordained its destiny.

2858.arabic: واتخذوا من دونه الهة لا يخلقون شيـا وهم يخلقون ولا يملكون لانفسهم ضرا ولا نفعا ولا يملكون موتا ولا حيوة ولا نشورا
2858.en: Yet the people have set up, besides Him, deities, who do not create anything but are themselves created: who can neither harm nor help even themselves: who have no power over life or death, nor can they raise up the dead.

2859.arabic: وقال الذين كفروا ان هذا الا افك افترىه واعانه عليه قوم اخرون فقد جاو ظلما وزورا
2859.en: Those who have rejected the Message of the Prophet, say, "This (Al#Furgan) is a forgery which this man himself has devised, and some others have helped him at it. " What a cruel injustice and an impudent lie!

2860.arabic: وقالوا اسطير الاولين اكتتبها فهى تملى عليه بكرة واصيلا
2860.en: They say, "These things are the writings of the ancients which he has got copied down for himself, and then these are recited to him in the morning and evening.''

2861.arabic: قل انزله الذى يعلم السر فى السموت والارض انه كان غفورا رحيما
2861.en: O Muhammad, say to them, "This has been sent down by Him, Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth." The fact is that He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

2862.arabic: وقالوا مال هذا الرسول ياكل الطعام ويمشى فى الاسواق لولا انزل اليه ملك فيكون معه نذيرا
2862.en: They say, "What sort of a Messenger is he that he eats food and moves about in the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to accompany him and threaten (the disbelievers)?

2863.arabic: او يلقى اليه كنز او تكون له جنة ياكل منها وقال الظلمون ان تتبعون الا رجلا مسحورا
2863.en: Or why has not at least a treasure been sent down for him or a garden given to him for (easy) sustenance?" And the wicked people say, "You are following a man bewitched."

2864.arabic: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الامثل فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا
2864.en: Just see what strange arguments they bring forward with regard to you! They have gone so far astray that they cannot charge any thing against you.

2865.arabic: تبارك الذى ان شا جعل لك خيرا من ذلك جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر ويجعل لك قصورۢا
2865.en: Highly blessed is He, Who, if He wills, could give you much more and better things than what they propose for you: (Not one but) many gardens, beneath which rivers flow; and big castles:

2866.arabic: بل كذبوا بالساعة واعتدنا لمن كذب بالساعة سعيرا
2866.en: The fact of the matter is that these people have denied "the Hour", ##And for the one who denies the coming of the Hour, We have prepared a blazing Fire.

2867.arabic: اذا راتهم من مكانۭ بعيد سمعوا لها تغيظا وزفيرا
2867.en: When it will see them from afar, they will hear the sounds of its raging and roaring.

2868.arabic: واذا القوا منها مكانا ضيقا مقرنين دعوا هنالك ثبورا
2868.en: And when they are chained together and flung into a narrow space therein, they will begin to call for death.

2869.arabic: لا تدعوا اليوم ثبورا وحدا وادعوا ثبورا كثيرا
2869.en: (Then it will be said to them:) "Do not call for one death today, but call for many deaths."

2870.arabic: قل اذلك خير ام جنة الخلد التى وعد المتقون كانت لهم جزا ومصيرا
2870.en: Ask them "Is this (Fire) better or the everlasting Garden which has been promised to the God#fearing righteous people?" which will be the recompense of their good deeds and the final destination of their journey

2871.arabic: لهم فيها ما يشاون خلدين كان على ربك وعدا مسـولا
2871.en: wherein they will get everything they desire and wherein they will dwell for ever. This is a promise which your Lord has taken upon Himself to fulfil.

2872.arabic: ويوم يحشرهم وما يعبدون من دون الله فيقول انتم اضللتم عبادى هؤلا ام هم ضلوا السبيل
2872.en: And on that Day (your Lord will gather these people together as well as their deities, whom they worship besides AIlah. Then He will ask them, "Did you mislead these servants of Mine, or did they themselves go astray?"

2873.arabic: قالوا سبحنك ما كان ينبغى لنا ان نتخذ من دونك من اوليا ولكن متعتهم واباهم حتى نسوا الذكر وكانوا قومۢا بورا
2873.en: They will answer, "Glory be to Thee! We dared not take anyguardian besides Thee: (they were misled because) Thou didst give them and their forefathers all the good things of life till they forgot the Admonition, and incurred the punishment. "

2874.arabic: فقد كذبوكم بما تقولون فما تستطيعون صرفا ولا نصرا ومن يظلم منكم نذقه عذابا كبيرا
2874.en: Thus will your gods deny alI that you are professing today. Then you shall neither be able to repel your punishment nor shall get any help from anywhere; and whoso is guilty. of iniquity'' among you, We shall make him taste a severe torment.

2875.arabic: وما ارسلنا قبلك من المرسلين الا انهم لياكلون الطعام ويمشون فى الاسواق وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة اتصبرون وكان ربك بصيرا
2875.en: O Muhammad,, all the Messengers whom We sent before you also ate food and moved about in the streets. In fact, We have made you all a means of test for one another. Will you show patience? for your Lord sees everything.

2876.arabic: وقال الذين لا يرجون لقانا لولا انزل علينا الملئكة او نرى ربنا لقد استكبروا فى انفسهم وعتو عتوا كبيرا
2876.en: Those people, who have no fear of coming before Us, say, "Why should not the angels be sent down to us? Or else we should see our Lord. " Great arrogance have they assumed in regard to themselves, and have transgressed all limits in their rebellion.

2877.arabic: يوم يرون الملئكة لا بشرى يومئذ للمجرمين ويقولون حجرا محجورا
2877.en: The Day, when they will see the angels, will not be a day of rejoicing for the criminals; they will cry out, "May Allah save us!"

2878.arabic: وقدمنا الى ما عملوا من عمل فجعلنه هبا منثورا
2878.en: Then We shall turn to what they had done and render it vain like scattered dust.

2879.arabic: اصحب الجنة يومئذ خير مستقرا واحسن مقيلا
2879.en: (On the contrary) only those who have deserved the Garden, will have a good abode on that Day and a cool place for midday rest.

2880.arabic: ويوم تشقق السما بالغمم ونزل الملئكة تنزيلا
2880.en: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.

2881.arabic: الملك يومئذ الحق للرحمن وكان يوما على الكفرين عسيرا
2881.en: The real Kingdom on that Day will belong only to the Merciful, and it will be a very hard Day for the disbelievers.

2882.arabic: ويوم يعض الظالم على يديه يقول يليتنى اتخذت مع الرسول سبيلا
2882.en: The unjust man will bite at his hand and say, "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!

2883.arabic: يويلتى ليتنى لم اتخذ فلانا خليلا
2883.en: O, woe to me! Would that I had not chosen so and so for a friend!

2884.arabic: لقد اضلنى عن الذكر بعد اذ جانى وكان الشيطن للانسن خذولا
2884.en: For it was he, who had deluded me to reject the Admonition which had come to me. Satan has proved very treacherous to man. "

2885.arabic: وقال الرسول يرب ان قومى اتخذوا هذا القران مهجورا
2885.en: And the Messenger will say, "O my Lord, my people had made this Qur'an the object of their ridicule."

2886.arabic: وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبى عدوا من المجرمين وكفى بربك هاديا ونصيرا
2886.en: O Muhammad, in this very way We have made the criminals the enemies of every Prophet, but your Lord suffices for you as your Guide and Helper.

2887.arabic: وقال الذين كفروا لولا نزل عليه القران جملة وحدة كذلك لنثبت به فؤادك ورتلنه ترتيلا
2887.en: The disbelievers say, "Why has not the entire Qur'an been sent down to this man all at nce?" #Well, this has been done to impress it deeply on your mind, and (for the same object) We have sent it down piecemeal by degrees.

2888.arabic: ولا ياتونك بمثل الا جئنك بالحق واحسن تفسيرا
2888.en: And (there is another wisdom in this: whenever they brought to you an odd thing (or a strange question), We sent its right answer to you in time and explained it all in the best manner,

2889.arabic: الذين يحشرون على وجوههم الى جهنم اولئك شر مكانا واضل سبيلا
2889.en: those who are going to be driven to Hell upon their faces, have taken an utterly wrong stand and their way is most erroneous!

2890.arabic: ولقد اتينا موسى الكتب وجعلنا معه اخاه هرون وزيرا
2890.en: We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron as his counsellor:

2891.arabic: فقلنا اذهبا الى القوم الذين كذبوا بـايتنا فدمرنهم تدميرا
2891.en: then We said to them, "Go to the people who have treated Our Revelations as false. " So We annihilated those people utterly.

2892.arabic: وقوم نوح لما كذبوا الرسل اغرقنهم وجعلنهم للناس اية واعتدنا للظلمين عذابا اليما
2892.en: The same was the case with the people of Noah when they charged the Messenger with imposture: We drowned them and made them a sign of warning for entire mankind, and We have prepared a painful chastisement for the unjust.

2893.arabic: وعادا وثمودا واصحب الرس وقرونا بين ذلك كثيرا
2893.en: Likewise were destroyed the \`Ad and the Thamud and the people of the Rass, and many a generation in between.

2894.arabic: وكلا ضربنا له الامثل وكلا تبرنا تتبيرا
2894.en: We admonished each one of them by citing the examples (of those who were destroyed before them) and ultimately annihilated all of them.

2895.arabic: ولقد اتوا على القرية التى امطرت مطر السو افلم يكونوا يرونها بل كانوا لا يرجون نشورا
2895.en: Surely, these people have passed by that habitation on which was rained an evil rain: have they not seen its ruins? But they do not expect another life in the Hereafter.

2896.arabic: واذا راوك ان يتخذونك الا هزوا اهذا الذى بعث الله رسولا
2896.en: When these people see you, they scoff at you, (saying), "Is this the man whom Allah has sent as His Messenger?

2897.arabic: ان كاد ليضلنا عن الهتنا لولا ان صبرنا عليها وسوف يعلمون حين يرون العذاب من اضل سبيلا
2897.en: He had almost led us astray from our gods, had we not remained firm in our faith with regard to them. " The time is not far when they will see the torment and realize who had strayed far from the truth.

2898.arabic: اريت من اتخذ الهه هوىه افانت تكون عليه وكيلا
2898.en: Have you ever considered the case of the person who has made his lust his god? Can you take the responsibility of guiding such a one aright?

2899.arabic: ام تحسب ان اكثرهم يسمعون او يعقلون ان هم الا كالانعم بل هم اضل سبيلا
2899.en: Do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are only like the cattle; nay, even worse than the cattle.

2900.arabic: الم تر الى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شا لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا
2900.en: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it constant, but We have made the sun its pilot;

2901.en: then (as the sun climbs up), We roll it up little by little towards Ourselves.

2902.arabic: وهو الذى جعل لكم اليل لباسا والنوم سباتا وجعل النهار نشورا
2902.en: And it is Allah Who has ordained the night as a garment for you, and the sleep as a repose of death, and the day as the time of return to life.

2903.arabic: وهو الذى ارسل الريح بشرا بين يدى رحمته وانزلنا من السما ما طهورا
2903.en: And it is He, Who drives the winds to be the harbingers of His mercy: then He sends down pure water from the sky

2904.arabic: لنحى به بلدة ميتا ونسقيه مما خلقنا انعما واناسى كثيرا
2904.en: so that He may revive the dead land, and quench the thirst of many of His creatures from among beasts and men.

2905.arabic: ولقد صرفنه بينهم ليذكروا فابى اكثر الناس الا كفورا
2905.en: We present the same phenomenon over and over again before them so that they may learn a lesson from it; but most people decline to adopt any other attitude than of disbelief and ingratitude.

2906.arabic: ولو شئنا لبعثنا فى كل قرية نذيرا
2906.en: Had We willed, We would have raised up a separate Warner in each habitation.

2907.arabic: فلا تطع الكفرين وجهدهم به جهادا كبيرا
2907.en: So, O Prophet, do not yield to the disbelievers, but wage a Jihad against them with this Qur'an.

2908.arabic: وهو الذى مرج البحرين هذا عذب فرات وهذا ملح اجاج وجعل بينهما برزخا وحجرا محجورا
2908.en: And it is He, Who has let loose the two seas, one palatable and sweet, the other bitter and saltish, and there is a partition between them, which is an insurmountable barrier.

2909.arabic: وهو الذى خلق من الما بشرا فجعله نسبا وصهرا وكان ربك قديرا
2909.en: And it is He, Who created man from water: then from him He caused two kinds of kindred, by blood and by marriage: your Lord is AI I#Powerful.

2910.arabic: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعهم ولا يضرهم وكان الكافر على ربه ظهيرا
2910.en: Yet they worship, instead of Allah, those who can neither benefit them nor harm them: more than this, the disbeliever has become a helper of every rebel against his Lord.

2911.en: O Muhammad, We have sent you only to proclaim good tidings and to give warning.

2912.arabic: قل ما اسـلكم عليه من اجر الا من شا ان يتخذ الى ربه سبيلا
2912.en: Tell them, "I do not ask of you any recompense for this work: I only ask of the one, who will, to adopt the way of his Lord.

2913.arabic: وتوكل على الحى الذى لا يموت وسبح بحمده وكفى به بذنوب عباده خبيرا
2913.en: O Muhammad trust in that Allah Who is Ever#Living and will never die' Glorify Him with His praise, for He alone is sufficient to be aware of the sins of His servants.

2914.arabic: الذى خلق السموت والارض وما بينهما فى ستة ايام ثم استوى على العرش الرحمن فسـل به خبيرا
2914.en: In six days He created the earth and the heavens and all that is between them; then He established Himself on the "Throne" (of the Kingdom of the uriverse). (He is) the Merciful: as to His Glory, ask the one who knows.

2915.arabic: واذا قيل لهم اسجدوا للرحمن قالوا وما الرحمن انسجد لما تامرنا وزادهم نفورا
2915.en: When it is said to them. "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful," they retort, "What is the Merciful? Would you have us prostrate ourselves before whomsoever you will?" And this invitation only helps to increase their hatred all the more.

2916.arabic: تبارك الذى جعل فى السما بروجا وجعل فيها سرجا وقمرا منيرا
2916.en: Highly blessed is He, Who has made fortified spheres in the heavens and has set in it a "lamp" and a shining moon.

2917.arabic: وهو الذى جعل اليل والنهار خلفة لمن اراد ان يذكر او اراد شكورا
2917.en: He it is Who caused the night and the day to succeed each other so that everyone who desires may learn a lesson or become grateful.

2918.arabic: وعباد الرحمن الذين يمشون على الارض هونا واذا خاطبهم الجهلون قالوا سلما
2918.en: The (true) servants of the Merciful are those who walk humbly on the earth who, when the ignorant people behave insolently towards them, say, "Peace to you"

2919.en: who pass their nights in prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord:

2920.arabic: والذين يقولون ربنا اصرف عنا عذاب جهنم ان عذابها كان غراما
2920.en: who pray, "Our Lord, save us from the torment of Hell, for its torment is killing:

2921.en: it is an evil abode and an evil resting place":

2922.arabic: والذين اذا انفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما
2922.en: who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor miserly but keep the golden mean between the two (extremes):

2923.arabic: والذين لا يدعون مع الله الها اخر ولا يقتلون النفس التى حرم الله الا بالحق ولا يزنون ومن يفعل ذلك يلق اثاما
2923.en: who do not invoke any god but Allah nor kill a soul, which Allah has forbidden, unjustly, nor commit adultery. #He who does this shall be punished for his sin,

2924.arabic: يضعف له العذاب يوم القيمة ويخلد فيه مهانا
2924.en: and his torment shall be doubled on the Day of Resurrection, and he shall abide in a state of ignominy,

2925.arabic: الا من تاب وامن وعمل عملا صلحا فاولئك يبدل الله سيـاتهم حسنت وكان الله غفورا رحيما
2925.en: except the one who may have repented (after those sins) and have believed and done righteous works, for then Allah will change his evil deeds into good deeds, and He is very Forgiving and Merciful.

2926.arabic: ومن تاب وعمل صلحا فانه يتوب الى الله متابا
2926.en: In fact, the one who repents and does righteous deeds, returns to Allah as one ightly should. #

2927.arabic: والذين لا يشهدون الزور واذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما
2927.en: (And the servants of the Merciful are those:) who do not bear witness to falsehood and who; if they have ever to pass by what is vain, pass by like dignified people:

2928.arabic: والذين اذا ذكروا بـايت ربهم لم يخروا عليها صما وعميانا
2928.en: who do not behave like the blind and the deaf, when the Revelations of their Lord are recited to them for admonition;

2929.arabic: والذين يقولون ربنا هب لنا من ازوجنا وذريتنا قرة اعين واجعلنا للمتقين اماما
2929.en: who pray, "Our Lord, bless us with wives and children, who may be the comfort of our eyes, and make us leaders of the righteous. " #

2930.arabic: اولئك يجزون الغرفة بما صبروا ويلقون فيها تحية وسلما
2930.en: Such are the people who will be rewarded with high palaces for their fortitude,, wherein they will be welcomed with due respect, honour and salutations

2931.en: and wherein they will live for ever: what an excellent abode and what an excellent resting place!

2932.arabic: قل ما يعبؤا بكم ربى لولا دعاؤكم فقد كذبتم فسوف يكون لزامۢا
2932.en: O Muhammad, tell the people, "MyLord does not care at all if you do not invoke Him. Now that you have denied (His Revelation), you will soon be awarded such a punishment which you will never be able to avoid."

2934.en: These are the verses of the Clear Book.

2935.arabic: لعلك بخع نفسك الا يكونوا مؤمنين
2935.en: (O Muhammad), you will perhaps grieve yourself to death because these people do not believe.

2936.arabic: ان نشا ننزل عليهم من السما اية فظلت اعنقهم لها خضعين
2936.en: If We will, We can send down a Sign to them from heaven, so their necks will be humbled to it.

2937.arabic: وما ياتيهم من ذكر من الرحمن محدث الا كانوا عنه معرضين
2937.en: Never does there come to them an admonition from the Merciful Lord but they turn away from it.

2938.arabic: فقد كذبوا فسياتيهم انبؤا ما كانوا به يستهزون
2938.en: They will soon come to know the truth of that which they have been scoffing at.

2939.arabic: اولم يروا الى الارض كم انبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم
2939.en: Do they not look at the earth, how We caused a variety of fine vegetation to grow from it (in abundance)?

2940.arabic: ان فى ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
2940.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

2941.en: Verily Your Lord is Infinitely Mighty, Most Compassionate.

2942.arabic: واذ نادى ربك موسى ان ائت القوم الظلمين
2942.en: (Recount to them about the time) when Your Lord called Moses: "Go to the wrong#doing people,

2943.en: the people of Pharaoh: do they have no fear?"

2944.arabic: قال رب انى اخاف ان يكذبون
2944.en: He said: "My Lord! I fear that they will brand me a liar.

2945.arabic: ويضيق صدرى ولا ينطلق لسانى فارسل الى هرون
2945.en: My breast is constricted and my tongue is not fluent, so endow Messengership on Aaron.

2946.arabic: ولهم على ذنب فاخاف ان يقتلون
2946.en: As for me, they hold the charge of a crime against me. I fear they will put me to death."

2947.arabic: قال كلا فاذهبا بـايتنا انا معكم مستمعون
2947.en: He said: "Certainly not! So go both of you with Our Signs. We shall be with you listening to everything.

2948.arabic: فاتيا فرعون فقولا انا رسول رب العلمين
2948.en: Go, then, to Pharaoh and say to him: 'The Lord of the Universe has sent us

2949.en: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.'"

2950.arabic: قال الم نربك فينا وليدا ولبثت فينا من عمرك سنين
2950.en: Pharaoh said: "Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child?

2951.arabic: وفعلت فعلتك التى فعلت وانت من الكفرين
2951.en: You spent many years of your life among us and then you committed that deed of yours. You are very ungrateful indeed."

2952.arabic: قال فعلتها اذا وانا من الضالين
2952.en: Moses replied: "I committed that act erringly.

2953.arabic: ففررت منكم لما خفتكم فوهب لى ربى حكما وجعلنى من المرسلين
2953.en: Then I fled for fear of you. Then my Lord bestowed wisdom and authority on me and made me one of the Messengers.

2954.arabic: وتلك نعمة تمنها على ان عبدت بنى اسريل
2954.en: Now this is the favour that you tauntingly remind me of: that you enslaved the Children of Israel!"

2955.en: Pharaoh said: "And who is this Lord of the Universe?"

2956.arabic: قال رب السموت والارض وما بينهما ان كنتم موقنين
2956.en: Moses answered: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you were only to believe."

2957.en: Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear (what he says)?"

2958.en: Moses said: "(He is) Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of yore."

2959.arabic: قال ان رسولكم الذى ارسل اليكم لمجنون
2959.en: Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."

2960.arabic: قال رب المشرق والمغرب وما بينهما ان كنتم تعقلون
2960.en: Moses continued: "(He is) the Lord of the east and the west, and all between them. If you only had any understanding!"

2961.arabic: قال لئن اتخذت الها غيرى لاجعلنك من المسجونين
2961.en: Pharaoh said: "If you take any god other than me, I will certainly make you one of those (who are rotting) in prison."

2962.en: Moses said: "Even if I were to bring a Clear Sign to you?"

2963.arabic: قال فات به ان كنت من الصدقين
2963.en: Pharaoh said: "Then bring it if you are truthful at all."

2964.arabic: فالقى عصاه فاذا هى ثعبان مبين
2964.en: (No sooner had he said this than) Moses threw down his rod and behold, it was a veritable serpent,

2965.arabic: ونزع يده فاذا هى بيضا للنظرين
2965.en: and he drew his hand (out of his armpit) and lo! it had become a shining object to the beholders.

2966.arabic: قال للملا حوله ان هذا لسحر عليم
2966.en: Pharaoh said to the nobles around him: "Surely this man is a skilled magician

2967.arabic: يريد ان يخرجكم من ارضكم بسحره فماذا تامرون
2967.en: who wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. Tell us, what do you advise us?"

2968.arabic: قالوا ارجه واخاه وابعث فى المدائن حشرين
2968.en: They said: "Detain him and his brother for a while and send forth heralds to the cities

2970.en: So the magicians were brought together on a particular day at a set time

2971.en: and the people were told: "Will you join the assembly?

2972.arabic: لعلنا نتبع السحرة ان كانوا هم الغلبين
2972.en: We may perhaps follow the religion of the magicians if they triumph."

2973.arabic: فلما جا السحرة قالوا لفرعون ائن لنا لاجرا ان كنا نحن الغلبين
2973.en: When the magicians came forth (for the encounter) they said to Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we triumph?"

2974.arabic: قال نعم وانكم اذا لمن المقربين
2974.en: He said: "Yes, you will then become those near#stationed to me."

2975.arabic: قال لهم موسى القوا ما انتم ملقون
2975.en: Moses said to them: "Throw down whatever you wish to throw."

2976.arabic: فالقوا حبالهم وعصيهم وقالوا بعزة فرعون انا لنحن الغلبون
2976.en: Thereupon they threw down their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall prevail."

2977.arabic: فالقى موسى عصاه فاذا هى تلقف ما يافكون
2977.en: Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.

2978.en: Thereupon the magicians fell down in prostration,

2979.en: saying: "We (now) believe in the Lord of the Universe,

2980.en: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

2981.arabic: قال امنتم له قبل ان اذن لكم انه لكبيركم الذى علمكم السحر فلسوف تعلمون لاقطعن ايديكم وارجلكم من خلف ولاصلبنكم اجمعين
2981.en: Pharaoh said: "You accepted the word of Moses even before I granted you the leave to do so. Surely he is your chief who has taught you magic. Soon shall you come to know. I shall cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and shall crucify all of you."

2982.arabic: قالوا لا ضير انا الى ربنا منقلبون
2982.en: They said: "We do not care, for we are bound to return to our Lord,

2983.arabic: انا نطمع ان يغفر لنا ربنا خطينا ان كنا اول المؤمنين
2983.en: and we surely expect that Our Lord will forgive us our sins for we are the first ones to believe."

2984.arabic: واوحينا الى موسى ان اسر بعبادى انكم متبعون
2984.en: We revealed to Moses: "Set forth with My servants by night for you will be pursued."

2985.en: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities (to mobilise troops)

2986.en: saying: "These (Israelites) are only a small band of people

2987.en: who have certainly provoked our wrath.

2988.en: But we are a numerous host, ever on guard."

2989.en: Thus did We drive them out of their gardens and springs

2990.en: and their treasures and excellent dwellings.

2991.en: This happened with them; (but on the other hand), We enabled the Children of Israel to inherit those bounties.

2992.en: At sunrise they set off in pursuit of them

2993.arabic: فلما ترا الجمعان قال اصحب موسى انا لمدركون
2993.en: and when the groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out: "We are overtaken!"

2994.arabic: قال كلا ان معى ربى سيهدين
2994.en: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."

2995.arabic: فاوحينا الى موسى ان اضرب بعصاك البحر فانفلق فكان كل فرق كالطود العظيم
2995.en: Then We revealed to Moses, (commanding him): "Strike the sea with your rod." Thereupon the sea split up, and then each became like the mass of a huge mount.

2996.en: We also brought the other party close to the same spot,

2997.en: and We delivered Moses and his companions, all of them,

2999.arabic: ان فى ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
2999.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3000.en: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

3001.en: And recount to them the story of Abraham:

3002.arabic: اذ قال لابيه وقومه ما تعبدون
3002.en: when he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

3003.arabic: قالوا نعبد اصناما فنظل لها عكفين
3003.en: They answered: "There are some idols that we worship and are devoted to them with constancy."

3004.en: He asked: "Do they hear you when you call them

3005.en: or do they cause you any benefit or harm?"

3006.arabic: قالوا بل وجدنا ابانا كذلك يفعلون
3006.en: They answered: "No; but we found our forefathers doing so."

3007.en: Thereupon, Abraham said: "Have you seen (with your eyes) those whom you have been worshipping,

3008.en: you and your forefathers of yore?

3009.arabic: فانهم عدو لى الا رب العلمين
3009.en: They are all enemies to me; all, except the Lord of the Universe

3010.en: Who created me and Who guides me;

3011.en: Who gives me food and drink,

3012.en: and Who, when I am ill, heals me;

3013.en: Who will cause me to die and then will again restore me to life;

3014.arabic: والذى اطمع ان يغفر لى خطيـتى يوم الدين
3014.en: Who, I hope, will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgement."

3015.arabic: رب هب لى حكما والحقنى بالصلحين
3015.en: (And then Abraham prayed): "My Lord, endow me with knowledge and wisdom and join me with the righteous,

3016.arabic: واجعل لى لسان صدق فى الاخرين
3016.en: and grant me an honourable reputation among posterity,

3017.en: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss,

3018.arabic: واغفر لابى انه كان من الضالين
3018.en: and forgive my father for he is among those who strayed,

3019.en: and disgrace me not on the Day when people will be raised to life,

3020.arabic: يوم لا ينفع مال ولا بنون
3020.en: the Day when nothing will avail, neither wealth nor offspring,

3021.arabic: الا من اتى الله بقلب سليم
3021.en: but only he that brings to Allah a sound heart will (attain to success)."

3022.en: (On that Day) the Garden will be brought near to the God#fearing,

3023.en: and the Fire will be uncovered for those who strayed,

3024.arabic: وقيل لهم اين ما كنتم تعبدون
3024.en: and they will be asked: "Where are the gods that you worshipped

3025.arabic: من دون الله هل ينصرونكم او ينتصرون
3025.en: beside Allah? Can they be of any help to you, or even be of any help to themselves?"

3026.en: Then the idols and those who strayed will be hurled into the Fire headlong, one upon another,

3027.en: and so too the hosts of Iblis, all of them.

3028.en: There they will quarrel with one another and the erring ones will say (to their deities):

3029.arabic: تالله ان كنا لفى ضلل مبين
3029.en: "By Allah, we were surely in clear error

3030.en: when we assigned to you a position equal to that of the Lord of the Universe.

3031.en: It is none but those steeped in guilt who led us into this error,

3032.en: and now we have none to intercede on our behalf,

3033.en: nor do we have a truly sincere friend.

3034.arabic: فلو ان لنا كرة فنكون من المؤمنين
3034.en: If only we could return we would be among the believers."

3035.arabic: ان فى ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
3035.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3036.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

3037.en: The people of Noah gave the lie to the Messengers.

3038.arabic: اذ قال لهم اخوهم نوح الا تتقون
3038.en: Recall when their brother Noah said to them: "Do you have no fear?

3039.en: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you;

3040.en: so fear Allah and obey me.

3041.arabic: وما اسـلكم عليه من اجر ان اجرى الا على رب العلمين
3041.en: I seek of you no reward for this: my reward is with none except the Lord of the Universe.

3042.en: So fear Allah and obey me."

3043.en: They answered: "Shall we accept you even though it is the meanest of people who follow you?"

3044.arabic: قال وما علمى بما كانوا يعملون
3044.en: Noah said: "What knowledge do I have about their deeds?

3045.arabic: ان حسابهم الا على ربى لو تشعرون
3045.en: It is only for my Lord to take account of them. Would that you made use of your understanding!

3046.en: It is not for me to repel those who choose to believe.

3047.en: I am none but a plain warner."

3048.arabic: قالوا لئن لم تنته ينوح لتكونن من المرجومين
3048.en: They said: "O Noah! If you do not desist, you will certainly become one of the accursed."

3049.en: He said: "My Lord! My people have branded me a liar.

3050.arabic: فافتح بينى وبينهم فتحا ونجنى ومن معى من المؤمنين
3050.en: So pass a clear judgement between me and them and rescue me and the believers with me."

3051.arabic: فانجينه ومن معه فى الفلك المشحون
3051.en: Thereafter We rescued him and those who were with him in the laden Ark

3053.arabic: ان فى ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
3053.en: Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3054.en: Verily Your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Ever Compassionate.

3055.en: The Ad gave the lie to the Messengers.

3056.arabic: اذ قال لهم اخوهم هود الا تتقون
3056.en: Recall, when their brother Hud said to them: "Have you no fear?

3057.en: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

3058.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3059.arabic: وما اسـلكم عليه من اجر ان اجرى الا على رب العلمين
3059.en: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is with none but the Lord of the Universe.

3060.en: What, you build a monument on every hill merely for fun

3061.en: and erect huge palaces as though you will live for ever,

3062.en: and when you strike you strike like tyrants?

3063.en: So fear Allah and obey me.

3064.en: Have fear of Him Who has provided you with all the (good) things you know;

3065.en: Who has provided you with flocks and children

3067.arabic: انى اخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم
3067.en: I fear for you the chastisement of an Awesome Day."

3068.arabic: قالوا سوا علينا اوعظت ام لم تكن من الوعظين
3068.en: They replied: "It is all the same for us whether you admonish us or not.

3069.en: This has been happening all along.

3070.en: We will not be subjected to any chastisement."

3071.arabic: فكذبوه فاهلكنهم ان فى ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
3071.en: Eventually they gave the lie to him and We destroyed them. Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.

3072.en: Verily your Lord is Immensely Mighty, Most Compassionate.
