4571.en: This, because they said to those who are averse to the faith that Allah has revealed: “In some matters we shall obey you.” Allah has full knowledge of their secret parleys.

4572.arabic: فكيف اذا توفتهم الملئكة يضربون وجوههم وادبرهم
4572.en: But how will they fare when angels will take their souls at death and will carry them, striking their faces and backs?

4573.arabic: ذلك بانهم اتبعوا ما اسخط الله وكرهوا رضونه فاحبط اعملهم
4573.en: That is because they have followed a way that angered Allah, and have been averse to His good pleasure. So He reduced all their works to nought.

4574.arabic: ام حسب الذين فى قلوبهم مرض ان لن يخرج الله اضغنهم
4574.en: Or do they, in whose hearts there is a sickness, believe that Allah will not bring their failings to light?

4575.arabic: ولو نشا لارينكهم فلعرفتهم بسيمهم ولتعرفنهم فى لحن القول والله يعلم اعملكم
4575.en: If We were to so will, We could have shown them to you so that you would recognise them by their faces, and you would certainly know them by the manner of their speech. Allah knows all your deeds.

4576.arabic: ولنبلونكم حتى نعلم المجهدين منكم والصبرين ونبلوا اخباركم
4576.en: We shall certainly test you until We know those of you who truly strive and remain steadfast, and will ascertain about you.

4577.arabic: ان الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله وشاقوا الرسول من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى لن يضروا الله شيـا وسيحبط اعملهم
4577.en: Those who disbelieved and barred others from Allah's Way and opposed the Messenger after the True Guidance had become manifest to them, they shall not be able to cause Allah the least harm; rather, Allah will reduce all their works to nought.

4578.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول ولا تبطلوا اعملكم
4578.en: Believers, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not cause your works to be nullified.

4579.arabic: ان الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله ثم ماتوا وهم كفار فلن يغفر الله لهم
4579.en: Verily Allah shall not forgive those who disbelieved and barred others from Allah's Way and clung to their unbelief until their death.

4580.arabic: فلا تهنوا وتدعوا الى السلم وانتم الاعلون والله معكم ولن يتركم اعملكم
4580.en: So, be not faint#hearted and do not cry for peace. You shall prevail. Allah is with you and will not bring your works to nought.

4581.arabic: انما الحيوة الدنيا لعب ولهو وان تؤمنوا وتتقوا يؤتكم اجوركم ولا يسـلكم امولكم
4581.en: The life of this world is but sport and amusement. If you believe and are God#fearing, He will grant you your reward, and will not ask you for your possessions.

4582.arabic: ان يسـلكموها فيحفكم تبخلوا ويخرج اضغنكم
4582.en: If He were to ask you for your possessions and press you (in that regard), you would have grown niggardly, and Allah would have brought your failings to light.

4583.arabic: هانتم هؤلا تدعون لتنفقوا فى سبيل الله فمنكم من يبخل ومن يبخل فانما يبخل عن نفسه والله الغنى وانتم الفقرا وان تتولوا يستبدل قوما غيركم ثم لا يكونوا امثلكم
4583.en: Behold, you are those who are called upon to spend in Allah's Way, but some of you are niggardly. Whoever is niggardly is in fact niggardly to himself. For Allah is All#Sufficient, whereas it is you who are in need of Him. If you turn away, He will replace you by a people other than you, and they will not be like you.

4584.en: (O Prophet), surely We have granted you a clear victory

4585.arabic: ليغفر لك الله ما تقدم من ذنبك وما تاخر ويتم نعمته عليك ويهديك صرطا مستقيما
4585.en: so that Allah may forgive you your shortcomings, whether earlier or later, and may complete His favours upon you and guide you to the Straight Way,

4586.en: and that Allah may bestow upon you a mighty help.

4587.arabic: هو الذى انزل السكينة فى قلوب المؤمنين ليزدادوا ايمنا مع ايمنهم ولله جنود السموت والارض وكان الله عليما حكيما
4587.en: He it is Who bestowed inner peace on the hearts of the believers so that they may grow yet more firm in their faith. To Allah belong the legions of the heavens and the earth; Allah is All#Knowing, Most Wise.

4588.arabic: ليدخل المؤمنين والمؤمنت جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها ويكفر عنهم سيـاتهم وكان ذلك عند الله فوزا عظيما
4588.en: (He did this) to admit the believers, both men and women, to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall abide, and to efface their evil deeds from them. That, in Allah's sight, is the supreme triumph.

4589.arabic: ويعذب المنفقين والمنفقت والمشركين والمشركت الظانين بالله ظن السو عليهم دائرة السو وغضب الله عليهم ولعنهم واعد لهم جهنم وسات مصيرا
4589.en: (He also did this) to chastise the hypocrites, both men and women, and those who associate others in His Divinity, both men and women, and who harbour evil thoughts about Allah. They shall be afflicted with misfortune, Allah is wroth with them. He has laid His curse upon them and has prepared for them Hell. What an evil end!

4590.arabic: ولله جنود السموت والارض وكان الله عزيزا حكيما
4590.en: To Allah belong the legions of the heavens and the earth. Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.

4591.en: (O Prophet), We have sent you forth as a witness, as a bearer of good news, and as a warner

4592.arabic: لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتعزروه وتوقروه وتسبحوه بكرة واصيلا
4592.en: so that (all of) you may all believe in Allah and His Messenger, and support him, and revere him, and celebrate Allah's glory, morning and evening.

4593.arabic: ان الذين يبايعونك انما يبايعون الله يد الله فوق ايديهم فمن نكث فانما ينكث على نفسه ومن اوفى بما عهد عليه الله فسيؤتيه اجرا عظيما
4593.en: Those who swore fealty to you, (O Prophet), in fact swore fealty to Allah. The Hand of Allah is above their hands. So whoever breaks his covenant breaks it to his own hurt; and whoever fulfils the covenant that he made with Allah, He will bestow on him a great reward.

4594.arabic: سيقول لك المخلفون من الاعراب شغلتنا امولنا واهلونا فاستغفر لنا يقولون بالسنتهم ما ليس فى قلوبهم قل فمن يملك لكم من الله شيـا ان اراد بكم ضرا او اراد بكم نفعۢا بل كان الله بما تعملون خبيرۢا
4594.en: (O Prophet), the bedouins who were left behind say to you: “We were occupied with our goods and families. So ask forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say to them: “Who can be of any avail to you against Allah if He should intend to cause you any harm or confer upon you any benefit?” Allah is well aware of all that you do.

4595.arabic: بل ظننتم ان لن ينقلب الرسول والمؤمنون الى اهليهم ابدا وزين ذلك فى قلوبكم وظننتم ظن السو وكنتم قومۢا بورا
4595.en: (But the truth is not what you say.) You had imagined that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this notion was embellished in your hearts. You harboured an evil thought, and you are an immensely evil people.”

4596.arabic: ومن لم يؤمن بالله ورسوله فانا اعتدنا للكفرين سعيرا
4596.en: As for those who do not believe in Allah and His Messenger, for such unbelievers We have prepared a Blazing Fire.

4597.arabic: ولله ملك السموت والارض يغفر لمن يشا ويعذب من يشا وكان الله غفورا رحيما
4597.en: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He pleases and chastises whom He pleases. He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

4598.arabic: سيقول المخلفون اذا انطلقتم الى مغانم لتاخذوها ذرونا نتبعكم يريدون ان يبدلوا كلم الله قل لن تتبعونا كذلكم قال الله من قبل فسيقولون بل تحسدوننا بل كانوا لا يفقهون الا قليلا
4598.en: When you press forth for the spoils, those who were left behind will say: “Let us accompany you.” They want to change the command of Allah. Say to them (in clear words): “You shall not accompany us. Thus has Allah already said.” Then they will say: “Nay; but you are jealous of us.” The truth is that they understand little.

4599.arabic: قل للمخلفين من الاعراب ستدعون الى قوم اولى باس شديد تقتلونهم او يسلمون فان تطيعوا يؤتكم الله اجرا حسنا وان تتولوا كما توليتم من قبل يعذبكم عذابا اليما
4599.en: Say to the bedouins who were left behind: “You will be called against those who possess great might and be asked to fight against them unless they surrender. If you obey (the command to fight), Allah will bestow upon you a goodly reward. But if you turn away, as you turned away before, He shall inflict upon you a grievous chastisement.”

4600.arabic: ليس على الاعمى حرج ولا على الاعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ومن يطع الله ورسوله يدخله جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر ومن يتول يعذبه عذابا اليما
4600.en: There is no blame on the blind, nor on the lame, nor on the sick (if they do not go forth to fight). Allah will admit those who obey Allah and His Messenger to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow and will inflict a grievous chastisement on those who turn away.

4601.arabic: لقد رضى الله عن المؤمنين اذ يبايعونك تحت الشجرة فعلم ما فى قلوبهم فانزل السكينة عليهم واثبهم فتحا قريبا
4601.en: Allah was much pleased with the believers when they swore fealty to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts. So He bestowed inner peace upon them and rewarded them with a victory near at hand

4602.arabic: ومغانم كثيرة ياخذونها وكان الله عزيزا حكيما
4602.en: and with abundant spoils which they shall acquire. Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.

4603.arabic: وعدكم الله مغانم كثيرة تاخذونها فعجل لكم هذه وكف ايدى الناس عنكم ولتكون اية للمؤمنين ويهديكم صرطا مستقيما
4603.en: Allah has promised you abundant spoils which you shall acquire. He has instantly granted you this (victory) and has restrained the hands of people from you that it may be a Sign for the believers and He may guide you to a Straight Way.

4604.arabic: واخرى لم تقدروا عليها قد احاط الله بها وكان الله على كل شى قديرا
4604.en: He also promises you other spoils which you have not yet taken, but Allah has encompassed them. Allah has power over everything.

4605.arabic: ولو قتلكم الذين كفروا لولوا الادبر ثم لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا
4605.en: Had the unbelievers fought against you at that time, they would have turned their backs (in flight), and would have found none to protect or help them.

4606.arabic: سنة الله التى قد خلت من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا
4606.en: Such is Allah's Way that has come down from the past. Never shall you find any change in the Way of Allah.

4607.arabic: وهو الذى كف ايديهم عنكم وايديكم عنهم ببطن مكة من بعد ان اظفركم عليهم وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا
4607.en: He it is Who restrained their hands from you, and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah, even though He had made you victorious against them. Allah was watching all that you did.

4608.arabic: هم الذين كفروا وصدوكم عن المسجد الحرام والهدى معكوفا ان يبلغ محله ولولا رجال مؤمنون ونسا مؤمنت لم تعلموهم ان تطـوهم فتصيبكم منهم معرة بغير علم ليدخل الله فى رحمته من يشا لو تزيلوا لعذبنا الذين كفروا منهم عذابا اليما
4608.en: They are the ones who disbelieved and barred you from the Inviolable Mosque and prevented the animals you had designated for sacrifice from reaching the place of their offering. If it had not been for the believing men and believing women (who lived in Makkah and) whom you did not know, and had there not been the fear that you might trample on them and unwittingly incur blame on their account, (then fighting would not have been put to a stop. It was stopped so that) Allah may admit to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. Had those believers been separated from the rest, We would certainly have inflicted a grievous chastise#ment on those of them \[i.e. the Makkans) who disbelieved.

4609.arabic: اذ جعل الذين كفروا فى قلوبهم الحمية حمية الجهلية فانزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين والزمهم كلمة التقوى وكانوا احق بها واهلها وكان الله بكل شى عليما
4609.en: (This is why) when the unbelievers set in their hearts a fierce bigotry ## the bigotry of ignorance ## Allah bestowed inner peace upon His Messenger and upon the believers and made the word of piety binding on them. They were more deserving and worthier thereof. Allah has knowledge of everything.

4610.arabic: لقد صدق الله رسوله الريا بالحق لتدخلن المسجد الحرام ان شا الله امنين محلقين روسكم ومقصرين لا تخافون فعلم ما لم تعلموا فجعل من دون ذلك فتحا قريبا
4610.en: Allah indeed showed His Messenger the true vision, one fully in accord with reality. If Allah so wills you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security, you will shave your heads and cut your hair short, and do so without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted you a victory near at hand even before (the fulfilment of the vision).

4611.arabic: هو الذى ارسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله وكفى بالله شهيدا
4611.en: He it is Who sent His Messenger with the True Guidance and the Religion of Truth that He may make it prevail over every religion. Sufficient is Allah as a witness (to this).

4612.arabic: محمد رسول الله والذين معه اشدا على الكفار رحما بينهم ترىهم ركعا سجدا يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضونا سيماهم فى وجوههم من اثر السجود ذلك مثلهم فى التورىة ومثلهم فى الانجيل كزرع اخرج شطـه فـازره فاستغلظ فاستوى على سوقه يعجب الزراع ليغيظ بهم الكفار وعد الله الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت منهم مغفرة واجرا عظيمۢا
4612.en: Muhammad is Allah's Messenger, and those who are with him are firm with the unbelievers but compassionate with one another. You see them occupied in bowing and prostrating and in seeking Allah's bounty and good pleasure. They are distinguished from others by the marks of prostration on their faces. Thus are they described in the Torah. And their parable in the Gospel is that of a tilth that puts forth its shoot, then strengthens it so that it becomes stout and stands firmly on its stem. This is a sight pleasing to the sowers and one by which the unbelievers will be enraged. As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, Allah has promised them forgiveness and a great reward.

4613.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا تقدموا بين يدى الله ورسوله واتقوا الله ان الله سميع عليم
4613.en: Believers, do not advance before Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah. Verily Allah is All#Hearing, All#Knowing.

4614.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا ترفعوا اصوتكم فوق صوت النبى ولا تجهروا له بالقول كجهر بعضكم لبعض ان تحبط اعملكم وانتم لا تشعرون
4614.en: Believers, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and when speaking to him do not speak aloud as you speak aloud to one another, lest all your deeds are reduced to nothing without your even realising it.

4615.arabic: ان الذين يغضون اصوتهم عند رسول الله اولئك الذين امتحن الله قلوبهم للتقوى لهم مغفرة واجر عظيم
4615.en: The ones who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of Allah are those whose hearts Allah has tested for God#fearing. Theirs shall be forgiveness and a great reward.

4616.arabic: ان الذين ينادونك من ورا الحجرت اكثرهم لا يعقلون
4616.en: Surely most of those who call out to you, (O Prophet), from behind the apartments, are devoid of understanding.

4617.arabic: ولو انهم صبروا حتى تخرج اليهم لكان خيرا لهم والله غفور رحيم
4617.en: If they were patient until you went out to them, that would have been better for them. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

4618.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا ان جاكم فاسقۢ بنبا فتبينوا ان تصيبوا قومۢا بجهلة فتصبحوا على ما فعلتم ندمين
4618.en: Believers, when an ungodly person brings to you a piece of news, carefully ascertain its truth, lest you should hurt a people unwittingly and thereafter repent at what you did.

4619.arabic: واعلموا ان فيكم رسول الله لو يطيعكم فى كثير من الامر لعنتم ولكن الله حبب اليكم الايمن وزينه فى قلوبكم وكره اليكم الكفر والفسوق والعصيان اولئك هم الرشدون
4619.en: Know that Allah's Messenger is among you. Were he to follow you in many an affair, you yourselves would suffer. But Allah has endeared faith to you and has embellished it in your hearts, and has made unbelief and evil#doing and disobedience abhorrent to you. Such are those who are rightly guided,

4620.arabic: فضلا من الله ونعمة والله عليم حكيم
4620.en: by Allah's favour and bounty. Allah is All#Knowing, All#Wise.

4621.arabic: وان طائفتان من المؤمنين اقتتلوا فاصلحوا بينهما فان بغت احدىهما على الاخرى فقتلوا التى تبغى حتى تفى الى امر الله فان فات فاصلحوا بينهما بالعدل واقسطوا ان الله يحب المقسطين
4621.en: If two parties of the believers happen to fight, make peace between them. But then, if one of them transgresses against the other, fight the one that transgresses until it reverts to Allah's command. And if it does revert, make peace between them with justice, and be equitable for Allah loves the equitable.

4622.arabic: انما المؤمنون اخوة فاصلحوا بين اخويكم واتقوا الله لعلكم ترحمون
4622.en: Surely the believers are none but brothers unto one another, so set things right between your brothers, and have fear of Allah that you may be shown mercy.

4623.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا يسخر قوم من قوم عسى ان يكونوا خيرا منهم ولا نسا من نسا عسى ان يكن خيرا منهن ولا تلمزوا انفسكم ولا تنابزوا بالالقب بئس الاسم الفسوق بعد الايمن ومن لم يتب فاولئك هم الظلمون
4623.en: Believers, let not a group (of men) scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter (at whom they scoff) are better than they; nor let a group of women scoff at another group, it may well be that the latter are better than they. And do not taunt one another, nor revile one another by nicknames. It is an evil thing to gain notoriety for ungodliness after belief. Those who do not repent are indeed the wrong#doers.

4624.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اجتنبوا كثيرا من الظن ان بعض الظن اثم ولا تجسسوا ولا يغتب بعضكم بعضا ايحب احدكم ان ياكل لحم اخيه ميتا فكرهتموه واتقوا الله ان الله تواب رحيم
4624.en: Believers, avoid being excessively suspicious, for some suspicion is a sin. Do not spy, nor backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would surely detest it. Have fear of Allah. Surely Allah is much prone to accept repentance, is Most Compassionate.

4625.arabic: يايها الناس انا خلقنكم من ذكر وانثى وجعلنكم شعوبا وقبائل لتعارفوا ان اكرمكم عند الله اتقىكم ان الله عليم خبير
4625.en: Human beings, We created you all from a male and a female, and made you into nations and tribes so that you may know one another. Verily the noblest of you in the sight of Allah is the most God#fearing of you. Surely Allah is All#Knowing, All#Aware.

4626.arabic: قالت الاعراب امنا قل لم تؤمنوا ولكن قولوا اسلمنا ولما يدخل الايمن فى قلوبكم وان تطيعوا الله ورسوله لا يلتكم من اعملكم شيـا ان الله غفور رحيم
4626.en: The Bedouins say: “We believe.” (O Prophet), say to them: “You do not believe; you should rather say: 'We have submitted'”; for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish anything from the reward of any of your deeds. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

4627.arabic: انما المؤمنون الذين امنوا بالله ورسوله ثم لم يرتابوا وجهدوا بامولهم وانفسهم فى سبيل الله اولئك هم الصدقون
4627.en: Indeed the ones possessed of true faith are those who believed in Allah and His Messenger and then they did not entertain any doubt and strove hard in the Way of Allah with their lives and their possessions. These are the truthful ones.

4628.arabic: قل اتعلمون الله بدينكم والله يعلم ما فى السموت وما فى الارض والله بكل شى عليم
4628.en: Say, (O Prophet), (to these pretenders to faith): “Are you apprising Allah of your faith? Allah knows all that is in the heavens and the earth. Allah has full knowledge of everything.”

4629.arabic: يمنون عليك ان اسلموا قل لا تمنوا على اسلمكم بل الله يمن عليكم ان هدىكم للايمن ان كنتم صدقين
4629.en: They count it as a favour to you that they accepted Islam. Say: “Do not regard your (accepting) Islam as a favour to me; rather, Allah has bestowed a favour on you by guiding you to faith, if you are truthful (in your claim to be believers).

4630.arabic: ان الله يعلم غيب السموت والارض والله بصير بما تعملون
4630.en: Surely Allah knows every hidden thing of the heavens and the earth. Allah sees all that you do.

4632.arabic: بل عجبوا ان جاهم منذر منهم فقال الكفرون هذا شى عجيب
4632.en: Nay; they wondered that a warner should have come to them from among themselves. The unbelievers said: “This indeed is a strange thing.

4633.arabic: اذا متنا وكنا ترابا ذلك رجعۢ بعيد
4633.en: What! When we are dead and reduced to mere dust, (shall we be raised to life)? Such a return is far#fetched.”

4634.arabic: قد علمنا ما تنقص الارض منهم وعندنا كتب حفيظۢ
4634.en: (Thus do they imagine, although) We know well what the earth takes away from them. With Us is a Record that preserves everything.

4635.arabic: بل كذبوا بالحق لما جاهم فهم فى امر مريج
4635.en: They gave the lie to the Truth when it came to them. So they are now in a state of great perplexity.

4636.arabic: افلم ينظروا الى السما فوقهم كيف بنينها وزينها وما لها من فروج
4636.en: Did they never observe the sky above them: how We built it and beautified it; and it has no cracks;

4637.arabic: والارض مددنها والقينا فيها روسى وانبتنا فيها من كل زوجۭ بهيج
4637.en: and We have spread out the earth, and have set upon it firm mountains, and have caused it to bring out plants of all beauteous kinds?

4638.en: All these are to serve as eye openers and as a lesson to every being who is prone to turn (to the Truth).

4639.arabic: ونزلنا من السما ما مبركا فانبتنا به جنت وحب الحصيد
4639.en: We also sent down blessed water from the heaven, wherewith We caused gardens and harvest#grain to grow,

4640.en: and tall palm#trees with their thickly#clustered spathes;

4641.arabic: رزقا للعباد واحيينا به بلدة ميتا كذلك الخروج
4641.en: all this as sustenance for Our servants. And thus We do bring the dead land back to life with water. Such shall be the coming forth (of human beings from the earth).

4642.arabic: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح واصحب الرس وثمود
4642.en: In the past Noah's people, and the people of Rass and Thamud gave the lie (to Messengers),

4643.en: and so did 'Ad, and Pharaoh and Lot's brethren,

4644.arabic: واصحب الايكة وقوم تبع كل كذب الرسل فحق وعيد
4644.en: and the people of Aykah, and the people of Tubba'. They all gave the lie to the Messengers. Thereafter My threat of chastisement against them was fulfilled.

4645.arabic: افعيينا بالخلق الاول بل هم فى لبس من خلق جديد
4645.en: Did We, then, become worn out by the first creation? Not at all; but they are in doubt about a fresh creation.

4646.arabic: ولقد خلقنا الانسن ونعلم ما توسوس به نفسه ونحن اقرب اليه من حبل الوريد
4646.en: Surely We have created man, and We know the promptings of his heart, and We are nearer to him than even his jugular vein.

4647.arabic: اذ يتلقى المتلقيان عن اليمين وعن الشمال قعيد
4647.en: Moreover, there are two scribes, one each sitting on the right and the left, recording everything.

4648.arabic: ما يلفظ من قول الا لديه رقيب عتيد
4648.en: He utters not a word, but there is a vigilant watcher at hand.

4649.arabic: وجات سكرة الموت بالحق ذلك ما كنت منه تحيد
4649.en: Lo, the agony of death has indeed come with the Truth. That is what you had sought to avoid.

4650.arabic: ونفخ فى الصور ذلك يوم الوعيد
4650.en: And then the Trumpet was blown. This is the day of the promised chastisement.

4651.arabic: وجات كل نفس معها سائق وشهيد
4651.en: Everyone has come, each attended by one who will drive him on, and another who will bear witness.

4652.arabic: لقد كنت فى غفلة من هذا فكشفنا عنك غطاك فبصرك اليوم حديد
4652.en: You were heedless of this. Now We have removed your veil and so your vision today is sharp.

4653.arabic: وقال قرينه هذا ما لدى عتيد
4653.en: His companion said: “Here is he who was in my charge.”

4654.arabic: القيا فى جهنم كل كفار عنيد
4654.en: The command was given: “Cast into Hell every hardened, stubborn unbeliever,

4655.en: who hinders good, exceeds the limits, is immersed in doubts,

4656.arabic: الذى جعل مع الله الها اخر فالقياه فى العذاب الشديد
4656.en: and has set up another deity with Allah. Hurl him into the grievous torment.”

4657.arabic: قال قرينه ربنا ما اطغيته ولكن كان فى ضللۭ بعيد
4657.en: His companion said: “I did not incite him to rebel; he was far gone into error of his own accord.”

4658.arabic: قال لا تختصموا لدى وقد قدمت اليكم بالوعيد
4658.en: (It was said): “Do not remonstrate in My presence. I had warned you.

4659.arabic: ما يبدل القول لدى وما انا بظلم للعبيد
4659.en: My Word is not changed; and never do I inflict the least wrong upon My servants.”

4660.arabic: يوم نقول لجهنم هل امتلات وتقول هل من مزيد
4660.en: On that Day We shall ask Hell: “Are you full?” And it will reply: “Are there any more?”

4661.en: And when Paradise shall be brought close to the God#fearing, and will no longer be far away,

4662.arabic: هذا ما توعدون لكل اواب حفيظ
4662.en: it will be said: “This is what you were promised, a promise made to everyone who turned much (to Allah) and was watchful of his conduct,

4663.arabic: من خشى الرحمن بالغيب وجا بقلب منيب
4663.en: to everyone who feared the Merciful One though He is beyond the reach of perception, to everyone who has come with a heart ever wont to turn (to Him).

4664.en: Enter this Paradise in peace.” That will be the Day of Eternity.

4665.arabic: لهم ما يشاون فيها ولدينا مزيد
4665.en: Therein they shall get whatever they desire; and with Us there is even more.

4666.arabic: وكم اهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هم اشد منهم بطشا فنقبوا فى البلد هل من محيص
4666.en: How many a nation did We destroy before them that were stronger in prowess than these. They searched about the lands of the world. But could they find a refuge?

4667.arabic: ان فى ذلك لذكرى لمن كان له قلب او القى السمع وهو شهيد
4667.en: Verily there is a lesson in this for everyone who has a (sound) heart and who listens with an attentive mind.

4668.arabic: ولقد خلقنا السموت والارض وما بينهما فى ستة ايام وما مسنا من لغوب
4668.en: We created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six days, and weariness did not even touch Us.

4669.arabic: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل الغروب
4669.en: Hence bear with patience whatever they say, and celebrate your Lord's glory before the rising of the sun and before its setting;

4670.en: and in the night, too, celebrate His glory, in the wake of prostration.

4671.arabic: واستمع يوم يناد المناد من مكان قريب
4671.en: Hearken on the Day when the caller will call from a place nearby,

4672.arabic: يوم يسمعون الصيحة بالحق ذلك يوم الخروج
4672.en: the Day when they shall hear the Blast in truth. That will be the Day (for the dead) to come forth.

4673.arabic: انا نحن نحى ونميت والينا المصير
4673.en: Surely it is We Who give life and cause death, and to Us shall all return

4674.arabic: يوم تشقق الارض عنهم سراعا ذلك حشر علينا يسير
4674.en: on the Day when the earth will be rent asunder and people, rising from it, will hasten forth. To assemble them all will be easy for Us.

4675.arabic: نحن اعلم بما يقولون وما انت عليهم بجبار فذكر بالقران من يخاف وعيد
4675.en: (O Prophet), We are well aware of what they say; and you are not required to force things on them. So exhort with the Qur'an all those who fear My warning.

4676.en: By the winds which scatter dust,

4677.en: which carry clouds laden with water,

4679.en: and execute the great task of apportioning (rainfall):

4680.en: surely what you are being warned against is true,

4681.en: and the Judgement shall doubtlessly take place.

4682.en: By the heaven with its numerous forms:

4683.en: surely you are at variance (about the Hereafter);

4684.en: though only those who are averse to the Truth will turn away from (believing in it).

4686.en: who are steeped in ignorance and heedlessness.

4687.en: They ask: “When will the Day of Judgement be?”

4688.en: It will be the Day when they shall be scourged by the Fire

4689.arabic: ذوقوا فتنتكم هذا الذى كنتم به تستعجلون
4689.en: (and be told): “Taste your ordeal! This is what you were seeking to hasten.”

4690.en: As for the God#fearing, they shall be in the midst of gardens and fountains,

4691.arabic: اخذين ما اتىهم ربهم انهم كانوا قبل ذلك محسنين
4691.en: joyously receiving what their Lord will have granted them. Verily they did good works before (the coming of this Day):

4692.arabic: كانوا قليلا من اليل ما يهجعون
4692.en: they used to sleep but little by night,

4693.en: and would ask for forgiveness at dawn,

4694.en: and in their wealth there was a rightful share for him who would ask and for the destitute.

4695.en: There are many Signs on earth for those of sure faith,

4696.en: and also in your own selves. Do you not see?

4697.en: And in heaven is your provision and also what you are being promised.

4698.arabic: فورب السما والارض انه لحق مثل ما انكم تنطقون
4698.en: So, by the Lord of the heaven and the earth, this is certainly true, as true as the fact of your speaking.

4699.arabic: هل اتىك حديث ضيف ابرهيم المكرمين
4699.en: (O Prophet), did the story of Abraham's honoured guests reach you?

4700.arabic: اذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلما قال سلم قوم منكرون
4700.en: When they came to him, they said: “Peace”; he said: “Peace also be to you; (you seem to be) a group of strangers.”

4701.arabic: فراغ الى اهله فجا بعجل سمين
4701.en: Then he went back to his family and brought a fat roasted calf

4702.en: and laid it before them, saying: “Will you not eat?”

4703.arabic: فاوجس منهم خيفة قالوا لا تخف وبشروه بغلم عليم
4703.en: Then he became afraid of them. They said: “Fear not,” and announced to him the good news of (the birth of) a boy endowed with knowledge.

4704.arabic: فاقبلت امراته فى صرة فصكت وجهها وقالت عجوز عقيم
4704.en: So hearing his wife went forth shouting. She struck her face and exclaimed: “A barren old woman am I.”

4705.arabic: قالوا كذلك قال ربك انه هو الحكيم العليم
4705.en: They said: “So has your Lord said (that you shall have a boy). Surely He is Most Wise, All#Knowing.”

4706.en: Abraham said: “Envoys (of Allah), what is your errand?”

4707.arabic: قالوا انا ارسلنا الى قوم مجرمين
4707.en: They replied: “Behold, we have been sent to a wicked people

4708.en: that we may unleash a shower of clay#stones

4709.en: marked by your Lord upon those who go beyond the limits.”

4710.arabic: فاخرجنا من كان فيها من المؤمنين
4710.en: Then We evacuated there from all the believers

4711.arabic: فما وجدنا فيها غير بيت من المسلمين
4711.en: – and We did not find there any, apart from a single house of Muslims –

4712.arabic: وتركنا فيها اية للذين يخافون العذاب الاليم
4712.en: and We left therein a Sign for those who fear the grievous chastisement.

4713.arabic: وفى موسى اذ ارسلنه الى فرعون بسلطن مبين
4713.en: There is also a Sign for you in the story of Moses when We sent him with a clear authority to Pharaoh.

4714.arabic: فتولى بركنه وقال سحر او مجنون
4714.en: But Pharaoh turned away, showing arrogance on account of his power, and said (about Moses): “He is either a sorcerer or a madman.”

4715.arabic: فاخذنه وجنوده فنبذنهم فى اليم وهو مليم
4715.en: So We seized him and his hosts, and cast them into the sea. He became an object of much blame.

4716.arabic: وفى عاد اذ ارسلنا عليهم الريح العقيم
4716.en: There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Ad, when We let loose upon them an ominous wind

4717.arabic: ما تذر من شى اتت عليه الا جعلته كالرميم
4717.en: that left nothing that it came upon without reducing it to rubble.

4718.arabic: وفى ثمود اذ قيل لهم تمتعوا حتى حين
4718.en: There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Thamud. They were told: “Enjoy yourselves for a while.”

4719.arabic: فعتوا عن امر ربهم فاخذتهم الصعقة وهم ينظرون
4719.en: But they brazenly disobeyed their Lord's command, and then a sudden chastisement overtook them while they looked on.

4720.arabic: فما استطعوا من قيام وما كانوا منتصرين
4720.en: They were unable even to stand up or protect themselves.

4721.arabic: وقوم نوح من قبل انهم كانوا قوما فسقين
4721.en: Before all these We destroyed the people of Noah: they were a wicked people.

4722.en: And heaven – We made it with Our Own Power and We have the Power to do so.

4723.en: And the earth – We spread it out, and how well have We smoothed it!

4724.arabic: ومن كل شى خلقنا زوجين لعلكم تذكرون
4724.en: And of everything We have created pairs; perhaps you will take heed.

4725.arabic: ففروا الى الله انى لكم منه نذير مبين
4725.en: Flee, therefore, to Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him;

4726.arabic: ولا تجعلوا مع الله الها اخر انى لكم منه نذير مبين
4726.en: and do not set up any deity with Allah. Surely I am a clear warner to you from Him.

4727.arabic: كذلك ما اتى الذين من قبلهم من رسول الا قالوا ساحر او مجنون
4727.en: Thus has it been (in the past): never did a Messenger come to the nations that preceded them but they said: “(He is) a sorcerer, or a mad#man.”

4728.arabic: اتواصوا به بل هم قوم طاغون
4728.en: Have they arrived at a common understanding concerning this? No; but they are a people given to transgression.

4729.en: So turn your attention away from them; you shall incur no blame.

4730.en: Do, however, keep exhorting them; for exhortation benefits those endowed with faith.

4731.arabic: وما خلقت الجن والانس الا ليعبدون
4731.en: I created the jinn and humans for nothing else but that they may serve Me;

4732.arabic: ما اريد منهم من رزق وما اريد ان يطعمون
4732.en: I desire from them no provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

4733.arabic: ان الله هو الرزاق ذو القوة المتين
4733.en: Surely Allah is the Bestower of all provision, the Lord of all power, the Strong.

4734.arabic: فان للذين ظلموا ذنوبا مثل ذنوب اصحبهم فلا يستعجلون
4734.en: The wrong#doers shall receive a portion of the chastisements as their fellows (of yore). So let them not rush Me.

4735.arabic: فويل للذين كفروا من يومهم الذى يوعدون
4735.en: Woe, then, betide those who disbelieved in that Day of theirs which they are being asked to hold in dread.

4742.en: verily your Lord's chastisement shall come to pass,

4744.en: (It shall come to pass) on the Day when the heaven will convulse in a great convulsion,

4745.en: and the mountains shall violently fly about.

4746.en: Woe, then, on that Day to those who give the lie (to this Message)

4747.en: and amuse themselves with vain argumentation.

4748.arabic: يوم يدعون الى نار جهنم دعا
4748.en: On the Day when they shall be thrust into Hell with a violent thrust (and shall be told):

4749.arabic: هذه النار التى كنتم بها تكذبون
4749.en: “This is the Hell which you used to give the lie to.”

4750.arabic: افسحر هذا ام انتم لا تبصرون
4750.en: Is this, then, any feat of magic or are you unable to see?

4751.arabic: اصلوها فاصبروا او لا تصبروا سوا عليكم انما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون
4751.en: Go now and burn in it. It is all the same whether you bear it patiently or do not bear it with patience. You are only being recompensed for your deeds.”

4752.en: Surely the God#fearing shall be in Gardens and bliss,

4753.arabic: فكهين بما اتىهم ربهم ووقىهم ربهم عذاب الجحيم
4753.en: enjoying what Allah will have endowed them with; and their Lord will have saved them from the torment of the Blazing Fire.

4754.arabic: كلوا واشربوا هنيـۢا بما كنتم تعملون
4754.en: (They will be told): “Eat and drink to your hearts' content as a reward for your deeds.”

4755.arabic: متكـين على سرر مصفوفة وزوجنهم بحور عين
4755.en: The God#fearing shall be reclining on couches facing each other, and We shall wed them to maidens with large, beautiful eyes.

4756.arabic: والذين امنوا واتبعتهم ذريتهم بايمن الحقنا بهم ذريتهم وما التنهم من عملهم من شى كل امرئۭ بما كسب رهين
4756.en: We shall unite the believers with those descendants of theirs who followed them in their faith, and shall not deny them any part of the reward for their good deeds. Every person is pledged to what he did.

4757.en: We shall provide them in abundance with all kinds of fruit and meat, whatever they may desire.

4758.arabic: يتنزعون فيها كاسا لا لغو فيها ولا تاثيم
4758.en: They shall pass on to one another a cup that will incite neither levity nor sin.

4759.arabic: ويطوف عليهم غلمان لهم كانهم لؤلؤ مكنون
4759.en: Youths as fair as hidden pearls will be set apart to wait upon them; they will be running to and fro to serve them.

4760.en: They will turn to one another and ask (regarding the past events).

4761.arabic: قالوا انا كنا قبل فى اهلنا مشفقين
4761.en: They will say: “When we were living before among our kinsfolk we lived in constant fear (of Allah's displeasure).

4762.arabic: فمن الله علينا ووقىنا عذاب السموم
4762.en: Then Allah graced us with His favour and saved us from the chastisement of the scorching wind.

4763.arabic: انا كنا من قبل ندعوه انه هو البر الرحيم
4763.en: Formerly we had always prayed to Him. Surely He is Most Benign, Most Compassionate.”

4764.arabic: فذكر فما انت بنعمت ربك بكاهن ولا مجنون
4764.en: So exhort (them, O Prophet), for by your Lord's Grace, you are neither a soothsayer nor a madman.

4765.arabic: ام يقولون شاعر نتربص به ريب المنون
4765.en: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await an adverse turn of fortune.”

4766.arabic: قل تربصوا فانى معكم من المتربصين
4766.en: Tell them: “Wait; I too am waiting with you.”

4767.arabic: ام تامرهم احلمهم بهذا ام هم قوم طاغون
4767.en: Do their minds prompt them to say such things, or are they a people immersed in transgression?”

4768.arabic: ام يقولون تقوله بل لا يؤمنون
4768.en: Do they say: “He has himself fabricated the Qur'an?” No; the truth is that they are altogether averse to believing.

4769.arabic: فلياتوا بحديث مثله ان كانوا صدقين
4769.en: (If they are truthful in this), then let them produce a discourse of similar splendour.

4770.arabic: ام خلقوا من غير شى ام هم الخلقون
4770.en: Did they come into being without any creator? Or were they their own creators?

4771.arabic: ام خلقوا السموت والارض بل لا يوقنون
4771.en: Or is it they who created the heavens and the earth? No; the truth is that they lack sure faith.

4772.arabic: ام عندهم خزائن ربك ام هم المصۣيطرون
4772.en: Or do they have your Lord's treasures in their keeping? Or have absolute authority over them?

4773.arabic: ام لهم سلم يستمعون فيه فليات مستمعهم بسلطن مبين
4773.en: Or do they have a ladder whereon they can climb and attempt to listen (to what is transpiring in the Higher Realm)? Then, let any of them who has listened to it produce a clear proof of it.

4774.en: Or does Allah have daughters whereas you have sons?

4775.arabic: ام تسـلهم اجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون
4775.en: Or is it that you ask of them any recompense so that they should fear to be weighed down under the burden of debt?

4776.en: Or is it that they have access to (the Truths in) the realm beyond sense#perception which they are writing down?

4777.arabic: ام يريدون كيدا فالذين كفروا هم المكيدون
4777.en: Or are they contriving a stratagem against you? If so, that stratagem will rebound against the unbelievers.

4778.arabic: ام لهم اله غير الله سبحن الله عما يشركون
4778.en: Do they have any god other than Allah? Exalted be Allah above whatever they associate (with Him in His Divinity).

4779.arabic: وان يروا كسفا من السما ساقطا يقولوا سحاب مركوم
4779.en: (So obstinate are they that) even if they were to see some fragments of the sky falling down they would still say: “It is only a mass of cloud.”

4780.arabic: فذرهم حتى يلقوا يومهم الذى فيه يصعقون
4780.en: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs when they shall be struck down,

4781.arabic: يوم لا يغنى عنهم كيدهم شيـا ولا هم ينصرون
4781.en: when their stratagem shall be of no avail to them, nor shall they be succoured.

4782.arabic: وان للذين ظلموا عذابا دون ذلك ولكن اكثرهم لا يعلمون
4782.en: Surely a chastisement awaits the wrong#doers even before the coming of that Day; but most of them do not know.

4783.arabic: واصبر لحكم ربك فانك باعيننا وسبح بحمد ربك حين تقوم
4783.en: Be patient, then, (O Prophet), until the judgement of your Lord comes. For surely you are before Our eyes. And celebrate the praise of your Lord when you rise,

4784.en: and also celebrate His praise at night, and at the retreat of the stars.

4785.en: By the star when it sets:

4786.en: your companion has neither strayed nor is he deluded;

4787.en: nor does he speak out of his desire.

4788.en: This is nothing but a revelation that is conveyed to him,

4789.en: something that a very powerful one has imparted to him,

4790.en: one endowed with immense wisdom. He came forth and stood poised,

4792.en: Then he drew near and hung above suspended,

4793.en: until he was two bows' length away, or nearer.

4794.en: Then he revealed to Allah's servant whatever he had to reveal.

4795.en: His heart added no untruth to what he saw.

4796.en: Are you, then, going to contend with him regarding what he sees with his eyes?

4797.en: Indeed he saw him a second time,

4798.en: by the lote#tree at the farthest boundary,

4799.en: near which is the Garden of Abode.

4800.en: (This was) when the lote#tree was covered with that which covered it.

4801.en: His eye did not waver, nor did it stray,

4802.arabic: لقد راى من ايت ربه الكبرى
4802.en: and he certainly saw some of the greatest Signs of His Lord.

4803.en: Have you ever thought about al#Lat and al#Uzza,

4804.en: and about the third deity, al#Manat?

4805.en: Shall you have the male issues, and He the female issues?

4806.en: That is indeed an unfair division!

4807.arabic: ان هى الا اسما سميتموها انتم واباؤكم ما انزل الله بها من سلطن ان يتبعون الا الظن وما تهوى الانفس ولقد جاهم من ربهم الهدى
4807.en: These are nothing but names that you and your forefathers have invented, for which Allah has sent down no authority. They are merely following their conjectures and their carnal desires although guidance has come to them from their Lord.

4808.en: Does man imagine that whatever he wishes for is right for him?

4809.en: To Allah belong both the Next World and the present.

4810.arabic: وكم من ملك فى السموت لا تغنى شفعتهم شيـا الا من بعد ان ياذن الله لمن يشا ويرضى
4810.en: Numerous are the angels in the heavens; yet their intercession shall be of no avail, except in regard to those whom He grants the leave of intercession and whose plea He is pleased to accept.

4811.arabic: ان الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة ليسمون الملئكة تسمية الانثى
4811.en: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give angels the names of females,

4812.arabic: وما لهم به من علم ان يتبعون الا الظن وان الظن لا يغنى من الحق شيـا
4812.en: although they have no knowledge regarding that. They only follow their conjecture and conjecture can never take the place of the Truth.

4813.arabic: فاعرض عن من تولى عن ذكرنا ولم يرد الا الحيوة الدنيا
4813.en: So leave alone those who turn away from the remembrance of Us and who seek nothing but the life of the world –

4814.arabic: ذلك مبلغهم من العلم ان ربك هو اعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو اعلم بمن اهتدى
4814.en: that being the utmost of their knowledge. Surely your Lord fully knows those who have strayed away from His Path and He also fully knows those who are rightly guided.

4815.arabic: ولله ما فى السموت وما فى الارض ليجزى الذين اسـوا بما عملوا ويجزى الذين احسنوا بالحسنى
4815.en: To Allah alone belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. He will requite the evil#doers for their deeds and bestow a goodly reward on those who have done good,

4816.arabic: الذين يجتنبون كبئر الاثم والفوحش الا اللمم ان ربك وسع المغفرة هو اعلم بكم اذ انشاكم من الارض واذ انتم اجنة فى بطون امهتكم فلا تزكوا انفسكم هو اعلم بمن اتقى
4816.en: on those who avoid grave sins and shameful deeds, even if they may sometimes stumble into lesser offences. Surely your Lord is abounding in His Forgiveness. Very well is He aware of you since He produced you from the earth, and while you were still in your mothers' wombs and not yet born. So do not boastfully claim yourselves to be purified. He fully knows those that are truly Godfearing.

4817.en: (O Prophet), did you see him who turned away (from the Path of Allah),

4818.en: who gave a little, and then stopped?

4819.en: Does he have any knowledge of the world beyond the ken of sense#perception, and therefore, clearly sees (the Truth)?

4820.arabic: ام لم ينبا بما فى صحف موسى
4820.en: Has he not been informed of what is in the Scrolls of Moses,

4821.en: and of Abraham, who lived up to the trust?

4822.en: “That no bearer of a burden shall bear the burden of another,

4823.arabic: وان ليس للانسن الا ما سعى
4823.en: and that man shall have nothing but what he has striven for,

4824.en: and that (the result of) his striving shall soon be seen,

4825.en: and that he shall then be fully recompensed,

4826.en: and that the final end is with your Lord,

4827.en: and that He it is Who causes people to laugh and to cry,

4828.en: and that He it is Who causes death and grants life,

4829.en: and He it is Who created the two kinds, the male and the female,

4830.en: from a drop of sperm when it was emitted,

4831.en: and that it is for Him to grant the second life,

4832.en: that He it is Who bestowed wealth and riches,

4833.en: that He is the Lord of Sirius,

4834.en: that He it is Who destroyed the ancient 'Ad,

4835.en: and Thamud, leaving no trace of them,

4836.arabic: وقوم نوح من قبل انهم كانوا هم اظلم واطغى
4836.en: and that He it is Who destroyed the people of Noah before for they were much given to iniquity and transgression.

4837.en: And He brought perdition upon the subverted cities

4838.en: and caused them to be covered with that which He covered them with.

4839.en: So, which of your Lord's bounties will you doubt?”

4840.en: This is a warning among the warnings of yore.

4841.en: The imminent Hour has drawn near,

4842.arabic: ليس لها من دون الله كاشفة
4842.en: and none but Allah can avert it.

4843.en: Will you, then, wonder at this?

4844.en: Will you laugh at it rather than weep?

4845.en: Will you occupy yourselves simply in merriment?

4846.en: Prostrate yourselves before Allah, and serve Him.

4847.en: The Hour of Resurrection drew near and the moon split asunder.

4848.arabic: وان يروا اية يعرضوا ويقولوا سحر مستمر
4848.en: (Regardless of any Signs these people see), they turn away and say: “This is an ongoing sorcery.”

4849.arabic: وكذبوا واتبعوا اهواهم وكل امر مستقر
4849.en: They also gave the lie to (the splitting asunder of the moon) and only followed their desires. Yet everything is destined to reach an end.

4850.arabic: ولقد جاهم من الانبا ما فيه مزدجر
4850.en: Surely there came to them narratives (of the ancient nations) that should suffice to deter (them from transgression),

4851.en: narratives that are full of consummate wisdom. But warnings do not avail them.

4852.arabic: فتول عنهم يوم يدع الداع الى شى نكر
4852.en: So turn away from them, (O Prophet). On the Day when a caller shall call them to a thing most terrible,

4853.arabic: خشعا ابصرهم يخرجون من الاجداث كانهم جراد منتشر
4853.en: with down#cast eyes they shall go forth from their graves, as though they were scattered locusts.

4854.arabic: مهطعين الى الداع يقول الكفرون هذا يوم عسر
4854.en: They shall be hurrying forth towards the caller, and the unbelievers (who had once denied this Day), will say: “This is a woeful Day.”

4855.arabic: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح فكذبوا عبدنا وقالوا مجنون وازدجر
4855.en: Before them Noah's people also gave the lie (to his Message). They rejected Our servant as a liar, saying: “He is a madman”; and he was rebuffed.

4856.en: Then he called upon His Lord: “Verily I am vanquished; so come You to my aid.”

4857.en: Thereupon We opened the gates of the sky for water to pour down,

4858.arabic: وفجرنا الارض عيونا فالتقى الما على امر قد قدر
4858.en: and We made the earth burst forth with springs, and all this water converged to fulfil that which had been decreed.

4859.en: And We bore Noah on the vessel built of planks and nails,

4860.arabic: تجرى باعيننا جزا لمن كان كفر
4860.en: which sailed on under Our supervision: a reward for him who had been shown ingratitude.

4861.arabic: ولقد تركنها اية فهل من مدكر
4861.en: And We left the Ark as a Sign. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

4862.en: So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

4863.arabic: ولقد يسرنا القران للذكر فهل من مدكر
4863.en: We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

4864.arabic: كذبت عاد فكيف كان عذابى ونذر
4864.en: 'Ad also gave the lie (to Hud). So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

4865.arabic: انا ارسلنا عليهم ريحا صرصرا فى يوم نحس مستمر
4865.en: We sent a tumultuous wind against them on a day of unremitting misfortune,

4866.arabic: تنزع الناس كانهم اعجاز نخل منقعر
4866.en: which tore people away and hurled them as though they were trunks of uprooted palm#trees.

4867.en: So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

4868.arabic: ولقد يسرنا القران للذكر فهل من مدكر
4868.en: We have made the Qur'an easy to derive lessons from. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

4869.en: Thamud gave the lie to the warnings,

4870.arabic: فقالوا ابشرا منا وحدا نتبعه انا اذا لفى ضلل وسعر
4870.en: saying: “Are we to follow a single mortal, one from among ourselves? If we do that, we shall surely be in error and folly.

4871.arabic: القى الذكر عليه من بيننا بل هو كذاب اشر
4871.en: Was there none but he to whom the Reminder could be vouchsafed excluding all others? Nay; he is an insolent liar.”

4872.en: (We told Our Messenger): “Tomorrow they shall know who is the insolent liar.

4873.arabic: انا مرسلوا الناقة فتنة لهم فارتقبهم واصطبر
4873.en: We shall send the she#camel as a trial for them; so watch their end with patience.

4874.arabic: ونبئهم ان الما قسمة بينهم كل شرب محتضر
4874.en: Let them know that the water should be divided between them and the she#camel, each availing their turn.”

4875.en: Eventually, they summoned their companion, and he undertook the (outrageous) task and hamstrung the she#camel.

4876.en: So how awesome were My chastisement and My warnings!

4877.arabic: انا ارسلنا عليهم صيحة وحدة فكانوا كهشيم المحتظر
4877.en: Behold, We sent a single Blast against them, and they became like the trampled twigs of a sheep pen#builder.

4878.arabic: ولقد يسرنا القران للذكر فهل من مدكر
4878.en: Surely We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

4879.en: Lot's people also gave the lie to the warnings,

4880.arabic: انا ارسلنا عليهم حاصبا الا ال لوط نجينهم بسحر
4880.en: and behold, We let loose upon them a tempest which rained stones upon them, except upon Lot's household whom We rescued in the last hours of the night

4881.arabic: نعمة من عندنا كذلك نجزى من شكر
4881.en: as a favour from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.

4882.en: Surely Lot warned his people that We shall seize them (with Our chastisement), but they doubted the warnings.

4883.arabic: ولقد رودوه عن ضيفه فطمسنا اعينهم فذوقوا عذابى ونذر
4883.en: Then they even solicited his guests from him, whereupon We blotted out their eyes, (telling them): “Now have a taste of My chastisement and My warnings.”

4884.en: Indeed an abiding chastisement came upon them in the morning.

4885.en: So have a taste of My chastisement and My warnings.

4886.arabic: ولقد يسرنا القران للذكر فهل من مدكر
4886.en: Surely We have made this Qur'an easy as a reminder. Is there, then, any who will take heed?

4887.en: Warnings also came to the Pharaonites,

4888.arabic: كذبوا بـايتنا كلها فاخذنهم اخذ عزيز مقتدر
4888.en: but they gave the lie to Our Signs, to all of them. Thereupon We seized them with the seizing of the Most Mighty, the Most Powerful.

4889.arabic: اكفاركم خير من اولئكم ام لكم براة فى الزبر
4889.en: Are your unbelievers (of Makkah) any better than they? Or have you been granted any immunity in the Scriptures?

4890.en: Or do they say: “We are a strong legion, strong enough for victory?”

4891.en: Soon shall this legion be routed and shall turn their backs and flee.

4892.arabic: بل الساعة موعدهم والساعة ادهى وامر
4892.en: Nay; the Hour of Doom is their appointed time, and the Hour shall be more calamitous and bitter.

4893.en: The evil#doers are victims of error and madness.

4894.arabic: يوم يسحبون فى النار على وجوههم ذوقوا مس سقر
4894.en: There shall come a Day when they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire and will be told: “Now taste the flame of Hell.”

4895.en: We have created everything in a determined measure.

4896.arabic: وما امرنا الا وحدة كلمح بالبصر
4896.en: Our command consists of only one Word which is carried out in the twinkling of an eye.

4897.arabic: ولقد اهلكنا اشياعكم فهل من مدكر
4897.en: We did indeed destroy many like you. Is there, then, any who will heed?

4898.en: All their deeds are recorded in the Scrolls;

4899.en: everything large or small, is duly inscribed.

4900.en: Surely those who shun disobedience will dwell amidst Gardens and running streams

4901.arabic: فى مقعد صدق عند مليك مقتدرۭ
4901.en: where they will be honourably seated in the presence of a King, Mighty in Power.

4905.en: and has taught him articulate speech.

4906.en: The sun and the moon follow a reckoning,

4907.en: and the stars and the trees all prostrate themselves,

4908.en: and He has raised up the heaven and has set a balance

4909.en: that you may not transgress in the balance,

4910.arabic: واقيموا الوزن بالقسط ولا تخسروا الميزان
4910.en: but weigh things equitably and skimp not in the balance.

4911.en: And He has set up the earth for all beings.

4912.en: Therein are fruit and palm#trees with their dates in sheaths,

4913.en: and a variety of corn with both husk and grain.

4914.en: Which of the bounties of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4915.en: He has created man from dry, rotten clay like the potter's,

4916.arabic: وخلق الجان من مارج من نار
4916.en: and has created the jinn from the flame of fire.

4917.en: Which of the wonders of your Lord's power will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4918.en: Lord of the two easts and of the two wests is He.

4919.en: Which of the powers of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4920.en: He unleashed the two seas so that they merge together,

4921.en: and yet there is a barrier between them which they may not overstep.

4922.en: Which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4923.en: From these seas come forth pearls and coral.

4924.en: Which of the wonders of your Lord's power will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4925.arabic: وله الجوار المنشـات فى البحر كالاعلم
4925.en: His are the ships, towering on the sea like mountains.

4926.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4927.en: All that is on earth will perish,

4928.arabic: ويبقى وجه ربك ذو الجلل والاكرام
4928.en: only the Person of your Lord, full of majesty and splendour, will endure.

4929.en: So which of the wonders of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4930.arabic: يسـله من فى السموت والارض كل يوم هو فى شان
4930.en: All in the heavens and the earth entreat Him for their needs; a new, mighty task engages Him each day.

4931.en: Which of your Lord's laudable attributes will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4932.en: O you twain, who are a burden (on the earth), We shall attend to you and call you to account.

4933.en: (We shall then see), which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4934.arabic: يمعشر الجن والانس ان استطعتم ان تنفذوا من اقطار السموت والارض فانفذوا لا تنفذون الا بسلطن
4934.en: O company of jinn and men, if you have the power to go beyond the bounds of the heavens and the earth, go beyond them! Yet you will be unable to go beyond them for that requires infinite power.

4935.en: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4936.arabic: يرسل عليكما شواظ من نار ونحاس فلا تنتصران
4936.en: (If you so venture) a flame of fire and smoke shall be lashed at you, which you shall be unable to withstand.

4937.en: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4938.arabic: فاذا انشقت السما فكانت وردة كالدهان
4938.en: (What will happen) when the heaven will be split asunder and will become crimson like leather?

4939.en: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4940.arabic: فيومئذ لا يسـل عن ذنبه انس ولا جان
4940.en: On that Day there will be no need to ask either men or jinn about their sins.

4941.en: (We shall see) which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4942.arabic: يعرف المجرمون بسيمهم فيؤخذ بالنوصى والاقدام
4942.en: The culprits shall be known by their marks, and shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.

4943.en: Which of the powers of your Lord, will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4944.arabic: هذه جهنم التى يكذب بها المجرمون
4944.en: (It will be said): “This is the Hell that the culprits had cried lies to.

4945.en: They will keep circling around between Hell and boiling water.

4946.en: Which of your Lord's powers will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4947.en: For any who fears to stand before his Lord are two Gardens.

4948.en: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4949.en: These Gardens will abound in green, blooming branches.

4950.en: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4951.en: In each of the two Gardens are two flowing springs.

4952.en: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4953.en: In both these is a pair of every fruit.

4954.en: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4955.arabic: متكـين على فرشۭ بطائنها من استبرق وجنى الجنتين دان
4955.en: They shall recline on couches lined with brocade, and within reach shall hang the fruits of the two Gardens.

4956.en: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4957.arabic: فيهن قصرت الطرف لم يطمثهن انس قبلهم ولا جان
4957.en: In the midst of these shall be maidens with modest, restrained glances; maidens whom no man or jinn has ever touched before.

4958.en: Which of your Lord's favours will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4960.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4961.en: Can the reward of goodness be any other than goodness?

4962.en: Which of the laudable attributes of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4963.en: And besides these two there shall be two other Gardens.

4964.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4965.en: Two Gardens, dark green and fresh.

4966.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4967.en: In them will be two gushing springs.

4968.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4969.en: Therein will be fruits and dates and pomegranates.

4970.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4971.en: In the midst of these will be maidens, good and comely.

4972.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4973.en: There shall be maidens sheltered in tents.

4974.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4975.arabic: لم يطمثهن انس قبلهم ولا جان
4975.en: No man or jinn ever touched them before.

4976.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4977.arabic: متكـين على رفرف خضر وعبقرى حسان
4977.en: They shall be reclining on green cushions and splendid carpets.

4978.en: Which of the favours of your Lord will you twain – you men and jinn – then deny?

4979.arabic: تبرك اسم ربك ذى الجلل والاكرام
4979.en: Blessed be the name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Glory.

4980.en: When the Event will come to pass

4981.en: – and then there will be no one to deny its occurrence –

4982.en: (a calamitous Event) that shall turn things upside down:

4983.en: when the earth will suddenly shake with a terrible shaking,

4985.en: and will scatter abroad into fine dust.

4986.en: You shall then become three groups.

4987.en: The People on the Right: and how fortunate will be the People on the Right!

4988.en: And the People on the Left: and how miserable will be the People on the Left!

4989.en: As for the Foremost, they will be the foremost!

4990.en: They shall be near#stationed (to their Lord),

4993.en: and a few from later times.

4994.en: They (will be seated) on gold#encrusted couches,

4995.en: reclining on them, arrayed face to face;

4996.en: immortal youths shall go about them

4997.en: with goblets and ewers and a cup filled with a drink drawn from a running spring,

4998.en: a drink by which their minds will not be clouded nor will it cause drunkenness;

4999.en: they will also go about them with the fruits of which they may choose,

5000.en: and with the flesh of any fowl that they may desire to eat;

5001.en: and there shall be wide#eyed maidens,

5002.en: beautiful as pearls hidden in their shells.

5003.en: All this shall be theirs as a reward for their deeds.

5004.arabic: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا تاثيما
5004.en: There they shall hear no idle talk nor any sinful speech.

5005.en: All talk will be sound and upright.

5006.en: As for the People on the Right, how fortunate shall be the people on the Right!

5007.en: They shall be in the midst of thornless lote trees,

5013.en: They shall be on upraised couches,

5014.en: and their spouses We shall have brought them into being afresh,

5015.en: and shall have made them virgins,

5016.en: intensely loving and of matching age.

5017.en: All this will be for the People on the Right;

5018.en: a large throng from the ancients,

5019.en: and also a large throng from those of later times.

5020.en: As for the People on the Left: how miserable will be the People on the Left!

5021.en: They will be in the midst of scorching wind and boiling water,

5022.en: and a shade of thick, pitch#black smoke,

5023.en: which will neither be cool nor soothing.

5024.en: Surely they had lived before in luxury,

5025.en: and had persisted in the Great Sin.

5026.arabic: وكانوا يقولون ائذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظما انا لمبعوثون
5026.en: They used to say: “What! Once we are dead and are reduced to dust and bones, shall we still be raised to a new life from the dead?

5028.en: Tell them, (O Prophet): “The earlier ones and the later ones

5029.en: shall all be brought together on an appointed Day.

5030.en: Then you, the erring ones and those that gave the lie to the Truth,

5031.en: shall all eat from the Tree of al#Zaqqum,

5033.en: and thereupon you shall drink boiling water,

5034.en: drinking it as thirsty camels do.”

5035.en: Thus shall they be entertained on the Day of Recompense.

5036.en: We have created you, then why would you not confirm it?

5037.en: Did you ever consider the sperm that you emit?

5038.en: Do you create a child out of it, or are We its creators?

5039.arabic: نحن قدرنا بينكم الموت وما نحن بمسبوقين
5039.en: It is We Who ordained death upon you and We are not to be frustrated.

5040.arabic: على ان نبدل امثلكم وننشئكم فى ما لا تعلمون
5040.en: Had We so wished, nothing could have hindered Us from replacing you by others like yourselves, or transforming you into beings you know nothing about.

5041.arabic: ولقد علمتم النشاة الاولى فلولا تذكرون
5041.en: You are well aware of the first creation; then, do you learn no lesson from it?

5042.en: Have you considered the seeds you till?

5043.en: Is it you or We Who make them grow?

5044.arabic: لو نشا لجعلنه حطما فظلتم تفكهون
5044.en: If We so wished, We could have reduced your harvest to rubble, and you would have been left wonder#struck to exclaim:

5047.en: Did you cast a good look at the water that you drink?

5048.arabic: انتم انزلتموه من المزن ام نحن المنزلون
5048.en: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds or is it We Who brought it down?

5049.arabic: لو نشا جعلنه اجاجا فلولا تشكرون
5049.en: If We had so pleased, We could have made it bitter. So why would you not give thanks?

5050.en: Did you consider the fire which you kindle?

5051.arabic: انتم انشاتم شجرتها ام نحن المنشـون
5051.en: Did you make its tree grow or was it We Who made it grow?

5052.en: We made it a reminder and a provision for the needy.

5053.en: Glorify, then, (O Prophet), the name of your Great Lord.

5054.en: No! I swear by the positions of the stars –

5055.en: and this is indeed a mighty oath, if only you knew –

5056.en: that this indeed is a noble Qur'an,

5058.en: which none but the pure may touch;

5059.en: a revelation from the Lord of the Universe.

5060.en: Do you, then, take this discourse in light esteem,

5061.en: and your portion in it is simply that you denounce it as false?

5062.en: Why, then, when the soul leaps up to the throat,

5063.en: the while you are helplessly watching that he is on the verge of death,

5064.arabic: ونحن اقرب اليه منكم ولكن لا تبصرون
5064.en: – at that moment when We are closer to him than you, although you do not see (Us)

5065.en: if you are not subject to anyone's authority,

5066.en: why are you then not able to bring them back to life if you are truthful?

5067.en: So if he is one of those who are near#stationed (to Allah),

5068.en: then happiness and delight and Gardens of Bliss are his.

5069.arabic: واما ان كان من اصحب اليمين
5069.en: And if he is one of the People on the Right,

5070.en: he will be welcomed by the words: “Peace to you” from the People on the Right.

5071.arabic: واما ان كان من المكذبين الضالين
5071.en: And if he is one of those who give the lie (to this Message) and go astray,

5072.en: then he will be served boiling water,

5073.en: and will be scorched by the Fire.

5074.en: That indeed is the absolute truth.

5075.en: So glorify the name of your Great Lord.

5076.arabic: سبح لله ما فى السموت والارض وهو العزيز الحكيم
5076.en: All that is in the heavens and the earth extols the glory of Allah. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

5077.arabic: له ملك السموت والارض يحى ويميت وهو على كل شى قدير
5077.en: His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death, and He has power over everything.

5078.arabic: هو الاول والاخر والظهر والباطن وهو بكل شى عليم
5078.en: He is the First and the Last, and the Manifest and the Hidden, and He has knowledge of everything.

5079.arabic: هو الذى خلق السموت والارض فى ستة ايام ثم استوى على العرش يعلم ما يلج فى الارض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السما وما يعرج فيها وهو معكم اين ما كنتم والله بما تعملون بصير
5079.en: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself on the Throne. He knows all that enters the earth and all that comes forth from it, and all that comes down from the heaven and all that goes up to it. He is with you wherever you are. Allah sees all that you do.

5080.arabic: له ملك السموت والارض والى الله ترجع الامور
5080.en: His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Him are all matters referred (for judgement).

5081.arabic: يولج اليل فى النهار ويولج النهار فى اليل وهو عليمۢ بذات الصدور
5081.en: He causes the night to pass into the day, and causes the day to pass into the night, and He fully knows all that is hidden in the breasts of people.

5082.arabic: امنوا بالله ورسوله وانفقوا مما جعلكم مستخلفين فيه فالذين امنوا منكم وانفقوا لهم اجر كبير
5082.en: Believe in Allah and in His Messenger and expend of what He has entrusted to you. A great reward awaits those of you who believe and spend their wealth.

5083.arabic: وما لكم لا تؤمنون بالله والرسول يدعوكم لتؤمنوا بربكم وقد اخذ ميثقكم ان كنتم مؤمنين
5083.en: How is it that you do not believe in Allah when the Messenger calls you to believe in your Lord and although he has taken a covenant from you, if indeed you are believers?

5084.arabic: هو الذى ينزل على عبده ايت بينت ليخرجكم من الظلمت الى النور وان الله بكم لروف رحيم
5084.en: He it is Who sends down Clear Signs to His servant so as to bring you out from darkness into light. Surely Allah is Most Kind and Most Compassionate to you.

5085.arabic: وما لكم الا تنفقوا فى سبيل الله ولله ميرث السموت والارض لا يستوى منكم من انفق من قبل الفتح وقتل اولئك اعظم درجة من الذين انفقوا من بعد وقتلوا وكلا وعد الله الحسنى والله بما تعملون خبير
5085.en: How is it that you do not expend in the Way of Allah when to Allah belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth? Those who spent their wealth and took part in fighting before the Victory cannot be equated (with those who spent their wealth and took part in fighting afterwards). They are higher in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards. But to each Allah has promised a good reward. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

5086.arabic: من ذا الذى يقرض الله قرضا حسنا فيضعفه له وله اجر كريم
5086.en: Who is it that will give Allah a beautiful loan? A loan that Allah will repay after increasing it many times and grant him a generous reward.

5087.arabic: يوم ترى المؤمنين والمؤمنت يسعى نورهم بين ايديهم وبايمنهم بشرىكم اليوم جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها ذلك هو الفوز العظيم
5087.en: On that Day you will see believing men and women that their light will be running before them and on their right hands. (They will be told): “A good tiding to you today.” There shall be Gardens beneath which rivers flow; therein they shall abide. That indeed is the great triumph.

5088.arabic: يوم يقول المنفقون والمنفقت للذين امنوا انظرونا نقتبس من نوركم قيل ارجعوا وراكم فالتمسوا نورا فضرب بينهم بسور له بابۢ باطنه فيه الرحمة وظهره من قبله العذاب
5088.en: On that Day the hypocrites, both men and women, shall say to the believers: “Look at us that we may extract some light from your light.” They will be told: “Go back and seek light for yourselves elsewhere.” Then a wall shall be erected between them with a door in it. On the inside of it there will be mercy, and on the outside of it there will be chastisement.

5089.arabic: ينادونهم الم نكن معكم قالوا بلى ولكنكم فتنتم انفسكم وتربصتم وارتبتم وغرتكم الامانى حتى جا امر الله وغركم بالله الغرور
5089.en: The hypocrites will call out to the believers: “Were we not with you?” The believers will reply: “Yes; but you allowed yourselves to succumb to temptations, and you wavered and you remained in doubt and false expectations deluded you until Allah's command came to pass, and the Deluder deluded you concerning Allah.

5090.arabic: فاليوم لا يؤخذ منكم فدية ولا من الذين كفروا ماوىكم النار هى مولىكم وبئس المصير
5090.en: So no ransom shall be accepted from you today, nor from those who disbelieved. You are destined for the Fire. That will be your guardian. And that indeed is a grievous destination.

5091.arabic: الم يان للذين امنوا ان تخشع قلوبهم لذكر الله وما نزل من الحق ولا يكونوا كالذين اوتوا الكتب من قبل فطال عليهم الامد فقست قلوبهم وكثير منهم فسقون
5091.en: Is the time not come that the hearts of the believers should be humbled to Allah's remembrance and to the Truth that He has revealed, and that they should not be like those who were vouchsafed the Book and then a long time elapsed so that their hearts were hardened? A great many of them are now evil#doers.

5092.arabic: اعلموا ان الله يحى الارض بعد موتها قد بينا لكم الايت لعلكم تعقلون
5092.en: Know well that Allah revives the earth after it becomes lifeless. We have clearly shown Our Signs to you, perchance you will use your reason.

5093.arabic: ان المصدقين والمصدقت واقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضعف لهم ولهم اجر كريم
5093.en: Verily those who give alms ## be they men or women, ## and give Allah a beautiful loan shall be repaid after increasing it many times; and theirs shall be a generous reward.

5094.arabic: والذين امنوا بالله ورسله اولئك هم الصديقون والشهدا عند ربهم لهم اجرهم ونورهم والذين كفروا وكذبوا بـايتنا اولئك اصحب الجحيم
5094.en: In Allah's sight only those who truly believe in Allah and His Messengers are utterly truthful and true bearers of witness (for the sake of Allah). For them is their reward and their light. As for those who gave the lie to Our Signs, they are the people of Hell.

5095.arabic: اعلموا انما الحيوة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخرۢ بينكم وتكاثر فى الامول والاولد كمثل غيث اعجب الكفار نباته ثم يهيج فترىه مصفرا ثم يكون حطما وفى الاخرة عذاب شديد ومغفرة من الله ورضون وما الحيوة الدنيا الا متع الغرور
5095.en: Know well that the life of this world is merely sport and diversion and adornment and an object of your boasting with one another, and a rivalry in the multiplication of riches and children. Its likeness is that of rain: when it produces vegetation it delights the tillers. But then it withers and you see it turn yellow, and then it crumbles away. In the Hereafter there is (either) grievous chastisement (or) forgiveness from Allah and (His) good pleasure. The life of this world is nothing but delusion.

5096.arabic: سابقوا الى مغفرة من ربكم وجنة عرضها كعرض السما والارض اعدت للذين امنوا بالله ورسله ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشا والله ذو الفضل العظيم
5096.en: So vie with one another in seeking to attain your Lord's forgiveness and a Garden whose width is as the width of the heaven and the earth, one which has been prepared for those who believe in Allah and His Messengers. That is Allah's bounty which He bestows upon those whom He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding bounty.

5097.arabic: ما اصاب من مصيبة فى الارض ولا فى انفسكم الا فى كتب من قبل ان نبراها ان ذلك على الله يسير
5097.en: No misfortune ever befalls on earth, nor on yourselves but We have inscribed it in the Book before We make it manifest. Surely that is easy for Allah.

5098.arabic: لكيلا تاسوا على ما فاتكم ولا تفرحوا بما اتىكم والله لا يحب كل مختال فخور
5098.en: (We do so) that you may not grieve over the loss you suffer, nor exult over what He gave you. Allah does not love the vainglorious, the boastful,

5099.arabic: الذين يبخلون ويامرون الناس بالبخل ومن يتول فان الله هو الغنى الحميد
5099.en: those who are niggardly and bid others to be niggardly. And he who turns away, (should know that) Allah is Self#Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.

5100.arabic: لقد ارسلنا رسلنا بالبينت وانزلنا معهم الكتب والميزان ليقوم الناس بالقسط وانزلنا الحديد فيه باس شديد ومنفع للناس وليعلم الله من ينصره ورسله بالغيب ان الله قوى عزيز
5100.en: Indeed We sent Our Messengers with Clear Signs, and sent down with them the Book and the Balance that people may uphold justice. And We sent down iron, wherein there is awesome power and many benefits for people, so that Allah may know who, without even having seen Him, helps Him and His Messengers. Surely Allah is Most Strong, Most Mighty.

5101.arabic: ولقد ارسلنا نوحا وابرهيم وجعلنا فى ذريتهما النبوة والكتب فمنهم مهتد وكثير منهم فسقون
5101.en: Indeed We sent forth Noah and Abraham and established in their line Prophecy and the Book. Then some of them embraced the guidance and many of them are wicked.

5102.arabic: ثم قفينا على اثرهم برسلنا وقفينا بعيسى ابن مريم واتينه الانجيل وجعلنا فى قلوب الذين اتبعوه رافة ورحمة ورهبانية ابتدعوها ما كتبنها عليهم الا ابتغا رضون الله فما رعوها حق رعايتها فـاتينا الذين امنوا منهم اجرهم وكثير منهم فسقون
5102.en: In their wake, We sent a succession of Our Messengers, and raised Jesus, son of Mary, after all of them, and bestowed upon him the Evangel, and We set tenderness and mercy in the hearts of those that followed him. As for monasticism, it is they who invented it; We did not prescribe it for them. They themselves invented it in pursuit of Allah's good pleasure, and then they did not observe it as it ought to have been observed. So We gave their reward to those of them that believed. But many of them are wicked.

5103.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اتقوا الله وامنوا برسوله يؤتكم كفلين من رحمته ويجعل لكم نورا تمشون به ويغفر لكم والله غفور رحيم
5103.en: Believers, have fear of Allah and believe in His Messenger, and He will grant you a two#fold portion of His Mercy, and will appoint for you a light whereby you shall walk; and He will forgive you. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5104.arabic: لئلا يعلم اهل الكتب الا يقدرون على شى من فضل الله وان الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشا والله ذو الفضل العظيم
5104.en: (You should do this) so that the People of the Book know that they have no control over Allah's Bounty, and that all bounty is in Allah's Hand; He bestows it on whomsoever He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding bounty.

5105.arabic: قد سمع الله قول التى تجدلك فى زوجها وتشتكى الى الله والله يسمع تحاوركما ان الله سميعۢ بصير
5105.en: Allah has surely heard the words of her who contends with you concerning her husband and complains to Allah. Allah hears what both of you say. Verily Allah is All# Hearing, All#Seeing.

5106.arabic: الذين يظهرون منكم من نسائهم ما هن امهتهم ان امهتهم الا الـى ولدنهم وانهم ليقولون منكرا من القول وزورا وان الله لعفو غفور
5106.en: Those among you who divorce their wives by declaring them to be their mothers, such are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave birth to them. Indeed what they say is highly contemptible and false. Verily Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Forgiving.

5107.arabic: والذين يظهرون من نسائهم ثم يعودون لما قالوا فتحرير رقبة من قبل ان يتماسا ذلكم توعظون به والله بما تعملون خبير
5107.en: Those who declare their wives to be their mothers and thereafter go back on what they have said shall free a slave before they may touch each other. That is what you are exhorted to do. Allah is fully aware of all your deeds.

5108.arabic: فمن لم يجد فصيام شهرين متتابعين من قبل ان يتماسا فمن لم يستطع فاطعام ستين مسكينا ذلك لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتلك حدود الله وللكفرين عذاب اليم
5108.en: And he who does not find a slave (to free), shall fast for two months consecutively before they may touch each other; and he who is unable to do so shall feed sixty needy people. All this is in order that you may truly believe in Allah and His Messenger. These are the bounds set by Allah; and a grievous chastisement awaits the unbelievers.

5109.arabic: ان الذين يحادون الله ورسوله كبتوا كما كبت الذين من قبلهم وقد انزلنا ايت بينت وللكفرين عذاب مهين
5109.en: Verily those who oppose Allah and His Messenger shall be brought low even as those before them were brought low. Surely We have sent down Clear Signs; and a humiliating chastisement awaits the unbelievers;

5110.arabic: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فينبئهم بما عملوا احصىه الله ونسوه والله على كل شى شهيد
5110.en: a chastisement that shall come upon them on the Day when Allah will raise them all to a new life and will inform them of their deeds. Allah has recorded it all while they have forgotten it. Allah is a witness over everything.

5111.arabic: الم تر ان الله يعلم ما فى السموت وما فى الارض ما يكون من نجوى ثلثة الا هو رابعهم ولا خمسة الا هو سادسهم ولا ادنى من ذلك ولا اكثر الا هو معهم اين ما كانوا ثم ينبئهم بما عملوا يوم القيمة ان الله بكل شى عليم
5111.en: Are you not aware that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth? Never is there any whispering among three but He is their fourth; nor among five but He is their sixth; nor fewer nor more but He is with them wherever they may be. And then He will tell them on the Day of Judgement all that they have done. Surely Allah knows everything.

5112.arabic: الم تر الى الذين نهوا عن النجوى ثم يعودون لما نهوا عنه ويتنجون بالاثم والعدون ومعصيت الرسول واذا جاوك حيوك بما لم يحيك به الله ويقولون فى انفسهم لولا يعذبنا الله بما نقول حسبهم جهنم يصلونها فبئس المصير
5112.en: Have you not seen those who were forbidden to whisper and yet they engaged in what they had been forbidden? They secretly converse among themselves concerning sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to you, they greet you in a manner that Allah does not greet you, and say to themselves: “Why does Allah not chastise us for these utterances of ours?” Hell it is that shall suffice them, and in it will they burn. How woeful is their destination!

5113.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اذا تنجيتم فلا تتنجوا بالاثم والعدون ومعصيت الرسول وتنجوا بالبر والتقوى واتقوا الله الذى اليه تحشرون
5113.en: Believers, when you converse in secrecy, let that not be concerning sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger; rather, converse concerning virtue and piety. And fear Allah to Whom all of you shall be mustered.

5114.arabic: انما النجوى من الشيطن ليحزن الذين امنوا وليس بضارهم شيـا الا باذن الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون
5114.en: Whispering is an act of Satan, one that aims at causing grief to the believers; yet without Allah's leave no harm can be caused to them. So in Allah should the believers put all their trust.
