5115.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اذا قيل لكم تفسحوا فى المجلس فافسحوا يفسح الله لكم واذا قيل انشزوا فانشزوا يرفع الله الذين امنوا منكم والذين اوتوا العلم درجت والله بما تعملون خبير
5115.en: Believers, when you are told: “Make room for one another in your assemblies,” then make room; Allah will bestow amplitude on you. And when it is said: “Rise up,” then rise up; Allah will raise to high ranks those of you who believe and are endowed with knowledge. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

5116.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اذا نجيتم الرسول فقدموا بين يدى نجوىكم صدقة ذلك خير لكم واطهر فان لم تجدوا فان الله غفور رحيم
5116.en: Believers, when you come to the Messenger for private consultation, offer some charity before your consultation with him. That is better for you and more conducive to purity. But if you find nothing to offer in charity, then know that Allah is Most Merciful, Most Compassionate.

5117.arabic: اشفقتم ان تقدموا بين يدى نجوىكم صدقت فاذ لم تفعلوا وتاب الله عليكم فاقيموا الصلوة واتوا الزكوة واطيعوا الله ورسوله والله خبيرۢ بما تعملون
5117.en: Are you afraid that you will have to offer charity when you hold private conversation with the Prophet? But if you are unable to do so and Allah pardons you, then establish Prayer and pay Zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

5118.arabic: الم تر الى الذين تولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم ما هم منكم ولا منهم ويحلفون على الكذب وهم يعلمون
5118.en: Do you not see those who took for friends a people whom Allah is wroth with? They neither belong to you nor you to them. They swear to a falsehood, and they do so knowingly.

5119.arabic: اعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا انهم سا ما كانوا يعملون
5119.en: Allah has prepared for them a grievous chastisement. Indeed, evil are the acts in which they are engaged.

5120.arabic: اتخذوا ايمنهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله فلهم عذاب مهين
5120.en: They have taken their oaths as a shield by means of which they hinder people from the Way of Allah. Theirs shall be a humiliating chastisement.

5121.arabic: لن تغنى عنهم امولهم ولا اولدهم من الله شيـا اولئك اصحب النار هم فيها خلدون
5121.en: Neither their possessions nor their offspring will be of any avail to them against Allah. They are the people of the Fire; therein they shall abide.

5122.arabic: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فيحلفون له كما يحلفون لكم ويحسبون انهم على شى الا انهم هم الكذبون
5122.en: On the Day when Allah will raise them all from the dead they will swear before Him as they swear before you today, thinking that this will avail them. Behold, they are utter liars.

5123.arabic: استحوذ عليهم الشيطن فانسىهم ذكر الله اولئك حزب الشيطن الا ان حزب الشيطن هم الخسرون
5123.en: Satan has gained mastery over them and has made them neglect remembering Allah. They are the party of Satan. Behold, the party of Satan will be the losers.

5124.arabic: ان الذين يحادون الله ورسوله اولئك فى الاذلين
5124.en: Verily those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be among the most abject beings.

5125.arabic: كتب الله لاغلبن انا ورسلى ان الله قوى عزيز
5125.en: Allah has written: “Surely I will prevail; I and My Messengers.” Verily Allah is Most Strong, Most Mighty.

5126.arabic: لا تجد قوما يؤمنون بالله واليوم الاخر يوادون من حاد الله ورسوله ولو كانوا اباهم او ابناهم او اخونهم او عشيرتهم اولئك كتب فى قلوبهم الايمن وايدهم بروح منه ويدخلهم جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها رضى الله عنهم ورضوا عنه اولئك حزب الله الا ان حزب الله هم المفلحون
5126.en: You shall not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day befriending those who oppose Allah and His Messenger even though they be their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. He has inscribed faith in their hearts and has strengthened them with a spirit from Him, and He shall make them enter Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Therein they shall abide. Allah is well#pleased with them, and they are well#pleased with Him. They belong to Allah's party. Verily Allah's party shall prosper.

5127.arabic: سبح لله ما فى السموت وما فى الارض وهو العزيز الحكيم
5127.en: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols Allah's Glory: He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

5128.arabic: هو الذى اخرج الذين كفروا من اهل الكتب من ديرهم لاول الحشر ما ظننتم ان يخرجوا وظنوا انهم مانعتهم حصونهم من الله فاتىهم الله من حيث لم يحتسبوا وقذف فى قلوبهم الرعب يخربون بيوتهم بايديهم وايدى المؤمنين فاعتبروا ياولى الابصر
5128.en: He it is Who in the first assault drove forth the People of the Book that disbelieved from their homes at the first gathering of forces. You did not believe that they would leave; while they too thought that their fortresses would defend them against Allah. Then Allah came upon them from whence they did not even imagine, casting such terror into their hearts that they destroyed their homes by their own hands and their destruction was also caused by the hands of the believers. So learn a lesson from this, O you who have perceptive eyes!

5129.arabic: ولولا ان كتب الله عليهم الجلا لعذبهم فى الدنيا ولهم فى الاخرة عذاب النار
5129.en: If Allah had not decreed banishment for them, He would certainly have chastised them in this world. As for the Hereafter, the chastisement of the Fire awaits them.

5130.arabic: ذلك بانهم شاقوا الله ورسوله ومن يشاق الله فان الله شديد العقاب
5130.en: That is because they set themselves against Allah and His Messenger; and whoever sets himself against Allah should know that Allah is surely Most Stern in retribution.

5131.arabic: ما قطعتم من لينة او تركتموها قائمة على اصولها فباذن الله وليخزى الفسقين
5131.en: The palm#trees that you cut down or those that you left standing on their roots, it was by Allah's leave that you did so. (Allah granted you this leave) in order that He might humiliate the evil#doers.

5132.arabic: وما افا الله على رسوله منهم فما اوجفتم عليه من خيل ولا ركاب ولكن الله يسلط رسله على من يشا والله على كل شى قدير
5132.en: Whatever Allah has taken away from them and bestowed (as spoils) on His Messenger for which you spurred neither horses nor camels; but Allah grants authority to His Messengers over whomsoever He pleases. Allah has power over everything.

5133.arabic: ما افا الله على رسوله من اهل القرى فلله وللرسول ولذى القربى واليتمى والمسكين وابن السبيل كى لا يكون دولة بين الاغنيا منكم وما اتىكم الرسول فخذوه وما نهىكم عنه فانتهوا واتقوا الله ان الله شديد العقاب
5133.en: Whatever (from the possessions of the towns people) Allah has bestowed on His Messenger belongs to Allah, and to the Messenger, and to his kinsfolk, and to the orphans, and to the needy, and to the wayfarer so that it may not merely circulate between the rich among you. So accept whatever the Messenger gives you, and refrain from whatever he forbids you. And fear Allah: verily Allah is Most Stern in retribution.

5134.arabic: للفقرا المهجرين الذين اخرجوا من ديرهم وامولهم يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضونا وينصرون الله ورسوله اولئك هم الصدقون
5134.en: It also belongs to the poor Emigrants who have been driven out of their homes and their possessions, those who seek Allah's favour and good pleasure and help Allah and His Messenger. Such are the truthful ones.

5135.arabic: والذين تبوو الدار والايمن من قبلهم يحبون من هاجر اليهم ولا يجدون فى صدورهم حاجة مما اوتوا ويؤثرون على انفسهم ولو كان بهم خصاصة ومن يوق شح نفسه فاولئك هم المفلحون
5135.en: It also belongs to those who were already settled in this abode (of Hijrah) having come to faith before the (arrival of the) Muhajirun (Emigrants). They love those who have migrated to them and do not covet what has been given them; they even prefer them above themselves though poverty be their own lot. And whosoever are preserved from their own greed, such are the ones that will prosper.

5136.arabic: والذين جاو من بعدهم يقولون ربنا اغفر لنا ولاخوننا الذين سبقونا بالايمن ولا تجعل فى قلوبنا غلا للذين امنوا ربنا انك روف رحيم
5136.en: (And it also belongs to) those who came after them, and who pray: “Lord, forgive us and our brethren who have preceded us in faith, and do not put in our hearts any rancour towards those who believe. Lord, You are the Most Tender, the Most Compassionate.”

5137.arabic: الم تر الى الذين نافقوا يقولون لاخونهم الذين كفروا من اهل الكتب لئن اخرجتم لنخرجن معكم ولا نطيع فيكم احدا ابدا وان قوتلتم لننصرنكم والله يشهد انهم لكذبون
5137.en: Did you not see the hypocrites say to their brethren, the unbelievers among the People of the Book: “If you are banished we too will go with you and will not listen to anyone concerning you; and if war is waged against you, we will come to your aid.” But Allah bears witness that they are liars.

5138.arabic: لئن اخرجوا لا يخرجون معهم ولئن قوتلوا لا ينصرونهم ولئن نصروهم ليولن الادبر ثم لا ينصرون
5138.en: To be sure, if they are banished, they will not go with them and if war is waged against them, they will not aid them; and even if they provide any aid to them, they will still turn their backs, and thereafter no aid will be forthcoming to them.

5139.arabic: لانتم اشد رهبة فى صدورهم من الله ذلك بانهم قوم لا يفقهون
5139.en: Surely they have greater dread for you in their hearts than for Allah. That is because they are a people who are devoid of understanding.

5140.arabic: لا يقتلونكم جميعا الا فى قرى محصنة او من ورا جدرۭ باسهم بينهم شديد تحسبهم جميعا وقلوبهم شتى ذلك بانهم قوم لا يعقلون
5140.en: They will never fight against you as a body (in an open battlefield); and if they fight against you they will fight only in fortified townships or from behind walls. Intense is their hostility to one another. You reckon them united while their hearts are divided. That is because they are a people devoid of reason.

5141.arabic: كمثل الذين من قبلهم قريبا ذاقوا وبال امرهم ولهم عذاب اليم
5141.en: They are like those who tasted the evil consequences of their deeds a short while before. A grievous chastisement awaits them.

5142.arabic: كمثل الشيطن اذ قال للانسن اكفر فلما كفر قال انى برى منك انى اخاف الله رب العلمين
5142.en: Their parable is that of Satan when he says to man: “Disbelieve,” but when he disbelieves, he says: “I am quit of you. Verily I fear Allah, the Lord of the Universe.”

5143.arabic: فكان عقبتهما انهما فى النار خلدين فيها وذلك جزؤا الظلمين
5143.en: In the end both will be in the Fire, and will abide in it. That is the recompense of the wrong#doers.

5144.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اتقوا الله ولتنظر نفس ما قدمت لغد واتقوا الله ان الله خبيرۢ بما تعملون
5144.en: Believers, fear Allah and let every person look to what he sends forward for the morrow. Fear Allah; Allah is well aware of all that you do.

5145.arabic: ولا تكونوا كالذين نسوا الله فانسىهم انفسهم اولئك هم الفسقون
5145.en: And be not like those who forgot Allah and so He made them oblivious of themselves. They are the wicked ones.

5146.arabic: لا يستوى اصحب النار واصحب الجنة اصحب الجنة هم الفائزون
5146.en: Those destined for the Fire and those destined for Paradise cannot be alike. Verily it is those destined for Paradise who shall triumph.

5147.arabic: لو انزلنا هذا القران على جبل لرايته خشعا متصدعا من خشية الله وتلك الامثل نضربها للناس لعلهم يتفكرون
5147.en: Had We sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain you would indeed have seen it humbling itself and breaking asunder out of fear of Allah. We propound such parables to people that they may reflect.

5148.arabic: هو الله الذى لا اله الا هو علم الغيب والشهدة هو الرحمن الرحيم
5148.en: He is Allah: there is no god but He; the Knower of the unseen and the manifest, He is the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate.

5149.arabic: هو الله الذى لا اله الا هو الملك القدوس السلم المؤمن المهيمن العزيز الجبار المتكبر سبحن الله عما يشركون
5149.en: He is Allah: there is no god but He: the King, the Holy, the All#Peace, the Giver of security, the Overseer, the Most Mighty, the Overpowering, the All#Great. Exalted be He from whatever they associate with Him.

5150.arabic: هو الله الخلق البارئ المصور له الاسما الحسنى يسبح له ما فى السموت والارض وهو العزيز الحكيم
5150.en: He is Allah, the Planner, Executer and Fashioner of creation. His are the names most beautiful. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth extols His Glory. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

5151.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا تتخذوا عدوى وعدوكم اوليا تلقون اليهم بالمودة وقد كفروا بما جاكم من الحق يخرجون الرسول واياكم ان تؤمنوا بالله ربكم ان كنتم خرجتم جهدا فى سبيلى وابتغا مرضاتى تسرون اليهم بالمودة وانا اعلم بما اخفيتم وما اعلنتم ومن يفعله منكم فقد ضل سوا السبيل
5151.en: Believers, if you have left (your homes and) have come forth to struggle in My Way and to seek My good pleasure, do not make friends with My enemies and your enemies. You befriend them whereas they have spurned the Truth that has come to you; and (such is their enmity that) they expel the Messenger and yourselves for no other reason than that you believe in Allah, your Lord. You send to them messages of friendship in secrecy, although I know well whatever you do, be it secretly or publicly. And whosoever of you does so has indeed strayed far away from the Straight Path.

5152.arabic: ان يثقفوكم يكونوا لكم اعدا ويبسطوا اليكم ايديهم والسنتهم بالسو وودوا لو تكفرون
5152.en: If they could overcome you, they would act as your foes and would hurt you by their hands and tongues, and would love to see you become unbelievers.

5153.arabic: لن تنفعكم ارحامكم ولا اولدكم يوم القيمة يفصل بينكم والله بما تعملون بصير
5153.en: On the Day of Resurrection neither your blood#kindred nor your own offspring will avail you. (On that Day) He will separate you. Allah sees all that you do.

5154.arabic: قد كانت لكم اسوة حسنة فى ابرهيم والذين معه اذ قالوا لقومهم انا برؤا منكم ومما تعبدون من دون الله كفرنا بكم وبدا بيننا وبينكم العدوة والبغضا ابدا حتى تؤمنوا بالله وحده الا قول ابرهيم لابيه لاستغفرن لك وما املك لك من الله من شى ربنا عليك توكلنا واليك انبنا واليك المصير
5154.en: You have a good example in Abraham and his companions: they said to their people: “We totally dissociate ourselves from you, and from the deities that you worship instead of Allah. We renounce you and there has come to be enmity and hatred between us and you until you believe in Allah, the One True God.” (But you may not emulate) Abraham's saying to his father: “Certainly I will ask pardon for you, although I have no power over Allah to obtain anything on your behalf.” (And Abraham and his companions prayed): “Our Lord, in You have we put our trust, and to You have we turned, and to You is our ultimate return.

5155.arabic: ربنا لا تجعلنا فتنة للذين كفروا واغفر لنا ربنا انك انت العزيز الحكيم
5155.en: Our Lord, do not make us a test for the unbelievers, and forgive us, our Lord. Surely You are Most Mighty, Most Wise.”

5156.arabic: لقد كان لكم فيهم اسوة حسنة لمن كان يرجوا الله واليوم الاخر ومن يتول فان الله هو الغنى الحميد
5156.en: Indeed there is a good example for you in them; a good example for anyone who looks forward to Allah and the Last Day. As for him who turns away, Allah is All#Sufficient, Immensely Praiseworthy.

5157.arabic: عسى الله ان يجعل بينكم وبين الذين عاديتم منهم مودة والله قدير والله غفور رحيم
5157.en: It may well be that Allah will implant love between you and those with whom you have had enmity. Allah is Most Powerful; and Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5158.arabic: لا ينهىكم الله عن الذين لم يقتلوكم فى الدين ولم يخرجوكم من ديركم ان تبروهم وتقسطوا اليهم ان الله يحب المقسطين
5158.en: Allah does not forbid that you be kind and just to those who did not fight against you on account of religion, nor drove you out of your homes. Surely Allah loves those who are equitable.

5159.arabic: انما ينهىكم الله عن الذين قتلوكم فى الدين واخرجوكم من ديركم وظهروا على اخراجكم ان تولوهم ومن يتولهم فاولئك هم الظلمون
5159.en: Allah only forbids you to be friends with those who have fought against you on account of religion and who have driven you out of your homes and have abetted in your expulsion. And any who make friends with them, they are the wrong#doers.

5160.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اذا جاكم المؤمنت مهجرت فامتحنوهن الله اعلم بايمنهن فان علمتموهن مؤمنت فلا ترجعوهن الى الكفار لا هن حل لهم ولا هم يحلون لهن واتوهم ما انفقوا ولا جناح عليكم ان تنكحوهن اذا اتيتموهن اجورهن ولا تمسكوا بعصم الكوافر وسـلوا ما انفقتم وليسـلوا ما انفقوا ذلكم حكم الله يحكم بينكم والله عليم حكيم
5160.en: Believers, when believing women come to you as Emigrants (in the cause of faith), examine them. Allah fully knows (the truth) concerning their faith. And when you have ascertained them to be believing women, do not send them back to the unbelievers. Those women are no longer lawful to the unbelievers, nor are those unbelievers lawful to those (believing) women. Give their unbelieving husbands whatever they have spent (as bridal#dues); and there is no offence for you to marry those women if you give them their bridal#dues. Do not hold on to your marriages with unbelieving women: ask for the return of the bridal#due you gave to your unbelieving wives and the unbelievers may ask for the return of the bridal#due they had given to their believing wives. Such is Allah's command. He judges between you. Allah is All#Knowing, Most Wise.

5161.arabic: وان فاتكم شى من ازوجكم الى الكفار فعاقبتم فـاتوا الذين ذهبت ازوجهم مثل ما انفقوا واتقوا الله الذى انتم به مؤمنون
5161.en: And if you fail to receive from the unbelievers a part of the bridal#due of your disbelieving wives, and then your turn comes, pay to those who have been left on the other side an amount the like of the bridal#due that they have paid. And have fear of Allah in Whom you believe.

5162.arabic: يايها النبى اذا جاك المؤمنت يبايعنك على ان لا يشركن بالله شيـا ولا يسرقن ولا يزنين ولا يقتلن اولدهن ولا ياتين ببهتن يفترينه بين ايديهن وارجلهن ولا يعصينك فى معروف فبايعهن واستغفر لهن الله ان الله غفور رحيم
5162.en: O Prophet, when believing women come to you and pledge to you that they will not associate aught with Allah in His Divinity, that they will not steal, that they will not commit illicit sexual intercourse, that they will not kill their children, that they will not bring forth a calumny between their hands and feet, and that they will not disobey you in anything known to be good, then accept their allegiance and ask Allah to forgive them. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5163.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا تتولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم قد يئسوا من الاخرة كما يئس الكفار من اصحب القبور
5163.en: Believers, do not make friends with those against whom Allah is wrathful and who are despaired of the Hereafter, as despaired as are the unbelievers lying in their graves.

5164.arabic: سبح لله ما فى السموت وما فى الارض وهو العزيز الحكيم
5164.en: All that is in the heavens and all that is on earth extols Allah's glory. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

5165.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لم تقولون ما لا تفعلون
5165.en: Believers, why do you profess that which you do not practise?

5166.arabic: كبر مقتا عند الله ان تقولوا ما لا تفعلون
5166.en: It is most loathsome in the sight of Allah that you should profess what you do not practise.

5167.arabic: ان الله يحب الذين يقتلون فى سبيله صفا كانهم بنين مرصوص
5167.en: Allah indeed loves those who fight in His Way as though they are a solid wall cemented with molten lead.

5168.arabic: واذ قال موسى لقومه يقوم لم تؤذوننى وقد تعلمون انى رسول الله اليكم فلما زاغوا ازاغ الله قلوبهم والله لا يهدى القوم الفسقين
5168.en: And call to mind when Moses said to his people: “O my people, why do you torment me when you know well that I am Allah's Messenger to you?” So when they deviated, Allah made their hearts deviant. Allah does not direct the evil#doers to the Right Way.

5169.arabic: واذ قال عيسى ابن مريم يبنى اسريل انى رسول الله اليكم مصدقا لما بين يدى من التورىة ومبشرا برسول ياتى من بعدى اسمه احمد فلما جاهم بالبينت قالوا هذا سحر مبين
5169.en: And call to mind when Jesus, son of Mary, said: “O Children of Israel, I am Allah's Messenger to you, I verify the Torah which has come before me, and I give you the glad tiding of a Messenger who shall come after me, his name being Ahmad.” Yet when he came to them with Clear Signs they said: “This is sheer trickery.”

5170.arabic: ومن اظلم ممن افترى على الله الكذب وهو يدعى الى الاسلم والله لا يهدى القوم الظلمين
5170.en: Who would be more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah the while he is being called to Islam? Allah does not direct such evildoing folk to the Right Way.

5171.arabic: يريدون ليطفـوا نور الله بافوههم والله متم نوره ولو كره الكفرون
5171.en: They seek to extinguish Allah's light (by blowing) with their mouths, but Allah shall spread His light in all its fullness, howsoever the unbelievers may abhor this.

5172.arabic: هو الذى ارسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله ولو كره المشركون
5172.en: He it is Who has sent forth the Messenger with the Guidance and the True Religion that He may make it prevail over all religion, however those that associate aught with Allah in His Divinity might dislike this.

5173.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا هل ادلكم على تجرة تنجيكم من عذاب اليم
5173.en: Believers, shall I direct you to a commerce that will deliver you from a grievous chastisement?

5174.arabic: تؤمنون بالله ورسوله وتجهدون فى سبيل الله بامولكم وانفسكم ذلكم خير لكم ان كنتم تعلمون
5174.en: Have faith in Allah and His Messenger and strive in the Way of Allah with your possessions and your lives. That is better for you if you only knew.

5175.arabic: يغفر لكم ذنوبكم ويدخلكم جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر ومسكن طيبة فى جنت عدن ذلك الفوز العظيم
5175.en: He will forgive you your sins and will admit you to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. He will lodge you in excellent mansions in the Gardens of eternity. That is the supreme triumph.

5176.arabic: واخرى تحبونها نصر من الله وفتح قريب وبشر المؤمنين
5176.en: He will also grant you the other favour that you desire: help from Allah and a victory that will come soon. Give glad tidings of this to the believers.

5177.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا كونوا انصار الله كما قال عيسى ابن مريم للحوارين من انصارى الى الله قال الحواريون نحن انصار الله فـامنت طائفة من بنى اسريل وكفرت طائفة فايدنا الذين امنوا على عدوهم فاصبحوا ظهرين
5177.en: Believers, become Allah's helpers, as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples: “Who is my helper in (calling people) to Allah?” The disciples had responded by saying: “We are Allah's helpers.” Then a section of the Children of Israel believed and a section rejected the call. Thereafter We aided the believers against their enemies, and they prevailed.

5178.arabic: يسبح لله ما فى السموت وما فى الارض الملك القدوس العزيز الحكيم
5178.en: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols the glory of Allah, the Sovereign, the Holy, the All# Mighty, the All#Wise.

5179.arabic: هو الذى بعث فى الامين رسولا منهم يتلوا عليهم ايته ويزكيهم ويعلمهم الكتب والحكمة وان كانوا من قبل لفى ضلل مبين
5179.en: He it is Who has sent to the gentiles a Messenger from among themselves, one who rehearses to them His verses, purifies their lives, and imparts to them the Book and the Wisdom although before that they were in utter error;

5180.arabic: واخرين منهم لما يلحقوا بهم وهو العزيز الحكيم
5180.en: and (He has also) sent him to those others who have not yet joined them. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

5181.arabic: ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشا والله ذو الفضل العظيم
5181.en: Such is Allah's favour: He bestows it on whomsoever He pleases. Allah is the Lord of abounding favour.

5182.arabic: مثل الذين حملوا التورىة ثم لم يحملوها كمثل الحمار يحمل اسفارۢا بئس مثل القوم الذين كذبوا بـايت الله والله لا يهدى القوم الظلمين
5182.en: The parable of those who were charged with the Torah and then they failed to live up to it is that of a donkey laden with books. Even more evil is the parable of the people who gave the lie to the Signs of Allah. Allah does not direct such wrong#doers to the Right Way.

5183.arabic: قل يايها الذين هادوا ان زعمتم انكم اوليا لله من دون الناس فتمنوا الموت ان كنتم صدقين
5183.en: Tell them: “O you who have become Judaised, if you arrogantly fancy that you are Allah's favourites to the exclusion of all people, then wish for death, if you are truthful in your claim.”

5184.arabic: ولا يتمنونه ابدا بما قدمت ايديهم والله عليمۢ بالظلمين
5184.en: But they shall never wish for death because of the (evil) deeds they have committed. Allah is well aware of these evil#doers.

5185.arabic: قل ان الموت الذى تفرون منه فانه ملقيكم ثم تردون الى علم الغيب والشهدة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون
5185.en: Tell them: “The death from which you flee will certainly overtake you. Then you will be returned to Him Who fully knows what is hidden and what is manifest. Thereupon He will let you know all that you used to do.”

5186.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا اذا نودى للصلوة من يوم الجمعة فاسعوا الى ذكر الله وذروا البيع ذلكم خير لكم ان كنتم تعلمون
5186.en: Believers, when the call for Prayer is made on Friday, hasten to the remembrance of Allah and give up all trading. That is better for you, if you only knew.

5187.arabic: فاذا قضيت الصلوة فانتشروا فى الارض وابتغوا من فضل الله واذكروا الله كثيرا لعلكم تفلحون
5187.en: But when the Prayer is ended, disperse in the land and seek Allah's Bounty, and remember Allah much so that you may prosper.

5188.arabic: واذا راوا تجرة او لهوا انفضوا اليها وتركوك قائما قل ما عند الله خير من اللهو ومن التجرة والله خير الرزقين
5188.en: Yet no sooner than they saw some trading or amusement, they flocked to it and left you standing by yourself. Tell them: “That which is with Allah is far better than amusement and trading. Allah is the Best Provider of sustenance.”

5189.arabic: اذا جاك المنفقون قالوا نشهد انك لرسول الله والله يعلم انك لرسوله والله يشهد ان المنفقين لكذبون
5189.en: (O Prophet), when the hypocrites come to you, they say: “We bear witness that you are certainly Allah's Messenger.” Allah certainly knows that you are His Messenger. But Allah also bears witness that the hypocrites are utter liars!

5190.arabic: اتخذوا ايمنهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله انهم سا ما كانوا يعملون
5190.en: They shelter behind their oath, and thus hinder their own selves and others from the Path of Allah. Evil indeed is what they do.

5191.arabic: ذلك بانهم امنوا ثم كفروا فطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يفقهون
5191.en: All that is because they first believed and then disbelieved, and therefore a seal was set on their hearts; as a result they understand nothing.

5192.arabic: واذا رايتهم تعجبك اجسامهم وان يقولوا تسمع لقولهم كانهم خشب مسندة يحسبون كل صيحة عليهم هم العدو فاحذرهم قتلهم الله انى يؤفكون
5192.en: When you look at them, their persons are pleasing, and when they speak, you pay heed to what they say. But in truth they are (merely) beams of timber propped#up (against a wall). They consider every shout they hear to be directed against them. They are your utter enemies; guard against them. May Allah do away with them! How are they being turned away (from the Truth)?

5193.arabic: واذا قيل لهم تعالوا يستغفر لكم رسول الله لووا روسهم ورايتهم يصدون وهم مستكبرون
5193.en: When it is said to them: “Come, Allah's Messenger will seek forgiveness for you,” they (contemptuously) shake their heads and you see them holding back in pride.

5194.arabic: سوا عليهم استغفرت لهم ام لم تستغفر لهم لن يغفر الله لهم ان الله لا يهدى القوم الفسقين
5194.en: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or not; for Allah shall never forgive them. Surely Allah does not direct the transgressing folk to the Right Way.

5195.arabic: هم الذين يقولون لا تنفقوا على من عند رسول الله حتى ينفضوا ولله خزائن السموت والارض ولكن المنفقين لا يفقهون
5195.en: It is they who say: “Give nothing to those who are with the Messenger of Allah so that they may disperse.” (They say so although) the treasures of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah. But the hypocrites do not understand.

5196.arabic: يقولون لئن رجعنا الى المدينة ليخرجن الاعز منها الاذل ولله العزة ولرسوله وللمؤمنين ولكن المنفقين لا يعلمون
5196.en: They say: “When we return to Madinah, the honourable ones will drive out from it those that are abject.” In truth, all honour belongs to Allah, and to His Messenger, and to the believers. But the hypocrites do not know.

5197.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا لا تلهكم امولكم ولا اولدكم عن ذكر الله ومن يفعل ذلك فاولئك هم الخسرون
5197.en: Believers, let your possessions and your offspring not make you negligent of Allah's remembrance. For whoso does that, they will be the losers.

5198.arabic: وانفقوا من ما رزقنكم من قبل ان ياتى احدكم الموت فيقول رب لولا اخرتنى الى اجل قريب فاصدق واكن من الصلحين
5198.en: And spend of what Allah has granted you by way of sustenance before death should come to any of you and he should say: “Lord, why did You not defer my return for a while so that I might give alms and be among the righteous?”

5199.arabic: ولن يؤخر الله نفسا اذا جا اجلها والله خبيرۢ بما تعملون
5199.en: But when a person's term comes to an end, Allah never grants any respite. Allah is well aware of all that you do.

5200.arabic: يسبح لله ما فى السموت وما فى الارض له الملك وله الحمد وهو على كل شى قدير
5200.en: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth extols Allah's glory. His is the sovereignty and to Him is all praise due; He has power over everything.

5201.arabic: هو الذى خلقكم فمنكم كافر ومنكم مؤمن والله بما تعملون بصير
5201.en: He it is Who has created you: and among you are those that deny the Truth and among you are those that believe in it. Allah observes all that you do.

5202.arabic: خلق السموت والارض بالحق وصوركم فاحسن صوركم واليه المصير
5202.en: He created the heavens and the earth with Truth and shaped you, giving you excellent shapes. And to Him is your ultimate return.

5203.arabic: يعلم ما فى السموت والارض ويعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون والله عليمۢ بذات الصدور
5203.en: He knows what is in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you conceal and what you disclose. Allah even knows what lies hidden in the breasts of people.

5204.arabic: الم ياتكم نبؤا الذين كفروا من قبل فذاقوا وبال امرهم ولهم عذاب اليم
5204.en: Has the news of the unbelievers of the past not reached you? (They disbelieved) and then tasted its evil consequence. A grievous chastisement awaits them.

5205.arabic: ذلك بانه كانت تاتيهم رسلهم بالبينت فقالوا ابشر يهدوننا فكفروا وتولوا واستغنى الله والله غنى حميد
5205.en: This was because their Messengers would come to them with Clear Signs, but they would say: “Shall mortals (like ourselves) guide us to the Right Way?” They rejected the Truth and turned away. Thereupon Allah became unconcerned with them, for Allah is Self#Sufficient, Innately Praiseworthy.

5206.arabic: زعم الذين كفروا ان لن يبعثوا قل بلى وربى لتبعثن ثم لتنبؤن بما عملتم وذلك على الله يسير
5206.en: The unbelievers have vehemently contended that they shall not be raised to life. Say to them: “Yes, by my Lord, you shall surely be raised to life, and you shall certainly be fully informed of all that you did. That is easy enough for Allah.”

5207.arabic: فـامنوا بالله ورسوله والنور الذى انزلنا والله بما تعملون خبير
5207.en: So believe in Allah and in His Messenger and in the Light that We have sent down. Allah is fully aware of what you do.

5208.arabic: يوم يجمعكم ليوم الجمع ذلك يوم التغابن ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صلحا يكفر عنه سيـاته ويدخله جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها ابدا ذلك الفوز العظيم
5208.en: (You shall come to know that) when He will assemble you on the Day of Gathering. That shall be the Day (to determine) mutual gains and losses. Whoever believes in Allah and acts righteously, Allah will have his evil deeds expunged and will admit him to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Therein they shall abide forever. That is the supreme triumph.

5209.arabic: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بـايتنا اولئك اصحب النار خلدين فيها وبئس المصير
5209.en: As for those who disbelieved and gave the lie to Our Signs: they shall be the inmates of the Fire, and will abide in it. That is a woeful resort!

5210.arabic: ما اصاب من مصيبة الا باذن الله ومن يؤمن بالله يهد قلبه والله بكل شى عليم
5210.en: No misfortune ever befalls unless it be by Allah's leave. And whosoever has faith in Allah, Allah directs his heart along the Right Path. Allah has knowledge of everything.

5211.arabic: واطيعوا الله واطيعوا الرسول فان توليتم فانما على رسولنا البلغ المبين
5211.en: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away from obedience, (then know that) Our Messenger has no other duty than to clearly convey the Truth.

5212.arabic: الله لا اله الا هو وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون
5212.en: Allah there is no god but He; in Allah should the believers put all their trust.

5213.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا ان من ازوجكم واولدكم عدوا لكم فاحذروهم وان تعفوا وتصفحوا وتغفروا فان الله غفور رحيم
5213.en: Believers, there are enemies to you from among your spouses and your off#spring, so beware of them. But if you forgive and overlook their offences and pardon them, then surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5214.arabic: انما امولكم واولدكم فتنة والله عنده اجر عظيم
5214.en: Your possessions and your offspring are nothing but a trial for you. And there awaits a great reward for you with Allah.

5215.arabic: فاتقوا الله ما استطعتم واسمعوا واطيعوا وانفقوا خيرا لانفسكم ومن يوق شح نفسه فاولئك هم المفلحون
5215.en: So hold Allah in awe as much as you can, and listen and obey, and be charitable. This is for your own good. And whoever remains safe from his own greediness, it is such that will prosper.

5216.arabic: ان تقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضعفه لكم ويغفر لكم والله شكور حليم
5216.en: If you give Allah a goodly loan, He will increase it for you several fold and will forgive you. Allah is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.

5217.en: He knows that which is beyond the ken of perception as well as that which can be perceived. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

5218.arabic: يايها النبى اذا طلقتم النسا فطلقوهن لعدتهن واحصوا العدة واتقوا الله ربكم لا تخرجوهن من بيوتهن ولا يخرجن الا ان ياتين بفحشة مبينة وتلك حدود الله ومن يتعد حدود الله فقد ظلم نفسه لا تدرى لعل الله يحدث بعد ذلك امرا
5218.en: O Prophet, when you divorce women, divorce them for their waiting#period, and compute the waiting period accurately, and hold Allah, your Lord, in awe. Do not turn them out of their homes (during the waiting period) – nor should they go away (from their homes) – unless they have committed a manifestly evil deed. Such are the bounds set by Allah; and he who transgresses the bounds set by Allah commits a wrong against himself. You do not know: maybe Allah will cause something to happen to pave the way (for reconciliation).

5219.arabic: فاذا بلغن اجلهن فامسكوهن بمعروف او فارقوهن بمعروف واشهدوا ذوى عدل منكم واقيموا الشهدة لله ذلكم يوعظ به من كان يؤمن بالله واليوم الاخر ومن يتق الله يجعل له مخرجا
5219.en: And when they reach the end of their term (of waiting), then either honourably retain them (in the bond of wedlock) or honourably part with them, and call two persons of known probity as witnesses from among yourselves, and (let these witnesses) give upright testimony for the sake of Allah. That is to what all those that believe in Allah and the Last Day are exhorted. Allah will find a way out for him who fears Allah,

5220.arabic: ويرزقه من حيث لا يحتسب ومن يتوكل على الله فهو حسبه ان الله بلغ امره قد جعل الله لكل شى قدرا
5220.en: and will provide him sustenance from whence he never even imagined. Whoever puts his trust in Allah, He shall suffice him. Surely Allah brings about what He decrees; Allah has set a measure for everything.

5221.arabic: والـى يئسن من المحيض من نسائكم ان ارتبتم فعدتهن ثلثة اشهر والـى لم يحضن واولت الاحمال اجلهن ان يضعن حملهن ومن يتق الله يجعل له من امره يسرا
5221.en: The waiting period of those of your women who have lost all expectation of menstruation shall be three months in case you entertain any doubt; and the same shall apply to those who have not yet menstruated. As for pregnant women, their waiting period shall be until the delivery of their burden. Allah will create ease for him who fears Allah.

5222.arabic: ذلك امر الله انزله اليكم ومن يتق الله يكفر عنه سيـاته ويعظم له اجرا
5222.en: This is the commandment of Allah that He has revealed to you. Whoever fears Allah, He will expunge his evil deeds and will richly reward him.

5223.arabic: اسكنوهن من حيث سكنتم من وجدكم ولا تضاروهن لتضيقوا عليهن وان كن اولت حمل فانفقوا عليهن حتى يضعن حملهن فان ارضعن لكم فـاتوهن اجورهن واتمروا بينكم بمعروف وان تعاسرتم فسترضع له اخرى
5223.en: (During the waiting period) lodge them according to your means wherever you dwell, and do not harass them to make them miserable. And if they are pregnant, provide for them maintenance until they have delivered their burden. And if they suckle your offspring whom they bore you, then give them due recompense, and graciously settle the question of compensation between yourselves by mutual understanding. But if you experience difficulty (in determining the compensation for suckling) then let another woman suckle the child.

5224.arabic: لينفق ذو سعة من سعته ومن قدر عليه رزقه فلينفق مما اتىه الله لا يكلف الله نفسا الا ما اتىها سيجعل الله بعد عسر يسرا
5224.en: Whoever has abundant means, let him spend according to his means; and he whose means are straitened, let him spend out of what Allah has given him. Allah does not burden any human being beyond the means that He has bestowed upon him. Possibly Allah will grant ease after hardship.

5225.arabic: وكاين من قرية عتت عن امر ربها ورسله فحاسبنها حسابا شديدا وعذبنها عذابا نكرا
5225.en: How many towns rebelled against the commandment of their Lord and His Messengers. Then We called them to a stern accounting, and subjected them to a harrowing chastisement.

5226.arabic: فذاقت وبال امرها وكان عقبة امرها خسرا
5226.en: So they tasted the evil fruit of their deeds; and the fruit of their deeds was utter loss.

5227.arabic: اعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا فاتقوا الله ياولى الالبب الذين امنوا قد انزل الله اليكم ذكرا
5227.en: Allah has laid in store for them a grievous chastisement. So fear Allah, O people of understanding who have attained to faith. Allah has sent down to you an Exhortation,

5228.arabic: رسولا يتلوا عليكم ايت الله مبينت ليخرج الذين امنوا وعملوا الصلحت من الظلمت الى النور ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صلحا يدخله جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر خلدين فيها ابدا قد احسن الله له رزقا
5228.en: a Messenger who rehearses to you Allah's verses that clearly expound the Guidance so that He may bring out those that believe and act righteously, from every kind of darkness into light. He will admit whosoever believes in Allah and acts righteously to Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall abide in them forever. For such has Allah made an excellent provision.

5229.arabic: الله الذى خلق سبع سموت ومن الارض مثلهن يتنزل الامر بينهن لتعلموا ان الله على كل شى قدير وان الله قد احاط بكل شى علمۢا
5229.en: Allah it is He Who created seven heavens, and, like them, the earth. His commandment descends among them. (All this is being stated so that you know) that Allah has power over everything, and that Allah encompasses all things in His knowledge.

5230.arabic: يايها النبى لم تحرم ما احل الله لك تبتغى مرضات ازوجك والله غفور رحيم
5230.en: O Prophet, why do you forbid what Allah has made lawful for you? Is it to please your wives? Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5231.arabic: قد فرض الله لكم تحلة ايمنكم والله مولىكم وهو العليم الحكيم
5231.en: Allah has prescribed for you a way for the absolution of your oaths. Allah is your Guardian. He is All#Knowing, Most Wise.

5232.arabic: واذ اسر النبى الى بعض ازوجه حديثا فلما نبات به واظهره الله عليه عرف بعضه واعرض عن بعض فلما نباها به قالت من انباك هذا قال نبانى العليم الخبير
5232.en: The Prophet confided something to one of his wives and then she disclosed it (to another); so after Allah revealed to the Prophet (that she had disclosed that secret), he made a part of it known to her and passed over a part of it. And when he told her about this (i.e., that she had disclosed the secret entrusted to her), she asked: “Who informed you of this?” He said: “I was told of it by He Who is All#Knowing, All#Aware.”

5233.arabic: ان تتوبا الى الله فقد صغت قلوبكما وان تظهرا عليه فان الله هو مولىه وجبريل وصلح المؤمنين والملئكة بعد ذلك ظهير
5233.en: If the two of you turn in repentance to Allah (that is better for you), for the hearts of both of you have swerved from the Straight Path. But if you support one another against the Prophet, then surely Allah is his Protector; and after that Gabriel and all righteous believers and the angels are all his supporters.

5234.arabic: عسى ربه ان طلقكن ان يبدله ازوجا خيرا منكن مسلمت مؤمنت قنتت تئبت عبدت سئحت ثيبت وابكارا
5234.en: Maybe if he were to divorce you, your Lord might grant him in exchange wives better than you – those who truly submit to Allah, are full of faith, obedient, disposed to repentance, and given to worship and fasting – both previously wedded ones and virgins.

5235.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا قوا انفسكم واهليكم نارا وقودها الناس والحجارة عليها ملئكة غلاظ شداد لا يعصون الله ما امرهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون
5235.en: Believers, guard yourselves and your kindred against a Fire whose fuel is human beings and stones, a Fire held in the charge of fierce and stern angels who never disobey what He has commanded them, and always do what they are bidden.

5236.arabic: يايها الذين كفروا لا تعتذروا اليوم انما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون
5236.en: (It will then be said): “Unbelievers, make no excuses today. You are being recompensed for nothing else but your deeds.”

5237.arabic: يايها الذين امنوا توبوا الى الله توبة نصوحا عسى ربكم ان يكفر عنكم سيـاتكم ويدخلكم جنت تجرى من تحتها الانهر يوم لا يخزى الله النبى والذين امنوا معه نورهم يسعى بين ايديهم وبايمنهم يقولون ربنا اتمم لنا نورنا واغفر لنا انك على كل شى قدير
5237.en: Believers, turn to Allah in sincere repentance; maybe your Lord will expunge your evil deeds and admit you to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow. This will be on the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who have embraced faith and are with him; their light will be running before them and on their right hands, and they will say: “Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Surely You have power over everything.”

5238.arabic: يايها النبى جهد الكفار والمنفقين واغلظ عليهم وماوىهم جهنم وبئس المصير
5238.en: O Prophet, strive against the unbelievers and the hypocrites, and be severe with them. Hell shall be their resort. What a grievous end!

5239.arabic: ضرب الله مثلا للذين كفروا امرات نوح وامرات لوط كانتا تحت عبدين من عبادنا صلحين فخانتاهما فلم يغنيا عنهما من الله شيـا وقيل ادخلا النار مع الدخلين
5239.en: Allah has set forth for the unbelievers the parable of the wives of Noah and Lot. They were wedded to two of Our righteous servants, but each acted treacherously with her husband, and their husbands could be of no avail to them against Allah. The two of them were told: “Enter the Fire with all the others who enter it.”

5240.arabic: وضرب الله مثلا للذين امنوا امرات فرعون اذ قالت رب ابن لى عندك بيتا فى الجنة ونجنى من فرعون وعمله ونجنى من القوم الظلمين
5240.en: Allah has set forth for the believers the parable of Pharaoh's wife. She prayed: “My Lord, build for me a house with You in Paradise and deliver me from Pharaoh and his misdeeds; and deliver me from the iniquitous people.”

5241.arabic: ومريم ابنت عمرن التى احصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيه من روحنا وصدقت بكلمت ربها وكتبه وكانت من القنتين
5241.en: Allah has also set forth the parable of Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, and into whom We breathed of Our Spirit, and who testified to the words of her Lord and His Books. She was among the obedient.

5242.arabic: تبرك الذى بيده الملك وهو على كل شى قدير
5242.en: Blessed is He in Whose Hand is the dominion of the Universe, and Who has power over everything;

5243.arabic: الذى خلق الموت والحيوة ليبلوكم ايكم احسن عملا وهو العزيز الغفور
5243.en: Who created death and life that He might try you as to which of you is better in deed. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Forgiving;

5244.arabic: الذى خلق سبع سموت طباقا ما ترى فى خلق الرحمن من تفوت فارجع البصر هل ترى من فطور
5244.en: Who created the seven heavens one upon another. You will see no incongruity in the Merciful One's creation. Turn your vision again, can you see any flaw?

5245.arabic: ثم ارجع البصر كرتين ينقلب اليك البصر خاسئا وهو حسير
5245.en: Then turn your vision again, and then again; in the end your vision will come back to you, worn out and frustrated.

5246.arabic: ولقد زينا السما الدنيا بمصبيح وجعلنها رجوما للشيطين واعتدنا لهم عذاب السعير
5246.en: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans. We have prepared for them the chastisement of the Blazing Fire.

5247.arabic: وللذين كفروا بربهم عذاب جهنم وبئس المصير
5247.en: The chastisement of Hell awaits those who disbelieve in their Lord. What a wretched destination!

5248.arabic: اذا القوا فيها سمعوا لها شهيقا وهى تفور
5248.en: When they will be cast into it, they will hear it roar as it boils,

5249.arabic: تكاد تميز من الغيظ كلما القى فيها فوج سالهم خزنتها الم ياتكم نذير
5249.en: as though it will burst with rage. Every time a multitude is cast into it, its keepers will ask them: “Did no warner come to you?”

5250.arabic: قالوا بلى قد جانا نذير فكذبنا وقلنا ما نزل الله من شى ان انتم الا فى ضلل كبير
5250.en: They will say: “Yes, a warner came to us, but we gave the lie to him and said: 'Allah has revealed nothing. You are surely in huge error.'

5251.arabic: وقالوا لو كنا نسمع او نعقل ما كنا فى اصحب السعير
5251.en: They will say: 'If we had only listened and understood, we would not be among the inmates of the Blazing Fire.'”

5252.en: Thus will they confess their sins. Damned are these inmates of the Blazing Fire.

5253.arabic: ان الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب لهم مغفرة واجر كبير
5253.en: Surely forgiveness and a mighty reward await those who fear Allah without seeing Him.

5254.arabic: واسروا قولكم او اجهروا به انه عليمۢ بذات الصدور
5254.en: Whether you speak in secrecy or aloud, (it is all the same to Allah). He even knows the secrets that lie hidden in the breasts of people.

5255.arabic: الا يعلم من خلق وهو اللطيف الخبير
5255.en: Would He not know, He Who has created, when He is All#Subtle, All#Aware?

5256.arabic: هو الذى جعل لكم الارض ذلولا فامشوا فى مناكبها وكلوا من رزقه واليه النشور
5256.en: He it is Who made the earth subservient to you. So traverse in its tracks and partake of the sustenance He has provided. To Him will you be resurrected.

5257.arabic: امنتم من فى السما ان يخسف بكم الارض فاذا هى تمور
5257.en: Do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not cause the earth to cave in with you, and then suddenly it will begin to rock violently?

5258.arabic: ام امنتم من فى السما ان يرسل عليكم حاصبا فستعلمون كيف نذير
5258.en: Do you feel secure that He Who is in the heaven will not let loose upon you a storm of stones? Then shall you know what My warning is like!

5259.arabic: ولقد كذب الذين من قبلهم فكيف كان نكير
5259.en: Those who came before them also gave the lie (to the Messengers): then how awesome was My chastisement!

5260.arabic: اولم يروا الى الطير فوقهم صفت ويقبضن ما يمسكهن الا الرحمن انه بكل شىۭ بصير
5260.en: Have they not seen birds above them spreading and closing their wings, with none holding them except the Merciful One? He oversees everything.

5261.arabic: امن هذا الذى هو جند لكم ينصركم من دون الرحمن ان الكفرون الا فى غرور
5261.en: Which is your army that will come to your aid against the Merciful Lord? But the unbelievers are in utter delusion.

5262.arabic: امن هذا الذى يرزقكم ان امسك رزقه بل لجوا فى عتو ونفور
5262.en: Who shall provide for you if He withholds His sustenance? Nay; but they persist in rebellion and aversion.

5263.arabic: افمن يمشى مكبا على وجهه اهدى امن يمشى سويا على صرط مستقيم
5263.en: Who is better guided: he who walks grovelling on his face, or he who walks upright on a Straight Path?

5264.arabic: قل هو الذى انشاكم وجعل لكم السمع والابصر والافـدة قليلا ما تشكرون
5264.en: Say: “He it is Who has brought you into being, and has given you hearing and sight, and has given you hearts to think and understand. How seldom do you give thanks!”

5265.arabic: قل هو الذى ذراكم فى الارض واليه تحشرون
5265.en: Say: “Allah it is Who multiplied you in the earth and to Him you will be mustered.”

5266.arabic: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صدقين
5266.en: They say: “If you are truthful, tell us when will this promise (of the Hereafter) be fulfilled?”

5267.arabic: قل انما العلم عند الله وانما انا نذير مبين
5267.en: Say: “Allah alone knows about that; and I am no more than a plain warner.”

5268.arabic: فلما راوه زلفة سيـت وجوه الذين كفروا وقيل هذا الذى كنتم به تدعون
5268.en: When they will see it near at hand, the faces of all those who had denied it will be distraught, and then they will be told: “This is the doom which you used to ask for.”

5269.arabic: قل اريتم ان اهلكنى الله ومن معى او رحمنا فمن يجير الكفرين من عذاب اليم
5269.en: Say to them: “Did you ever consider: whether Allah destroys me and those that are with me, or shows mercy to us, who can protect the unbelievers from a grievous chastisement?”

5270.arabic: قل هو الرحمن امنا به وعليه توكلنا فستعلمون من هو فى ضلل مبين
5270.en: Say to them: “He is Merciful, and it is in Him that we believe, and it is in Him that we put all our trust. Soon will you know who is in manifest error.”

5271.arabic: قل اريتم ان اصبح ماؤكم غورا فمن ياتيكم بما معينۭ
5271.en: Say to them: “Did you even consider: if all the water that you have (in the wells) were to sink down into the depths of the earth, who will produce for you clear, flowing water?”

5272.en: Nun. By the pen and what the scribes write.

5273.en: By your Lord's Grace, you are not afflicted with madness,

5274.en: and surely yours shall be a never#ending reward,

5275.en: and you are certainly on the most exalted standard of moral excellence.

5276.en: So you will soon see, and they too will see,

5277.en: which of you is afflicted with madness.

5278.arabic: ان ربك هو اعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو اعلم بالمهتدين
5278.en: Surely your Lord knows well those who have strayed from His Way just as He knows well those who are on the Right Way.

5279.en: Do not, then, yield to those who reject the Truth, decrying it as false;

5280.en: they would wish you to be pliant so that they too may be pliant.

5281.en: And do not yield to any contemptible swearer,

5282.en: the fault#finder who goes around slandering,

5283.en: the hinderer of good, the transgressor, the sinful;

5284.en: the coarse#grained, and above all mean and ignoble;

5285.en: (who so acts) simply because he has wealth and sons,

5286.arabic: اذا تتلى عليه ايتنا قال اسطير الاولين
5286.en: and whenever Our verses are rehearsed to him, he says: “These are fairy# tales of times gone by.”

5287.en: Soon shall We brand him on his snout.

5288.arabic: انا بلونهم كما بلونا اصحب الجنة اذ اقسموا ليصرمنها مصبحين
5288.en: We have put them \[i.e., the Makkans\] to test even as We put to test the owners of the orchard when they vowed that they would gather the fruit of their orchard in the morning,

5289.en: without making any allowance (for the will of Allah).

5290.arabic: فطاف عليها طائف من ربك وهم نائمون
5290.en: Thereupon a calamity from your Lord passed over it while they were asleep,

5291.en: and so by morning the orchard lay as though it had been fully harvested.

5292.en: At daybreak they called out to one another:

5293.arabic: ان اغدوا على حرثكم ان كنتم صرمين
5293.en: “Hurry to your orchard if you would gather its fruit.”

5294.en: So off they went, whispering to one another:

5295.arabic: ان لا يدخلنها اليوم عليكم مسكين
5295.en: “No destitute person shall enter it today.”

5296.en: They went forth early, believing that they had the power (to gather the fruit).

5297.en: But as soon as they beheld the orchard, (they cried out): “We have certainly lost the way;

5299.arabic: قال اوسطهم الم اقل لكم لولا تسبحون
5299.en: The best among them said: “Did I not say to you: why do you not give glory to (your Lord)?”

5300.arabic: قالوا سبحن ربنا انا كنا ظلمين
5300.en: They cried out: “Glory be to our Lord! Certainly we were sinners.”

5301.en: Then they began to reproach one another.

5302.en: They said: “Woe to us! We had indeed transgressed.

5303.arabic: عسى ربنا ان يبدلنا خيرا منها انا الى ربنا رغبون
5303.en: Maybe our Lord will give us a better orchard in its place; to our Lord do we penitently turn.”

5304.arabic: كذلك العذاب ولعذاب الاخرة اكبر لو كانوا يعلمون
5304.en: Such is the chastisement; and the chastisement of the Hereafter is assuredly even greater, if only they knew.

5305.arabic: ان للمتقين عند ربهم جنت النعيم
5305.en: Surely the God#fearing shall have Gardens of bliss with their Lord.

5306.en: What! Shall We treat those who have submitted (to Our command) like those who have acted as criminals?

5307.en: What is the matter with you? How ill do you judge!

5308.en: Or do you have a Book wherein you read

5309.en: that (in the Hereafter) you shall have all that you choose for yourselves?

5310.arabic: ام لكم ايمن علينا بلغة الى يوم القيمة ان لكم لما تحكمون
5310.en: Or have We sworn a covenant with you which We are bound to keep till the Day of Resurrection, (a covenant requiring that whatever you ordain for yourselves shall be yours)?

5311.en: Ask them: “Which of them can guarantee that?

5312.arabic: ام لهم شركا فلياتوا بشركائهم ان كانوا صدقين
5312.en: Or has something been guaranteed by any of those whom they associate with Allah in His Divinity?” If so, let them bring forth their associates, if they are truthful.

5313.arabic: يوم يكشف عن ساق ويدعون الى السجود فلا يستطيعون
5313.en: On the Day when the dreadful calamity will unfold, when people will be summoned to prostrate themselves, and yet they will not be able to prostrate.

5314.arabic: خشعة ابصرهم ترهقهم ذلة وقد كانوا يدعون الى السجود وهم سلمون
5314.en: Their eyes shall be downcast and ignominy shall overwhelm them. For when they were safe and sound, they were summoned to prostrate themselves, (and they refused).

5315.arabic: فذرنى ومن يكذب بهذا الحديث سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون
5315.en: So leave Me, (O Prophet), to deal with him who gives the lie to this Discourse. We shall draw them little by little (to their undoing) in a way that they will not know.

5316.en: I am giving them a respite. Great is My scheme!

5317.arabic: ام تسـلهم اجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون
5317.en: Or are you asking them for some compensation so that they feel burdened with debt?

5318.en: Or do they have any knowledge of the Unseen which they are now writing down?

5319.arabic: فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تكن كصاحب الحوت اذ نادى وهو مكظوم
5319.en: So bear with patience until the Judgement of your Lord comes, and do not belike the man in the fish (i.e., Jonah) who called out, choking with grief:

5320.arabic: لولا ان تدركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعرا وهو مذموم
5320.en: had his Lord not bestowed His favour upon him, he would have been cast upon that barren shore (and would have remained there) in disgrace.

5321.en: But his Lord exalted him, and included him among His righteous servants.

5322.arabic: وان يكاد الذين كفروا ليزلقونك بابصرهم لما سمعوا الذكر ويقولون انه لمجنون
5322.en: When the unbelievers hear this Exhortation, they look at you as though they would knock you off your feet with their (hostile) glances. They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;

5323.en: although this is nothing but an Exhortation (to goodness) for everyone in the world.

5325.en: And what is that indubitable event?

5326.en: And what do you know what that indubitable event is?

5327.en: The Thamud and the Ad denied the (possibility of a) sudden calamity, calling it false.

5328.en: Then the Thamud were destroyed by an awesome upheaval;

5329.arabic: واما عاد فاهلكوا بريح صرصر عاتية
5329.en: and the Ad were destroyed by a furiously raging wind#storm

5330.arabic: سخرها عليهم سبع ليال وثمنية ايام حسوما فترى القوم فيها صرعى كانهم اعجاز نخل خاوية
5330.en: which He let loose upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession; so that (if you had been there) you might have seen people lying prostrate, as though they were uprooted trunks of hollowed palm trees.

5331.en: Do you now see any trace of them?

5332.arabic: وجا فرعون ومن قبله والمؤتفكت بالخاطئة
5332.en: Pharaoh and those before him and the people of the overturned habitations all engaged in the same great sin.

5333.arabic: فعصوا رسول ربهم فاخذهم اخذة رابية
5333.en: They did not follow the Messenger of their Lord, and so He seized them with a severe grip.

5334.arabic: انا لما طغا الما حملنكم فى الجارية
5334.en: Verily when the water rose to great heights, We bore you upon a floating vessel (i.e. the Ark)

5335.arabic: لنجعلها لكم تذكرة وتعيها اذن واعية
5335.en: so that We might make it an instructive event for you, and retentive ears might preserve its memory.

5336.arabic: فاذا نفخ فى الصور نفخة وحدة
5336.en: So when the Trumpet is blown with a single blast

5337.arabic: وحملت الارض والجبال فدكتا دكة وحدة
5337.en: and the earth and the mountains are carried aloft and are crushed to bits at one stroke,

5338.en: on that Day shall that indubitable event come to pass;

5339.en: when the sky will be rent asunder, the grip holding it together having loosened on that Day,

5340.arabic: والملك على ارجائها ويحمل عرش ربك فوقهم يومئذ ثمنية
5340.en: and the angels will stand on the sides, with eight of them bearing aloft the Throne of your Lord on that Day.

5341.arabic: يومئذ تعرضون لا تخفى منكم خافية
5341.en: That will be the Day when you shall be brought forth (before Allah) and no secret of yours shall remain hidden.

5342.arabic: فاما من اوتى كتبه بيمينه فيقول هاؤم اقروا كتبيه
5342.en: On that Day, he whose Record is given to him in his right hand will say: “Lo! Read my Record!

5343.en: Verily I was sure that I would be handed over my account.”

5344.en: Then he shall find himself in a life of bliss;

5346.en: the clusters of whose fruit will be hanging low to be within reach (of the inmates of Paradise).

5347.arabic: كلوا واشربوا هنيـۢا بما اسلفتم فى الايام الخالية
5347.en: (They will be told): “Eat and drink with good cheer as a reward for the good deeds you did in the days that have passed by.”

5348.arabic: واما من اوتى كتبه بشماله فيقول يليتنى لم اوت كتبيه
5348.en: As for him whose Record will be given to him in his left hand, he will exclaim: “Would that I had never been given my Record,

5349.en: and had not known my account.

5350.en: Oh! Would that the death that came to me in the world had made an end of me!

5351.en: My riches have not availed me,

5353.en: (A command will be issued): “Seize him and shackle him,

5354.en: then cast him in the Fire,

5355.arabic: ثم فى سلسلة ذرعها سبعون ذراعا فاسلكوه
5355.en: then fasten him with a chain, seventy cubits long.

5356.arabic: انه كان لا يؤمن بالله العظيم
5356.en: He would not believe in Allah, the Most Great;

5357.en: nor would he urge the feeding of the poor.

5358.en: Today he has been left here friendless;

5359.en: and has no food except the filth from the washing of wounds,

5360.en: which only the sinners will eat.”

5361.en: But no; I swear by what you see,

5362.en: and by what you do not see,

5363.en: that this is the speech of an honourable Messenger,

5364.arabic: وما هو بقول شاعر قليلا ما تؤمنون
5364.en: not the speech of a poet. Little do you believe!

5365.arabic: ولا بقول كاهن قليلا ما تذكرون
5365.en: Nor is this the speech of a soothsayer. Little do you reflect!

5366.en: It has been revealed by the Lord of the Universe.

5367.en: And if he \[i.e., the Prophets\] had forged this Discourse and thereafter ascribed it to Us,

5368.en: We would surely have seized him by the right hand,

5369.en: and then severed his life vein;

5370.arabic: فما منكم من احد عنه حجزين
5370.en: and not one of you would have been able to withhold Us from doing so.

5371.en: Surely it is a Good Counsel for the God#fearing.

5372.en: We certainly know that some among you will give the lie to it,

5373.en: and surely it will be a cause of regret for the unbelievers.

5374.en: Certainly it is a Truth of absolute certainty.

5375.en: So glorify the name of your Lord Most Great.

5376.en: A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,

5377.en: (a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;

5378.en: a chastisement from Allah, the Lord of the ascending steps,

5379.arabic: تعرج الملئكة والروح اليه فى يوم كان مقداره خمسين الف سنة
5379.en: by which the angels and the Spirit ascend to Him in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.

5380.en: So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.

5381.en: Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,

5382.en: while We think that it is near at hand.

5383.en: It shall befall on a Day whereon the sky will become like molten brass,

5384.en: and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,

5385.en: and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends

5386.arabic: يبصرونهم يود المجرم لو يفتدى من عذاب يومئذۭ ببنيه
5386.en: although they shall be within sight of one another. The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,

5387.en: and his spouse and his brother,

5388.en: and his kinsfolk who had stood by him,

5389.arabic: ومن فى الارض جميعا ثم ينجيه
5389.en: and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.

5390.en: By no means! It will be the fierce flame

5391.en: that will strip off the scalp.

5392.en: It shall insistently summon him who turned his back and retreated,

5393.en: and amassed wealth and covetously hoarded it.

5394.en: Verily man is impatient by nature:

5396.en: and tight#fisted when good fortune visits him,

5398.en: and are constant in their Prayer;

5399.en: and those in whose wealth there is a known right

5400.en: for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,

5401.en: those who firmly believe in the Day of Recompense,

5402.arabic: والذين هم من عذاب ربهم مشفقون
5402.en: and fear the chastisement of their Lord –

5403.en: surely the chastisement of their Lord is a thing none can feel secure from –

5404.en: and those who guard their private parts,

5405.arabic: الا على ازوجهم او ما ملكت ايمنهم فانهم غير ملومين
5405.en: except in regard to their spouses and those whom their right hands possess, for in regard to them they are not reproachable,

5406.arabic: فمن ابتغى ورا ذلك فاولئك هم العادون
5406.en: but any who seeks to go beyond that, it is indeed they who are the transgressors,

5407.en: and those who fulfil their trusts and their covenants,

5408.en: and those who are upright in their testimonies;

5409.en: and who take due care of their Prayer:

5410.en: all these shall live honourably in the Gardens.

5411.en: But what is the matter with the unbelievers who are hurrying towards you

5412.en: in crowds, both on the right and on the left?

5413.arabic: ايطمع كل امرئ منهم ان يدخل جنة نعيم
5413.en: Does everyone of them wish to enter the Garden of Bliss?

5414.en: By no means! They know that which We have created them from.

5415.arabic: فلا اقسم برب المشرق والمغرب انا لقدرون
5415.en: I swear by the Lord of the easts and the wests that We have the power

5416.arabic: على ان نبدل خيرا منهم وما نحن بمسبوقين
5416.en: to replace them by others who would be better than they; and We shall certainly not be overpowered.

5417.arabic: فذرهم يخوضوا ويلعبوا حتى يلقوا يومهم الذى يوعدون
5417.en: So leave them to engage in vain talk and to amuse themselves until they come face to face with the Day which they are promised,

5418.arabic: يوم يخرجون من الاجداث سراعا كانهم الى نصب يوفضون
5418.en: the Day on which they will hastily come forth from their graves, as though they were hurrying on to the altars of their deities.

5419.arabic: خشعة ابصرهم ترهقهم ذلة ذلك اليوم الذى كانوا يوعدون
5419.en: Their eyes will be downcast and disgrace will overwhelm them. Such is the Day that they were promised.

5420.arabic: انا ارسلنا نوحا الى قومه ان انذر قومك من قبل ان ياتيهم عذاب اليم
5420.en: We sent Noah to his people (and directed him): “Warn your people before a grievous chastisement comes upon them.”

5421.arabic: قال يقوم انى لكم نذير مبين
5421.en: Noah said: “My people, I have certainly been sent as a clear warner to you,

5422.en: that you serve Allah and fear Him, and follow me;

5423.arabic: يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويؤخركم الى اجل مسمى ان اجل الله اذا جا لا يؤخر لو كنتم تعلمون
5423.en: He will forgive your sins and will grant you respite until an appointed term. Indeed when Allah's appointed term comes, it cannot be deferred; if you only knew!”

5424.arabic: قال رب انى دعوت قومى ليلا ونهارا
5424.en: He said: “My Lord, I called my people by night and by day,

5425.en: but the more I called, the farther they fled.

5426.arabic: وانى كلما دعوتهم لتغفر لهم جعلوا اصبعهم فى اذانهم واستغشوا ثيابهم واصروا واستكبروا استكبارا
5426.en: And every time I called them so that You might forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears and wrapped up their faces with their garments and obstinately clung to their attitude, and waxed very proud.

5428.arabic: ثم انى اعلنت لهم واسررت لهم اسرارا
5428.en: and preached to them in public, and also addressed them in secret.

5429.arabic: فقلت استغفروا ربكم انه كان غفارا
5429.en: I said to them: “Ask forgiveness from your Lord; surely He is Most Forgiving.

5430.en: He will shower upon you torrents from heaven,

5431.arabic: ويمددكم بامول وبنين ويجعل لكم جنت ويجعل لكم انهرا
5431.en: and will provide you with wealth and children, and will bestow upon you gardens and rivers.

5432.arabic: ما لكم لا ترجون لله وقارا
5432.en: What is amiss with you that you do not look forward to the majesty of Allah

5433.en: when He has created you in stages?

5434.arabic: الم تروا كيف خلق الله سبع سموت طباقا
5434.en: Do you not see how Allah has created seven heavens, one upon the other,

5435.arabic: وجعل القمر فيهن نورا وجعل الشمس سراجا
5435.en: and has placed the moon in them as a light, and the sun as a radiant lamp?

5436.en: And Allah has caused you to grow out of the earth so wondrously,

5437.en: and He will later cause you to return to it and will then again bring you out of it.

5438.en: Allah has made the earth a wide expanse for you

5439.en: so that you may tread its spacious paths.”

5440.arabic: قال نوح رب انهم عصونى واتبعوا من لم يزده ماله وولده الا خسارا
5440.en: Noah said: “My Lord, they did not pay heed to what I said, and followed those (nobles) whose possession of wealth and children has led them to an even greater loss.

5441.en: They contrived a plot of great magnitude.

5442.arabic: وقالوا لا تذرن الهتكم ولا تذرن ودا ولا سواعا ولا يغوث ويعوق ونسرا
5442.en: They said: “Do not abandon your deities; do not abandon Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, nor Yauq, nor Nasr.

5443.arabic: وقد اضلوا كثيرا ولا تزد الظلمين الا ضللا
5443.en: They have misled many. So do not enable these evildoers to increase in anything except straying (from the Right Way).”

5444.arabic: مما خطيـتهم اغرقوا فادخلوا نارا فلم يجدوا لهم من دون الله انصارا
5444.en: And so they were drowned on account of their sins, and then cast into the Fire, and did not find any other than Allah, to come forth to their help.

5445.arabic: وقال نوح رب لا تذر على الارض من الكفرين ديارا
5445.en: Noah said: “My Lord, do not leave out of these unbelievers even a single dweller on earth,

5446.arabic: انك ان تذرهم يضلوا عبادك ولا يلدوا الا فاجرا كفارا
5446.en: for certainly if You should leave them (alive), they will mislead Your servants, and will beget none but sinners and utter unbelievers.

5447.arabic: رب اغفر لى ولولدى ولمن دخل بيتى مؤمنا وللمؤمنين والمؤمنت ولا تزد الظلمين الا تبارۢا
5447.en: My Lord, forgive me and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a believer, and forgive all believers, both men and women, and do not increase the wrong#doers in anything except perdition.”

5448.arabic: قل اوحى الى انه استمع نفر من الجن فقالوا انا سمعنا قرانا عجبا
5448.en: Say, (O Prophet), it was revealed to me that a band of jinn attentively listened to (the recitation of the Qur'an) and then (went back to their people) and said:

5449.arabic: يهدى الى الرشد فـامنا به ولن نشرك بربنا احدا
5449.en: “We have indeed heard a wonderful Qur'an which guides to the Right Way; so we have come to believe in it, and we will not associate aught with Our Lord in His Divinity”;

5450.arabic: وانه تعلى جد ربنا ما اتخذ صحبة ولا ولدا
5450.en: and that “He – exalted be His Majesty – has not taken to Himself either a wife or a son”;

5451.arabic: وانه كان يقول سفيهنا على الله شططا
5451.en: and that “the foolish among us have been wont to say outrageous things about Allah”;

5452.arabic: وانا ظننا ان لن تقول الانس والجن على الله كذبا
5452.en: and that “we had thought that men and jinn would never speak a lie about Allah”,

5453.arabic: وانه كان رجال من الانس يعوذون برجال من الجن فزادوهم رهقا
5453.en: and that “some from among the humans used to seek protection of some among the jinn, and thus they increased the arrogance of the jinn”;

5454.arabic: وانهم ظنوا كما ظننتم ان لن يبعث الله احدا
5454.en: and that “they thought, even as you thought, that Allah would never raise anyone (as a Messenger)”;

5455.arabic: وانا لمسنا السما فوجدنها ملئت حرسا شديدا وشهبا
5455.en: and that “we tried to pry (the secrets of) the heaven, but we found it full of terrible guards and shooting meteors”;

5456.arabic: وانا كنا نقعد منها مقعد للسمع فمن يستمع الان يجد له شهابا رصدا
5456.en: and that “we would take up stations in the heaven to try to hear but anyone who now attempts to listen finds a shooting meteor in wait for him”;

5457.arabic: وانا لا ندرى اشر اريد بمن فى الارض ام اراد بهم ربهم رشدا
5457.en: and that “we do not know whether evil is intended for those on the earth, or whether their Lord intends to direct them to the Right Way”;

5458.arabic: وانا منا الصلحون ومنا دون ذلك كنا طرائق قددا
5458.en: and that “some of us are upright and some of us are otherwise for we follow widely divergent paths”;

5459.arabic: وانا ظننا ان لن نعجز الله فى الارض ولن نعجزه هربا
5459.en: and that “we thought that we will neither be able to frustrate Allah on earth, nor frustrate Him by flight”;

5460.arabic: وانا لما سمعنا الهدى امنا به فمن يؤمن بربه فلا يخاف بخسا ولا رهقا
5460.en: and that “when we heard the teaching of the Right Way we came to believe in it; he who believes in His Lord shall have no fear of suffering loss or being subjected to any injustice”;

5461.arabic: وانا منا المسلمون ومنا القسطون فمن اسلم فاولئك تحروا رشدا
5461.en: and that “among us some are Muslims (Those who have submitted to Allah), and some of us are deviant. So those who became Muslims found the Right Course;

5462.en: but those who deviated from the Truth, will be the fuel for Hell.”

5463.arabic: والو استقموا على الطريقة لاسقينهم ما غدقا
5463.en: If people were to keep firmly to the Right Way, We would have vouchsafed them abundant rain

5464.arabic: لنفتنهم فيه ومن يعرض عن ذكر ربه يسلكه عذابا صعدا
5464.en: so that We might try them through this bounty. Whoso turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to suffer a grievous chastisement;

5465.arabic: وان المسجد لله فلا تدعوا مع الله احدا
5465.en: and that “mosques belong to Allah, so do not invoke anyone with Him”;

5466.arabic: وانه لما قام عبد الله يدعوه كادوا يكونون عليه لبدا
5466.en: and when Allah's servant stood up to call on Him, they well#nigh swarmed him.

5467.arabic: قل انما ادعوا ربى ولا اشرك به احدا
5467.en: Say, (O Prophet): “I call on my Lord alone, and I do not associate aught with Him in His Divinity.”

5468.arabic: قل انى لا املك لكم ضرا ولا رشدا
5468.en: Say: “Surely neither it is in my power to hurt you nor to bring you to the Right Way.”

5469.arabic: قل انى لن يجيرنى من الله احد ولن اجد من دونه ملتحدا
5469.en: Say: “None can protect me from Allah, nor can I find a refuge apart from Him.

5470.arabic: الا بلغا من الله ورسلته ومن يعص الله ورسوله فان له نار جهنم خلدين فيها ابدا
5470.en: (My task is no more than) to deliver Allah's proclamation and His messages. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, surely the Fire of Hell awaits him; therein he will abide in perpetuity.”

5471.arabic: حتى اذا راوا ما يوعدون فسيعلمون من اضعف ناصرا واقل عددا
5471.en: (They shall not change their ways) until they see that against which they had been warned, and then they will know whose helpers are weaker and whose supporters are fewer in number.

5472.arabic: قل ان ادرى اقريب ما توعدون ام يجعل له ربى امدا
5472.en: Say: “I know not whether what you are promised is near or whether my Lord will prolong its term.

5473.arabic: علم الغيب فلا يظهر على غيبه احدا
5473.en: He is the Knower of the Unseen, and He does not disclose His Unseen to anyone

5474.arabic: الا من ارتضى من رسول فانه يسلك من بين يديه ومن خلفه رصدا
5474.en: other than to a Messenger whom He chooses (for the bestowal of any part of the knowledge of the Unseen), whereafter He appoints guards who go before him and behind him,

5475.arabic: ليعلم ان قد ابلغوا رسلت ربهم واحاط بما لديهم واحصى كل شى عددا
5475.en: so that He may know that they have delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge their surroundings and keeps a count of all things.”

5477.en: Stand up in Prayer by night, all but a small part of it;

5478.en: half of it, or reduce it a little;

5479.arabic: او زد عليه ورتل القران ترتيلا
5479.en: or add to it a little; and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.

5480.en: Behold, We shall cast upon you a Weighty Word.

5481.arabic: ان ناشئة اليل هى اشد وطـا واقوم قيلا
5481.en: Surely getting up at night is the best means of subduing the self and is more suitable for uprightness in speech.

5482.arabic: ان لك فى النهار سبحا طويلا
5482.en: You are indeed much occupied during the day with the affairs of the world.

5483.arabic: واذكر اسم ربك وتبتل اليه تبتيلا
5483.en: So remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with exclusive devotion.

5484.arabic: رب المشرق والمغرب لا اله الا هو فاتخذه وكيلا
5484.en: He is the Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but He. So take Him alone for your Guardian,

5485.arabic: واصبر على ما يقولون واهجرهم هجرا جميلا
5485.en: And bear patiently the vain things they utter, and gracefully forsake them.

5486.arabic: وذرنى والمكذبين اولى النعمة ومهلهم قليلا
5486.en: Leave it to Me to deal with the affluent ones who give the lie (to the Truth), and bear with them for a while.

5487.en: We have heavy fetters and a blazing Fire in store for them;

5488.en: and a food that chokes, and a grievous chastisement.

5489.arabic: يوم ترجف الارض والجبال وكانت الجبال كثيبا مهيلا
5489.en: (They will come across all this) on the Day when the earth and the mountains shall tremble violently and the mountains shall crumble into heaps of scattered sand.

5490.arabic: انا ارسلنا اليكم رسولا شهدا عليكم كما ارسلنا الى فرعون رسولا
5490.en: Surely We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness over you, just as We had sent a Messenger to Pharaoh.

5491.arabic: فعصى فرعون الرسول فاخذنه اخذا وبيلا
5491.en: But Pharaoh disobeyed Our Messenger, so We seized him with a terrible seizing.

5492.arabic: فكيف تتقون ان كفرتم يوما يجعل الولدن شيبا
5492.en: If you persist in disbelieving, how will you guard yourself against the (woe of the) Day that will turn children grey#haired,

5493.arabic: السما منفطرۢ به كان وعده مفعولا
5493.en: the Day whose severity shall cause the heaven to split asunder? Allah's promise is ever bound to be fulfilled.

5494.arabic: ان هذه تذكرة فمن شا اتخذ الى ربه سبيلا
5494.en: Indeed this is nothing but a Good Counsel; so let him who will take a way leading to his Lord.

5495.arabic: ان ربك يعلم انك تقوم ادنى من ثلثى اليل ونصفه وثلثه وطائفة من الذين معك والله يقدر اليل والنهار علم ان لن تحصوه فتاب عليكم فاقروا ما تيسر من القران علم ان سيكون منكم مرضى واخرون يضربون فى الارض يبتغون من فضل الله واخرون يقتلون فى سبيل الله فاقروا ما تيسر منه واقيموا الصلوة واتوا الزكوة واقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا وما تقدموا لانفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله هو خيرا واعظم اجرا واستغفروا الله ان الله غفور رحيمۢ
5495.en: (O Prophet), your Lord knows that you sometimes stand up in Prayer nearly two#thirds of the night, and sometimes half or one#third of it, and so does a party of those with you; Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He has shown mercy to you. So now recite as much of the Qur'an as you can. He knows that there are among you those who are sick and others who are journeying in the land in quest of Allah's bounty, and still others who are fighting in the cause of Allah. So recite as much of the Qur'an as you easily can, and establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and give Allah a goodly loan. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you shall find it with Allah. That is better and its reward is greater. And ask for Allah's forgiveness; surely He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

5496.en: O you enveloped in your cloak!

5498.en: and magnify the glory of your Lord,

5501.en: and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,

5502.en: and persevere for your Lord's sake.

5503.en: When the Trumpet shall be sounded,

5504.en: that will surely be a hard day,

5505.en: not an easy day for the unbelievers.

5506.en: Leave Me with him whom I alone have created,

5507.en: whom I have endowed with abundant riches,

5508.en: and sons ever present with him,

5509.en: and for whom I have smoothed the way (to power and riches),

5510.en: and who still greedily desires that I should bestow upon him more.

5511.en: By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.

5512.en: I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.

5513.en: He reflected and then hatched a scheme.

5514.en: Ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

5515.en: Again, ruin seize him, how did he hatch a scheme?

5518.en: then he retreated and waxed proud,

5519.arabic: فقال ان هذا الا سحر يؤثر
5519.en: and said: “This (Qur'an) is merely a sorcery of yore;

5520.en: this is nothing but the word of a mere mortal!”

5521.en: Him shall I soon roast in Hell.

5522.en: And what do you know what Hell is?

5523.en: It spares nothing; it leaves nothing intact;

5526.arabic: وما جعلنا اصحب النار الا ملئكة وما جعلنا عدتهم الا فتنة للذين كفروا ليستيقن الذين اوتوا الكتب ويزداد الذين امنوا ايمنا ولا يرتاب الذين اوتوا الكتب والمؤمنون وليقول الذين فى قلوبهم مرض والكفرون ماذا اراد الله بهذا مثلا كذلك يضل الله من يشا ويهدى من يشا وما يعلم جنود ربك الا هو وما هى الا ذكرى للبشر
5526.en: We have appointed none but angels as the keepers of the Fire, and We have not made their number but as a trial for the unbelievers so that those who have been endowed with the Book will be convinced and the believers' faith will increase, and neither those who have been endowed with the Book nor the believers will fall into any doubt. As for those in whose hearts there is a sickness as well as the unbelievers, they will say: “What did Allah aim at by this strange parable?” Thus does Allah let whomsoever He pleases to go astray, and directs whomsoever He pleases to the Right Way. And none knows the hosts of your Lord but He. (And Hell has only been mentioned here) that people may take heed.

5528.en: and by the night when it recedes,

5529.en: and by the day when it dawns (with its radiance),

5530.en: surely (Hell) is one of the greatest Signs,

5532.arabic: لمن شا منكم ان يتقدم او يتاخر
5532.en: a warning to everyone of you whether he would like to come forward or lag behind.

5533.en: Each one is a hostage to one's deeds,

5534.en: save the People of the Right Hand

5535.en: who shall be in the Gardens, and shall ask

5538.en: They will answer: “We were not among those who observed Prayer,

5539.en: and we did not feed the poor,

5540.en: and we indulged in vain talk with those who indulged in vain talk,

5541.en: and we gave the lie to the Day of Judgement

5542.en: until the inevitable event overtook us.”

5543.en: The intercession of the intercessors shall then be of no avail to them.

5544.en: What is the matter with people that they are turning away from this Exhortation,

5545.en: as though they were frightened wild asses,

5547.arabic: بل يريد كل امرئ منهم ان يؤتى صحفا منشرة
